name: agree
trans: The students agree they have too much homework.

sentences.english: Teenagers and their parents rarely agree.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子跟父母意见很少一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express the same opinion about something as someone else

name: alcohol
trans: A person should not drive a car after he or she has been drinking alcohol.

sentences.english: I don’t drink alcohol anymore.
sentences.chinese: 我不再喝酒了。

sentences.english: alcohol abuse
sentences.chinese: 酗酒

sentences.english: people with alcohol problems
sentences.chinese: 有酗酒问题的人

detailed_translations.english: drinks such as beer or wine that contain a substance which can make you drunk

name: arrive
trans: They arrived at school at 7 a.m.

sentences.english: Give me a call to let me know you’ve arrived safely.
sentences.chinese: 打个电话给我，告诉我你已平安到达。

sentences.english: By the time the police arrived on the scene, the burglars had fled.
sentences.chinese: 警方赶到现场时，窃贼已经逃跑了。

sentences.english: When her wedding day arrived, she was really nervous.
sentences.chinese: 到了婚礼那天，她十分紧张。

detailed_translations.english: to get to the place you are going to

name: August
trans: Is your birthday in August?

sentences.english: He moved to another city last August.
sentences.chinese: 去年八月，他搬到另一座城市。

sentences.english: That night in August, waiting for the Rolling Stones to come on stage, we felt like rebels.
sentences.chinese: 在那个八月的夜晚，在等待滚石乐队登台演出时，我们有种造反的感觉。

sentences.english: They make a huge migration from the north to the south of the US, mostly starting in August and the other way around in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 大部分是从八月开始，它们开始进行巨大的迁徙，从美国的北部到南部，而到了春天又沿相反方向回来。

detailed_translations.english: the eighth month of the year, between July and September

name: boat
trans: There is a small boat on the lake.

sentences.english: a fishing boat
sentences.chinese: 渔船

sentences.english: The boat capsized (=  turned over  ) in heavy seas.
sentences.chinese: 船在波涛汹涌的大海上倾覆了。

sentences.english: a boat trip around the islands
sentences.chinese: 乘船环岛旅行

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle that travels across water

name: breakfast
trans: I ate eggs for breakfast.

sentences.english: We had bacon and eggs for breakfast .
sentences.chinese: 我们早餐吃了熏肉鸡蛋。

sentences.english: I never eat breakfast .
sentences.chinese: 我从来不吃早饭。

sentences.english: After a hearty breakfast (=  large breakfast  ) , we set out for a hike.
sentences.chinese: 我们吃了一顿丰盛的早餐，然后出发去远足了。

sentences.english: a light breakfast
sentences.chinese: 简单的早餐

sentences.english: a working breakfast
sentences.chinese: 工作早餐

detailed_translations.english: the meal you have in the morning

name: camera
trans: I brought my camera on my vacation.

sentences.english: Her grandmother lent her a camera for a school trip to Venice and Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 她的祖母借给她一部相机，让她在学校组织的到威尼斯和埃及的旅行中使用。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment used to take photographs or make films or television programmes

name: capital
trans: The capital of the United States is Washington, D.C.

sentences.english: capital investments
sentences.chinese: 资本投资

detailed_translations.english: relating to money that you use to start a business or to make more money

name: catch
trans: Did you catch the ball during the baseball game?

sentences.english: Did you catch any fish?
sentences.chinese: 你捕到鱼了吗？

sentences.english: Early settlers caught rabbits and squirrels and even rats in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 早期移民为了生存而捕食野兔、松鼠，甚至老鼠。

sentences.english: I caught the 7.15 train to London.
sentences.chinese: 我赶上了7点15分的火车去伦敦。

sentences.english: Sorry, I didn't quite catch what you said.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我没听清楚你的话。

detailed_translations.english: to trap an animal or fish by using a trap, net, or hook, or by hunting it

name: duck
trans: People feed ducks at the lake.

sentences.english: If she hadn’t ducked, the ball would have hit her.
sentences.chinese: 如果她没有弯腰躲闪的话，那个球就可能击中她了。

sentences.english: Tim ducked down to comb his hair in the mirror.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆低下身在镜子前梳头发。

sentences.english: She ducked her head to look more closely at the inscription.
sentences.chinese: 她低下头更仔细地看碑文。

detailed_translations.chinese: 鸭子似的突然扎入水中； 突然低下
detailed_translations.english: to lower your head or body very quickly, especially to avoid being seen or hit
a very common water bird with short legs and a wide beak, used for its meat, eggs, and soft feathers

name: enjoy
trans: The woman enjoys riding her bicycle.

sentences.english: We thoroughly enjoyed our time in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我们在纽约的时间过得十分快活。

sentences.english: Thanks for a great evening. I really enjoyed it.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你这美好的晚会。我真的玩得很开心。

detailed_translations.english: to get pleasure from something

name: invite
trans: I will invite my friends to my birthday party.

sentences.english: I’m afraid I wasn’t invited.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我没有受到邀请。

sentences.english: Successful candidates will be invited for interview next week.
sentences.chinese: 通过甄别的候选人将获邀于下周参加面试。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone to come to a party, wedding, meal etc

name: love
trans: I love my family very much.

sentences.english: I love you, Tracy.
sentences.chinese: 我爱你，特雷西。

sentences.english: He was the only man she had ever loved.
sentences.chinese: 他是她唯一爱过的男人。

sentences.english: What these kids need is love and support.
sentences.chinese: 这些孩子需要的是关心和支持。

detailed_translations.english: to have a strong feeling of  affection  for someone, combined with sexual attraction
a strong feeling of caring about someone, especially a member of your family or a close friend

name: month
trans: January is the first month of the year.

sentences.english: I hope I’ll have finished the work by the end of the month.
sentences.chinese: 我希望我这个月底能完成工作。

sentences.english: She earns about £350 a month (= each month ).
sentences.chinese: 她每月约挣350英镑。

sentences.english: We update the schedule at least once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们至少每月更新一次日程表。

detailed_translations.english: one of the 12 named periods of time that a year is divided into

name: travel
trans: They will travel to Argentina this summer.

sentences.english: Light travels faster than sound.
sentences.chinese: 光比声音传播得快。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旅行； 行进； 被传送， 被传播； 走过， 驶过
detailed_translations.english: to move at a particular speed or in a particular direction
the activity of travelling

name: typical
trans: My typical breakfast is toast and eggs.

sentences.english: typical British weather
sentences.chinese: 典型的英国天气

sentences.english: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

detailed_translations.english: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

name: visit
trans: She wants to visit her grandmother.

sentences.english: Eric went to Seattle to visit his cousins.
sentences.chinese: 埃里克到西雅图去看望他的表兄弟。

detailed_translations.english: to go and spend time in a place or with someone, especially for pleasure or interest

name: weather
trans: Today’s weather is rainy and cloudy.

sentences.english: What’s the weather like today?
sentences.chinese: 今天天气如何？

sentences.english: The weather turned bitterly cold.
sentences.chinese: 天气变得很冷了。

detailed_translations.english: the temperature and other conditions such as sun, rain, and wind

detailed_translations.chinese: 经受住；使风化；侵蚀；使受风吹雨打
detailed_translations.english: if rock, wood, or someone’s face is weathered by the wind, sun, rain etc, or if it weathers, it changes colour or shape over a period of time

name: week
trans: What are you doing next week?

sentences.english: I can’t see you this week.
sentences.chinese: 我这星期不能见你。

detailed_translations.english: a period of seven days and nights, usually measured in Britain from Monday to Sunday and in the US from Sunday to Saturday

name: wine
trans: The store carried both red and white wine.

sentences.english: a glass of wine
sentences.chinese: 一杯葡萄酒

detailed_translations.english: an alcoholic drink made from grapes, or a type of this drink
to entertain someone well with a meal, wine etc

name: adventure
trans: Riding in the rough water was an adventure.

sentences.english: a great adventure
sentences.chinese: 一大奇遇

sentences.english: Ahab’s adventures at sea
sentences.chinese: 亚哈的海上历险

sentences.english: an adventure story
sentences.chinese: 一个历险故事

detailed_translations.english: an exciting experience in which dangerous or unusual things happen

name: approach
trans: The boy approached his school.

sentences.english: He decided to adopt a different approach and teach the Bible through story-telling.
sentences.chinese: 他决定采用一种不同的方法，通过讲故事来教授《圣经》。

sentences.english: This book takes an unorthodox approach to art criticism.
sentences.chinese: 这本书采用的是非传统的艺术评论方法。

sentences.english: organizations which take a positive approach to creative thinking
sentences.chinese: 对创造性思维采取积极态度的组织

detailed_translations.english: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

name: carefully
trans: The baby carefully climbed down the stairs.

sentences.english: He folded the sheets up carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他把床单仔细地叠好。

detailed_translations.english: in a careful way

name: chemical
trans: The scientist mixed the chemicals.

sentences.english: the chemical composition of bleach
sentences.chinese: 漂白剂的化学成分

sentences.english: a chemical analysis of the soil
sentences.chinese: 对土壤的化学分析

sentences.english: synthetic chemicals
sentences.chinese: 合成化学品

detailed_translations.english: relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances
relating to substances, the study of substances, or processes involving changes in substances

name: create
trans: She created an igloo from blocks of snow.

sentences.english: Some people believe the universe was created by a big explosion.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为宇宙是通过一次大爆炸创造出来的。

sentences.english: Her behaviour is creating a lot of problems.
sentences.chinese: 她的行为引起了很多问题。

sentences.english: The new factory is expected to create more than 400 new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 这家新工厂预计能创造400多个新的就业机会。

sentences.english: The announcement only succeeded in creating confusion.
sentences.chinese: 那通告反而引起了混乱。

detailed_translations.english: to make something exist that did not exist before

name: evil

sentences.english: She wanted to protect her children from the evils of the outside world.
sentences.chinese: 她想保护她的孩子不受外界的不良影响。

sentences.english: Poverty is one of the greatest social evils of our time.
sentences.chinese: 贫困是当代最大的社会弊端之一。

sentences.english: the evils of capitalism
sentences.chinese: 资本主义的种种祸害

sentences.english: There is too much evil in the world.
sentences.chinese: 世上的罪恶太多。

sentences.english: an evil dictator responsible for the deaths of millions
sentences.chinese: 对数百万人之死负责的邪恶独裁者

detailed_translations.english: something that is very bad or harmful

name: experiment
trans: The student did an experiment in science class.

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

name: kill
trans: I killed the fly.

sentences.english: Why did she kill her husband?
sentences.chinese: 她为什么杀死丈夫？

sentences.english: Murray held a gun to his head and threatened to kill him.
sentences.chinese: 默里拿枪指着他的头并威胁要杀了他。

sentences.english: Four people were killed when a train plunged into a flooded river.
sentences.chinese: 火车冲进洪水泛滥的河中，造成四人身亡。

sentences.english: Bleach kills household germs.
sentences.chinese: 漂白剂能够杀灭日常病菌。

sentences.english: Smoking kills.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟会致人死亡。

sentences.english: The out-of-town shopping centre will kill local trade.
sentences.chinese: 城外的购物中心将令本地商业难以为继。

sentences.english: With time to kill, he took a cab to the centre.
sentences.chinese: 还有点时间可以消磨，于是他叫了一辆出租车去市中心。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or animal die

name: laboratory
trans: My mother works in a laboratory.

sentences.english: a research laboratory
sentences.chinese: 研究实验室

sentences.english: tests on laboratory animals
sentences.chinese: 在实验室动物身上做的试验

detailed_translations.english: a special room or building in which a scientist does tests or prepares substances

name: laugh
trans: The sound of her laugh filled the room.

sentences.english: Maria looked at him and laughed.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚看着他大笑起来。

sentences.english: Tony was laughing so hard he had to steady himself on the table.
sentences.chinese: 托尼笑得太厉害了，靠着桌子才能让自己站稳。

sentences.english: Nora laughed so much that she nearly cried.
sentences.chinese: 诺拉笑得眼泪都快出来了。

sentences.english: He couldn’t help it; he burst out laughing (= suddenly started laughing ).
sentences.chinese: 他情不自禁地放声大笑起来。

sentences.english: He’s one of the few writers who can make me laugh out loud.
sentences.chinese: 有几位作家能让我放声大笑，他是其中之一。

sentences.english: He gave a short laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他笑了一声。

name: loud
trans: The man’s voice was so loud that we all could hear him.

sentences.english: The book fell to the floor with a loud bang.
sentences.chinese: 书砰的一声掉落到地上。

sentences.english: The music was so loud that I had to shout.
sentences.chinese: 音乐太响了，我只得大声地喊。

sentences.english: ‘Who’s there?’ asked David in a loud voice.
sentences.chinese: “是谁？” 戴维大声问道。

detailed_translations.english: making a lot of noise

name: nervous
trans: The boy became nervous when he heard the news.

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

name: noise
trans: The crying baby made a loud noise.

sentences.english: What’s that noise?
sentences.chinese: 那是什么声音？

sentences.english: Try not to make a noise when you go upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 上楼时尽量不要弄出声。

sentences.english: There was a lot of noise outside.
sentences.chinese: 外面很吵闹。

sentences.english: Noise levels have been reduced by 20%.
sentences.chinese: 噪音水平下降了20%。

detailed_translations.english: a sound, especially one that is loud, unpleasant, or frightening

name: project
trans: His afternoon work project was to paint the room green.

sentences.english: The project aims to provide an analysis of children’s emotions.
sentences.chinese: 该计划旨在对儿童情绪作出分析。

sentences.english: a three-year research project
sentences.chinese: 一项为期三年的研究计划

sentences.english: The scheme will now be extended after a successful pilot project (= a small trial to test if an idea will be successful ) .
sentences.chinese: 试行成功后，该方案现在将得到推广。

sentences.english: The project is funded by Wellcome plc.
sentences.chinese: 这个项目由威康公司资助。

sentences.english: a project manager
sentences.chinese: 项目经理

sentences.english: a geography project
sentences.chinese: 一个地理课题

detailed_translations.english: a carefully planned piece of work to get information about something, to build something, to improve something etc

name: scare
trans: My uncle was scared by what he saw in the room.

sentences.english: You really gave us a scare !
sentences.chinese: 你真的吓了我们一跳！

detailed_translations.english: a sudden feeling of fear

name: secret
trans: The two boys were sharing a secret.

sentences.english: I can’t tell you. It’s a secret.
sentences.chinese: 我不能告诉你，这是个秘密。

sentences.english: It was no secret that the two men hated each other.
sentences.chinese: 这两个男人相互仇视，这算不得什么秘密。

sentences.english: Don’t worry. Your secret is safe with me (= I won’t tell anyone about it ) .
sentences.chinese: 别担心，我会替你保守秘密。

sentences.english: Your hair always looks so great – what’s your secret ?
sentences.chinese: 你的头发看起来总是很漂亮——你的秘诀是什么？

sentences.english: They kept their relationship secret from their parents.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩的关系瞒着父母。

detailed_translations.english: something that is kept hidden or that is known about by only a few people
known about by only a few people and kept hidden from others

name: shout
trans: My boss shouted at me because I was late for work.

sentences.english: There’s no need to shout! I can hear you!
sentences.chinese: 用不着大声喊叫！我听得见！

sentences.english: ‘Watch out!’she shouted, as the car started to move.
sentences.chinese: “小心！”汽车开动时，她大声喊道。

detailed_translations.english: to say something very loudly
a loud call expressing anger, pain, excitement etc

name: smell
trans: The two friends smelled the flower.

sentences.english: I can smell burning.
sentences.chinese: 我闻到烧焦的气味。

sentences.english: Can you smell something?
sentences.chinese: 你闻到什么气味了吗？

detailed_translations.english: to notice or recognize a particular smell
the quality that people and animals recognize by using their nose

name: terrible
trans: The way he treated his classmate was terrible.

sentences.english: The hotel was absolutely terrible.
sentences.chinese: 这家宾馆糟糕透了。

sentences.english: I’d better write this down; I have a terrible memory.
sentences.chinese: 我最好把它记下来，我的记性很差。

sentences.english: You’re making a terrible mistake.
sentences.chinese: 你犯了一个极大的错误。

detailed_translations.english: very bad

name: worse
trans: Business was worse this month than last month.

sentences.english: The traffic is much worse after five o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 5点以后交通拥堵严重得多。

sentences.english: The weather was a lot worse this year.
sentences.chinese: 今年天气糟糕得多。

sentences.english: Conditions will get worse as the winter continues.
sentences.chinese: 随着冬天持续下去，情况会更糟。

sentences.english: High inflation will make unemployment worse.
sentences.chinese: 高通货膨胀率将使失业状况更加严重。

sentences.english: Don’t say anything, you’ll only make matters worse.
sentences.chinese: 什么也别说，说了只会火上浇油。

sentences.english: The bullying got worse and worse until finally he had to leave the school.
sentences.chinese: 他所受的欺侮越来越过分，最后只得离开了学校。

sentences.english: There’s nothing worse than being robbed while you’re on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 没有比度假时被抢劫更糟的了。

sentences.english: The school’s not perfect, but I suppose it could be worse.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校不是十全十美，不过我想还不算太糟吧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 更坏的；更差的；更恶劣的（bad的比较级）；（病情）更重的（ill的比较级）
detailed_translations.english: more unpleasant, bad, or severe

detailed_translations.chinese: 更糟；更坏；更恶劣地；更坏地
detailed_translations.english: in a more severe or serious way than before
something worse

name: alien
trans: The alien came in peace.

sentences.english: alien cultures
sentences.chinese: 异域文化

sentences.english: an alien multiracial society
sentences.chinese: 一个多种族的异国社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 外国的；相异的，性质不同的；不相容的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to another country or race
someone who is not a legal citizen of the country they are living or working in

name: among
trans: There was a red apple among the green ones.

sentences.english: The girl quickly disappeared among the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 女孩转眼消失在人群中。

sentences.english: I could hear voices coming from somewhere among the bushes.
sentences.chinese: 我能听到灌木丛中某个地方传来说话的声音。

sentences.english: We walked among the chestnut woods on the mountain slopes.
sentences.chinese: 我们走在山坡上的栗树林中。

sentences.english: She began rummaging among the books on her desk.
sentences.chinese: 她开始在桌子上的一堆书中乱翻起来。

detailed_translations.english: in or through the middle of a group of people or things

name: chart
trans: We used a chart to see how we had improved.

sentences.english: a chart showing last year’s sales
sentences.chinese: 显示去年销售情况的一份图表

sentences.english: a weather chart
sentences.chinese: 天气图

sentences.english: the theatre’s seating chart
sentences.chinese: 剧场的座位图

detailed_translations.english: information that is clearly arranged in the form of a simple picture, set of figures,  graph  etc, or a piece of paper with this information on it

detailed_translations.chinese: 用图表表示， 在图上表示
detailed_translations.english: if a record charts, it enters the weekly list of the most popular records

name: cloud
trans: The sky was filled with white clouds.

sentences.english: Dark clouds floated across the moon.
sentences.chinese: 乌云飘过月亮。

sentences.english: A cloud of steam rose into the air.
sentences.chinese: 一团水蒸气升到空中。

sentences.english: Fears of renewed terrorist attacks cast a cloud over the event (= spoilt the happy situation ) .
sentences.chinese: 对恐怖分子再次发动袭击的担心给这次活动蒙上了一层阴影。

detailed_translations.english: a white or grey mass in the sky that forms from very small drops of water

name: describe
trans: They described their tree as colorful, with gold ribbon and a star.

sentences.english: The police asked her to describe the man.
sentences.chinese: 警察叫她描述一下那名男子。

sentences.english: Another approach to the problem is described in Chapter 3.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题的另一种解决方法在第三章有所阐述。

detailed_translations.chinese: 形容， 描写； 画出
detailed_translations.english: to say what something or someone is like by giving details about them

name: ever
trans: Going skiing last winter was the most fun I’ve ever had.

sentences.english: Nothing ever seems to upset him.
sentences.chinese: 似乎从来没有什么事情会使他烦恼。

sentences.english: Have you ever been to Paris?
sentences.chinese: 你去过巴黎吗？

sentences.english: I don’t think I’ve ever been here before.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我以前从未到过这里。

sentences.english: It was raining harder than ever.
sentences.chinese: 当时下着前所未有的大雨。

detailed_translations.english: used in negative sentences and questions, or sentences with if to mean ‘at any time’

name: fail
trans: Since he failed to get the job, he was sad.

sentences.english: It looks likely that the peace talks will fail.
sentences.chinese: 看来和平谈判可能会失败。

sentences.english: Millions of people have tried to quit smoking and failed miserably (= been completely unsuccessful ).
sentences.chinese: 数百万人戒过烟，都以惨败告终。

sentences.english: his efforts to save his failing marriage
sentences.chinese: 他挽救自己濒危婚姻的努力

sentences.english: The brakes on my bike failed half way down the hill.
sentences.chinese: 我骑自行车下山到中途刹车失灵了。

detailed_translations.english: to not succeed in achieving something

name: grade
trans: I managed to get good grades on my report card.

sentences.english: Pencils are graded according to softness.
sentences.chinese: 铅笔按软硬度分级。

sentences.english: The best grades of tea are expensive.
sentences.chinese: 最上等的茶叶价格很贵。

detailed_translations.english: to say what level of a quality something has, or what standard it is
a particular level of quality that a product, material etc has

name: instead
trans: He ate the carrot instead of the ice cream.

sentences.english: You probably picked up my keys instead of yours.
sentences.chinese: 你可能没拿你的钥匙而错拿了我的。

sentences.english: Could I have tuna instead of ham?
sentences.chinese: 我可否要金枪鱼来代替火腿？

sentences.english: Instead of being annoyed, he seemed quite pleased.
sentences.chinese: 他没有生气，反而似乎很高兴。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what is not used, does not happen etc, when something else is used, happens etc

name: library
trans: The library at school is full of books.

sentences.english: a public library
sentences.chinese: 公共图书馆

sentences.english: a library book
sentences.chinese: 图书馆的书

sentences.english: My thanks go to the British School of Osteopathy, for the use of their library.
sentences.chinese: 感谢不列颠骨疗法学校允许我使用他们的藏书。

detailed_translations.english: a room or building containing books that can be looked at or borrowed

name: photograph
trans: I took this photograph with my cell phone.

sentences.english: a colour photograph
sentences.chinese: 彩色照片

sentences.english: a black and white photograph
sentences.chinese: 黑白照片

sentences.english: Tim was looking through an old photograph album (= book in which you put photographs ) .
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆在翻看一本旧相册。

sentences.english: Did you see Leo’s photograph (= a photograph of Leo ) in the newspaper?
sentences.chinese: 你看到报纸上利奥的照片了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a picture obtained by using a camera and film that is sensitive to light
to take a photograph of someone or something

name: planet
trans: Saturn is the planet with the ring around it.

sentences.english: The picture shows six of the nine planets in the solar system.
sentences.chinese: 这张图片展示太阳系9个行星中的6个行星。

detailed_translations.english: A planet is a large, round object in space that moves around a star. The Earth is a planet.

name: report
trans: Karen had trouble writing her report.

sentences.english: This is Gavin Williams, reporting from the United Nations in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我是加文·威廉斯，在纽约联合国总部为您报道。

sentences.english: We aim to report the news as fairly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。

sentences.english: The incident was widely reported in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件在全国的媒体上被广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio

name: several
trans: He had to read several books for class.

sentences.english: I have several suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个建议。

sentences.english: I have several methods.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个方法。

sentences.english: I have several reasons to support my view.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个理由来支持我的观点。

name: shape
trans: Even with your eyes closed you can feel the shape of it.

sentences.english: What shape is the table?
sentences.chinese: 那张桌子是什么形状的？

sentences.english: You can recognize a tree by the shape of its leaves.
sentences.chinese: 可以根据树叶的形状辨认出是什么树。

sentences.english: His battered old hat had completely lost its shape.
sentences.chinese: 他那顶破旧的帽子已经完全变形了。

sentences.english: The plants grow in every shape and size .
sentences.chinese: 这些植物有各种形状，各种大小。

sentences.english: The children cut out shapes (= squares, triangles etc ) from the piece of cardboard.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们把卡纸片剪成各种形状。

detailed_translations.english: the form that something has, for example round, square,  triangular  etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成；塑造，使成形；使符合
detailed_translations.english: to influence something such as a belief, opinion etc and make it develop in a particular way

name: solve
trans: All the students could easily solve the math problem.

sentences.english: Charlie thinks money will solve all his problems.
sentences.chinese: 查理认为钱能解决他所有的问题。

sentences.english: the best way of solving our dilemma
sentences.chinese: 解决我们两难处境的最佳办法

sentences.english: attempts to solve a mathematical equation
sentences.chinese: 解数学方程式的尝试

detailed_translations.english: to find or provide a way of dealing with a problem

name: suddenly
trans: I was surprised when my friends suddenly shouted, “Happy birthday!”

sentences.english: I suddenly realized that there was someone following me.
sentences.chinese: 我突然意识到有人跟着我。

sentences.english: George died very suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 乔治死得非常突然。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the eagle opened its wings.
sentences.chinese: 突然，鹰展开翅膀。

detailed_translations.english: quickly and unexpectedly

name: suppose
trans: I suppose I should go home now.

sentences.english: There were many more deaths than was first supposed.
sentences.chinese: 死亡人数远远超过最初的预料。

sentences.english: There's no reason to suppose (= it is unlikely that ) he’s lying.
sentences.chinese: 没有理由认为他在说谎。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is probably true, based on what you know

name: understand
trans: Henry could not understand the message.

sentences.english: She doesn’t understand English.
sentences.chinese: 她不懂英语。

sentences.english: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Can yon explain that again?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我不明白。你能再解释一遍吗？

sentences.english: The woman had a strong accent, and I couldn’t understand what she was saying.
sentences.chinese: 那女人口音很重，我听不懂她在说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to know the meaning of what someone is telling you, or the language that they speak

name: view
trans: Michael likes to view himself in the mirror.

sentences.english: an opportunity to view the film before it goes on general release
sentences.chinese: 在影片公映之前观影的机会

detailed_translations.english: to think about something or someone in a particular way

name: appropriate
trans: It’s appropriate to wear a suit when you go to the office.

sentences.english: The timing of the announcement was particularly appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 通告发布的时机很合适。

sentences.english: Where appropriate , I delegate as much work as possible.
sentences.chinese: 只要合适，我就尽量把工作分派出去。

sentences.english: Mark box 1 or 2, as appropriate .
sentences.chinese: 把方框1和2中的合适者标出来。

sentences.english: I can assure you that appropriate action will be taken.
sentences.chinese: 我向你保证会采取适当的行动。

detailed_translations.english: correct or suitable for a particular time, situation, or purpose
to take something, especially money, to use for a particular purpose

name: avoid
trans: Avoid the broken bottle on the floor.

sentences.english: Road safety is taught to young children to avoid road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子受到道路安全知识的教育，以避免交通事故。

sentences.english: It is important to take measures to avoid the risk of fire.
sentences.chinese: 采取措施避免火灾风险很重要。

sentences.english: Alan narrowly avoided an accident.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦险出事故。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something bad from happening

name: behave
trans: She always behaves well when her father is around.

sentences.english: She behaved in a very responsible way .
sentences.chinese: 她表现得很有责任心。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.
sentences.chinese: 我无法相信这些人竟这样行事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表现，举止；运转，做出反应
detailed_translations.english: to do things that are good, bad, sensible etc
The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say

name: calm
trans: A nice warm bath makes me feel so calm.

sentences.english: Glen was calm and composed at the funeral.
sentences.chinese: 格伦在葬礼上表现得平静而镇定。

detailed_translations.english: relaxed and quiet, not angry, nervous, or upset
to become quiet and relaxed after you have been angry, excited, nervous, or upset, or to make someone become quiet and relaxed
a situation or time that is quiet and peaceful

name: concern
trans: I was filled with concern after reading the newspaper.

sentences.english: He was moved by her obvious concern.
sentences.chinese: 她明显的关心使他感动。

detailed_translations.chinese: 关切的事，有关的事；关心，挂念；关系，关联；公司，企业
detailed_translations.english: a feeling of wanting someone to be happy and healthy

detailed_translations.chinese: 涉及， 有关； 使关心， 使担心
detailed_translations.english: if a story, book, report etc concerns someone or something, it is about them

name: content
trans: The baby looked very content sitting on the floor.

sentences.english: The content of the media course includes scripting, editing and camera work.
sentences.chinese: 大众传媒课程的内容包括稿件写作、剪辑和摄像操作。

detailed_translations.english: the ideas, facts, or opinions that are contained in a speech, piece of writing, film, programme etc

name: expect
trans: I expect the bus to be here very soon.

sentences.english: He will be hard to beat. I fully expect (= am completely sure about ) that and I’m ready.
sentences.chinese: 他很难击败。我确信这一点，不过我准备好了。

sentences.english: ‘Who are you?’ he murmured, only half expecting (= thinking it was possible, but not likely ) her to answer.
sentences.chinese: “你是谁？”他低声问道，预计她可能不会回答。

sentences.english: to expect a visit/call/letter from sb
sentences.chinese: 等待某人的来访 / 电话 / 来信

detailed_translations.english: to think that something will happen because it seems likely or has been planned

name: frequently
trans: We meet frequently, either at the beginning or end of the week.

sentences.english: He was frequently drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他经常喝醉。

detailed_translations.english: very often or many times

name: habit
trans: Smoking is a bad habit that can kill you.

sentences.english: Regular exercise is a good habit.
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼是个好习惯。

sentences.english: Thinking negatively can become a habit.
sentences.chinese: 消极的思维方式会成为一种习惯。

sentences.english: She has a habit of playing with her hair when she’s nervous.
sentences.chinese: 她有一个习惯，一紧张就拨弄自己的头发。

sentences.english: Some people drink alcohol as much from habit as from desire.
sentences.chinese: 有些人喝酒既是因为想喝，也是出于习惯。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do regularly or usually, often without thinking about it because you have done it so many times before

name: instruct
trans: My teacher instructs us in several subjects.

sentences.english: Eva went straight to the hotel, as instructed (= as she had been told ).
sentences.chinese: 伊娃按照指示径直去了宾馆。

sentences.english: Greater effort is needed to instruct children in road safety.
sentences.chinese: 在指导儿童注意道路安全方面需要更大的努力。

sentences.english: I was instructed that £20,000 had been paid into my account.
sentences.chinese: 我得到通知两万英镑已存入我的账户。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell someone what to do

name: issue
trans: The men spoke about issues that were important to the people.

sentences.english: Silva issued a statement denying all knowledge of the affair.
sentences.chinese: 西尔瓦发表声明，宣称对此事一无所知。

sentences.english: a warning issued by the Surgeon General
sentences.chinese: （美国）卫生局局长发出的警告

detailed_translations.chinese: 发行； 分发， 发出
detailed_translations.english: to officially make a statement, give an order, warning etc
a subject or problem that is often discussed or argued about, especially a social or political matter that affects the interests of a lot of people

name: none
trans: He spent all his money. There is none left.

sentences.english: I wish I could offer you some cake but there’s none left.
sentences.chinese: 我真想能请你吃些蛋糕，但一点也没剩的了。

sentences.english: Although these were good students, none had a score above 60.
sentences.chinese: 虽然这些都是好学生，但是没有一个考到60分以上。

sentences.english: She waited for a reply, but none came.
sentences.chinese: 她等着答复，可是什么也没等到。

sentences.english: Even an old car is better than none.
sentences.chinese: 有一辆旧车也比没有车强。

sentences.english: I was none too pleased to have to take the exam again.
sentences.chinese: 我要重考一次，根本高兴不起来。

detailed_translations.english: not any amount of something or not one of a group of people or things
not at all

name: patient
trans: I had to be patient and wait until 5 o’clock to leave.

sentences.english: You’ll just have to be patient and wait till I’m off the phone.
sentences.chinese: 你只能耐心点，等我打完电话。

sentences.english: She was tough but wonderful with her patients.
sentences.chinese: 她很严厉，但对病人很好。

detailed_translations.english: able to wait calmly for a long time or to accept difficulties, people’s annoying behaviour etc without becoming angry
someone who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or in a hospital

name: positive
trans: She has a positive future ahead of her after finishing college.

sentences.english: At least something positive has come out of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 至少这个情况也产生了一些积极的东西。

sentences.english: Write down all the positive things about your life.
sentences.chinese: 记下生活中所有好的事情。

sentences.english: The rural environment was having a positive effect on the children’s health.
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境对孩子们的健康有好处。

sentences.english: It’s been a very positive experience for her.
sentences.chinese: 那对她来说是一次非常有益的经历。

sentences.english: TV can be a positive influence .
sentences.chinese: 电视也会有好的影响。

sentences.english: the positive contribution to the community made by many older people
sentences.chinese: 许多老年人为社区做出的积极贡献

sentences.english: It’s been a difficult time but, on the positive side , I feel physically fine.
sentences.chinese: 日子过得不容易，不过从好的方面看，我的身体状况还不错。

sentences.english: Women should be portrayed in a more positive light .
sentences.chinese: 应该从更正面的角度来描绘女性。

detailed_translations.chinese: 确实的， 明确的； 积极的， 肯定的
detailed_translations.english: good or useful

name: punish
trans: To punish me, my teacher had me stand in the corner.

sentences.english: Smacking is not an acceptable way of punishing a child.
sentences.chinese: 要惩罚孩子，不应该用打的方式。

sentences.english: He promised to punish severely any officials found guilty of electoral fraud.
sentences.chinese: 他承诺要严惩任何在选举中有欺诈行为的官员。

sentences.english: They deserve to be punished for putting passengers at risk.
sentences.chinese: 他们置乘客于危险之中，理应受到惩罚。

sentences.english: I felt I was being punished for what my mother had done.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己在为妈妈的所作所为接受惩罚。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone suffer because they have done something wrong or broken the law

name: represent
trans: My lawyer will represent me in court.

sentences.english: Mr Kobayashi was chosen to represent the company at the conference.
sentences.chinese: 小林先生被选中代表公司出席会议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为…的代表， 表示， 象征； 描绘， 表现
detailed_translations.english: to officially speak or take action for another person or group of people

name: shake
trans: When people shake hands, it usually means they agree.

sentences.english: She shook him to wake him up.
sentences.chinese: 她摇摇他，想把他叫醒。

sentences.english: Shake the bottle before you open it.
sentences.chinese: 打开瓶子之前先摇一摇。

sentences.english: The whole house started to shake.
sentences.chinese: 整幢房子摇晃起来。

sentences.english: The car shook as it went over a bump.
sentences.chinese: 汽车驶过一个隆起的地方时颠了一下。

sentences.english: The little boy’s hand was shaking.
sentences.chinese: 这小男孩的手在发抖。

sentences.english: Give the bottle a good shake before use.
sentences.chinese: 使用前要用力摇晃瓶子

sentences.english: His confidence was badly shaken.
sentences.chinese: 他的自信心受到很大的打击。

detailed_translations.english: to move suddenly from side to side or up and down, usually with a lot of force, or to make something or someone do this
if you give something a shake, you move it up and down or from side to side

name: spread
trans: I like to spread butter on my toast.

sentences.english: The cancer had spread to her liver.
sentences.chinese: 癌已经扩散到她的肝脏。

sentences.english: The news spread like wildfire.
sentences.chinese: 消息如野火般迅速传开。

detailed_translations.english: if something spreads or is spread, it becomes larger or moves so that it affects more people or a larger area

name: stroll
trans: My dog and I strolled through the park today.

sentences.english: After dinner, I took a stroll round the city.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭后，我绕着城溜达了一圈。

detailed_translations.english: a slow relaxed walk

name: village
trans: There are only a few houses in my village.

sentences.english: a little fishing village
sentences.chinese: 一座小渔村

detailed_translations.english: a very small town in the countryside

name: active
trans: It is important to be active and not sit around all the time.

sentences.english: games for active youngsters
sentences.chinese: 活跃好动的年轻人玩的游戏

sentences.english: She’s over 80, but is still very active.
sentences.chinese: 她80多岁了，但仍旧很活跃。

sentences.english: He became politically active at college.
sentences.chinese: 他上大学时开始积极参与政治活动。

detailed_translations.english: always busy doing things, especially physical or mental activities

name: adult
trans: My mom and dad are adults.

sentences.english: Some children find it difficult to talk to adults.
sentences.chinese: 一些孩子觉得与大人很难谈得来。

sentences.english: an adult lion
sentences.chinese: 一头成年的狮子

detailed_translations.english: a fully-grown person, or one who is considered to be legally responsible for their actions
fully grown or developed

name: age
trans: She died at the age of 80.

sentences.english: Francis is the same age as me.
sentences.chinese: 弗朗西斯和我同年岁。

sentences.english: Experts disagree over the age of the drawings.
sentences.chinese: 专家对这些画作的年代意见不统一。

sentences.english: Dad retired at the age of 56.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸是在56岁时退休的。

sentences.english: We are living in the age of technology.
sentences.chinese: 我们生活在科技时代。

sentences.english: He was worried to see how much she’d aged.
sentences.chinese: 看到她苍老了许多，他很担心。

detailed_translations.english: the number of years someone has lived or something has existed
to start looking older or to make someone or something look older

name: bad
trans: She is unhappy because she had a bad day.

sentences.english: I have some bad news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我有坏消息要告诉你。

sentences.english: I thought things couldn’t possibly get any worse.
sentences.chinese: 我想事情最坏也不过如此了。

sentences.english: The plane was delayed for several hours by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好，飞机延误了好几个小时。

sentences.english: It’s difficult to break bad habits.
sentences.chinese: 坏习惯很难改。

sentences.english: a bad smell
sentences.chinese: 难闻的气味

detailed_translations.english: unpleasant or likely to cause problems

name: balance
trans: A good balance between work and fun helps keep you healthy.

sentences.english: She balanced the cup on her knee.
sentences.chinese: 她把杯子在膝盖上放稳。

detailed_translations.english: to put your body or sth else into a position where it is steady and does not fall
an instrument for weighing things, with two dishes that hang from a bar

name: bike
trans: He rides his bike to school every day.

sentences.english: Let’s go for a bike ride.
sentences.chinese: 我们去骑会儿自行车吧。

sentences.english: She bikes to work every day.
sentences.chinese: 她每天骑自行车上班。

detailed_translations.english: a bicycle
to ride a bicycle

name: choose
trans: I have to choose between taking art classes and sports lessons.

sentences.english: It took us ages to choose a new carpet.
sentences.chinese: 我们挑选新地毯花了很长时间。

sentences.english: A panel of judges will choose the winner.
sentences.chinese: 会由一个评判小组选出冠军。

sentences.english: He chose his words carefully as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他说话时字斟句酌。

sentences.english: You can, if you choose, invest in the stock market.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意，可以投资股票市场。

detailed_translations.english: to decide which one of a number of things or people you want

name: doctor
trans: You should go to the doctor when you are sick.

sentences.english: She was treated by her local doctor.
sentences.chinese: 她由她的本区医生治疗。

sentences.english: I’d like to make an appointment to see Dr Pugh.
sentences.chinese: 我想预约看皮尤医生。

sentences.english: a Doctor of Law
sentences.chinese: 法学博士

detailed_translations.english: someone who is trained to treat people who are ill

name: during
trans: Did you sleep during the movie?

sentences.english: During the summer she worked as a lifeguard.
sentences.chinese: 夏天她当过救生员。

sentences.english: He slept calmly during the early part of the night.
sentences.chinese: 他上半夜睡得很安稳。

sentences.english: Foxes remain hidden during the day.
sentences.chinese: 狐狸白天一直躲藏着。

detailed_translations.english: from the beginning to the end of a period of time

name: football
trans: Football is a popular sport in the United States.

sentences.english: Which football team do you support?
sentences.chinese: 你支持哪个球队？

sentences.english: kids playing football in the street
sentences.chinese: 在街上踢球的小孩子

sentences.english: My Dad took me to watch my first football match .
sentences.chinese: 爸爸带我去看了我人生第一场足球比赛。

sentences.english: a football club
sentences.chinese: 足球俱乐部

detailed_translations.english: a game played by two teams of eleven players who try to kick a round ball into the other team’s  goal

name: fun
trans: We had a fun time at the birthday party.

sentences.english: There’s plenty of fun for all the family.
sentences.chinese: 可以让全家人玩得很开心。

sentences.english: The children were having so much fun, I hated to call them inside.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子玩得很开心，我不忍心把他们叫进来。

detailed_translations.english: an experience or activity that is very enjoyable and exciting

name: game
trans: Let’s play a board game tonight.

sentences.english: The boys were playing a game in the backyard.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们在后院里玩游戏。

sentences.english: game birds
sentences.chinese: 被捕猎的鸟

detailed_translations.english: an activity or sport in which people compete with each other according to agreed rules

name: heart
trans: My heart beats fast when I am nervous.

sentences.english: Regular exercise is good for the heart.
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼对心脏有好处。

sentences.english: Can you hear my heart beating?
sentences.chinese: 你能听见我的心跳吗？

sentences.english: Her cheeks were hot and her heart was pounding.
sentences.chinese: 她脸颊发烫，心怦怦直跳。

sentences.english: My heart raced. Were we going to land safely?
sentences.chinese: 我心跳得厉害。我们能安全着陆吗？

sentences.english: Daniel had no history of heart problems.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔没有心脏病史。

sentences.english: She suffers from a rare heart condition.
sentences.chinese: 她患有罕见的心脏病。

sentences.english: His breathing and heart rate were now normal.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸和心率现在都正常了。

detailed_translations.english: the organ in your chest which pumps blood through your body

name: golf
trans: People play golf in nice weather.

sentences.english: He plays golf on Sundays.
sentences.chinese: 他星期天都去打高尔夫球。

sentences.english: a round of golf
sentences.chinese: 一场高尔夫球赛

detailed_translations.chinese: 高尔夫球；高尔夫球运动
detailed_translations.english: a game in which the players hit a small white ball into holes in the ground with a set of golf clubs, using as few hits as possible

name: increase
trans: I will increase my score if I study for the test.

sentences.english: The population increased dramatically in the first half of the century.
sentences.chinese: 该世纪上半叶，人口大幅度增加。

sentences.english: political tensions that might increase the likelihood of war
sentences.chinese: 或许会增加战争爆发可能性的紧张政治局面

sentences.english: Visits to the site have increased threefold since May.
sentences.chinese: 来这里的参观者自5月起已增至原来的三倍。

sentences.english: an increase in spending
sentences.chinese: 开支的增长

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sth greater in amount, number, value, etc.
a rise in the amount, number or value of sth

name: life
trans: My grandfather had a long life.

sentences.english: Learning goes on throughout life.
sentences.chinese: 学习是一生的事。

sentences.english: You have your whole life ahead of you.
sentences.chinese: 你前面还有漫长的人生呢。

sentences.english: I’ve known John all my life (= since I was born ).
sentences.chinese: 我从小就认识约翰了。

sentences.english: His main aim in life was to have fun.
sentences.chinese: 他人生的主要目标就是享乐。

sentences.english: It was one of the best days of my life.
sentences.chinese: 那是我一生中最快乐的时光之一。

sentences.english: The accident scarred him for life (= for the rest of his life ).
sentences.chinese: 这场事故给他留下了终生的创伤。

sentences.english: She knew she’d feel guilty for the rest of her life.
sentences.chinese: 她知道自己将内疚终生。

sentences.english: Raj spent his life caring for others.
sentences.chinese: 拉杰一辈子都在关爱他人。

sentences.english: Bonington spent his entire adult life in France.
sentences.chinese: 博宁顿成年后就一直在法国生活。

sentences.english: We don’t know much about the poet’s early life (= when he was young ).
sentences.chinese: 我们对这位诗人的早年生活所知甚少。

sentences.english: Poor diet can lead to a whole range of diseases in later life (= when you are older ).
sentences.chinese: 饮食不良会在晚年引发各种疾病。

sentences.english: She married late in life (= when she was fairly old ).
sentences.chinese: 她结婚晚。

sentences.english: He’s a life member (= continuing until he dies ) of the club.
sentences.chinese: 他是俱乐部的终身会员。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time when someone is alive

name: kilometer
trans: A marathon is 42.2 kilometers.

sentences.english: She had to battle snowstorms, landslides, snakes and loneliness on her 350 kilometer journey.
sentences.chinese: 在350公里的行程中，她要克服暴风雪、滑坡、蛇和孤独寂寞。

sentences.english: But it says food grown and harvested in the 30-kilometer exclusion zone after the emergency might be contaminated and should be avoided.
sentences.chinese: 但是，该组织说，事故发生后，在30公里禁区内种植和收获的食物可能受到污染，应该避免食用。

sentences.english: For example, the researchers last week said they had managed to gather enough energy from a TV station a half-kilometer away to power a small temperature sensor.
sentences.chinese: 例如，研究人员上周说，他们已经设法从半公里远的一座电视发射台收集了足够了能量给一个小型温度传感器供电。

detailed_translations.chinese: [计量] 公里；[计量] 千米（等于kilometre）

name: often
trans: He often goes to bed early during the week.

sentences.english: She often works at the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 她周末经常要上班。

sentences.english: If you wash your hair too often, it can get too dry.
sentences.chinese: 如果洗头过勤，头发会变得干枯。

sentences.english: How often do you see your parents?
sentences.chinese: 你隔多久去看你父母？

sentences.english: Robin is a difficult child; you’ve said so yourself often enough (= a lot of times ).
sentences.chinese: 罗宾是个难管的孩子，你自己也常常这么说。

detailed_translations.english: if something happens often, it happens regularly or many times

name: plenty
trans: We have plenty of fruit, so help yourself.

sentences.english: There’s plenty to do and see in New York.
sentences.chinese: 在纽约有很多事可做，很多东西可看。

detailed_translations.english: a large quantity that is enough or more than enough

name: weight
trans: I gained weight because I ate a lot of pizza.

sentences.english: The average weight of a baby at birth is just over seven pounds.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿的平均出生体重是七磅多一点。

sentences.english: It can be sewn into curtain hems to weight the curtain and so allow it to hang better.
sentences.chinese: 可以把它缝在窗帘的摺边里以增加窗帘的重量，使之更有下垂感。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重量，重力；负担；砝码；重要性
detailed_translations.english: how heavy something is when you measure it
If you weight something, you make it heavier by adding something to it, for example, in order to stop it from moving easily

name: apart
trans: They moved apart and then came back together.

sentences.english: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
sentences.chinese: 他们的办事处远至印度、秘鲁等国。

sentences.english: The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
sentences.chinese: 警方在所有的比赛中都设法将双方的支持者分开。

sentences.english: A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart .
sentences.chinese: 几名男子打起架来，我们不得不将他们拉开。

sentences.english: Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
sentences.chinese: 乔尔皱着眉头，独自站在一边。

sentences.english: Their concept of a performance and our concept were miles apart.
sentences.chinese: 他们对一场表演的概念和我们的概念相去甚远。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成距离，相间隔；分开，除去
detailed_translations.english: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other
If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it

name: attribute
trans: He isn’t very clever, but he does have some other positive attributes.

sentences.english: Women tend to attribute their success to external causes such as luck.
sentences.chinese: 女性往往把她们的成功归因于外因，如运气。

detailed_translations.english: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation
a quality or feature, especially one that is considered to be good or useful

name: bilingual
trans: Since you already know English, after learning French you’ll be bilingual.

sentences.english: a bilingual dictionary
sentences.chinese: 双语词典

sentences.english: The report proposed bilingual education in schools.
sentences.chinese: 报告建议在学校中实行双语教学。

detailed_translations.english: written or spoken in two languages

name: completely
trans: I was completely wrong.

sentences.english: I completely forgot that it’s his birthday today.
sentences.chinese: 我完全忘了今天是他的生日。

sentences.english: He had never completely recovered from his illness.
sentences.chinese: 他病后一直没有完全康复。

sentences.english: a completely new range of low-cost computers
sentences.chinese: 全新的低价电脑系列

sentences.english: I’m not completely sure.
sentences.chinese: 我不能十分肯定。

sentences.english: Portuguese is pronounced completely differently from Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄牙语的发音和西班牙语的完全不同。

detailed_translations.english: to the greatest degree possible

name: dash
trans: Helen dashed up the stairs so she wouldn’t be late for her appointment.

sentences.english: The boat was dashed repeatedly against the rocks.
sentences.chinese: 小船一次又一次撞在岩石上。

sentences.english: When the doors opened, there was a mad dash for seats.
sentences.chinese: 门一开，人们便疯狂地朝座位奔去。

detailed_translations.english: to beat against a surface
an act of going somewhere suddenly and/or quickly

name: disgust
trans: He felt disgust toward his date because she had such terrible eating habits.

sentences.english: He reached into the bin with a look of disgust on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他把手伸进垃圾箱，脸上带着厌恶的表情。

sentences.english: He disgusted many with his boorish behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他以其粗鲁的行为使许多人感到厌恶。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of dislike, annoyance, or disapproval
To disgust someone means to make them feel a strong sense of dislike and disapproval

name: fashionable
trans: It is very fashionable to wear a hat.

sentences.english: Strong colours are very fashionable at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 眼下流行艳丽的色彩。

detailed_translations.english: popular, especially for a short period of time

name: foreign
trans: He has travelled widely in foreign countries.

sentences.english: foreign students
sentences.chinese: 外国学生

sentences.english: Can you speak any foreign languages?
sentences.chinese: 你会讲外语吗？

detailed_translations.english: from or relating to a country that is not your own

name: gulf
trans: There has been a gulf between James and Tony since their parents died.

sentences.english: the Gulf of Mexico
sentences.chinese: 墨西哥湾

detailed_translations.english: a large area of sea partly enclosed by land

name: mirror
trans: He used the mirror to shine light in their eyes.

sentences.english: He spends hours in front of the mirror !
sentences.chinese: 他老是照镜子！

sentences.english: When I looked in the mirror I couldn’t believe it. I looked fantastic!
sentences.chinese: 我看着镜子简直不敢相信，我看上去棒极了！

sentences.english: Henry’s sad smile mirrored that of his son.
sentences.chinese: 亨利脸上那苦涩的笑容跟他儿子一模一样。

sentences.english: The economic recovery in Britain was mirrored in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国出现了和英国相似的经济复苏。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of special glass that you can look at and see yourself in
if one thing mirrors another, it is very similar to it and may seem to copy or represent it

name: natural
trans: We need to take care of the natural world.

sentences.english: the study of the natural world
sentences.chinese: 对自然界的研究

sentences.english: an area of spectacular natural beauty
sentences.chinese: 自然风景秀丽的地区

sentences.english: death from natural causes
sentences.chinese: 自然死亡

sentences.english: the need for natural light in offices
sentences.chinese: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

detailed_translations.english: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people

name: nowadays
trans: Nowadays, not so many people smoke.

sentences.english: Nowadays people are rarely shocked by the sex they see on television.
sentences.chinese: 如今人们在电视上看见性爱镜头不太会感到吃惊了。

sentences.english: Most people nowadays are aware of the importance of a healthy diet.
sentences.chinese: 现在大多数人都明白健康饮食的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: now, compared with what happened in the past

name: participant
trans: There were thousands of participants in this year’s marathon.

sentences.english: If you have time – please answer a comment of another participant.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有时间-请答复另外一个参与者的评论。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is taking part in an activity or event

name: ritual
trans: Ken was very interested to learn about the religious rituals of the natives.

sentences.english: ancient pagan rituals
sentences.chinese: 古老的异教仪式

sentences.english: the importance of religion and ritual in our lives
sentences.chinese: 我们生活中宗教和宗教仪式的重要性

sentences.english: The lady of the house performs the sacred ritual of lighting two candles.
sentences.chinese: 由女主人来完成点燃两根蜡烛的神圣仪式。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, in order to mark an important religious or social occasion

name: spoken
trans: We cannot take back what has been spoken.

sentences.english: How do you think of your proficiency in written and spoken English?
sentences.chinese: 你认为你的书面英语和口头英语熟练程度如何？

sentences.english: They found that what language is spoken by a community largely depends on the arrival of men, whether through the migration of pioneering farmers or military invasion.
sentences.chinese: 他们发现一个群落说什么样的语言很大程度上取决于男人的进驻，无论这些人是移居的垦荒农民还是军事入侵者。

detailed_translations.english: the form of language that you speak rather than write

name: sport
trans: She loves watching sport on TV.

sentences.english: the sport of falconry
sentences.chinese: 放鹰狩猎运动

sentences.english: a demonstration by people opposed to blood sports
sentences.chinese: 反对猎杀动物运动的人士举行的示威游行

detailed_translations.chinese: 运动；游戏；娱乐；运动会；玩笑
detailed_translations.english: an activity that people do in the countryside, especially hunting or fishing
to play together happily

name: surprised
trans: He didn’t appear at all surprised when he read the article.

sentences.english: He looked surprised to see Cassie standing by the front door.
sentences.chinese: 他看到卡西站在前门旁，显得很吃惊。

sentences.english: He had a surprised look on his face.
sentences.chinese: 他一脸惊讶。

sentences.english: Don’t be surprised if the interviewer is rather direct.
sentences.chinese: 如果采访的人说话比较直接，也不要吃惊。

sentences.english: I wouldn’t be surprised if she married that fellow.
sentences.chinese: 要是她嫁给那家伙，我不会感到意外。

detailed_translations.english: having a feeling of surprise

name: tense
trans: I felt very tense waiting to hear the result of the vote.

sentences.english: Is anything wrong? You look a little tense.
sentences.chinese: 有什么不对劲吗？你看起来有点紧张。

detailed_translations.english: a tense situation is one in which you feel very anxious and worried because of something bad that might happen
to make your muscles tight and stiff, or to become tight and stiff

any of the forms of a verb that show the time, continuance, or completion of an action or state that is expressed by the verb. ‘I am’ is in the present tense, ‘I was’ is past tense, and ‘I will be’ is future tense.

name: totally
trans: I am totally against that.

sentences.english: That’s a totally different matter.
sentences.chinese: 那完全是两码事。

sentences.english: It’s like learning a totally new language.
sentences.chinese: 这像是在学一门全新的语言。

sentences.english: I totally agree.
sentences.chinese: 我完全同意。

detailed_translations.english: completely

name: vague
trans: I asked him about his mother’s health, but he was very vague about it.

sentences.english: The governor gave only a vague outline of his tax plan.
sentences.chinese: 州长只是含糊地大致说了一下他的税务计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不明确的； 含糊的； 暧昧的
detailed_translations.english: unclear because someone does not give enough detailed information or does not say exactly what they mean

name: allow
trans: Having a ticket will allow you to enter the show.

sentences.english: We don’t allow diving in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 泳池内禁止跳水。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

name: announce
trans: He announced to everyone his new idea for the company.

sentences.english: All visitors to the apartment building must be announced.
sentences.chinese: 那幢公寓楼的访客都必须通报。

sentences.english: After announcing himself at the reception desk, James was led upstairs.
sentences.chinese: 在接待处通报姓名后，詹姆斯被领上楼去。

detailed_translations.english: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

name: beside
trans: The two brothers stood beside each other.

sentences.english: Wendy came up and sat beside me.
sentences.chinese: 温迪走过来，坐在我身边。

sentences.english: the table beside the bed
sentences.chinese: 床边的桌子

sentences.english: I was standing right beside her at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我就站在她的旁边。

detailed_translations.english: next to or very close to the side of someone or something

name: challenge
trans: It was a challenge to climb to the top of the mountain.

sentences.english: They threw down the challenge that he couldn’t wash 40 cars in one hour (= invited him to try to do it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们激将他，说他不可能在1小时内擦洗40辆汽车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑战，邀请比赛；艰巨的任务；怀疑，质问
detailed_translations.english: something that tests strength, skill, or ability, especially in a way that is interesting

detailed_translations.chinese: 反对， 公然反抗； 向…挑战； 对…质疑
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept that something is right, fair, or legal

name: claim
trans: He claimed to know why the country’s laws were weak.

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

name: condition
trans: The patient’s condition was very good.

sentences.english: Profits increased by £1.5m, despite the difficult economic conditions.
sentences.chinese: 尽管经济形势不佳，利润还是增长了150万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: the state that something is in, especially how good or bad its physical state is

name: contribute
trans: We decided to contribute money to the new hospital.

sentences.english: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.chinese: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.english: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.chinese: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

detailed_translations.english: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose

name: difference
trans: The biggest difference between the birds is the color of their feathers.

sentences.english: There’s a big difference between knowing that something is true, and being able to prove it.
sentences.chinese: 知道什么正确与能够证明它正确，这之间有很大的不同。

sentences.english: There's not much difference in price between the two computers.
sentences.chinese: 这两种计算机价格上没有多大的差别。

sentences.english: We have our differences , but she's still my sister.
sentences.chinese: 我们之间虽然不和，但她仍旧是我的妹妹。

detailed_translations.english: a way in which two or more people or things are not like each other

name: divide
trans: We divided the pizza.

sentences.english: The book is divided into six sections.
sentences.chinese: 本书分为六部分。

sentences.english: The money will be divided equally among the charities.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱将被平分给各慈善机构。

detailed_translations.english: if something divides, or if you divide it, it separates into two or more parts

name: expert
trans: The wizard was an expert at magic.

sentences.english: ...a yoga expert.
sentences.chinese: …一位瑜伽专家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a special skill or special knowledge of a subject, gained as a result of training or experience

name: famous
trans: The Eiffel Tower in Paris is very famous.

sentences.english: a famous actor
sentences.chinese: 著名演员

sentences.english: Many famous people have stayed in the hotel.
sentences.chinese: 许多名人都曾下榻这家酒店。

sentences.english: The Eiffel Tower is a famous landmark (= a famous place or building that is easy to recognize ) .
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔是著名的地标。

sentences.english: Da Vinci’s world-famous portrait of the Mona Lisa
sentences.chinese: 达•芬奇的那幅闻名世界的肖像画《蒙娜丽莎》

detailed_translations.english: known about by many people in many places

name: force
trans: He used all his force to try and open the door.

sentences.english: Westerly gales forced the ship off course.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的西风将那艘船吹离了航道。

sentences.english: Firemen entering the building were forced back by flames.
sentences.chinese: 冲进大楼的消防队员被火焰挡了回来。

sentences.english: She tried to keep the door shut but the man forced it open .
sentences.chinese: 她不想打开门，但那男人硬是把它推开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 强迫；用力推动，用力打开
detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something move in a particular direction or into a different position, especially through or using great strength

detailed_translations.chinese: 军队， 兵力； 暴力， 武力； 力， 力气； 影响力， 效力
detailed_translations.english: military action used as a way of achieving your aims

name: harm
trans: A hot iron can cause great harm if you are not careful.

sentences.english: The scandal did his career a lot of harm.
sentences.chinese: 丑闻对他的职业生涯造成很大损害。

sentences.english: Our children deserve protection from harm.
sentences.chinese: 我们的儿童理应得到保护免受伤害。

sentences.english: chemicals that harm the environment
sentences.chinese: 损害环境的化学品

detailed_translations.english: damage, injury, or trouble caused by someone’s actions or by an event
to have a bad effect on something

name: lay
trans: Don’t lay your socks on the floor.

sentences.english: He laid his hand on my shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 他把一只手搭在我的肩上。

sentences.english: They laid a wreath at the place where so many people died.
sentences.chinese: 他们在这么多人丧生的地方放了一个花圈。

sentences.english: Lay the material flat on the table.
sentences.chinese: 把布料平铺在桌上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 躺下；产卵；搁放；放置；铺放；涂，敷
detailed_translations.english: to put someone or something down carefully into a flat position

detailed_translations.chinese: 世俗的；外行的；没有经验的
detailed_translations.english: not trained or not knowing much about a particular profession or subject

detailed_translations.chinese: 位置；短诗；花纹方向；叙事诗；性伙伴
detailed_translations.english: a poem or song

name: peace
trans: A white dove is a symbol of peace.

sentences.english: The country is at peace with its neighbours for the first time in years.
sentences.chinese: 这是多年来该国与其邻国第一次和平共处。

sentences.english: By the end of the century, France had made peace with Britain.
sentences.chinese: 到那个世纪末，法国和英国议和了。

sentences.english: a city where people of different religions have lived together in peace for centuries
sentences.chinese: 不同宗教的人们和平共处数百年的城市

sentences.english: efforts to bring peace to the region
sentences.chinese: 为该地区争取和平的努力

sentences.english: a dangerous situation which threatens world peace
sentences.chinese: 威胁世界和平的危险状况

sentences.english: An uneasy peace continued until 1939.
sentences.chinese: 不稳定的和平局面维持到1939年。

sentences.english: the Northern Ireland peace talks
sentences.chinese: 北爱尔兰和平会谈

sentences.english: an international peace conference
sentences.chinese: 国际和平大会

sentences.english: the peace treaty that ended the First World War
sentences.chinese: 终结第一次世界大战的和平条约

sentences.english: the Middle East peace process
sentences.chinese: 中东和平进程

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is no war or fighting

name: prince
trans: The prince and the princess were married.

sentences.english: Prince William
sentences.chinese: 威廉王子

sentences.english: Prince Rainier of Monaco
sentences.chinese: 摩纳哥的兰尼埃亲王

detailed_translations.english: the son of a king, queen, or prince

name: protect
trans: Firemen protect us from fires.

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: sense
trans: I could sense that he was watching me.

sentences.english: Cats have a very acute sense of hearing (= very good, so that they can hear even the smallest sound ) .
sentences.chinese: 猫的听觉非常敏锐。

sentences.english: Employees need the sense of being appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 雇员需要被赏识的感觉。

sentences.english: It was dark and he had completely lost his sense of direction.
sentences.chinese: 天黑了，他完全失去了方向感。

sentences.english: This is true in a general sense.
sentences.chinese: 从一般意义上来讲，这是对的。

sentences.english: Perhaps he sensed your distrust.
sentences.chinese: 也许他感觉到了你的不信任。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感官；感觉；理解力；判断力；意义
detailed_translations.english: one of the five natural powers of sight, hearing, feeling, taste, and smell, that give us information about the things around us
if you sense something, you feel that it exists or is true, without being told or having proof

name: sudden
trans: He felt a sudden pain in his chest.

sentences.english: a sudden change in the weather
sentences.chinese: 天气的突然变化

sentences.english: Life is cruel, she thought, with a sudden rush of anger.
sentences.chinese: 生活真残酷，她想，心头突然涌上一股怒气。

sentences.english: a sudden movement
sentences.chinese: 突然的一动

sentences.english: Her death was sudden.
sentences.chinese: 她的死很突然。

detailed_translations.english: happening, coming, or done quickly or when you do not expect it

name: therefore
trans: He is fat. Therefore, he should go on a diet.

sentences.english: Their car was bigger and therefore more comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他们的车大些，所以更舒适些。

sentences.english: Progress so far has been very good. We are, therefore, confident that the work will be completed on time.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止进展十分顺利，所以我们有把握按时完成工作。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that has just been mentioned

name: accept
trans: I accepted the girl’s very nice gift.

sentences.english: Rick accepted her offer of coffee.
sentences.chinese: 她请里克喝咖啡，他接受了。

sentences.english: He accepted the invitation to stay with us.
sentences.chinese: 他接受了邀请来我们家住。

sentences.english: His school reports said that he is always ready to accept a challenge (=  agree to do something difficult  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的学业报告上说他乐于接受挑战。

sentences.english: Please accept this small gift.
sentences.chinese: 请收下这份小小的礼物。

sentences.english: They offered me a job and I accepted.
sentences.chinese: 他们给我一份工作，我接受了。

sentences.english: He readily accepted her invitation (=  accepted it quickly  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他欣然接受了她的邀请。

detailed_translations.english: to take something that someone offers you, or to agree to do something that someone asks you to do

name: arrange
trans: Please arrange the words in order from A to Z.

sentences.english: Contact your local branch to arrange an appointment.
sentences.chinese: 请联络当地分部安排预约。

sentences.english: I’d like to arrange a business loan.
sentences.chinese: 我想办理一笔商业贷款。

sentences.english: Matthew arrived at 2 o'clock as arranged.
sentences.chinese: 马修两点钟依约而至。

detailed_translations.chinese: 安排， 准备； 整理
detailed_translations.english: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

name: attend
trans: My sister and I attend the same school.

sentences.english: Only 12 people attended the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 只有12个人出席了会议。

sentences.english: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
sentences.chinese: 如果不能出席，请通知我们。

sentences.english: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
sentences.chinese: 将军临终时有几名医生在照料他。

detailed_translations.english: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class

name: chase
trans: I was chased by a dog.

sentences.english: The dogs saw him running and chased him.
sentences.chinese: 那些狗看到他在跑就追他。

sentences.english: kids chasing around the house
sentences.chinese: 在屋里追逐嬉戏的孩子们

detailed_translations.chinese: 追逐， 追赶， 追求
detailed_translations.english: to quickly follow someone or something in order to catch them

name: contrast
trans: The contrast between my parents is very noticeable.

sentences.english: an essay comparing and contrasting (= showing how two things are similar and different ) Verdi and Wagner and their operas
sentences.chinese: 把威尔第和瓦格纳以及他们的歌剧进行比较和对照的一篇文章

detailed_translations.chinese: 形成对比， 对比之下显出区别
detailed_translations.english: if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising
something that is very different from something else
if two things contrast, the difference between them is very easy to see and is sometimes surprising

name: encourage
trans: My football coach will encourage us when we are losing.

sentences.english: I want to thank everyone who has encouraged and supported me.
sentences.chinese: 我要感谢每一位鼓励和支持过我的人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone the courage or confidence to do something

name: familiar
trans: The two friends were very familiar with each other.

sentences.english: a familiar tune
sentences.chinese: 熟悉的曲调

sentences.english: It was a relief to be back in familiar surroundings .
sentences.chinese: 回到熟悉的环境里让人松了一口气。

sentences.english: Beggars on the street are becoming a familiar sight .
sentences.chinese: 街上出现乞丐的情况逐渐变得屡见不鲜。

sentences.english: This kind of situation was all too familiar (= very familiar ) to John.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形对约翰来说太熟悉了。

sentences.english: Her face seems vaguely familiar , but I can’t quite place her.
sentences.chinese: 她看起来有点面熟，但我还是认不出她来。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is familiar is well-known to you and easy to recognize

name: grab
trans: I grabbed a pear from the tree.

sentences.english: I grabbed my bag and ran off.
sentences.chinese: 我抓起我的包就跑。

sentences.english: Two men grabbed her and pushed her to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 两名男子抓住她，把她推倒在地上。

sentences.english: Kay grabbed hold of my arm to stop herself falling.
sentences.chinese: 凯抓住我的手臂，以免自己摔倒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 抓取，攫取；赶紧做；抓住；抓，夺
detailed_translations.english: to take hold of someone or something with a sudden or violent movement
to suddenly try to take hold of something

name: hang
trans: I drew a picture of my family, and my mother hung it on the wall.

sentences.english: Philip hung his coat on a hook behind the door.
sentences.chinese: 菲利普把自己的大衣挂在门后的钩子上。

sentences.english: She hung the sheets on the washing line.
sentences.chinese: 她把床单晾在晒衣绳上。

detailed_translations.chinese: [hung-hung] 悬挂， 吊； 徘徊； [hanged-hanged] 吊
detailed_translations.english: to put something in a position so that the top part is fixed or supported, and the bottom part is free to move and does not touch the ground

name: huge
trans: At work, my father drives a huge truck.

sentences.english: a huge dog
sentences.chinese: 一条大狗

sentences.english: huge crowds
sentences.chinese: 大群大群的人

sentences.english: Your room’s huge compared to mine.
sentences.chinese: 你的房间跟我的比很大。

sentences.english: These shoes make my feet look huge.
sentences.chinese: 这双鞋让我的脚看上去大极了。

sentences.english: the huge scale of the problem
sentences.chinese: 该问题的严重性

detailed_translations.english: extremely large in size, amount, or degree

name: necessary
trans: A passport is necessary if you travel to other countries.

sentences.english: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
sentences.chinese: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。

sentences.english: No further changes were considered necessary.
sentences.chinese: 没有必要作出进一步改变。

sentences.english: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
sentences.chinese: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

sentences.english: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

detailed_translations.english: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do

name: pattern
trans: My pattern of brushing my teeth is the same as most people’s.

sentences.english: Weather patterns have changed in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 气候模式近年已经发生了变化。

sentences.english: A general pattern began to emerge .
sentences.chinese: 一个总体模式开始显现。

sentences.english: Their descriptions seemed to follow a set pattern (= always develop in the same way ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的描述似乎依据固定的模式。

sentences.english: His behavior fits a pattern of violent acts.
sentences.chinese: 他的举动符合暴力行为的模式。

sentences.english: a dress pattern
sentences.chinese: 连衣裙的纸样

detailed_translations.english: the regular way in which something happens, develops, or is done

name: propose
trans: My grandmother proposed that we have our picture taken with Santa.

sentences.english: the changes currently proposed by the local planning authorities
sentences.chinese: 目前由地方规划局提议的改革

sentences.english: the proposed budget cuts
sentences.chinese: 所提出的预算削减

detailed_translations.english: to suggest something as a plan or course of action

name: purpose
trans: The purpose of exercising is to get into shape.

sentences.english: The purpose of this meeting is to elect a new chairman.
sentences.chinese: 这次会议的目的是选出一位新主席。

detailed_translations.english: the purpose of something is what it is intended to achieve

name: release
trans: She released the bird from her hands.

sentences.english: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
sentences.chinese: 警察逮捕了几个人，后来都释放了。

sentences.english: The bears are eventually released into the wild.
sentences.chinese: 这些熊最后被放回野生环境中。

sentences.english: You need to release the tension in these shoulder muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你需要放松肩部肌肉。

sentences.english: The new trade figures have just been released.
sentences.chinese: 新的贸易数字刚刚公布。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere

name: require
trans: We require teachers to have a university degree.

sentences.english: Campbell’s broken leg will probably require surgery.
sentences.chinese: 坎贝尔的一条腿骨折，可能需要手术。

sentences.english: What’s required is a complete reorganization of the system.
sentences.chinese: 需要做的是彻底整顿整个系统。

sentences.english: Most house plants require regular watering.
sentences.chinese: 大多数室内盆栽植物需要定期浇水。

sentences.english: The bill failed to get the required number of votes.
sentences.chinese: 法案没有得到规定的票数。

detailed_translations.english: to need something

name: satisfied
trans: I am very satisfied with your work.

sentences.english: a satisfied smile
sentences.chinese: 满意的微笑

sentences.english: They have plenty of satisfied customers .
sentences.chinese: 他们的许多客户都很满意。

sentences.english: Will she ever be satisfied?
sentences.chinese: 她何时才能满足？

detailed_translations.english: feeling that something is as good as it should be, or that something has happened in the way that you want

name: single
trans: I have a single key in my hand.

sentences.english: A single tree gave shade from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 唯有一棵树遮阴。

sentences.english: They won the game by a single point.
sentences.chinese: 他们仅以一分的优势赢得比赛。

sentences.english: the highest price ever paid for a single work of art
sentences.chinese: 为单件艺术品所支付的最高价格

sentences.english: a single-sex school
sentences.chinese: 单一性别的学校

detailed_translations.english: only one
a ticket for a trip from one place to another but not back again

name: tear
trans: It is easy to tear paper.

sentences.english: The children were all in tears .
sentences.chinese: 孩子们全都哭了。

sentences.english: She came home in floods of tears .
sentences.chinese: 她泪流满面地回到家里。

sentences.english: I could see that Sam was close to tears .
sentences.chinese: 我看到萨姆都快哭了。

sentences.english: Bridget suddenly burst into tears and ran out.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特突然大哭着跑了出去。

sentences.english: He was fighting back tears as he spoke.
sentences.chinese: 他一边说，一边拼命忍住泪水。

sentences.english: A lot of people were moved to tears by his story.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都被他的故事感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He kissed her cheek, a gesture that brought tears to her eyes .
sentences.chinese: 他亲了亲她的脸，这个举动让她热泪盈眶。

sentences.english: I must admit I shed a few tears when the school closed.
sentences.chinese: 我必须承认，学校关闭时我掉过几滴眼泪。

sentences.english: I saw grown men reduced to tears that day.
sentences.chinese: 那天我看到成年男子都流下了眼泪。

sentences.english: ‘Please don’t talk like that,’ Ellen implored him, her eyes filling with tears .
sentences.chinese: “请别那么说。”埃伦恳求道，眼里噙满泪水。

sentences.english: By this time, tears were streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 此时，我已泪流满面。

sentences.english: The tears he shed were tears of joy .
sentences.chinese: 他淌下的是喜悦的泪水。

detailed_translations.english: a drop of salty liquid that comes out of your eye when you are crying

name: theory
trans: We talked about Einstein’s theory of relativity in class.
