trans: He took a bite of the apple and then gave me the remainder of it.

sentences.english: The remainder must be paid by the end of June.
sentences.chinese: 剩余款项必须在6月底之前支付。

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 余数，残余；剩余物；其余的人
detailed_translations.english: the part of something that is left after everything else has gone or been dealt with

name: retrieve
trans: She retrieved her mail from the mailbox.

sentences.english: She bent down to retrieve her earring.
sentences.chinese: 她俯身去捡回耳环。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重新得到， 取回， 收回； 挽回， 补救； 检索
detailed_translations.english: to find something and bring it back

name: shallow
trans: The kids were playing in the shallow water.

sentences.english: a shallow river
sentences.chinese: 浅河

sentences.english: The lake is quite shallow.
sentences.chinese: 这湖很浅。

sentences.english: the shallow end of the pool
sentences.chinese: 游泳池的浅水区

sentences.english: Place the meat in a shallow dish.
sentences.chinese: 把肉放在一个浅盘里。

detailed_translations.english: measuring only a short distance from the top to the bottom

name: slope
trans: The slope to the top of the mountain was very steep.

sentences.english: a steep slope
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

sentences.english: a gentle
sentences.chinese: 缓坡

sentences.english: She looked back up the grassy slope.
sentences.chinese: 她回头望了一眼那绿草如茵的坡地。

sentences.english: a pleasant garden that slopes down to the river
sentences.chinese: 一座向河边倾斜的宜人花园

detailed_translations.english: a piece of ground or a surface that slopes
if the ground or a surface slopes, it is higher at one end than the other

name: span
trans: His work at the bakery has spanned twenty years.

sentences.english: I worked with him over a span of six years.
sentences.chinese: 我和他共事达六年之久。

sentences.english: The bridge crosses the river in a single span.
sentences.chinese: 河上的桥为单跨桥。

detailed_translations.english: the length of time that sth lasts or is able to continue

name: superstition
trans: It is a superstition that Friday the 13th is an unlucky day.

sentences.english: the old superstition that walking under a ladder is unlucky
sentences.chinese: 认为从梯子下面穿过不吉利的古老迷信

detailed_translations.english: a belief that some objects or actions are lucky or unlucky, or that they cause events to happen, based on old ideas of magic

name: sympathy
trans: I felt sympathy for my sister, so I got her a balloon to cheer her up.

sentences.english: Our sympathies are with the families of the victims.
sentences.chinese: 我们向受害者家庭表示慰问。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being sorry for someone who is in a bad situation

name: vibrate
trans: The machine made his whole body vibrate as he broke up the ground.

sentences.english: The floor was vibrating to the beat of the music.
sentences.chinese: 地板随着音乐的节奏在颤动。

sentences.english: As air passes over our vocal cords, it makes them vibrate.
sentences.chinese: 气流通过我们的声带，使之产生振动。

detailed_translations.english: if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements
if something vibrates, or if you vibrate it, it shakes quickly and continuously with very small movements

name: wander
trans: The boys like to wander in the woods and look at birds.

sentences.english: She wandered aimlessly around the streets.
sentences.chinese: 她在大街上漫无目的地到处游荡。

sentences.english: Pauline started to wander from the point.
sentences.chinese: 保利娜开始偏题了。

sentences.english: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose

name: armor
trans: The soldier wore armor to protect his body.

sentences.english: The leading role in the film is costumed in medieval armor.
sentences.chinese: 影片中的主角穿着中古时代的甲胄。

sentences.english: This Courtly Poetry came out of the idea of chivalry and courtly love that you might associate with knights in shining armor.
sentences.chinese: 这首宫廷诗取材于骑士精神和典雅爱恋，你可能会想到这与身穿闪光的盔甲的骑士有关。

name: blaze
trans: The small fire soon blazed into a large, dangerous one.

sentences.english: Some 4,000 firefighters are battling the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 约有四千名消防人员正在与大火搏斗。

sentences.english: the blaze of light from the security lamps
sentences.chinese: 安全灯的强光

sentences.english: The room was warm, with a fire blazing in the hearth.
sentences.chinese: 房间里暖融融的，壁炉里的火熊熊燃烧。

detailed_translations.english: a big dangerous fire – used especially in news reports
to burn very brightly and strongly

name: boom
trans: The firecrackers made a loud boom when they exploded.

sentences.english: The boom has created job opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 经济繁荣创造了就业的机会。

sentences.english: the economic boom of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济繁荣

sentences.english: The economy went from boom to bust (=  from increasing to decreasing  ) very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 经济很快就从繁荣走向了萧条。

detailed_translations.english: a quick increase of business activity

name: cliff
trans: The wolf stood at the cliff and howled.

sentences.english: The car rolled over the edge of a cliff.
sentences.chinese: 汽车翻下了悬崖边。

detailed_translations.english: a large area of rock or a mountain with a very steep side, often at the edge of the sea or a river

name: flame
trans: The torch was filled with yellow and orange flames.

sentences.english: Flames poured out of the windows of the building.
sentences.chinese: 火焰从大楼窗口冒出来。

sentences.english: They rushed past us with buckets of water and tried to douse the flames .
sentences.chinese: 他们提着一桶桶水跑过我们身边去灭火。

sentences.english: They sat around the campfire, watching the flickering flames .
sentences.chinese: 他们围坐在篝火旁，看着跳动的火焰。

sentences.english: Flames quickly engulfed the building.
sentences.chinese: 火焰很快吞噬了大楼。

sentences.english: a candle flame
sentences.chinese: 烛焰

detailed_translations.english: hot bright burning gas that you see when something is on fire
to burn brightly

name: independence
trans: After leaving home, Sophia had a great feeling of independence.

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

name: invasion
trans: In Korea, walls were built around cities to protect them from invasions.

sentences.english: the invasion of Normandy
sentences.chinese: 对诺曼底的入侵

detailed_translations.english: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

name: knight
trans: He was the best soldier, so the king made him a knight.

sentences.english: knights in armour
sentences.chinese: 身披盔甲的骑士

sentences.english: He was knighted in June 1988.
sentences.chinese: 他于1988年6月被授予爵士称号。

detailed_translations.english: a man with a high rank in the past who was trained to fight while riding a horse
If someone is knighted, they are given a knighthood

name: lightning
trans: The lightning flashed above the water.

sentences.english: a lightning attack
sentences.chinese: 闪电式突袭

detailed_translations.english: very fast, and often without warning
a powerful flash of light in the sky caused by electricity and usually followed by thunder

name: rebel
trans: The rebel was angry about the government’s unfair policies.

sentences.english: Voters rebelled against high property taxes.
sentences.chinese: 投票者们反对高额财产税。

detailed_translations.english: to oppose or fight against someone in authority or against an idea or situation which you do not agree with
someone who opposes or fights against people in authority

name: retreat
trans: The army retreated because they were losing the battle.

sentences.english: Napoleon’s retreat from Moscow
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑从莫斯科的撤退

sentences.english: The rebel forces are in full retreat (= retreating very fast ) .
sentences.chinese: 叛军全线溃退。

sentences.english: The bugler sounded the retreat (= gave a loud signal for retreat ) .
sentences.chinese: 司号兵吹响撤退号。

detailed_translations.english: a movement away from the enemy after a defeat in battle
to move away from the enemy after being defeated in battle

name: revolution
trans: The revolution in Russia led to the creation of the Soviet Union.

sentences.english: the French Revolution of 1789
sentences.chinese: 1789年法国大革命

sentences.english: the planets’ revolution around the sun
sentences.chinese: 行星围绕太阳的公转

detailed_translations.english: an attempt, by a large number of people, to change the government of a country, especially by violent action

name: spear
trans: The soldier was holding a spear in his hand.

sentences.english: I fended off his sword thrust with my spear.
sentences.chinese: 他一刀砍来， 我拿枪架住。

sentences.english: He transfixed the enemy's heart with a spear.
sentences.chinese: 他用长矛刺穿了敌人的心脏。

sentences.english: Yes,of course. My shield is the strongest.It can stop any spear in the world.
sentences.chinese: 当然是了。我的盾是最结实的，它能抵挡住世界上任何矛。

detailed_translations.english: a pole with a sharp pointed blade at one end, used as a weapon in the past
to push or throw a spear into something, especially in order to kill it

name: steep
trans: He rode his bike up the steep hill to reach the top.

sentences.english: The road became rocky and steep.
sentences.chinese: 路变得崎岖陡峭起来。

sentences.english: a steep climb to the top
sentences.chinese: 到山顶的一段陡坡

sentences.english: steep cuts in benefits
sentences.chinese: 救济金的大幅度削减

detailed_translations.english: a road, hill etc that is steep slopes at a high angle

name: summit
trans: Snow covered the summit of the mountain even during the summer.

sentences.english: the European summit
sentences.chinese: 欧洲首脑会议

sentences.english: The two presidents agreed to hold a summit in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 两位总统商定在春天举行一次首脑会议。

sentences.english: a five-nation summit meeting
sentences.chinese: 五国峰会

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高点， 峰顶； 最高级会议
detailed_translations.english: an important meeting or set of meetings between the leaders of several governments

name: thunder
trans: The sound of the thunder startled me.

sentences.english: We were woken in the night by thunder.
sentences.chinese: 晚上我们被雷声惊醒。

detailed_translations.english: the loud noise that you hear during a storm, usually after a flash of lightning
if it thunders, there is a loud noise in the sky, usually after a flash of lightning
to make a very loud deep noise

name: troops
trans: The troops were all prepared to go into battle.

name: warrior
trans: The samurai were some of the most skilled warriors in the ancient world.

sentences.english: a noble warrior
sentences.chinese: 忠勇的战士

detailed_translations.chinese: 战士，勇士；鼓吹战争的人
detailed_translations.english: a soldier or fighter who is brave and experienced – used about people in the past

name: withdraw
trans: After losing the battle, the enemy withdrew back to its own country.

sentences.english: calls for Britain to withdraw from the European Union
sentences.chinese: 要求英国退出欧盟的呼声

detailed_translations.chinese: 缩回， 退出； 撤退
detailed_translations.english: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this
to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

name: yield
trans: He had to yield his turn because he was in checkmate.

sentences.english: Our research has only recently begun to yield important results.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近我们的研究才开始取得重要成果。

detailed_translations.english: to produce a result, answer, or piece of information

name: bench
trans: Most parks have benches for people to relax upon.

sentences.english: We sat on a park bench.
sentences.chinese: 我们坐在公园的长椅上。

detailed_translations.english: a long seat for two or more people, especially outdoors

name: daisy
trans: There were a few daisies growing in the field.

sentences.english: The little daisy was as happy as if the day had been a great holiday, but it was only Monday.
sentences.chinese: 小雏菊快乐得就像在过一个不寻常的假日，但这天只是星期一。

sentences.english: A crisp white blouse was paired with a slim single-fold black pencil skirt with a daisy for daytime sophistication.
sentences.chinese: 一件轻薄的白色宽松上衣，搭配细长的绣着雏菊的黑色单层铅笔裙作为混搭日装。

sentences.english: Then it noticed the little daisy, and nodded to it, and kissed it with its beak and said: “You must also fade in here, poor little flower.
sentences.chinese: 这时他注意到了那朵小雏菊，向她点头，吻了她并说：“你在这儿一定也会枯萎，可怜的小花儿。

detailed_translations.english: a white flower with a yellow centre

name: dispute
trans: Karen and Brian often have disputes about silly things.

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: empty
trans: The teacher showed the students an empty bottle.

sentences.english: an empty box
sentences.chinese: 空盒子

sentences.english: an empty bottle
sentences.chinese: 空瓶子

sentences.english: an empty space behind the desk
sentences.chinese: 书桌后面的空位

sentences.english: The fuel tank’s almost empty.
sentences.chinese: 燃油箱快要空了。

detailed_translations.english: having nothing inside

name: horror
trans: The audience screamed in horror when the ghost appeared in the movie.

sentences.english: People watched in horror as the plane crashed to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 人们惊恐地看着飞机坠落到地面上。

sentences.english: The thought of being left alone filled her with horror.
sentences.chinese: 想到被孤零零地留下，她就不寒而栗。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of great shock, fear or disgust

name: incident
trans: Mr. Wilson had an incident; he became sick and had to leave.

sentences.english: His bad behaviour was just an isolated incident.
sentences.chinese: 他的不良行为只是个别事件。

sentences.english: Roads were sealed off because of a major incident.
sentences.chinese: 因为发生重大事故，道路被封锁了。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens, especially sth unusual or unpleasant

name: mist
trans: The forest was covered with mist.

sentences.english: We could just see the outline of the house through the mist.
sentences.chinese: 薄雾中我们只能看到房子的轮廓。

sentences.english: He vanished into the mist.
sentences.chinese: 他消失在雾中。

sentences.english: The hills were shrouded in mist (= covered in mist, so that you could not see them ) .
sentences.chinese: 山峦笼罩在雾霭之中。

sentences.english: The mist came down off the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 雾从山上飘下来。

sentences.english: The mists rolled in off the sea (= came on to the land from the sea ) .
sentences.chinese: 雾气从海上涌来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄雾；视线模糊不清；模糊不清之物
detailed_translations.english: a light cloud low over the ground that makes it difficult for you to see very far

name: object
trans: The shopping cart was filled with objects.

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: orphan
trans: The orphan frequently cried during the night.

sentences.english: The war has left thousands of children as orphans.
sentences.chinese: 这场战争使成千上万的孩子成为孤儿。

detailed_translations.english: a child whose parents are both dead
to become an orphan

name: plot
trans: The group was plotting to ruin the company’s financial reports.

sentences.english: a two-acre plot of land
sentences.chinese: 一块两英亩的土地

sentences.english: a vegetable plot
sentences.chinese: 一块菜地

detailed_translations.english: a small piece of land for building or growing things on
to make a secret plan to harm a person or organization, especially a political leader or government

name: pregnant
trans: The pregnant woman was shopping for baby clothes.

sentences.english: care for pregnant women
sentences.chinese: 孕妇保健

sentences.english: I knew right away that I was pregnant.
sentences.chinese: 我立即明白我怀孕了。

sentences.english: I thought I was too old to get pregnant .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得自己年龄太大，已经不能怀孕了。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to get her pregnant (= make her pregnant ) .
sentences.chinese: 我没想让她怀孕。

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant (= almost ready to give birth ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的妻子即将临产。

detailed_translations.english: if a woman or female animal is pregnant, she has an unborn baby growing inside her body

name: rage
trans: The chef was filled with rage when his helpers ruined the meal.

sentences.english: Sobbing with rage, Carol was taken to the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 卡罗尔气得呜呜哭，被送往医院。

sentences.english: Richens was 17 when he flew into a rage and stabbed another teenager.
sentences.chinese: 里琴斯17岁那年一怒之下捅了一名少年。

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤怒；狂暴，肆虐；情绪激动
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of uncontrollable anger
to feel very angry about something and show this in the way you behave or speak

name: revenge
trans: He broke his sister’s doll as revenge after she lost his favorite book.

sentences.english: The attackers were said to be taking revenge on the 14-year-old, claiming he was a school bully.
sentences.chinese: 攻击者被称是在报复一名14岁男孩，称他是学校一霸。

detailed_translations.english: something you do in order to punish someone who has harmed or offended you
to punish someone who has done something to harm you or someone else

name: shame
trans: The boy felt shame about misplacing his clothes.

sentences.english: He felt a deep sense of shame.
sentences.chinese: 他深深地感到羞愧。

sentences.english: Maria blushed with shame.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚羞得脸都红了。

sentences.english: (= it made her feel ashamed ) , she gained back all the weight she’d lost.
sentences.chinese: 让她感到惭愧的是，她减掉的体重全又长回来了。

sentences.english: He’s brought shame on the whole family.
sentences.chinese: 他使全家蒙羞。

sentences.english: (= it should not make you feel ashamed ) saying ‘I don’t know’.
sentences.chinese: 说一句"我不知道”也没什么可难为情的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞耻，羞愧；憾事，带来耻辱的人
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you feel guilty and embarrassed because you, or someone who is close to you, have done something wrong
to make someone feel ashamed

name: sigh
trans: Molly sighed when she looked at all the information she had to research.

sentences.english: ‘Well, there’s nothing we can do about it now,’ she sighed.
sentences.chinese: “唉，我们现在对此无能为力。”她叹口气说。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in and out making a long sound, especially because you are bored, disappointed, tired etc
an act or sound of sighing

name: sneak
trans: The thief snuck out of the house without anyone noticing him.

sentences.english: I snuck her a note.
sentences.chinese: 我偷偷塞给她一张纸条。

detailed_translations.english: to go somewhere secretly and quietly in order to avoid being seen or heard
to go somewhere secretly and quietly in order to avoid being seen or heard

name: spare
trans: I wanted to help him but I couldn’t spare a tire.

sentences.english: Sorry, I can’t spare the time.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我抽不出时间。

sentences.english: Have you got any spare boxes?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有多余的盒子？

sentences.english: You could sleep in the spare bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 你可以睡那间空着的客房。

sentences.english: Do you have any spare cash?
sentences.chinese: 你手头有闲钱吗？

sentences.english: I’ll go and see if there are any spare seats.
sentences.chinese: 我去看看是否还有空余的座位。

sentences.english: A decline in beer sales had left the industry with spare capacity (= the ability to produce more than can be sold ) .
sentences.chinese: 啤酒销售量的下降使该行业出现产能闲置。

detailed_translations.english: to make something such as time, money, or workers available for someone, especially when this is difficult for you to do
not being used or not needed at the present time

name: stem
trans: The rose had a long thin stem.

sentences.english: ‘Writ ’ is the stem of the forms ‘writes ’, ‘writing ’ and ‘written ’.
sentences.chinese: writ是writes、writing和written三个词的词干。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a word that stays the same when different endings are added to it, for example ‘driv-’ in ‘driving’

name: supper
trans: We usually have supper around 6 o’clock at my house.

sentences.english: Why don’t you come over for supper on Friday?
sentences.chinese: 周五为什么不过来吃晚饭呢？

sentences.english: We had supper in a small Italian place.
sentences.chinese: 我们在一家意大利小餐馆吃了晚饭。

sentences.english: Have you eaten supper ?
sentences.chinese: 你吃过晚饭了吗？

detailed_translations.english: the meal that you have in the early evening

name: tender
trans: The meat was so tender they didn’t need knives to cut it.

sentences.english: Continue cooking until the meat is tender.
sentences.chinese: 把肉一直烧到松软为止。

detailed_translations.chinese: 嫩的；脆弱的；疼痛的，一触即痛的；温柔的
detailed_translations.english: tender food is easy to cut and eat, especially because it has been well cooked
to formally offer or show something to someone
a formal statement of the price you would charge for doing a job or providing goods or services

name: beneath
trans: The largest part of an iceberg lies beneath the waterline.

sentences.english: The top layer should now point down to the layer beneath.
sentences.chinese: 现在，顶部图层应当有小箭头指向下面的图层。

sentences.english: The fortress on the hill covered the harbour area beneath.
sentences.chinese: 山上的炮楼把下面的海港地区置于射程之内。

sentences.english: They must all be drowning beneath him, in the watery caves of the rock!
sentences.chinese: 他们一定是在他下面的水里，就在那岩石充满了水的洞中游泳了！

detailed_translations.english: in or to a lower position than something, or directly under something

name: cub
trans: The lion cub was crying for its mother.

sentences.english: a five-month old lion cub
sentences.chinese: 五个月大的幼狮

sentences.english: a tiger and her cubs
sentences.chinese: 一只老虎和它的幼崽

detailed_translations.chinese: 幼兽；不懂规矩的年轻人
detailed_translations.english: the baby of a wild animal such as a lion or a bear

name: dawn
trans: At dawn, the sun gently rose over the farm.

sentences.english: When dawn broke (= the first light of the day appeared ) , we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
sentences.chinese: 破晓的时候，我们离加尔各答还有50英里。

sentences.english: I was up at the crack of dawn (= very early in the morning ) to get the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我一大早就起来赶飞机。

sentences.english: We worked from dawn to dusk (= through the whole day while it is light ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们从早干到晚。

sentences.english: the cold light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 清冷的晨曦

sentences.english: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨过后，破晓时天朗气清。

detailed_translations.english: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears
if day or morning dawns, it begins

name: dissatisfied
trans: I was dissatisfied with their decision to work on Sunday.

sentences.english: dissatisfied clients
sentences.chinese: 感到不满意的客户

detailed_translations.chinese: 不满意的， 不满足的
detailed_translations.english: not satisfied because something is not as good as you had expected

name: ease
trans: The monkey climbed the tree with ease.

sentences.english: She lived a life of ease.
sentences.chinese: 她过着悠闲自在的生活。

sentences.english: The plan should ease traffic congestion in the town.
sentences.chinese: 这项计划对城里的交通拥挤状况应该有所缓解。

detailed_translations.english: lack of difficulty
to become or to make sth less unpleasant, painful, severe, etc.

name: evident
trans: It was evident from the look on his face that he was unhappy.

sentences.english: Bob ate his lunch with evident enjoyment.
sentences.chinese: 显然鲍勃吃午饭吃得津津有味。

detailed_translations.english: easy to see, notice, or understand

name: hail
trans: The hail from the storm was the size of golf balls.

sentences.english: heavy showers of rain and hail
sentences.chinese: 夹着冰雹的阵阵大雨

detailed_translations.english: frozen raindrops which fall as hard balls of ice

detailed_translations.chinese: 致敬；招呼；向欢呼；猛发；使像下雹样落下（过去式hailed，过去分词hailed，现在分词hailing，第三人称单数hails）
detailed_translations.english: to call to someone in order to greet them or try to attract their attention

name: howl
trans: The wolf howled at the moon.

sentences.english: wind howling in the trees
sentences.chinese: 在林间呼啸的风

sentences.english: Somewhere a dog suddenly howled, baying at the moon.
sentences.chinese: 某个地方的一只狗突然嗥叫起来，对着月亮狂吠。

detailed_translations.english: if the wind howls, it makes a loud high sound as it blows
If an animal such as a wolf or a dog howls, it makes a long, loud, crying sound

detailed_translations.chinese: 嗥叫； 呼啸；吼叫； 哀号
detailed_translations.english: a loud high sound made by the wind blowing

name: leap
trans: He had to leap over the gap to reach the other side of the hill.

sentences.english: She leapt over the fence.
sentences.chinese: 她跳过篱笆。

sentences.english: He threw a stick into the river and the dog went after it in a flying leap.
sentences.chinese: 他把一根枝条扔到河里，那条狗一个飞跃就追了过去。

detailed_translations.english: to jump high into the air or to jump in order to land in a different place
a big jump

name: magnificent
trans: The man gave his wife a pair of magnificent diamond earrings.

sentences.english: The magnificent beau is dancing to the light of chandeliers.
sentences.chinese: 这个衣着华丽的花花公子在枝形吊灯灯光下翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: These magnificent ancient buildings demonstrate the great intelligence of the labouring people.
sentences.chinese: 这些壮丽的古代建筑显示了劳动人民的高度智慧。

name: necessity
trans: Fresh water is a necessity for life.

sentences.english: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

detailed_translations.english: when something is necessary

name: outcome
trans: The outcome of his latest business plan was a complete failure.

sentences.english: People who had heard the evidence at the trial were surprised at the outcome.
sentences.chinese: 在审判过程中听过证词的人都对此结果感到吃惊。

detailed_translations.english: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

name: pile
trans: The pile of cups was beginning to lean.

sentences.english: He balanced the plate on the top of a pile of books.
sentences.chinese: 他把盘子在一摞书上放稳。

sentences.english: Ma stacked the cups and piled the plates.
sentences.chinese: 妈妈把杯盘堆叠起来。

detailed_translations.english: a group of several things of the same type that are put on top of each other
to arrange things in a pile

name: profound
trans: For a young man, Jeremy has some profound thoughts.

sentences.english: a profound question
sentences.chinese: 深刻的问题

sentences.english: Jenner is a profound thinker.
sentences.chinese: 詹纳是个思想深刻的人。

detailed_translations.english: showing great knowledge and understanding

name: seize
trans: The man seized as much money as he could before anyone could see him.

sentences.english: Suddenly he seized my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他突然抓住我的手。

sentences.english: The rebels have seized power.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子夺取了政权。

sentences.english: The gunmen were seized at 1 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 这几名持枪歹徒在凌晨1点被抓获。

detailed_translations.english: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

name: squeeze
trans: When Clara saw her cat, she squeezed it to her face.

sentences.english: She smiled as he squeezed her hand.
sentences.chinese: 他捏了捏她的手，她笑了。

sentences.english: He squeezed the trigger, but nothing happened.
sentences.chinese: 他扣动扳机，但没有反应。

detailed_translations.english: to press something firmly together with your fingers or hand

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤； 握手； 拮据， 紧缺
detailed_translations.english: an act of pressing something firmly with your fingers or hand

name: supreme
trans: The supreme officer was in charge of keeping the citizens calm.

sentences.english: the Supreme Allied Commander in Europe
sentences.chinese: 欧洲盟军最高指挥官

sentences.english: a country where the car reigns supreme
sentences.chinese: 汽车占绝对优势地位的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 最高的；至高的；最重要的
detailed_translations.english: having the highest position of power, importance, or influence

name: terrific
trans: My youngest daughter is a terrific painter.

sentences.english: That’s a terrific idea!
sentences.chinese: 这个主意真棒！

sentences.english: The actress who played the lawyer was terrific.
sentences.chinese: 扮演律师的女演员表演十分出色。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极妙的； 极大的； 令人恐惧的
detailed_translations.english: very good, especially in a way that makes you feel happy and excited

name: trait
trans: One trait of Salvador’s personality is his cheerfulness.

sentences.english: The study found that some alcoholics had clear personality traits showing up early in childhood.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究发现一些酗酒者早在孩童时就表现出明显的个性特征。

detailed_translations.english: a particular quality in someone’s character

name: vital
trans: The heart is a vital organ.

sentences.english: The work she does is absolutely vital.
sentences.chinese: 她所做的工作至关重要。

sentences.english: It is vital to be honest with your children.
sentences.chinese: 对自己的孩子坦诚十分重要。

sentences.english: The tourist industry is of vital importance to the national economy.
sentences.chinese: 旅游业对国家的经济至关重要。

sentences.english: Richardson played a vital role in the team’s success.
sentences.chinese: 理查森对球队的成功起了极重要的作用。

sentences.english: The samples could give scientists vital information about long-term changes in the earth’s atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 这些样本可以给科学家提供关于地球大气长期变化的极其重要的资料。

detailed_translations.english: extremely important and necessary for something to succeed or exist

name: attack
trans: She watched the lizard attack its prey.

sentences.english: a bomb attack
sentences.chinese: 炸弹袭击

sentences.english: a knife attack
sentences.chinese: 持刀攻击

sentences.english: an arson attack
sentences.chinese: 纵火袭击

sentences.english: victims of racial attacks
sentences.chinese: 种族袭击的受害者

detailed_translations.chinese: 攻击， 进攻； 突然发作
detailed_translations.english: an act of violence that is intended to hurt a person or damage a place

name: breast
trans: She was diagnosed with breast cancer.

sentences.english: These bras are specially designed for women with large breasts.
sentences.chinese: 这些胸罩专为乳房丰满的女性设计。

sentences.english: breast milk
sentences.chinese: 母乳

sentences.english: breast cancer
sentences.chinese: 乳腺癌

sentences.english: Dick cradled her photograph against his breast.
sentences.chinese: 迪克把她的照片轻轻拥在胸前。

detailed_translations.english: one of the two round raised parts on a woman’s chest that produce milk when she has a baby

name: cancer
trans: He was a leading scientist in finding a cure for cancer.

sentences.english: A lot of cancers can now be treated successfully.
sentences.chinese: 现在许多癌症可以治愈。

sentences.english: She was told last year that she had cancer .
sentences.chinese: 去年她得知自己患了癌症。

sentences.english: He died of cancer last month.
sentences.chinese: 上个月他死于癌症。

sentences.english: a new treatment which effectively kills cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 一种能有效杀死癌细胞的新疗法

detailed_translations.english: a very serious disease in which cells in one part of the body start to grow in a way that is not normal

name: cancerous
trans: The exam found cancerous cells in the patient’s blood.

name: cell
trans: A red blood cell carries oxygen.

sentences.english: cancer cells
sentences.chinese: 癌细胞

sentences.english: Embryos grow by cell division (= the splitting of cells ) .
sentences.chinese: 胚胎通过细胞分裂而成长。

detailed_translations.english: the smallest part of a living thing that can exist independently

name: cigarette
trans: Cigarette smoking is terrible for your health.

sentences.english: a packet of cigarettes
sentences.chinese: 一包香烟

detailed_translations.english: a thin tube of paper filled with finely cut tobacco that people smoke

name: code
trans: She used the code to solve the puzzle.

sentences.english: The spy sent his message in code.
sentences.chinese: 这个间谍用密码发送情报。

sentences.english: But we have not yet implemented this in the code.
sentences.chinese: 但我们在代码中尚未实现此功能。

sentences.english: The hacker came smack up against the company's policy of keeping its records in code.
sentences.chinese: 这个计算机黑客突然碰壁了，因这家公司实行了用密码保存公司纪录的政策。

name: cure
trans: Scientists are still working on finding a cure for diabetes.

sentences.english: Will you be able to cure him, Doctor?
sentences.chinese: 医生，你能把他治好吗？

sentences.english: The new treatment effected a miraculous cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种新疗法产生了奇迹般的疗效。

detailed_translations.english: to make a person or an animal healthy again after an illness
the act of making someone well again after an illness

name: destruction
trans: The wildfires left the forest in a state of destruction.

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["weapons of mass destruction"]}
sentences.chinese: 大规模杀伤性武器

sentences.english: the environmental destruction caused by the road building programme
sentences.chinese: 筑路工程造成的环境破坏

sentences.english: The floods brought death and destruction to the area.
sentences.chinese: 洪水给该地区带来了死亡和破坏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 破坏， 毁灭； 消灭
detailed_translations.english: the act or process of destroying something or of being destroyed

name: DNA
trans: The police sometimes use DNA to solve crime.

sentences.english: At the moment, the regulation on how much human DNA can be put into an animal is vague.
sentences.chinese: 目前，有关多少人类脱氧核糖核酸可以放入一只动物身上的规定，还很模糊。

name: extensive
trans: The game drew extensive media coverage.

sentences.english: The house stands in extensive grounds.
sentences.chinese: 这栋房子占地面积很大。

sentences.english: Fire has caused extensive damage to the island’s forests.
sentences.chinese: 大火严重毁坏了岛上的森林。

sentences.english: the extensive use of pesticides
sentences.chinese: 杀虫剂的大量使用

sentences.english: The exhibition has received extensive coverage in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这次展览会被全国媒体广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: large in size, amount, or degree

name: female
trans: She is the only female student in her class with short hair.

sentences.english: female voters
sentences.chinese: 女性选民

sentences.english: Over half of the staff is female.
sentences.chinese: 半数以上的员工是女性。

detailed_translations.english: relating to women or girls
an animal that belongs to the sex that can have babies or produce eggs

name: furthermore
trans: She’s clever, and furthermore, she is not afraid of work.

sentences.english: He is old and unpopular. Furthermore, he has at best only two years of political life ahead of him.
sentences.chinese: 他年纪已老，又不得人心，而且他最多也只有两年的政治生命了。

detailed_translations.english: in addition to what has already been said

name: gene
trans: Gene therapy is sometimes used to treat an illness.

sentences.english: human genes
sentences.chinese: 人类基因

sentences.english: the genes that regulate cell division
sentences.chinese: 控制细胞分裂的基因

detailed_translations.english: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

name: inherit
trans: All the girls in my family inherit red hair from my great-grandmother.

sentences.english: inherited wealth
sentences.chinese: 继承的财富

detailed_translations.english: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died
to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

name: link
trans: The two lines in the poem share a common link.

sentences.english: He walked with her, linking arms (= putting his arm around her arm ).
sentences.chinese: 他与她挽臂同行。

detailed_translations.english: to join two things by putting one through the other
each ring of a chain

name: male
trans: He was the only male in the store.

sentences.english: a deep male voice
sentences.chinese: 低沉的男声

sentences.english: traditional male values
sentences.chinese: 传统的男性价值观

sentences.english: Motor-racing has largely been a male preserve (= something that only men have been involved with ) .
sentences.chinese: 赛车基本上是男人的专利。

detailed_translations.english: typical of or relating to men or boys
a man

name: population
trans: The population of our city is steadily growing.

sentences.english: Nearly 70 percent of the population still live in the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 人口中差不多有70%仍住在乡村。

sentences.english: Most of the world’s population doesn’t get enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 世界上大多数人都吃不饱。

detailed_translations.english: the number of people living in a particular area, country etc

name: result
trans: The result of her experiment was surprising.

sentences.english: How would you cope with unemployment and the resulting loss of income?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何应付失业及由此造成的收入损失？

detailed_translations.english: if something results from something else, it is caused by it
something that happens or exists because of something that happened before

name: sugar
trans: She added extra sugar to her tea.

sentences.english: Do you take sugar in your coffee?
sentences.chinese: 你的咖啡加糖吗？

detailed_translations.english: a sweet white or brown substance that is obtained from plants and used to make food and drinks sweet
to add sugar or cover something with sugar

name: accommodate
trans: The meeting room can accommodate nine people.

sentences.english: He bought a huge house to accommodate his library.
sentences.chinese: 他买了一座大房子来放他的藏书。

sentences.english: The ballroom can accommodate 400 people.
sentences.chinese: 那个舞厅可容纳400人。

detailed_translations.english: if a room, building etc can accommodate a particular number of people or things, it has enough space for them

name: circus
trans: I like to go to the circus to see the animals do tricks.

sentences.english: Piccadilly Circus
sentences.chinese: 皮卡迪利广场

detailed_translations.english: a group of people and animals who travel to different places performing skilful tricks as entertainment

name: coincide
trans: My birthday coincides with Christmas.

sentences.english: When our vacations coincided, we often holidayed together.
sentences.chinese: 我们的假期要是凑巧赶在一起，我们常常会一同去度假。

sentences.english: The interests of the US and those of the islanders may not coincide.
sentences.chinese: 美国的利益和这些岛民的利益可能并不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

name: commission
trans: The artist was commissioned to create a picture.

sentences.english: The Government set up a commission to investigate allegations of police violence.
sentences.chinese: 政府成立了一个委员会调查对警察施暴行为的指控。

detailed_translations.chinese: 委任状；委员会；佣金，回扣；授权，委托
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who have been given the official job of finding out about something or controlling something
to formally ask someone to write an official report, produce a work of art for you etc

name: dose
trans: My mother gave me a dose of medicine before I went to bed.

sentences.english: In short, we badly need another very big dose of stimulus.
sentences.chinese: 简言之，我们很需要另一个很大剂量的刺激计划。

sentences.english: There are other questions too, including what dose of green tea catechins is ideal.
sentences.chinese: 也有一些别的问题，包括多少剂量的绿茶儿茶素是理想的。

sentences.english: All have a generous dose of herbs and spices, everything from chervil and celery seed to cloves and peppercorns.
sentences.chinese: 从山萝卜到芹菜籽，从丁香到胡椒籽，每一样均含有大剂量的药草和香料成分。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of a medicine or a drug that you should take

name: dye
trans: Valery got her hair dyed at the salon yesterday.

sentences.english: The women prepared, spun, and dyed the wool.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们将羊毛预备、纺线并染色。

sentences.english: hair dye
sentences.chinese: 染发剂

detailed_translations.english: to give something a different colour using a dye
a substance you use to change the colour of your clothes, hair etc

name: extent
trans: He ate to such an extent that he became overweight.

sentences.english: Things are not yet carried to that extent.
sentences.chinese: 事情还没有发展到那种程度。

sentences.english: When the smoke blew away, we could see the extent of the damage.
sentences.chinese: 浓烟消散后， 我们就能看清破坏的程度了。

sentences.english: The extent of human cooperation is unique, but not cooperation itself.
sentences.chinese: 人类的合作程度，而非合作本身，是独一无二的。

name: gender
trans: Do you know the gender of her new baby?

sentences.english: people of the same gender
sentences.chinese: 同性别的人

sentences.english: Discrimination on grounds of race or gender is forbidden.
sentences.chinese: 严禁种族歧视和性别歧视。

sentences.english: There may be gender differences in attitudes to paid work.
sentences.chinese: 对待有偿劳动的态度可能存在着性别差异。

sentences.english: traditional gender roles
sentences.chinese: 传统的性别角色

sentences.english: toys that do not reinforce gender stereotypes
sentences.chinese: 不强化性别模式化观念的玩具

sentences.english: a science fiction story dealing with gender issues
sentences.chinese: 以性别问题为题材的科幻故事

detailed_translations.english: the fact of being male or female

name: headline
trans: The headline on the front page was about the economy.

sentences.english: a paper carrying the front-page headline: ‘Space Aliens meet with President’
sentences.chinese: 头版报道题为“天外来客会见总统”的报纸

detailed_translations.chinese: 大标题；内容提要；栏外标题；头版头条新闻
detailed_translations.english: the title of a newspaper report, which is printed in large letters above the report

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…加标题；使成为注意中心；大力宣传
detailed_translations.english: to give a headline to an article or story

name: informal
trans: They had an informal meeting to talk about their experiences.

sentences.english: The atmosphere at work is fairly informal.
sentences.chinese: 工作气氛相当轻松。

sentences.english: The two groups met for informal talks.
sentences.chinese: 两个团体会面举行非正式会谈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非正式的；不拘礼节的；随便的；通俗的；日常使用的
detailed_translations.english: relaxed and friendly without being restricted by rules of correct behaviour

name: inquire
trans: Dad called to inquire about the price of tickets for the show.

sentences.english: ‘Why are you doing that?’ the boy inquired.
sentences.chinese: “你为什么这么做？”男孩问道。

sentences.english: Toby would have liked to inquire further (= ask more questions ).
sentences.chinese: 托比本想问更多的问题。

sentences.english: The investigation will inquire into the company’s financial dealings.
sentences.chinese: 此次调查将会涉及公司的财务往来。

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone for information

name: messenger
trans: The messenger delivered an important document to the office.

sentences.english: There will be a messenger at the airport to collect the photographs from our courier.
sentences.chinese: 机场会有一名信使从我们的快递员那儿取走照片。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to deliver messages or documents, or someone who takes a message to someone else

name: peer
trans: She peered at people through the window.

sentences.english: American children did less well in math than their peers in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 美国儿童的数学成绩不如日本的同龄儿童。

sentences.english: Staff members are trained by their peers.
sentences.chinese: 员工由同事培训。

detailed_translations.english: your peers are the people who are the same age as you, or who have the same type of job, social class etc

name: portrait
trans: I saw many religious portraits when I went to the museum.

sentences.english: a family portrait
sentences.chinese: 全家福

sentences.english: She’s been commissioned to paint Jackson’s portrait .
sentences.chinese: 她已受托为杰克逊画肖像。

detailed_translations.english: a painting, drawing, or photograph of a person

name: pose
trans: The kids and their dog posed for a picture.

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: ranch

sentences.chinese: 船翻后许多人淹死了。
