sentences.chinese: 三个联盟政党召开的一次紧急会议

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合体， 同盟； 结合， 联合
detailed_translations.english: a union of two or more political parties that allows them to form a government or fight an election together

name: deceptive
trans: The scary-looking man’s appearance is deceptive; he is actually very nice.

sentences.english: Some snakes move with deceptive speed (= move faster than you think or expect ) .
sentences.chinese: 有些蛇的爬行速度出乎意料地快。

sentences.english: Gwen’s students may look angelic, but appearances can be deceptive .
sentences.chinese: 格温的学生也许看起来像天使，不过人不可貌相。

detailed_translations.english: something that is deceptive seems to be one thing but is in fact very different

name: diabetes
trans: Overweight people are more likely to suffer from diabetes than slimmer ones.

sentences.english: You have diabetes, or liver or kidney disease.
sentences.chinese: 有糖尿病，或者是有肝病或肾病者。

sentences.english: It is like diabetes or asthma, an illness, due to a build up of pressures, which can happen to anyone.
sentences.chinese: 就像是糖尿病或者哮喘，由于压力的形成，这种病有可能发生在任何人身上。

sentences.english: We can then translate this information into estimates of the current diabetes and cardiovascular disease that can be attributed to the rise in consumption of these drinks.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们可以将这些信息转变成对当前糖尿病和冠心病的估计，而这些疾病是软饮料消耗量的增加所导致的。

detailed_translations.english: a serious disease in which there is too much sugar in your blood

name: eliminate
trans: Wearing a seatbelt eliminates some of the dangers of driving a car.

sentences.english: a ruthless dictator who eliminated all his rivals
sentences.chinese: 铲除所有异己的残酷独裁者

detailed_translations.english: to completely get rid of something that is unnecessary or unwanted

name: erosion
trans: Canyons are formed because rivers of fast-moving water caused erosion.

sentences.english: the problem of soil erosion
sentences.chinese: 水土流失的问题

sentences.english: the erosion of the coastline
sentences.chinese: 海岸线受到的侵蚀

detailed_translations.english: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

name: ethics
trans: The act of stealing certainly doesn’t go against some people’s ethics.

sentences.english: Refugee workers said such action was a violation of medical ethics.
sentences.chinese: 难民工作者称这种行为违背了医学道德。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理学；伦理观；道德标准
detailed_translations.english: Ethics are moral beliefs and rules about right and wrong

name: explicit
trans: The man gave a very explicit account of the car accident.

sentences.english: The contrast could not have been made more explicit.
sentences.chinese: 这个对比再清楚不过了。

sentences.english: explicit knowledge of grammar
sentences.chinese: 清楚易懂的语法知识

sentences.english: The kidnappers gave us explicit instructions not to involve the police.
sentences.chinese: 绑匪明确告诉我们不许报警。

sentences.english: Be explicit when you talk about money with your family.
sentences.chinese: 与家人谈钱的问题要直截了当。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

name: framework
trans: His ideas fit into the framework of a successful business plan.

sentences.english: We have to act within the existing legal framework.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须在现行的法律框架下行事。

detailed_translations.english: a set of ideas, rules, or beliefs from which something is developed, or on which decisions are based

name: manufacture
trans: My father’s company manufactures steel building materials.

sentences.english: the company that manufactured the drug
sentences.chinese: 生产这种药的公司

sentences.english: manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 工业品，制成品

sentences.english: Cost will determine the methods of manufacture.
sentences.chinese: 成本将决定生产方法。

sentences.english: a major importer of cotton manufactures
sentences.chinese: 棉花产品的主要进口商

detailed_translations.english: to use machines to make goods or materials, usually in large numbers or amounts
the process of making goods or materials using machines, usually in large numbers or amounts

name: mechanism
trans: I can’t open my car door because the locking mechanism is broke.

sentences.english: the brake mechanism
sentences.chinese: 刹车装置

sentences.english: a clock mechanism
sentences.chinese: 钟表机件

detailed_translations.english: part of a machine or a set of parts that does a particular job

name: minimize
trans: I checked my homework twice to minimize errors I might have made.

sentences.english: Every effort is being made to minimize civilian casualties.
sentences.chinese: 正在尽最大努力减少平民伤亡。

sentences.english: The rail company is bringing in more trains in an effort to minimize disruption to travellers.
sentences.chinese: 铁路公司正投入更多的列车来减少旅客的不便。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree

name: nectar
trans: Bees use nectar to make their honey.

sentences.english: Bees gather nectar from flowers.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂从花朵上采集花蜜。

sentences.english: Upon returning to the hive, they deposit the nectar into pockets, called honeycombs, in the hive’s walls. It is from here that we get honey.
sentences.chinese: 一返回蜂房，它们便将花蜜储存在被称作“六角形蜂窝”的蜂房壁上的小巢中，我们就是从那里采集蜂蜜的。

detailed_translations.english: the sweet liquid that bees collect from flowers

name: notion
trans: I had a notion that this route would get us to the beach.

sentences.english: She had no notion what he meant.
sentences.chinese: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

sentences.english: misguided notions of male superiority
sentences.chinese: 男尊女卑的错误观念

detailed_translations.english: an idea, belief, or opinion

name: regime
trans: He was a member of the old regime that had been overthrown in the election.

sentences.english: The regime got rid of most of its opponents.
sentences.chinese: 该政权清除了大多数反对者。

sentences.english: Under the new regime, all sheep and cattle will be regularly tested for disease.
sentences.chinese: 根据新制度，所有牛羊都要定期接受疾病检测。

detailed_translations.english: a government, especially one that was not elected fairly or that you disapprove of for some other reason

name: straightforward
trans: The teacher’s grading system was straightforward and fair.

sentences.english: In this example, we will use the most straightforward method of all -- writing our object reference to a file that will be picked up by our client.
sentences.chinese: 在这个示例中，我们将使用所有方法中最直截了当的一种 — 将对象引用写入一个文件，该 文件将由客户机选取。

name: bankrupt
trans: The store had few customers and soon went bankrupt.

sentences.english: The firm went bankrupt before the building work was completed.
sentences.chinese: 建筑工程尚未竣工，公司就破产了。

sentences.english: In 1977 he was declared bankrupt (=  by a court  ) .
sentences.chinese: 1977年，他被宣布破产。

sentences.english: Mr Trent lost his house when he was made bankrupt .
sentences.chinese: 特伦特先生破产以后房子也没有了。

sentences.english: Seventeen years of war left the country bankrupt.
sentences.chinese: 17年的战争把国家耗空了。

sentences.english: a bankrupt electrical company
sentences.chinese: 一家破产的电力公司

sentences.english: The move to the market nearly bankrupted the firm and its director.
sentences.chinese: 走向市场的行动几乎使这家公司及其董事破产。

sentences.english: Johns had been nearly bankrupted through a failed business venture.
sentences.chinese: 约翰斯因为商业投资失败几近破产。

sentences.english: In total, 80% of bankrupts are men.
sentences.chinese: 总体来看，有80%的破产者为男性。

detailed_translations.english: without enough money to pay what you owe
To bankrupt a person or organization means to make them go bankrupt
someone who has officially said that they cannot pay their debts

name: conform
trans: The new student had to conform to the school’s dress code.

sentences.english: The building does not conform with safety regulations.
sentences.chinese: 例句：这座建筑物不符合安全条例。

sentences.english: It did not conform to the usual stereotype of an industrial city.
sentences.chinese: 这和一座常规的工业城市那种千篇一律的格局不一样。

detailed_translations.english: to obey a law, rule etc

name: employ
trans: The bookstore employed two full-time clerks.

sentences.english: The factory employs over 2,000 people.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂雇用了2,000多名员工。

sentences.english: The report examines teaching methods employed in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 这个报告探讨了课堂教学方法。

sentences.english: Her days are employed in gardening and voluntary work.
sentences.chinese: 她的时间都花在搞园艺和做义工上。

detailed_translations.english: to pay someone to work for you

name: expel
trans: Since he would not follow the rules, the principal had to expel the student.

sentences.english: Two girls were expelled from school for taking drugs.
sentences.chinese: 两名女生因吸毒而被学校开除。

sentences.english: Foreign priests were expelled from the country.
sentences.chinese: 外国牧师被驱逐出境。

sentences.english: As the lungs exhale this waste, gas is expelled into the atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 当肺呼出这股废气，气体就被排到空气中。

detailed_translations.english: to officially force someone to leave a school or organization

name: extension
trans: My parents decided to add an extension to our house for the new baby.

sentences.english: Can I have extension 316, please?
sentences.chinese: 能帮我接316号分机吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of many telephone lines connected to a central system in a large building, which all have different numbers

name: forthcoming
trans: Some economists predicted that the forthcoming world economy would be severe.

sentences.english: the forthcoming elections
sentences.chinese: 即将到来的选举

sentences.english: Keep an eye on the noticeboards for forthcoming events .
sentences.chinese: 请注意布告牌上的活动预告。

detailed_translations.english: a forthcoming event, meeting etc is one that has been planned to happen soon

name: furnish
trans: Most homes are furnished with tables, chairs, and beds.

sentences.english: Will these finds furnish more information on prehistoric man?
sentences.chinese: 这些发现是否能提供更多有关史前人类的资料？

sentences.english: Having bought the house, they couldn’t afford to furnish it.
sentences.chinese: 买下房子后，他们没有钱买家具了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 装备，布置 （房间、建筑物）；供应，提供
detailed_translations.english: to put furniture and other things into a house or room

name: hygiene
trans: People who brush their teeth at least twice a day are practicing good hygiene.

sentences.english: the importance of personal hygiene
sentences.chinese: 个人卫生的重要性

sentences.english: a food hygiene training course
sentences.chinese: 食品卫生培训课程

detailed_translations.english: the practice of keeping yourself and the things around you clean in order to prevent diseases

name: hygienic
trans: My sister works very hard to keep her entire home as hygienic as possible.

name: landlord
trans: The landlord collected everyone’s rent money on the first day of every month.

sentences.english: His landlord doubled the rent.
sentences.chinese: 他的房东把房租提高了一倍。

detailed_translations.english: a man who rents a room, building, or piece of land to someone

name: lease
trans: When the family first leased the apartment, the rent was very low.

sentences.english: The landlord refused to renew his lease.
sentences.chinese: 房东拒绝和他续签租约。

sentences.english: The 99-year lease expired in 1999.
sentences.chinese: 99年期的租约于1999年到期。

sentences.english: Do you understand all the terms of the lease?
sentences.chinese: 租约条款你都理解吗？

detailed_translations.english: a legal agreement which allows you to use a building, car etc for a period of time, in return for rent

detailed_translations.chinese: 出租； 租得， 租有
detailed_translations.english: to use a building, car etc under a lease

name: mandatory
trans: It’s mandatory that everyone be at least 16 to drive a car in the US.

sentences.english: Murder carries a mandatory life sentence .
sentences.chinese: 谋杀罪依照法律要判无期徒刑。

sentences.english: The Council has made it mandatory for all nurses to attend a refresher course every three years.
sentences.chinese: 理事会规定所有护士必须每三年参加一次进修课程。

detailed_translations.english: if something is mandatory, the law says it must be done

name: mend
trans: Mother mended the rip in my pants with a piece of cloth.

sentences.english: My father used to mend our shoes.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲过去常为我们修补鞋子。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a tear or hole in a piece of clothing
to be getting better after an illness or after a difficult period

name: mortgage
trans: When they bought their new home, the married couple had to sign a mortgage.

sentences.english: Your building society or bank will help arrange a mortgage.
sentences.chinese: 你加入的购房互助协会或银行将会给你安排抵押贷款。

sentences.english: They’ve taken out a 30 year mortgage (= they will pay for their house over a period of 30 years ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们办理了一笔30年期的抵押贷款。

sentences.english: We decided to use Fred’s redundancy money to pay off the mortgage (= pay back all the money we borrowed for a mortgage ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定用弗雷德的遣散费来偿清抵押贷款。

sentences.english: Mortgage rates are set to rise again in the spring.
sentences.chinese: 抵押贷款利率到春季肯定还要上涨。

sentences.english: She was having trouble meeting her mortgage payments .
sentences.chinese: 她还抵押贷款有困难。

detailed_translations.english: a legal arrangement by which you borrow money from a bank or similar organization in order to buy a house, and pay back the money over a period of years

if you mortgage your home, land, or property, you borrow money, usually from a bank, and if you cannot pay back the money within a particular period of time, the bank has the right to sell your property in order to get the money you owe it

name: personnel
trans: When business increased, we had to hire more personnel.

sentences.english: All personnel are to receive security badges.
sentences.chinese: 所有人员都将拿到安保徽章。

detailed_translations.english: the people who work in a company, organization, or military force

name: plumbing
trans: When the plumbing stopped working, no one was allowed to use the toilets.

name: quote
trans: His writing was full of quotes from Shakespeare.

sentences.english: He quoted a short passage from the Bible.
sentences.chinese: 他引用了《圣经》里的一小段。

sentences.english: A military spokesman was quoted as saying that the border area is now safe.
sentences.chinese: 报道引述军方一位发言人的话，说边境地区现在很安全。

sentences.english: They quoted a price of £15,000.
sentences.chinese: 他们报价1.5万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to repeat exactly what someone else has said or written

name: tenant
trans: The new tenants moved into the house across the street.

sentences.english: The desk was left by the previous tenant.
sentences.chinese: 书桌是上一个房客留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: someone who lives in a house, room etc and pays rent to the person who owns it

name: utility
trans: If you don’t pay the utilities, you may have your electricity turned off.

sentences.english: Does your rent include utilities?
sentences.chinese: 你的房租包括公用事业费吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 公用事业〔如煤气、电力等〕
detailed_translations.english: a service such as gas or electricity provided for people to use

name: whereby
trans: The mayor had a new bridge built whereby the citizens could cross the river.

sentences.english: a proposal whereby EU citizens would be allowed to reside anywhere in the EU
sentences.chinese: 允许欧盟公民在欧盟任何地方居住的一项提议

detailed_translations.english: by means of which or according to which

name: adapt
trans: When he went to the new town, he had to adapt to all the weather changes.

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: biological
trans: In science class, we learned about the biological process of bacterial growth.

sentences.english: the biological functions of the body
sentences.chinese: 人体的生物机能

sentences.english: Depression is both biological and psychological.
sentences.chinese: 抑郁症与生理和心理都有关系。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the natural processes performed by living things

name: cellular
trans: She used a microscope to see the activity at a cellular level.

sentences.english: a cellular network
sentences.chinese: 蜂窝式网络系统

detailed_translations.chinese: 细胞的；多孔的；由细胞组成的
detailed_translations.english: consisting of or relating to the cells of plants or animals

name: dynamic
trans: The new, dynamic employee came up with a good way to juggle his workload.

sentences.english: a dynamic and unstable process
sentences.chinese: 不断变化的、不稳定的过程

detailed_translations.chinese: 有活力的；动力的；不断变化的
detailed_translations.english: continuously moving or changing
something that causes action or change

name: fantasy
trans: Becoming an astronaut is a fantasy shared by many children.

sentences.english: I used to have fantasies about living in Paris with an artist.
sentences.chinese: 我过去常幻想着在巴黎与一位艺术家同住。

sentences.english: sexual fantasies
sentences.chinese: 性幻想

sentences.english: Young children sometimes can’t distinguish between fantasy and reality.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子有时不能区分幻想与现实。

sentences.english: He lived in a fantasy world of his own, even as a small boy.
sentences.chinese: 甚至还是个小孩子的时候，他就生活在一个幻想世界里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想象， 幻想； 想象的产物
detailed_translations.english: an exciting and unusual experience or situation you imagine happening to you, but which will probably never happen

name: heredity
trans: The boy’s face is similar to his father’s because of heredity.

sentences.english: Heredity is not a factor in causing the cancer.
sentences.chinese: 遗传并非导致这种癌症的一个因素。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which mental and physical qualities are passed from a parent to a child before the child is born

name: internal
trans: We removed the outer case to reveal the computer’s internal wires.

sentences.english: We have no interest in interfering in the internal affairs of other countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们对干涉其他国家内政不感兴趣。

sentences.english: the threat to internal security
sentences.chinese: 对国内安全的威胁

sentences.english: internal markets
sentences.chinese: 国内市场

sentences.english: There’s to be an internal inquiry into the whole affair.
sentences.chinese: 对整个事件将进行内部调查。

detailed_translations.english: within a particular country

name: minimal
trans: My lazy husband does a minimal amount of work around the house.

sentences.english: The storm caused only minimal damage.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨只造成了轻微破坏。

sentences.english: The cost to taxpayers would be minimal.
sentences.chinese: 纳税人的支出将是最少的。

sentences.english: This is a practical course, with only a minimal amount of theory.
sentences.chinese: 这是实践课程，只有少量理论。

detailed_translations.english: very small in degree or amount, especially the smallest degree or amount possible

name: pioneer
trans: He was a pioneer of computer programming.

sentences.english: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
sentences.chinese: 达科他地区的早期拓荒者

detailed_translations.english: someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people
to be the first person to do, invent or use something

name: prescribe
trans: When I was sick, the doctor prescribed me flu medicine for me to take.

sentences.english: The physician examines the patient then diagnoses the disease and prescribes medication.
sentences.chinese: 内科医生检查了病人，然后对疾病作出诊断，并开出药方。

sentences.english: What punishment does the law prescribe for this crime?
sentences.chinese: 法律规定这种罪行应受何处罚？

detailed_translations.english: to say what medicine or treatment a sick person should have

name: respective
trans: The boxers were told to return to their respective corners.

sentences.english: We all went back to our respective homes to wait for news.
sentences.chinese: 我们都各自回家等待消息。

sentences.english: the respective roles of teachers and students
sentences.chinese: 教师和学生各自不同的角色

detailed_translations.english: used before a plural noun to refer to the different things that belong to each separate person or thing mentioned

name: rigid
trans: Societies often have rigid rules about the way that people are supposed to act.

sentences.english: rigid plastic
sentences.chinese: 硬塑料

detailed_translations.english: stiff and not moving or bending

name: sequence
trans: The dominos fell in a sequence of one after another.

sentences.english: Be careful to perform the actions in the correct sequence.
sentences.chinese: 注意要按正确的顺序来完成动作。

detailed_translations.english: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

name: similar
trans: I have had a similar experience to the one you described.

sentences.english: We have similar tastes in music.
sentences.chinese: 我们对音乐的品位相近。

sentences.english: Both approaches seem to achieve similar results.
sentences.chinese: 两种方法都得出了相似的结果。

sentences.english: A number of his friends had been affected in a similar way .
sentences.chinese: 他的一些朋友也受到了类似的影响。

sentences.english: The two products look quite similar .
sentences.chinese: 这两种产品看上去很相似。

detailed_translations.english: almost the same

name: substitute
trans: When I ran out of juice, I had to substitute water to drink in the morning.

sentences.english: Germany brought on a substitute at half time.
sentences.chinese: 德国队在比赛半场时换上一名替补队员。

sentences.english: substitute goalkeeper
sentences.chinese: 替补守门员

detailed_translations.english: someone who does someone else’s job for a limited period of time, especially in a sports team or school
to use something new or diffe-rent instead of something else

name: surgeon
trans: The surgeon operated on the old man’s heart.

sentences.english: ...a heart surgeon.
sentences.chinese: …一位心脏外科医生。

detailed_translations.english: a doctor who does operations in a hospital

name: therapy
trans: After she broke her legs, she used physical therapy to learn how to walk again.

sentences.english: new drug therapies
sentences.chinese: 新的药物疗法

sentences.english: radiation therapy for cancer treatment
sentences.chinese: 治疗癌症的放射疗法

detailed_translations.english: the treatment of an illness or injury over a fairly long period of time

name: transfer
trans: The family transferred the groceries from the shopping cart to the car.

sentences.english: He was transferred for a fee of £8 million.
sentences.chinese: 他以800万英镑的转会费转到了其他球队。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搬， 转移； 调动， 转学； 转让， 过户； 乘车， 转乘
detailed_translations.english: to move from one place, school, job etc to another, or to make someone do this, especially within the same organization

name: transition
trans: The weather gets colder during the transition from summer to autumn.

sentences.english: Making the transition from youth to adulthood can be very painful.
sentences.chinese: 从青少年过渡到成年有时是一个非常痛苦的过程。

sentences.english: a society that is in transition
sentences.chinese: 一个正在转型的社会

sentences.english: the period of transition to full democracy
sentences.chinese: 向全面民主的过渡时期

detailed_translations.english: when something changes from one form or state to another

name: transplant
trans: The sick child needed a heart transplant to live.

sentences.english: The operation to transplant a kidney is now fairly routine.
sentences.chinese: 移植肾脏的手术如今相当常见。

detailed_translations.english: to move an organ, piece of skin etc from one person’s body and put it into another as a form of medical treatment

detailed_translations.chinese: 移植；移植器官；被移植物；移居者
detailed_translations.english: the operation of transplanting an organ, piece of skin etc

name: astrology
trans: Jack, who studies astrology, believes that the stars can predict the future.

sentences.english: Astronomy inherits from astrology.
sentences.chinese: 天文学的前身是占星术。

sentences.english: This should be contrasted with nonscientific programs and the best example of a nonscientific program is astrology.
sentences.chinese: 这点与非科学假说正好相反,非科学假说最好的例子便是占星术了。

sentences.english: It was a great innovator in medicine, astronomy, astrology, mathematics and banking; the Babylonians may even have believed that the world was round.
sentences.chinese: 它在医药，天文学，占星术，数学和银行业方面都堪称一个伟大的改革者。 甚至，古巴比伦人可能已经相信地球是圆的。

detailed_translations.english: the study of the positions and movements of the stars and how they might influence people and events

name: couple
trans: There were a couple of problems I had to solve.

sentences.english: a newly married couple
sentences.chinese: 一对新婚夫妇

sentences.english: the couple next door
sentences.chinese: 隔壁的那对夫妇

detailed_translations.english: two people who are married or having a sexual or romantic relationship

name: deviate
trans: Very few deviate much from the average.

sentences.english: They stopped you as soon as you deviated from the script.
sentences.chinese: 你一偏离剧本，他们就会叫停。

detailed_translations.english: to change what you are doing so that you are not following an expected plan, idea, or type of behaviour

name: differentiate
trans: It was hard to differentiate between the identical twins.

sentences.english: What differentiates these two periods of history?
sentences.chinese: 这两个历史时期的差别在哪里？

detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

detailed_translations.chinese: 区分， 区别； 使不同， 使有差异
detailed_translations.english: to recognize or express the difference between things or people

name: disrupt
trans: The loud crash disrupted the class lecture.

sentences.english: Traffic was disrupted by a hoax bomb.
sentences.chinese: 有人虚报有炸弹，造成了交通混乱。

sentences.english: Climate change could disrupt the agricultural economy.
sentences.chinese: 气候变化可能给农业经济带来不良影响。

detailed_translations.english: to prevent something from continuing in its usual way by causing problems

name: equation
trans: I used the Pythagorean theorem to solve the equation.

sentences.english: When children enter the equation , further tensions may arise within a marriage.
sentences.chinese: 有了孩子以后，婚姻中可能出现新的矛盾。

detailed_translations.english: a problem or situation in which several things must be considered and dealt with

name: err
trans: The pilot erred in his estimate of the time it would take to make the trip.

sentences.english: It’s always best to err on the side of caution.
sentences.chinese: 过于谨慎永远比冒风险强。

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯错；做错；犯罪；走上歧途
detailed_translations.english: to be more careful or safe than is necessary, in order to make sure that nothing bad happens

name: erroneous
trans: The child held the erroneous belief that time machines were real.

sentences.english: His economic predictions are based on some erroneous assumptions.
sentences.chinese: 他的经济预测是基于错误假设之上的。

detailed_translations.english: erroneous ideas or information are wrong and based on facts that are not correct

name: frantic
trans: The cat became frantic when I tried to give it a bath.

sentences.english: A bird had been locked in and was by now quite frantic.
sentences.chinese: 一只鸟被关了起来，到现在它都非常狂躁。

detailed_translations.english: extremely worried and frightened about a situation, so that you cannot control your feelings

name: inadvertent
trans: She made an inadvertent error when she knocked over the nail polish.

sentences.english: The government has said it was an inadvertent error.
sentences.chinese: 政府声称那是无意的过失。

detailed_translations.chinese: 疏忽的；不注意的（副词inadvertently）；无意中做的
detailed_translations.english: An inadvertent action is one that you do without realizing what you are doing

name: improvise
trans: There was no meat for the pizza, so we improvised with what was in the fridge.

sentences.english: I forgot to bring my notes, so I had to improvise.
sentences.chinese: 我忘了带笔记，只好临时发挥。

detailed_translations.english: to do something without any preparation, because you are forced to do this by unexpected events

name: latitude
trans: The device was able to tell the traveler his exact latitude.

sentences.english: The birds breed in northern latitudes.
sentences.chinese: 这些鸟在北纬地区繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.

name: mariner
trans: The old mariner used his telescope to find the shore.

sentences.english: A smooth sea never makes a skillful mariner.
sentences.chinese: 平静的大海造就不出熟练的水手。

detailed_translations.english: a  sailor

name: multitude
trans: A multitude of people were waiting at the airport.

sentences.english: I had never seen such a multitude of stars before.
sentences.chinese: 我以前从未见过这么多的星星。

sentences.english: a multitude of possible interpretations
sentences.chinese: 种种可能的解释

detailed_translations.english: a very large number of people or things

name: nuisance
trans: The teenager considered her noisy little brothers to be quite a nuisance.

sentences.english: He could be a bit of a nuisance when he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他喝醉时会是一个有点令人讨厌的人。

detailed_translations.english: a person, thing, or situation that annoys you or causes problems

name: permanence
trans: Poor results threaten the permanence of the new system.

sentences.english: Even the permanence of America’s success in Iraq is far from guaranteed.
sentences.chinese: 甚至美国在伊拉克的成功的持久性也远未得到保证。

sentences.english: Because, despite the fleeting nature of most of my encounters, and despite my own role in their short duration, I think what I have been seeking in some form from all of these men is permanence.
sentences.chinese: 因为，即使大多数和我邂逅的男人们同我只是保持了非常短暂的关系，也无论我在与他们短暂的关系中扮演着什么样的角色，我始终觉得我渴望在这些男人身上得到的是一份持久的关系。

sentences.english: When new or difficult material is presented, almost all listeners are faced with a challenge because human speech lacks the stability and permanence of the printed word.
sentences.chinese: 当面对新资料或难度较大的资料时，几乎所有的听众都会面临挑战，因为人类口语缺乏书面文字的稳定性和永久性。

name: revolve
trans: My life revolves around sports.

sentences.english: The wheel began to revolve.
sentences.chinese: 轮子开始旋转。

sentences.english: The restaurant slowly revolves, giving excellent views of the city.
sentences.chinese: 餐厅缓缓旋转，城市美景尽收眼底。

sentences.english: Using graphics software, you can revolve the image on the screen.
sentences.chinese: 使用绘图软件可以旋转屏幕上的图像。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋转；循环出现；反复考虑
detailed_translations.english: to move around like a wheel, or to make something move around like a wheel

name: soothe
trans: The mother soothed her crying baby by rocking him in her arms.

sentences.english: Lucy soothed the baby by rocking it in her arms.
sentences.chinese: 露西把宝宝抱在怀里摇晃着，让他安静下来。

sentences.english: She made a cup of tea to soothe her nerves.
sentences.chinese: 她泡了杯茶让自己平静下来。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel calmer and less anxious, upset, or angry

name: stranded
trans: When the plane left, my sister and I were stranded in China.

sentences.english: Air travellers were left stranded because of icy conditions.
sentences.chinese: 飞机乘客因冰冻天气而滞留。

detailed_translations.chinese: 搁浅的， 处于困境的
detailed_translations.english: a person or vehicle that is stranded is unable to move from the place where they are

name: technique
trans: There are a lot of teaching techniques that are well supported by research.

sentences.english: In mathematics, we use many techniques of problem-solving.
sentences.chinese: 在数学中，我们会使用多种方法解题。

sentences.english: He’s a great player, with brilliant technique.
sentences.chinese: 他是个伟大的球员，球技十分精湛。

detailed_translations.english: a special way of doing something

name: absurd
trans: That group of people making animal noises sounds completely absurd.

sentences.english: It seems an absurd idea.
sentences.chinese: 这似乎是个荒唐的想法。

detailed_translations.english: completely stupid or unreasonable

name: aristocracy
trans: Most members of the aristocracy were very well fed.

sentences.english: dukes, earls, and other members of the aristocracy
sentences.chinese: 公爵、伯爵及其他贵族成员

sentences.english: the landed aristocracy
sentences.chinese: 拥有大量土地的贵族

detailed_translations.chinese: 贵族；贵族统治；上层社会；贵族政治
detailed_translations.english: the people in the highest social class, who traditionally have a lot of land, money, and power

name: aristocrat
trans: The aristocrat did not need a job because his family was wealthy.

sentences.english: ...a wealthy southern aristocrat.
sentences.chinese: …一位富有的南方贵族。

detailed_translations.english: someone who belongs to the highest social class

name: attire
trans: Everyone wore their best attire to the president’s daughter’s wedding.

sentences.english: business attire
sentences.chinese: 商务着装，正装

detailed_translations.english: clothes

name: craze
trans: Wearing bright red socks was a craze when I was in high school.

sentences.english: At that time, scooters were the latest craze .
sentences.chinese: 那时候，小型摩托车是最新的时尚。

detailed_translations.english: a fashion, game, type of music etc that becomes very popular for a short time

name: denote
trans: Quotation marks are used to denote speech.

sentences.english: What does the word ‘curriculum’ denote that ‘course’ does not?
sentences.chinese: curriculum一词的哪些含义是course没有的？

detailed_translations.english: to mean something

name: enlarge
trans: The classrooms were enlarged over the summer to make room for more students.

sentences.english: There are plans to enlarge the recreation area.
sentences.chinese: 已经有了扩大娱乐场地的计划。

sentences.english: Police will have the pictures enlarged in an attempt to identify the thief.
sentences.chinese: 为了确认窃贼的身份，警方会将这些照片放大。

detailed_translations.english: to make sth bigger; to become bigger

name: excess
trans: Because it never got cold that winter, many stores had an excess of coats.

sentences.english: The government was unable to curb the excesses of the secret police.
sentences.chinese: 政府无法约束秘密警察的过分行为。

sentences.english: the worst excesses of journalism
sentences.chinese: 新闻工作中那些最糟糕的越轨行为

detailed_translations.english: harmful actions that are socially or morally unacceptable

name: feminine
trans: Many of the older people thought his long hair made him look too feminine.

sentences.english: traditional feminine roles
sentences.chinese: 传统的女性角色

sentences.english: Dianne loved pretty feminine things.
sentences.chinese: 黛安娜喜爱漂亮有女人味的东西。

detailed_translations.english: relating to being female

name: hierarchy
trans: Everyone knows where they fit in the hierarchy.

sentences.english: a rigid social hierarchy
sentences.chinese: 严格的社会等级制度

sentences.english: She worked her way up through the corporate hierarchy to become president.
sentences.chinese: 她在公司一步一步升到了总裁的位置。

detailed_translations.english: a system of organization in which people or things are divided into levels of importance

name: pad
trans: Football players wear shoulder pads to keep them safe.

sentences.english: Use an abrasive pad for stubborn stains.
sentences.chinese: 用百洁布擦洗顽固污渍。

sentences.english: Keep a telephone pad and a pen to hand.
sentences.chinese: 手边准备一本电话记事簿和一支笔。

sentences.english: All the sharp corners were padded with foam.
sentences.chinese: 所有的棱角都垫上了泡沫塑料。

detailed_translations.english: a thick flat object made of cloth or rubber, used to protect or clean something, or to make something more comfortable
to put a layer of soft material in or on sth in order to protect it, make it thicker or change its shape

name: partner
trans: Ladies and gentlemen, take your partners for the next dance.

sentences.english: Discuss your worries with your partner.
sentences.chinese: 和伴侣谈谈你的忧虑。

sentences.english: Only 29% of lone parents receive financial support from their former partners .
sentences.chinese: 只有29%的单身家长得到他们前配偶的经济资助。

sentences.english: Clare’s my tennis partner.
sentences.chinese: 克莱尔是我的网球搭档。

sentences.english: Take your partners for the next dance.
sentences.chinese: 挑选下一支舞的舞伴吧。

detailed_translations.english: one of two people who are married, or who live together and have a sexual relationship

name: predominant
trans: Before cars were invented, horses were the predominant method of travel.

sentences.english: the predominant group in society
sentences.chinese: 社会中的主导群体

sentences.english: In this painting, the predominant colour is black.
sentences.chinese: 这幅画的主色调是黑色。

detailed_translations.english: more powerful, more common, or more easily noticed than others

name: protocol
trans: The introduction of the guests followed the normal protocol.

sentences.english: a breach of diplomatic protocol
sentences.chinese: 违反外交礼节

detailed_translations.english: a system of rules about the correct way to behave on an official occasion

name: reputable
trans: The service from the less-than-reputable company made her angry.

sentences.english: You are well advised to buy your car through a reputable dealer.
sentences.chinese: 你通过一个声誉好的经销商来买车是明智的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声誉好的；受尊敬的；卓越的
detailed_translations.english: respected for being honest or for doing good work

name: signify
trans: A red octagon is used to signify a place to stop.

sentences.english: Some tribes use special facial markings to signify status.
sentences.chinese: 有些部落使用特殊的面部标记来表示地位。

sentences.english: The image of the lion signified power and strength.
sentences.chinese: 狮子的形象代表权力和力量。

sentences.english: These figures don’t really signify in the overall results.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字对于总体结果影响不是很大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 表示,意味；要紧,有重要性
detailed_translations.english: to represent, mean, or be a sign of something

name: strap
trans: She put the strap of her purse over her shoulder and walked out the door.

sentences.english: The strap of my bag is broken.
sentences.chinese: 我包上的带子断了。

sentences.english: soldiers with grenades strapped to their belts
sentences.chinese: 腰带上绑着手榴弹的士兵

detailed_translations.english: a narrow band of strong material that is used to fasten, hang, or hold onto something
to fasten something or someone in place with one or more straps

name: style
trans: Her clothes were all in the latest style.

sentences.english: an attempt to use Japanese management style in a European business
sentences.chinese: 将日本的管理方式用于欧洲企业的尝试

detailed_translations.english: a particular way of doing, designing, or producing something, especially one that is typical of a particular place, period of time, or group of people
to design clothing, furniture, or the shape of someone’s hair in a particular way

name: tangle
trans: The laces of his shoes were in such a tangle that he could not untie them.

sentences.english: My hair tangles easily.
sentences.chinese: 我的头发很容易打结。

sentences.english: His parachute became tangled in the wheels of the plane.
sentences.chinese: 他的降落伞缠在了飞机的轮子上。

detailed_translations.english: to become twisted together, or make something become twisted together, in an untidy mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 乱糟糟的一堆， 混乱； 复杂的问题； 困惑
detailed_translations.english: a confused state or situation

name: vanity
trans: Her vanity won’t allow her to pass a mirror without looking at herself.

sentences.english: Sabrina had none of the vanity so often associated with beautiful women.
sentences.chinese: 萨布里娜没有一点漂亮女人经常会有的那种虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: too much pride in yourself, so that you are always thinking about yourself and your appearance

name: ashore
trans: After a long day of fishing, Glen pulled his boat ashore, so it wouldn’t float away.

sentences.english: Several dead birds had been washed ashore.
sentences.chinese: 几只死鸟被冲上了岸。

detailed_translations.english: on or towards the shore of a lake, river, sea etc

name: contradict
trans: Ken was always fighting with his little sister because she kept contradicting him.

sentences.english: Deborah opened her mouth to contradict, but closed it again.
sentences.chinese: 黛博拉张口想要反驳，但又把嘴闭上了。

sentences.english: Dad just can’t bear to be contradicted.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸就是受不了有人反驳他。

sentences.english: The article flatly contradicts their claims.
sentences.chinese: 这篇文章断然驳斥他们的说法。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with something, especially by saying that the opposite is true

name: counterpart
trans: Our manager will meet our rival company’s counterpart later today.

sentences.english: As soon as he heard what was afoot, he telephoned his German and Italian counterparts to protest.
sentences.chinese: 他一听到在进行中的事，马上就给德国和意大利相应人员打电话抗议。

detailed_translations.chinese: 副本；配对物；极相似的人或物
detailed_translations.english: Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different place

name: devoid
trans: The movie was devoid of any violence, so it was a perfect movie for the family.

sentences.english: We humans appear to be meaning-seeking creatures that have the misfortune to be thrown into a world devoid of intrinsic meaning.
sentences.chinese: 我们人类似乎是寻求意义的生物，而很不幸，我们却进入了一个本质上缺乏意义的世界。

sentences.english: Rice cakes may seem like a good option – after all they're fat-free and low in calories – but they're also devoid of fibre and protein and can make you crave something more satisfying.
sentences.chinese: 大米蛋糕似乎是好的选择-毕竟它们无脂肪，低卡路里-但是它们也缺乏纤维和蛋白质，会使你渴望更令人满意的东西。

name: diverge
trans: The road diverged into two paths that led to our houses.

sentences.english: The two species diverged millions of years ago.
sentences.chinese: 这两个物种从数百万年前开始朝不同方向演变。

sentences.english: Global growth rates are diverging markedly.
sentences.chinese: 世界各地的增长率在发生明显的分化。

detailed_translations.english: if similar things diverge, they develop in different ways and so are no longer similar

name: embryo
trans: Some doctors say that what a mother eats has a big effect on her embryo.

sentences.english: The system already exists in embryo.
sentences.chinese: 该体系已具雏形。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or human that has not yet been born, and has just begun to develop

name: finally
trans: We finally reached our destination.

sentences.english: After several delays we finally took off at six o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 几经耽搁后，我们终于在六点起飞了。

sentences.english: Finally, Karpov cracked under the pressure.
sentences.chinese: 最后，卡尔波夫承受不住压力崩溃了。

detailed_translations.english: after a long time

name: gazette
trans: Alice wants to write for a gazette when she’s older.

sentences.english: the ‘Phoenix Gazette’
sentences.chinese: 《凤凰城报》

detailed_translations.english: an official newspaper, especially one from the government giving important lists of people who have been employed by them etc

name: homogeneous
trans: All of the houses on Victor’s block were boring and homogenous.

sentences.english: a homogeneous society
sentences.chinese: 同种族人组成的社会

detailed_translations.english: consisting of people or things that are all of the same type

name: individual
trans: Each individual is responsible for themselves.

sentences.english: Each individual leaf on the tree is different.
sentences.chinese: 树上每片叶子都不相同。

sentences.english: the needs of the individual customer
sentences.chinese: 每位顾客的需求

detailed_translations.english: considered separately from other people or things in the same group
a person, considered separately from the rest of the group or society that they live in

name: major
trans: There had been a major shift in government policy.

sentences.english: There are two major political parties in the US.
sentences.chinese: 美国有两大政党。

sentences.english: The government’s major concern is with preventing road accidents.
sentences.chinese: 政府关注的大事是预防道路交通事故。

sentences.english: Smoking is one of the major causes of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 吸烟是引发癌症的元凶之一。

sentences.english: the major developments in computer technology
sentences.chinese: 计算机技术的重大进步

sentences.english: He’s majoring in Political Science.
sentences.chinese: 他主修政治学。

detailed_translations.english: very large or important, when compared to other things or people of a similar kind
to study something as your main subject at college or university

name: obstruct
trans: The car broke down on the road and obstructed traffic for hours.

sentences.english: A small aircraft was obstructing the runway.
sentences.chinese: 一架小型飞机堵住了跑道。

sentences.english: The column obstructed our view of the stage.
sentences.chinese: 柱子挡着，我们看不见舞台。

detailed_translations.english: to block a road, passage etc

name: plunge
trans: The water in the pool was very cold, but the boy plunged in anyway.

sentences.english: The government's political and economic reforms threaten to plunge the country into chaos.
sentences.chinese: 该政府的政治和经济改革有可能使这个国家陷入混乱之中。

sentences.english: Eddy found himself plunged into a world of brutal violence.
sentences.chinese: 埃迪发现自己突然陷入了一个残酷暴力的世界。

detailed_translations.english: to make sb/sth experience sth unpleasant

name: prolong
trans: Sandy walked slowly across the beach, trying to prolong her lunch break.

sentences.english: I was trying to think of some way to prolong the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 我在想方设法拖长这次谈话。

detailed_translations.english: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

name: publicize
trans: The company publicized the job positions in the newspaper.

sentences.english: television’s failure to publicize the unemployment issue
sentences.chinese: 电视未能报道失业问题

detailed_translations.english: to give information about something to the public, so that they know about it

name: surplus
trans: The store sold their surplus items on sale.

sentences.english: Ethiopia has no surplus food.
sentences.chinese: 埃塞俄比亚没有多余的食物。

detailed_translations.english: more than what is needed or used
an amount of something that is more than what is needed or used

name: survive
trans: She survived a heart attack.

sentences.english: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
sentences.chinese: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。

sentences.english: She survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 她在袭击中幸免于难。

sentences.english: people who survive cancer
sentences.chinese: 癌症幸存者

detailed_translations.chinese: 活下来，继续存在；幸免于
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 从中挺过来； 从…逃出； 比…活得长
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems

name: theorize
trans: They enjoyed theorizing about how things worked.

sentences.english: Police are theorizing that the robbers may be posing as hitchhikers.
sentences.chinese: 警方推测那些劫匪可能会装成搭便车的人。

detailed_translations.english: to think of a possible explanation for an event or fact

name: verify
trans: Julian called the movie theater to verify that the movie started at nine.

sentences.english: I verified the source from which I had that information.
sentences.chinese: 我核实了我获知那条信息的来源。

sentences.english: His statement was verified by several witnesses.
sentences.chinese: 他的说法得到了几位证人的证实。

detailed_translations.english: to discover whether something is correct or true

name: vigorous
trans: Henry uses vigorous exercise to keep himself in shape.

sentences.english: Your dog needs at least 20 minutes of vigorous exercise every day.
sentences.chinese: 你的狗每天需要进行至少20分钟的剧烈运动。

sentences.english: Environmentalists have begun a vigorous campaign to oppose nuclear dumping in the area.
sentences.chinese: 环保人士已经发动了一场积极的运动，反对在该地区倾倒核废物。

sentences.english: a vigorous debate
sentences.chinese: 一场激烈的辩论

sentences.english: Vigorous efforts are being made to find a solution to the problem.
sentences.chinese: 正积极地寻找办法解决这个问题。

sentences.english: The measures provoked vigorous opposition in right-wing circles.
sentences.chinese: 这些举措激起了右翼群体的强烈反对。

detailed_translations.english: using a lot of energy and strength or determination

name: altar
trans: The altar had many lit candles on it.

sentences.english: a crucifix above the high altar
sentences.chinese: 主圣坛上方的耶稣受难像

sentences.english: The victim was tied to a sacrificial altar.
sentences.chinese: 牺牲被绑在祭坛上。

detailed_translations.english: a holy table or surface used in religious ceremonies

name: arthritis
trans: Agatha couldn’t play the piano anymore because of her arthritis.

sentences.english: I have a touch of arthritis in the wrist.
sentences.chinese: 我的手腕有轻微关节炎。

detailed_translations.english: a disease that causes the joints of your body to become swollen and very painful

name: botany
trans: Gardens are the best places for botany.

sentences.english: He studied botany at university.
sentences.chinese: 他在大学学习植物学。

sentences.english: To what degree are you interested in botany?
sentences.chinese: 你对植物学的兴趣达到什么程度?

sentences.english: The first of these in the field of botany were the herbals.
sentences.chinese: 在植物学领域，这些最早的著作是本草书。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of plants

name: credible
trans: Dick gave a credible reason for being late and didn’t get in any trouble.

sentences.english: Her excuse was barely credible.
sentences.chinese: 她的借口无法让人信服。

sentences.english: a credible alternative to nuclear power
sentences.chinese: 原子能的可靠替代物

detailed_translations.english: deserving or able to be believed or trusted

name: deceased
trans: We visited the graves of our deceased grandparents.

sentences.english: A plan with a lack of money and uses meant a standstill, but the outside of the star-shaped building is now like a memory of a deceased person.
sentences.chinese: 一个计划同时缺乏金钱和吸引力就意味着将永远停滞，但这些外星状的建设现在却宛如是对已故人的一种怀念。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has died, especially recently

name: deception
trans: The magic looked very real, but it was only deception.

sentences.english: She didn’t have the courage to admit to her deception.
sentences.chinese: 她没有勇气承认自己的欺骗行为。

sentences.english: He was convicted of obtaining money by deception .
sentences.chinese: 他被判犯有诈骗钱财罪。

detailed_translations.english: the act of deliberately making someone believe something that is not true

name: document
trans: Please scan this document so we have an electronic copy.

sentences.english: She produces legal documents for a downtown Seattle law firm.
sentences.chinese: 她为西雅图市区的一家法律事务所撰写法律文件。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper that has official information on it
to write about something, film it, or take photographs of it, in order to record information about it

name: dung
trans: There was cow dung all over the field.

sentences.english: Tom: No.Although 75% of its raw materials is elephant dung, it is light delicate fragrance instead of stink. This is due to its special fabrication technology.
sentences.chinese: 不，尽管这种纸里75％的原料都是大象的粪便，但它不但不臭，反而有一种淡淡的清香，这是源于它的特殊的制造工艺。

detailed_translations.english: solid waste from animals, especially cows

name: dusk
trans: After dusk, Hannah went to catch fireflies in the park.

sentences.english: The street lights go on at dusk.
sentences.chinese: 街灯在黄昏时亮起来。

detailed_translations.english: the time before it gets dark when the sky is becoming less bright

name: gratify
trans: Bonnie was gratified after receiving her gift from her parents.

sentences.english: He was gratified by Lucy’s response.
sentences.chinese: 他对露西的回答很满意。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel pleased and satisfied

name: hone
trans: Lisa honed her chess skills through hours and hours of practice.

sentences.english: Leading companies spend time and money on honing the skills of senior managers.
sentences.chinese: 龙头公司会花费时间和金钱提高高层管理人员的技能。

detailed_translations.english: a fine whetstone, esp for sharpening razors
to make knives, swords etc sharp

name: interpret
trans: It is difficult to interpret while someone is speaking.

sentences.english: They spoke good Spanish, and promised to interpret for me.
sentences.chinese: 他们西班牙语说得很好，答应替我翻译。

sentences.english: Freud’s attempts to interpret the meaning of dreams
sentences.chinese: 弗洛伊德对梦的含义的解析

detailed_translations.english: to translate spoken words from one language into another

name: motive
trans: We can show he had a motive to commit the crime, but we cannot show he did it.

sentences.english: What do you suppose the killer’s motive was?
sentences.chinese: 你认为凶手的动机是什么？

sentences.english: The violence was clearly prompted by political motives.
sentences.chinese: 这次暴力事件显然是由政治动机引发的。

sentences.english: It’s not the kind of thing he’d do unless he had an ulterior motive (= a reason he kept hidden ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不会做这种事的，除非他另有隐情。

detailed_translations.english: the reason that makes someone do something, especially when this reason is kept hidden
the motive power or force for a machine, vehicle etc makes it move

name: pneumonia
trans: Elaine got pneumonia after playing outside in the rain without a coat.

sentences.english: She was taken to hospital, suffering from pneumonia.
sentences.chinese: 她得了肺炎，被送往医院。

detailed_translations.english: a serious illness that affects your lungs and makes it difficult for you to breathe

name: psychic
trans: I think my grandmother has psychic abilities because she can predict anything.

sentences.english: a spiritual healer with psychic powers
sentences.chinese: 有超自然力量的精神治疗师

sentences.english: a documentary on psychic phenomena
sentences.chinese: 关于超自然现象的纪录片

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神的；心灵的；灵魂的；超自然的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the power of the human mind to do strange or surprising things that cannot be explained by reason

name: psychotic
trans: The psychotic patient believed he saw things that weren’t real.

name: scope
trans: Modern history has a wide scope.

sentences.english: measures to limit the scope of criminals’ activities
sentences.chinese: 限制罪犯活动范围的措施

detailed_translations.english: the range of things that a subject, activity, book etc deals with

name: sinister
trans: Bad guys in most movies have sinister laughs.

sentences.english: There is a sinister side to these events.
sentences.chinese: 这些事件有邪恶的一面。

sentences.english: He was a handsome man, in a sinister sort of way.
sentences.chinese: 他英俊的外貌中带着一点阴险。

sentences.english: a sinister atmosphere
sentences.chinese: 不祥的气氛

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴险的；凶兆的；灾难性的；左边的
detailed_translations.english: making you feel that something evil, dangerous, or illegal is happening or will happen

name: strife
trans: There was a lot of strife between Jim and Lisa about what TV show to watch.

sentences.english: Money is a major cause of strife in many marriages.
sentences.chinese: 钱在许多婚姻中是导致冲突的一个主要原因。

detailed_translations.english: trouble between two or more people or groups

name: text
trans: Spoken text has many features which are different from written text.

sentences.english: a chemistry text
sentences.chinese: 化学课本

detailed_translations.english: a textbook
to send someone a written message on a  mobile phone

name: artery
trans: Eating healthily keeps your arteries clean so blood can flow with ease.

sentences.english: Of, like, or in an artery or arteries.
sentences.chinese: 动脉的动脉的，似动脉的，或在动脉里的。

sentences.english: When they are found, doctors pass a tube with a balloon into the narrowed area and inflate the balloon to compress plaque deposits against the side of the artery.
sentences.chinese: 当它们被发现后，医生通过一个软管把一个小气球进入狭小的区域并且膨胀这个气球去压缩动脉边沉淀下来的血小板。

sentences.english: This term is used to describe a condition in which the blood supply to part of the brain is suddenly and critically impaired by a blood clot or when a ruptured artery leaks blood into the brain.
sentences.chinese: 该术语是用来形容如下的一种情况：提供给大脑部分的血液突然地削弱，这种削弱是由于血液的凝固或由于动脉割裂导致血液漏到大脑里面。

detailed_translations.english: one of the tubes that carries blood from your heart to the rest of your body

name: deterioration
trans: The lack of care led to the deterioration of the house.

sentences.english: A reading over 50 indicates an expansion of activity in the manufacturing sector, while one below 50 suggests a deterioration.
sentences.chinese: 这一指数高于50表明制造业处于扩张状态，低于50时则反映制造业状况在恶化。

sentences.english: But underlying inflationary pressure is still extremely weak and is likely to remain so, particularly given the rapid and ongoing deterioration in the labour market.
sentences.chinese: 但潜在的通胀压力仍是非常微弱，特别是考虑到迅速而持续恶化的就业市场，这种状况很可能会持续下去。

name: elusive
trans: The elusive fish only came out at night.

sentences.english: She enjoys a firm reputation in this country but wider international success has been elusive.
sentences.chinese: 她在这个国家享有稳固的声誉，但却一直难以在国际上取得更大的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
detailed_translations.english: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

name: ensure
trans: Saving now will ensure we have enough money for our retirement.

sentences.english: facilities to ensure the safety of cyclists
sentences.chinese: 确保骑车人安全的设施

detailed_translations.english: to make certain that something will happen properly

name: induce
trans: Running without good shoes may induce leg pain.

sentences.english: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.english: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 医生们说手术可能导致心脏病。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

name: inseparable
trans: Denise and Diana have been inseparable since they first met.

sentences.english: Jane and Sarah soon became inseparable companions.
sentences.chinese: 简与萨拉很快就形影不离了。

detailed_translations.chinese: [数] 不可分割的；不能分离的
detailed_translations.english: things that are inseparable cannot be separated or cannot be considered separately

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可分离的事物；形影不离的朋友

name: invalid
trans: The way to winning debates is to avoid invalid arguments.

sentences.english: Without the right date stamped on it, your ticket will be invalid.
sentences.chinese: 票上若没有加盖正确日期就是废票。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无效的，作废的；无可靠根据的，站不住脚的
detailed_translations.english: a contract, ticket, claim etc that is invalid is not legally or officially acceptable
someone who cannot look after themselves because of illness, old age, or injury

name: magnify
trans: Astronomers use telescopes to magnify faraway stars.

sentences.english: At the Sheffield arena, the speakers were magnified ten times on a giant screen.
sentences.chinese: 在谢菲尔德体育馆，演讲者在一个巨大的屏幕上被放大了十倍。

sentences.english: A public address system magnifies all the little noises and coughs.
sentences.chinese: 扩音系统会放大任何细小的噪音和咳嗽声。

sentences.english: The report tends to magnify the risks involved
sentences.chinese: 这份报告有夸大所涉风险的倾向。

detailed_translations.english: to make something seem bigger or louder, especially using special equipment

name: mainstream
trans: Before punk rock music became part of the mainstream, only a few people liked it.

sentences.english: Genet started as a rebel, but soon became part of the literary mainstream.
sentences.chinese: 热内起初很叛逆，但不久就回归了文学主流。

detailed_translations.english: the most usual ideas or methods, or the people who have these ideas or methods

name: microbe
trans: The first step in curing a disease is finding the microbe that causes it.

sentences.english: ...a type of bacteria that include the microbes responsible for tuberculosis and leprosy.
sentences.chinese: …包括引起结核病和麻风病的微生物在内的一类细菌。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely small living thing which you can only see if you use a  microscope  . Some microbes can cause diseases.

name: minor
trans: This is a minor problem.

sentences.english: We have made some minor changes to the program.
sentences.chinese: 我们对那个程序做了一些小改动。

sentences.english: a relatively minor error
sentences.chinese: 相对较小的错误

sentences.english: a minor road
sentences.chinese: 小路

sentences.english: They played only a minor role in local government.
sentences.chinese: 他们在当地政府里只是扮演次要角色。

detailed_translations.english: small and not very important or serious, especially when compared with other things

name: negligible
trans: The amount she owed was negligible. It was less than ten cents.

sentences.english: The damage done to his property was negligible.
sentences.chinese: 对他财产造成的损失微不足道。

detailed_translations.english: too slight or unimportant to have any effect

name: paralysis
trans: His paralysis meant that he had to use a wheelchair to get around.

sentences.english: paralysis of the lower body
sentences.chinese: 下半身瘫痪

sentences.english: The snake’s poison causes paralysis.
sentences.chinese: 这种蛇的毒液会引起身体麻痹。

detailed_translations.english: the loss of the ability to move all or part of your body or feel things in it

name: pest
trans: Many farmers put up scarecrows to keep pests of their corn.

sentences.english: a chemical used in pest control
sentences.chinese: 用于防治虫害的一种化学品

detailed_translations.chinese: 害虫；有害之物；讨厌的人
detailed_translations.english: a small animal or insect that destroys crops or food supplies

name: prevail
trans: Unfortunately, injustice still prevails in the country’s court system.

sentences.english: 英文编辑：the economic conditions which prevail in England and Wales
sentences.chinese: 英格兰和威尔士普遍的经济状况

sentences.english: Justice will prevail.
sentences.chinese: 正义终将获胜。

detailed_translations.english: if a belief, custom, situation etc prevails, it exists among a group of people at a certain time

name: pursuit
trans: The pursuit of happiness is a basic human right.

sentences.english: The quarterback sprinted toward the end zone with Jansen in hot pursuit (= following closely behind ) .
sentences.chinese: 那名四分卫快速冲向底线区，詹森穷追不舍。

detailed_translations.english: when someone tries to get, achieve, or find something in a determined way

name: rupture
trans: Sarah put too much water into the balloon, and it ruptured.

sentences.english: The pipe will rupture at its weakest point.
sentences.chinese: 管道最薄弱的地方会破裂的。

sentences.english: His liver was ruptured when a brick wall collapsed on him.
sentences.chinese: 一堵砖墙坍塌压住了他，导致他的肝脏破裂。

detailed_translations.english: to break or burst, or to make something break or burst
an occasion when something suddenly breaks apart or bursts

name: savage
trans: Wild animals are very savage when defending their babies.

sentences.english: a savage dog
sentences.chinese: 一条凶猛的狗

sentences.english: a savage murder
sentences.chinese: 凶残的谋杀

detailed_translations.chinese: 野蛮的；残酷的；狂怒的；荒凉的
detailed_translations.english: very violent or cruel

detailed_translations.chinese: 未开化的人；粗鲁的人；残暴成性的人
detailed_translations.english: a very offensive word for someone who has a simple, traditional way of life
if an animal such as a dog savages someone, it attacks them and injures them badly

name: stun
trans: Tim fell of the swing and was too stunned to cry.

sentences.english: Redfern stunned the crowd with a last-minute goal.
sentences.chinese: 雷德芬在最后一分钟进球，使观众很是震惊。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使震惊， 使目瞪口呆； 把…打昏， 使昏迷
detailed_translations.english: to surprise or upset someone so much that they do not react immediately

name: susceptible
trans: Not eating enough vegetables makes you more susceptible to getting sick.

sentences.english: A lot of TV advertising is aimed at susceptible young children.
sentences.chinese: 很多电视广告瞄准了易受影响的幼儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 易受影响的； 过敏的； 能经受的， 容许的
detailed_translations.english: likely to suffer from a particular illness or be affected by a particular problem

name: advocate
trans: The group advocated increased spending on education and schools.

sentences.english: Extremists were openly advocating violence.
sentences.chinese: 极端主义者公开鼓吹使用暴力。

sentences.english: Mr. Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.
sentences.chinese: 威廉斯先生是一位提倡减少政府对商业的控制的保守人士。

detailed_translations.english: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly
someone who publicly supports someone or something

name: albeit
trans: She was happy, albeit briefly.

sentences.english: He accepted the job, albeit with some hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有些犹豫，他还是接受了那份工作。

sentences.english: Chris went with her, albeit reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 尽管勉强，克里斯还是同她一起去了。

detailed_translations.english: used to add information that reduces the force or importance of what you have just said

name: authorize
trans: The mayor authorized the construction of a new statue in the park.

sentences.english: an authorized biography
sentences.chinese: 授权传记

detailed_translations.english: to give official permission for something

name: civilian
trans: It was Todd’s job to keep civilians from entering the army facility.

sentences.english: Many innocent civilians were killed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 许多无辜的平民在战争中丧生。

sentences.english: It was difficult to return to civilian life after ten years in the military.
sentences.chinese: 从军十年后重新过平民生活不容易。

detailed_translations.english: anyone who is not a member of the military forces or the police
used to describe people or things that are not military

name: commodity
trans: Fran’s uncle made most of his money trading commodities.

sentences.english: agricultural commodities
sentences.chinese: 农业商品

sentences.english: Commodity prices fell sharply.
sentences.chinese: 商品价格急剧下跌。

detailed_translations.english: a product that is bought and sold

name: communicate
trans: He was unable to communicate his feelings clearly.

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

name: conquest
trans: After the conquest, the people of the small city had no freedom.

sentences.english: the Norman Conquest (= the conquest of England by the Normans )
sentences.chinese: 诺曼征服

detailed_translations.english: the act of getting control of a country by fighting

name: disclose
trans: John came home late, so he had to disclose his activities to his wife.

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: dynamics
trans: A good psychologist needs to know a lot about the dynamics of brain disorders.

sentences.english: And our goal is to find out the time, the dynamics of this problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目的是找出时间，找出这个问题的动力学。

sentences.english: We know the dynamics of outsourcing.
sentences.chinese: 我们了解外包的动力。

sentences.english: Both are believed to have important roles in sea ice dynamics, but how important they are remains unclear.
sentences.chinese: 认为这两者在海冰动力学方面都有重要的作用，但是他们尚不清楚是多么重要。

detailed_translations.english: the branch of mechanics concerned with the forces that change or produce the motions of bodies

name: enroll
trans: The students had to enroll in the class one semester in advance.

sentences.english: You need to enroll before the end of August.
sentences.chinese: 你必须在八月底前注册。

detailed_translations.english: to officially arrange to join a school, university, or course, or to arrange for someone else to do this

name: envious
trans: They were envious of their neighbor’s front yard.

sentences.english: envious looks
sentences.chinese: 妒忌的神色

detailed_translations.english: wanting something that someone else has

name: festive
trans: Dean’s favorite part of Christmas is the festive clothing that people wear.

sentences.english: The atmosphere was festive and jolly.
sentences.chinese: 气氛喜庆欢乐。

sentences.english: John was obviously in a festive mood .
sentences.chinese: 约翰显然喜气洋洋的。

detailed_translations.english: looking or feeling bright and cheerful in a way that seems suitable for celebrating something

name: indicate
trans: They indicated that things would be likely to improve soon.

sentences.english: The study indicates a connection between poverty and crime.
sentences.chinese: 研究显示贫穷和犯罪有关联。

detailed_translations.english: to show that a particular situation exists, or that something is likely to be true

name: lentil
trans: Danni made her special soup with lentils when her husband was sick.

sentences.english: The lentil is high in potassium, calcium and iron, and a good source of B vitamins, phosphorus and copper.
sentences.chinese: 小扁豆富含钾、钙和铁，还有优质来源的维生素B、磷和铜。

detailed_translations.chinese: [作物] 兵豆，[作物] 小扁豆
detailed_translations.english: a small round seed like a bean, dried and used for food

name: marshal
trans: The students were marshaled outside and put into groups.

sentences.chinese: 朱可夫元帅

sentences.english: the Marshal of the Royal Air force
sentences.chinese: 皇家空军元帅

detailed_translations.english: an officer of the highest rank in the army or air force of some countries

name: morale

sentences.chinese: 胜利总是可以鼓舞士气。

sentences.chinese: 政变未遂挫伤了军队的士气。

sentences.chinese: 王子去这个饱受战争磨难的国家鼓舞士气的使命

detailed_translations.english: the level of confidence and positive feelings that people have, especially people who work together, who belong to the same team etc

name: mood
trans: My boss is in a really bad mood today.

sentences.english: You’re in a good mood this morning!
sentences.chinese: 你今天早晨心情不错啊！

sentences.english: the general mood of depression in the office

sentences.chinese: 她有预言的天赋。

sentences.chinese: 参议院批准了这项议案。

sentences.chinese: 后来他和儿子迈克尔合作，把一个有关食品生产的文本翻译成英语。

sentences.english: The document was compiled by the Department of Health.

detailed_translations.english: to make a book, list, record etc, using different pieces of information, music etc

name: curb

sentences.english: measures to curb the spread of the virus

sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: a drama enacted on a darkened stage

sentences.chinese: 〔英国及英联邦国家〕妇女协会全国联合会

detailed_translations.english: a group of organizations, clubs, or people that have joined together to form a single group

sentences.english: the campaign for the humane treatment of criminals

sentences.english: a better, more humane world

name: needy

sentences.english: a needy family
sentences.chinese: 贫困家庭

sentences.english: There will be efforts to get larger amounts of food to the needy.
sentences.chinese: 将努力把更多的食品送给穷人。

sentences.english: the onset of winter
sentences.chinese: 冬天的来临

sentences.chinese: 会议以加快该地区6个州之间合作的承诺结束。

to make a formal, usually public, promise that you will do something

name: prohibit

sentences.english: Smoking is strictly prohibited inside the factory.
sentences.chinese: 厂区严禁吸烟。

name: render

sentences.english: an obligation to render assistance to those in need
sentences.chinese: 为有困难的人提供援助的义务

sentences.english: a bill of $3,200 for services rendered

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or do something, because it is your duty or because someone expects you to

name: smallpox
trans: When she saw the tiny bumps, she thought her son might have smallpox.

name: transform

sentences.english: Increased population has transformed the landscape.
sentences.chinese: 人口的增加使景观发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: to completely change the appearance, form, or character of something or someone, especially in a way that improves it

name: transmit

sentences.english: The US Open will be transmitted live via satellite.
sentences.chinese: 美国公开赛将通过卫星现场直播。

sentences.english: The system transmits information over digital phone lines.
sentences.chinese: 这一系统通过数字电话线路传输信息。

name: widespread

sentences.chinese: 化学品在农业中的广泛使用

sentences.chinese: 微小的粒子紧贴着种子。

sentences.chinese: 有同情心并关爱他人的人

sentences.chinese: 我出于同情让他回家了。

sentences.english: Over 500 people died during last year’s flu epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 去年流感大暴发期间有五百多人死亡。

sentences.english: Careless drivers hazard other people's lives as well as their own.

sentences.chinese: 政治家应该是很好的沟通者，这很重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的；紧急的，极重要的；命令的

detailed_translations.chinese: 必要的事， 必须完成的事； 【语】祈使语气
detailed_translations.english: something that must be done urgently

name: manifest

sentences.chinese: 股东们表明了要出售股票的意图。

a list of passengers or goods carried on a ship, plane, or train
plain and easy to see

sentences.english: Staff had to work in overcrowded conditions.
sentences.chinese: 员工们只得在过度拥挤的环境中工作。

sentences.chinese: 过度拥挤的住房

sentences.chinese: RMC在三个领域为从业者提供了结构：生产力，指导和个性化。

sentences.chinese: 当今的工作和生活，扮演工作与生活的平衡，已成为一个关键特性当前的很多政府、从业者和学术争论。

detailed_translations.english: the exact opposite of what has just been mentioned

name: sterile
trans: The hospital room looked quite sterile.

sentences.english: The classrooms are sterile, with no artwork on the walls.
sentences.chinese: 这些教室毫无生气，墙上一张画都没有。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不育的；无菌的；贫瘠的；不毛的；枯燥乏味的
detailed_translations.english: a person or animal that is sterile cannot produce babies

name: upgrade

sentences.english: Helicopters have been upgraded and modernized.
sentences.chinese: 直升机已经升级并且装上现代化设备。

detailed_translations.english: to make a computer, machine, or piece of software better and able to do more things

name: viable
trans: Her method of solving the math problem seemed viable.

sentences.english: viable seeds
sentences.chinese: 可存活的种子

detailed_translations.chinese: 可行的；能养活的；能生育的
detailed_translations.english: a viable idea, plan, or method can work successfully

name: voluntary

sentences.english: Workers are being encouraged to take voluntary redundancy.
sentences.chinese: 工人被鼓励主动离职。

detailed_translations.english: done willingly and without being forced

name: airway
trans: Since he was sick, mucus would occasionally get stuck in his airway.

sentences.english: How does a private pilot get access to the airways?
sentences.chinese: 一个私人飞机的飞行员如何获得航线使用权呢？

detailed_translations.chinese: 导气管；空中航线；通风孔
detailed_translations.english: the passage in your throat that you breathe through

name: Almighty
trans: Before eating, they thanked the Almighty for their food.

name: advent
trans: During the advent of radio, very few programs actually played music.

sentences.english: the advent of the computer
sentences.chinese: 计算机的问世

detailed_translations.chinese: 到来；出现；基督降临；基督降临节
detailed_translations.english: the time when something first begins to be widely used

name: cycle
trans: They were caught in a cycle of poverty, lack of education, and unemployment.

sentences.english: a woman’s menstrual cycle
sentences.chinese: 女性的月经周期

detailed_translations.chinese: 自行车、 摩托车； 循环
detailed_translations.english: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order

name: definitive
trans: This library has the definitive collection of books on ancient Egypt.

sentences.english: a definitive agreement to buy the company
sentences.chinese: 收购这家公司的最终协议

detailed_translations.chinese: 决定性的；最后的；限定的
detailed_translations.english: a definitive agreement, statement etc is one that will not be changed

name: equate

sentences.english: I'm always wary of men wearing suits, as I equate this with power and authority.
sentences.chinese: 我总是提防着穿制服的人，因为我将其等同于权力及权威。

name: found

sentences.english: Founded in 1935 in Ohio, Alcoholics Anonymous is now a world-wide organization.
sentences.chinese: 嗜酒者互诫协会1935年创立于俄亥俄州，现在是一个世界性的组织。

sentences.english: Eton College was founded by Henry VI in 1440.
sentences.chinese: 伊顿公学于1440年由亨利六世创办。

detailed_translations.english: to start something such as an organization, company, school, or city, often by providing the necessary money

name: ideology
trans: Within the teachers’ ideology, there was a belief in the value of parent participation.

sentences.english: the ideologies of fascism and terrorism
sentences.chinese: 法西斯主义和恐怖主义的意识形态

sentences.english: a new ideology based on individualism
sentences.chinese: 基于个人主义的新思想体系

detailed_translations.english: a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave

name: inhale
trans: The camper inhaled the cool and fresh mountain air and felt relaxed.

sentences.english: It is dangerous to inhale ammonia fumes.
sentences.chinese: 吸入氨气是很危险的。

sentences.english: Myra lit another cigarette and inhaled deeply  (= breathed in a lot of smoke ).
sentences.chinese: 迈拉又点上一支烟，深深地吸了一口。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe in air, smoke, or gas

name: invoke
trans: Before going into battle, the soldier invoked the name of his god for protection.

sentences.english: a painting that invokes images of the Rocky Mountains
sentences.chinese: 使人联想到落基山脉的画

sentences.english: During his speech, he invoked the memory of Harry Truman.
sentences.chinese: 他演讲时使人想起哈里 · 杜鲁门。

detailed_translations.english: to make a particular idea, image, or feeling appear in people’s minds by describing an event or situation, or by talking about a person

name: lunar
trans: During a lunar eclipse, Earth’s shadow darkens the moon’s surface.

sentences.english: studies of the lunar surface
sentences.chinese: 对月球表面的研究

sentences.english: a lunar eclipse
sentences.chinese: 月食

detailed_translations.english: relating to the Moon or to travel to the Moon

name: novelty
trans: Ice cream was a novelty for him since he rarely had any.

sentences.english: Many toys have no attraction beyond their novelty value.
sentences.chinese: 许多玩具除了有些新奇感之外，别无吸引力。

sentences.english: Then the Internet was still something of a novelty.
sentences.chinese: 那时因特网还是个挺新鲜的东西。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being new, unusual, and interesting

name: outmoded
trans: Black and white television sets are outmoded.

sentences.english: outmoded ideas
sentences.chinese: 过时的观点

detailed_translations.english: no longer fashionable or useful

name: personalize
trans: He personalized the woman’s exercises to give her a better workout.

sentences.english: Why not do something to personalize your office?
sentences.chinese: 为什么不做点什么使你的办公室有些个性呢？

detailed_translations.english: to put your name or  initial s  on something, or to decorate it in your own way, to show that it belongs to you

name: psychiatric
trans: The doctor said the patient might have a psychiatric problem.

sentences.english: a psychiatric hospital
sentences.chinese: 精神病医院

sentences.english: a psychiatric nurse
sentences.chinese: 精神病院护士

sentences.english: Charles was suffering from a psychiatric disorder (= mental illness ) .
sentences.chinese: 查尔斯彼时精神错乱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神病学的，精神病治疗的

name: psychiatry
trans: Studying psychiatry has taught me a lot about mental illness.
