detailed_translations.english: connected with knowledge of how machines work

name: veteran
trans: Hank was the team veteran and had completed more races than anyone else.

sentences.english: He is a veteran of the last revolution in medical technology, gene therapy, which, after some hyped expectations in the 1990s, fell into disfavor after some unsuccessful trials.
sentences.chinese: 他是基因治疗这项最新医学技术的老手，经过了1990年代的兴奋期和之后几次失败的实验后，基因治疗技术已经失宠了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has been a soldier, sailor etc in a war

name: villain
trans: The villain made of with half of my family’s valuables.

sentences.english: I left the room, feeling like a villain and a murderer.
sentences.chinese: 我离开了那个房间，感觉自己就像一个恶棍，一个杀人犯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坏人，恶棍；戏剧、小说中的反派角色；顽童；罪犯
detailed_translations.english: the main bad character in a film, play, or story

name: vine
trans: The branches of the trees were covered with vines.

sentences.english: Every square metre of soil was used, mainly for olives, vines, and almonds.
sentences.chinese: 每一平方米的土壤都用上了，主要是种植橄榄、葡萄藤和杏树。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藤；葡萄树；藤本植物；攀缘植物
detailed_translations.english: a plant that produces grapes

name: aroma
trans: I love the aroma of coffee in the morning.

sentences.english: the aroma of fresh coffee
sentences.chinese: 新煮咖啡的香味

detailed_translations.english: a strong pleasant smell

name: beverage
trans: The waiter brought our beverages first. Then he brought our food.

sentences.english: Beer is a beverage of the remotest time.
sentences.chinese: 啤酒是一种最古老的饮料。

sentences.english: And not only food: frequently there must be a beverage.
sentences.chinese: 而且不仅仅为了食物，还常常必须有饮料。

sentences.english: In this case, you want to provide the user with a way to say the desired beverage.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，您想为用户提供一种方法，让他们说出自己想要的饮料。

name: cluster
trans: She held a large cluster of grapes in her hand.

sentences.english: Do this for all nodes in the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 对集群中的所有节点都这样做。

sentences.english: This can be done on any server of the cluster.
sentences.chinese: 可以在集群的任何服务器中这样做。

sentences.english: However, there are some problems in the cluster environment.
sentences.chinese: 然而，在集群环境中却存在一些问题。

detailed_translations.english: a group of things of the same kind that are very close together
if a group of people or things cluster somewhere, or are clustered somewhere, they form a small group in that place

name: combine
trans: Mina combined peanut butter and jelly to make a sandwich.

sentences.english: Diets are most effective when combined with exercise.
sentences.chinese: 节食和锻炼相结合是最有效的。

sentences.english: Ruth hesitated, uncertain of how to combine honesty and diplomacy in her answer.
sentences.chinese: 露丝犹豫了，她不知道怎样回答才能既诚实又婉转。

detailed_translations.english: if you combine two or more different things, or if they combine, they begin to exist or work together

detailed_translations.chinese: 联合企业； 联合收割机
detailed_translations.english: a machine used by farmers to cut grain, separate the seeds from it, and clean it

name: condensed
trans: One way to make a dessert thick and sweet is to use condensed milk.

name: contemporary
trans: Contemporary scientists have learned quite a bit about DNA.

sentences.english: She writes a lot of contemporary music for people like Whitney Houston.
sentences.chinese: 她为惠特尼·休斯敦等人创作大量当代音乐作品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 现代的， 当代的； 同时代的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to the present time

name: cultivate
trans: A research company is cultivating new kinds of rice to aid poor countries.

sentences.english: We cultivated maize and watermelons.
sentences.chinese: 我们种植玉米和西瓜。

detailed_translations.english: to plant and take care of a particular crop

name: divine
trans: Legends say that music was given to humans as a divine gift from the gods.

sentences.english: divine power
sentences.chinese: 神的力量

sentences.english: divine love
sentences.chinese: 上帝的慈爱

detailed_translations.chinese: 神圣的；非凡的；天赐的；极好的
detailed_translations.english: coming from or relating to God or a god

name: humid
trans: It is very humid inside a sauna.

sentences.english: Tokyo is extremely humid in mid-summer.
sentences.chinese: 仲夏的东京十分潮湿。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot

name: odor
trans: He knew there was a leak when he noticed the strong odor of natural gas.

sentences.english: I smelled the odor of money.
sentences.chinese: 我闻到了一股铜臭气。

sentences.english: The researchers demonstrate that it is possible to generate odor in a compact device that can fit on the back of a TV with potentially thousands of odors.
sentences.chinese: 研究员表示，将一个可以散发上千种气味的小型设备安装在电视背后，从而实现电视(根据情景)生成气味是可能的。

sentences.english: Pewter has an odor.
sentences.chinese: 锡器有一股臭气。

name: palate
trans: You can touch your palate with your tongue.

sentences.english: It tasted very strange, at least to my untrained palate.
sentences.chinese: 这东西尝起来怪怪的，至少对于我这未经训练的味觉来说是如此。

sentences.english: a collection of dishes to tempt your palate
sentences.chinese: 让人胃口大开的一系列菜肴

detailed_translations.english: the sense of taste, and especially your ability to enjoy or judge food

name: paradise
trans: My vacation in Hawaii was like being in paradise.

sentences.english: The Koran describes paradise as a place containing a garden of delight.
sentences.chinese: 《古兰经》把天堂描绘成一个拥有快乐花园的地方。

detailed_translations.english: in some religions, a perfect place where people are believed to go after they die, if they have led good lives

name: plantation
trans: In the 1800s, there were many cotton plantations in the southern US.

sentences.english: a rubber plantation
sentences.chinese: 橡胶园

detailed_translations.chinese: 适用于种植园或热带、亚热带国家的

name: rapid
trans: His mother was surprised by her son’s rapid growth.

sentences.english: The patient made a rapid recovery.
sentences.chinese: 病人迅速康复。

sentences.english: a period of rapid decline
sentences.chinese: 迅速衰退期

sentences.english: He fired three times in rapid succession (= one after another ) .
sentences.chinese: 他接连开了三枪。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done very quickly and in a very short time

name: rate
trans: Grass tends to grow at a very slow rate.

sentences.english: $20 an hour is the going rate (= the usual amount paid ) for private tuition.
sentences.chinese: 每小时20美元是私人授课的一般收费。

sentences.english: The company seems to rate him very highly (= think he is very good) .
sentences.chinese: 公司好像对他的评价很高。

detailed_translations.english: a charge or payment that is set according to a standard scale
to think that someone or something has a particular quality, value, or standard

name: soothing
trans: The soothing music helped the baby fall asleep.

sentences.english: No one else leant over her, and whispered soothing words to her, or was near enough to hear the flutter of her beating heart.
sentences.chinese: 没有其他任何人向她弯下身去，低声地对她说些安慰的话，或跟她挨得很近，可以听到她颤动的心房正在怦怦地跳动。

sentences.english: He offered soothing words about the value of the French model in the recession and its ability to protect the most vulnerable from poverty.
sentences.chinese: 对于衰退中法兰西模式的价值，以及保护绝大多数易受伤害的贫困人口的能力，他给予了安慰。

name: subtle
trans: The handsome man has a subtle smile.

sentences.english: The pictures are similar, but there are subtle differences between them.
sentences.chinese: 这些图片很相似，但它们之间有细微的差别。

sentences.english: The warning signs of the disease are so subtle that they are often ignored.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病的警示征兆不易察觉，因而往往被忽视。

sentences.english: a subtle form of racism
sentences.chinese: 隐性的种族歧视

sentences.english: The dish had a subtle hint of ginger.
sentences.chinese: 这道菜微微带点姜的味道。

detailed_translations.english: not easy to notice or understand unless you pay careful attention

name: texture
trans: The texture of a rock found in the water is typically very smooth.

sentences.english: This cloth has a silky texture.
sentences.chinese: 这种布具有丝的质地。

sentences.english: What is the texture of your experience?
sentences.chinese: 这次经历的实质是什么？

name: toxic
trans: Please check the label to see if the product is toxic.

sentences.english: fumes from a toxic waste dump
sentences.chinese: 有毒废料堆产生的毒气

sentences.english: a highly toxic pesticide
sentences.chinese: 毒性很强的杀虫剂

detailed_translations.english: containing poison, or caused by poisonous substances

name: vary
trans: The heights of the people in my class vary by a large amount.

sentences.english: Test scores vary from school to school.
sentences.chinese: 测验成绩各校不同。

sentences.english: The heights of the plants vary from 8 cm to 20 cm.
sentences.chinese: 这些植物的高度从8厘米到20厘米不等。

sentences.english: Medical treatment varies greatly from state to state.
sentences.chinese: 医疗制度州与州之间差异很大。

sentences.english: Cooking times may vary slightly, depending on your oven.
sentences.chinese: 烹饪时间可能略有不同，因烤炉而异。

sentences.english: Charges vary according to size.
sentences.chinese: 费用因大小而异。

sentences.english: She has tried different diets with varying degrees of success.
sentences.chinese: 她试过各种不同的节食方式，效果各不相同。

sentences.english: tests of varying levels of difficulty
sentences.chinese: 难易程度不一的测验

sentences.english: Quentin’s mood seems to vary according to the weather.
sentences.chinese: 昆廷的情绪似乎随天气而变化。

detailed_translations.english: if several things of the same type vary, they are all different from each other

name: admiral
trans: They won the sea battle because of the admiral’s great leadership.

detailed_translations.chinese: 海军上将；舰队司令；旗舰
detailed_translations.english: a high rank in the British or US navy, or someone with this rank

name: arc
trans: A rainbow is an arc of colored bands across the sky.

sentences.english: the arc of a rainbow
sentences.chinese: 彩虹的弧状

detailed_translations.english: a curved shape or line

name: character
trans: My sister’s character is fun and very outgoing.

sentences.english: He has a cheerful but quiet character.
sentences.chinese: 他的性格乐观文静。

sentences.english: Everyone recognizes Disney’s cartoon characters.
sentences.chinese: 迪士尼的卡通人物尽人皆知。

sentences.english: The whole character of the school has changed.
sentences.chinese: 这所学校的特色已经完全变了。

detailed_translations.english: the particular combination of qualities that makes someone a particular type of person

name: conscience
trans: I recycle everything I can, so my conscience is clear!

sentences.english: Well, at least I can face them all with a clear conscience (= the knowledge that you have done nothing wrong ) .
sentences.chinese: 好吧，至少我可以问心无愧地面对他们所有人。

sentences.english: I can’t tell you what to do – it’s a matter of conscience (= something that you must make a moral judgment about ) .
sentences.chinese: 我不能告诉你怎么办——这是良心问题。

sentences.english: a crisis of conscience among medical staff (= a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what is the right thing to do )
sentences.chinese: 医务人员中的良心危机

detailed_translations.english: the part of your mind that tells you whether what you are doing is morally right or wrong

name: escape
trans: She tried to escape from the building.

sentences.english: He broke down the locked door and escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他砸开上锁的门，逃走了。

sentences.english: Vents allow any steam to escape if the system overheats.
sentences.chinese: 如果系统过热，排放口可使蒸汽逸出。

sentences.english: The girl had no chance of escape.
sentences.chinese: 那女孩没有机会逃跑。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a place when someone is trying to catch you or stop you, or when there is a dangerous situation
the act of getting away from a place, or a dangerous or bad situation

name: fiery
trans: The fiery blaze burned all night long.

sentences.english: He has a fiery temper .
sentences.chinese: 他脾气火爆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热烈的，炽烈的；暴躁的；燃烧般的
detailed_translations.english: becoming angry or excited very quickly

name: flesh
trans: The zebra’s flesh is covered by black and white skin.

sentences.english: a freshwater fish with firm white flesh
sentences.chinese: 一种肉色雪白、肉质紧实的淡水鱼

detailed_translations.english: the soft part of the body of a person or animal that is between the skin and the bones

name: grapefruit
trans: Would you like a grapefruit with your breakfast?

name: hay
trans: I need to buy some more hay for the horse to eat.

sentences.english: bales of hay.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 一捆捆的干草。

detailed_translations.english: long grass that has been cut and dried, used as food for cattle

name: horrified
trans: I was horrified when I read about the old lady who was attacked.

name: kerosene
trans: Many people in poor countries cook on kerosene stoves.

sentences.english: a kerosene lamp
sentences.chinese: 煤油灯

detailed_translations.english: a clear oil that is burnt to provide heat or light

name: loop
trans: He made a loop with the rope and placed it over the post.

sentences.english: He looped the rope over the wood.
sentences.chinese: 他把绳子打了环系在木头上。

detailed_translations.english: to fly a plane up and around in a circle so that the plane is  upside down  for a time
a shape like a curve or a circle made by a line curving back towards itself, or a piece of wire, string etc that has this shape

name: middle
trans: I suddenly woke up in the middle of the night.

sentences.english: We rowed out towards the middle of the lake.
sentences.chinese: 我们朝湖中央划去。

sentences.english: They spent the middle part of their vacation in Florida.
sentences.chinese: 文例句：假期的中间一段他们是在佛罗里达州度过的。

detailed_translations.english: the part that is nearest the centre of something, and furthest from the sides, edges, top, bottom etc
half of the way through an event or period of time

name: paddle
trans: Put your paddle in the water and pull hard to make the boat move.

sentences.english: Each man had a paddle for an hour and then a rest.
sentences.chinese: 每人划一小时桨， 然后休息一下。

sentences.english: We strive to paddle to follow the stream, however, we are unsure if how and when we will reach the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着河流奋力划桨，但是我们无法确定我们什么时候和怎样才能到达地平线。

sentences.english: If you run your team as if they were self-leading, but in reality they’re chaos, then before long you’ll be heading up a certain creek without a paddle.
sentences.chinese: 如果你当他们是自我引导型的团队在运作，但其实他们事实上还是在混乱的状态，那么不久你就会在一条河上像没有桨似的乱窜。

detailed_translations.english: a short pole that is wide and flat at the end, used for moving a small boat in water
to move a small light boat through water, using one or more paddles

name: sour
trans: I don’t like lemons because I think they are too sour.

sentences.english: Rachel sampled the wine. It was sour.
sentences.chinese: 雷切尔尝了尝葡萄酒，是酸的。

sentences.english: sour cherries
sentences.chinese: 酸樱桃

detailed_translations.chinese: 酸的；发酵的；刺耳的；酸臭的；讨厌的
detailed_translations.english: having a sharp acid taste, like the taste of a  lemon  or a fruit that is not ready to be eaten
if milk sours, or if something sours it, it begins to have an unpleasant sharp taste

name: stake
trans: We marked our property by placing stakes into the ground.

sentences.english: They have to win the contract – thousands of jobs are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须拿下这份合同，这关系到数千个工作岗位。

sentences.english: National pride is at stake in next week’s game against England.
sentences.chinese: 下星期对英格兰队的比赛关乎民族尊严。

detailed_translations.english: if something that you value very much is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful

name: steward
trans: The steward is bringing some tea.

sentences.english: race stewards
sentences.chinese: 比赛组织者

detailed_translations.chinese: 管家；乘务员；膳务员；工会管事
detailed_translations.english: a man whose job is to serve food and drinks to passengers on a plane or ship

name: string
trans: I found a large ball of string.

sentences.english: Her key hung on a string around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她的钥匙穿了根绳子挂在脖子上。

sentences.english: a ball of string
sentences.chinese: 一团细绳

sentences.english: I need a piece of string to tie this package.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一根绳子来捆这个包裹。

sentences.english: a string of pearls
sentences.chinese: 一串珍珠

detailed_translations.english: a strong thread made of several threads twisted together, used for tying or fastening things

name: thorn
trans: Be careful of the thorns when you pick up the roses!

sentences.english: a long, low hedge of thorns
sentences.chinese: 一长排矮矮的荆棘树篱

detailed_translations.english: a sharp point that grows on the stem of a plant such as a rose

name: wreck
trans: The teenagers wrecked the house for no reason at all.

sentences.english: Divers discovered the wreck of an old German warship.
sentences.chinese: 潜水员发现了一艘沉没的德国旧军舰。

sentences.english: Injury threatened to wreck his sporting career.
sentences.chinese: 伤病可能会毁了他的运动生涯。

detailed_translations.english: a ship that has sunk
to completely spoil something so that it cannot continue in a successful way

name: admonish
trans: The teacher admonished Mark because he was chewing gum in class.

sentences.english: They admonished me for taking risks with my health.
sentences.chinese: 他们告诫我不要拿自己的健康来冒险。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone severely that they have done something wrong

name: audible
trans: The sound of the drums was audible from miles away.

sentences.english: His voice was barely audible (=  could only just be heard  ) above the roar of the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 人声嘈杂，几乎听不见他的说话声。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that is audible is loud enough for you to hear it

name: awesome
trans: The huge military plane was an awesome sight.

sentences.english: an awesome responsibility
sentences.chinese: 一项令人惊惧的责任

sentences.english: the awesome sweep of the scenery
sentences.chinese: 连绵的壮丽景色

detailed_translations.english: extremely impressive, serious, or difficult so that you feel great respect, worry, or fear

name: beware
trans: You should beware of driving fast on wet roads.

sentences.english: Police warned drivers to beware.
sentences.chinese: 警方提醒司机小心行驶。

detailed_translations.english: used to warn someone to be careful because something is dangerous

name: brag
trans: He had strong muscles and bragged about them to the entire class.

sentences.english: Do not brag or bluff.
sentences.chinese: 不要自夸和虚张声势。

sentences.english: It is not in good form to brag of your learning.
sentences.chinese: 吹嘘自己的学识是欠妥的。

sentences.english: These are the people that have every right to brag and maybe be a bit arrogant, yet they remain humble.
sentences.chinese: 这些人有理由吹嘘自己的成功，甚至理应有点自傲，但是他们仍然保持着低调的作风。

detailed_translations.english: to talk too proudly about what you have done, what you own etc – used to show disapproval

name: conscious
trans: The new student was conscious of the other students staring at her.

sentences.english: I became conscious of someone watching me.
sentences.chinese: 我察觉到有人在监视我。

sentences.english: a conscious act of cruelty
sentences.chinese: 有意而为的残暴行径

detailed_translations.english: noticing or realizing something

name: disagree
trans: The lawyers disagreed about the best way to settle the case.

sentences.english: Barr strongly disagreed with Kronfeld’s statement.
sentences.chinese: 巴尔强烈反对克龙费尔德的说法。

sentences.english: The statements of several witnesses disagree.
sentences.chinese: 几名证人的证词不一致。

detailed_translations.english: to have or express a different opinion from someone else

name: echo
trans: The child yelled over the canyon, and the sound echoed off the wall.

sentences.english: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

sentences.english: ‘He's gone! ’ Viv echoed.
sentences.chinese: “他去了！”维夫重复道。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
to repeat what someone else has just said

name: eventual
trans: The constant training and planning led the team to an eventual victory.

sentences.english: Sweden were the eventual winners of the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典队是锦标赛的最后赢家。

sentences.english: Both sides were happy with the eventual outcome of the talks.
sentences.chinese: 双方对会谈的最终结果都感到满意。

detailed_translations.chinese: 最后的，结果的；可能的；终于的
detailed_translations.english: happening at the end of a long period of time or after a lot of other things have happened

name: hint
trans: I quietly passed on a hint to my sister about the test.

sentences.english: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
sentences.chinese: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.english: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
sentences.chinese: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.english: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.chinese: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning

name: idiot
trans: Because he got lost in the forest, the man felt like an idiot.

sentences.english: ‘You are an idiot, ’ he tells them.
sentences.chinese: ‘你确实是傻瓜，’他对他们说。

sentences.english: Reader, suppose you were an idiot. And suppose you were a member of Congress. But I repeat myself.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的读者，假设你是一个白痴。再假设你是一名国会成员。不过我的话说重复了。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is mentally ill or has a very low level of intelligence

name: immense
trans: An immense amount of money was needed to buy such a large boat.

sentences.english: People who travel by rail still read an immense amount.
sentences.chinese: 人们坐火车旅行时仍然会读很多书。

sentences.english: Regular visits from a social worker can be of immense value to old people living alone.
sentences.chinese: 对于独居老人来说社工的经常探望很重要。

name: indirect

sentences.english: Losing weight is an indirect result of smoking cigarettes.

sentences.chinese: 乔治的评论转弯抹角地指责了我。

name: option

sentences.english: There are a number of options available.
sentences.chinese: 有多种选择。

sentences.english: He had two options.
sentences.chinese: 他有两种选择。

sentences.english: This was not the only option open to him.
sentences.chinese: 这并非是他的唯一选择。

sentences.english: Teenage mothers often have no option but to (= have no other choice except to ) live with their parents.
sentences.chinese: 少女妈妈往往别无选择，只能与父母同住。

detailed_translations.chinese: 选择， 选择权， 选择自由； 选择的事物， 选课
detailed_translations.english: a choice you can make in a particular situation

trans: In the US, baseball is considered a national pastime.

sentences.english: Reading was her favourite pastime.
sentences.chinese: 阅读是她最喜爱的消遣方式。

detailed_translations.english: something that you do because you think it is enjoyable or interesting

name: perfect

sentences.english: His English was perfect.
sentences.chinese: 他的英语很地道。

sentences.english: The car was in perfect condition.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车的车况极佳。

sentences.english: You’re very lucky to have perfect teeth.
sentences.chinese: 你能拥有一口完美的牙齿太幸运了。

sentences.english: a perfect performance
sentences.chinese: 完美的演出

sentences.english: In a perfect world, we wouldn’t need an army.
sentences.chinese: 在理想世界中，我们不需要军队。

detailed_translations.english: not having any mistakes, faults, or damage

name: pinpoint
trans: The navigation system in my car is able to pinpoint my exact location.

sentences.english: New satellites will allow cars to pinpoint their position within an inch .
sentences.chinese: 新的卫星系统将让汽车精确他们的位置到每一英寸。

sentences.english: The feature could, for example, pinpoint areas being threatened by a quickly approaching tornado and alert residents of impending danger via their computers or cell phones.
sentences.chinese: 例如，精确地定位正遭受龙卷风攻击的区域并通过计算机和手机警告危险地区的人们。

detailed_translations.english: to find or show the exact position of something
a very small area or  dot  of something

name: switch
trans: Mom switched the TV station from the news to her favorite show.

sentences.english: The terrorists will switch tactics .
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子会改变战术。

detailed_translations.english: to change from doing or using one thing to doing or using another

name: thorough
trans: Tina did a thorough job of cleaning the stains out of the carpet.

sentences.english: The doctor gave him a thorough check-up.
sentences.chinese: 医生给他做了一次全面的体检。

sentences.english: a thorough and detailed biography
sentences.chinese: 详尽的传记

sentences.english: The police investigation was very thorough.
sentences.chinese: 警方的调查十分彻底。

sentences.english: thorough notes of the meeting
sentences.chinese: 详尽的会议记录

detailed_translations.english: including every possible detail

name: torment
trans: She tormented her little brother by taking his favorite toy.

sentences.english: The journey must have been a torment for them.
sentences.chinese: 这次旅途对他们来说一定十分痛苦。

detailed_translations.english: severe mental or physical suffering
to make someone suffer a lot, especially mentally

name: abrupt
trans: When the dancer fell down on her back, the ballet came to an abrupt stop.

sentences.english: an abrupt change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的突然改变

detailed_translations.chinese: 生硬的；突然的；唐突的；陡峭的
detailed_translations.english: sudden and unexpected

name: agony
trans: The boy yelled in agony when the puppy bit him.

sentences.english: the agony of arthritis
sentences.chinese: 关节炎的剧烈疼痛

detailed_translations.english: very severe pain

name: assassin

sentences.english: Kennedy’s assassin is assumed to have been Lee Harvey Oswald.
sentences.chinese: 暗杀肯尼迪的人据说是李·哈维·奥斯瓦尔德。

detailed_translations.english: someone who murders an important person

name: beard
trans: The farmer had a long beard, as white as snow.

sentences.english: He's decided to grow a beard.
sentences.chinese: 他已经决定蓄胡须。

detailed_translations.english: hair that grows around a man’s chin and cheeks

name: beast
trans: Tanzania is home to many famous beasts, such as lions, leopards, and hyenas.

sentences.english: ...the threats our ancestors faced from wild beasts.
sentences.chinese: …我们祖辈所面临的来自野兽的威胁。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, especially a large or dangerous one

name: chapel

sentences.english: Bethan goes to chapel every Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 贝唐每个星期天都去教堂做礼拜。

detailed_translations.english: a small church, or a room in a hospital, prison, big church etc in which Christians pray and have religious services

name: commentator
trans: According to many commentators, this winter has been one of the coldest in the last century.

sentences.english: political commentators
sentences.chinese: 政治评论员

detailed_translations.chinese: 评论员，解说员；实况播音员；时事评论者
detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about a particular subject, and who writes about it or discusses it on the television or radio

name: con
trans: It was unfair of the fortune teller to con me out of 500 dollars.

sentences.english: However, this is often interpreted as implying that all public speech must be either pro-or-con some very specific proposal.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这经常被认为是暗示：公众演讲必须是对于某项具体的建议的正面的或者是反面的反映。

detailed_translations.english: an argument or vote against a proposal, motion, etc

name: consensus
trans: The consensus among the children was that ghosts exist.

sentences.english: The EU Council of Finance Ministers failed to reach a consensus on the pace of integration.
sentences.chinese: 欧盟财政部长会议未能就一体化的进度达成共识。

sentences.english: the current consensus of opinion
sentences.chinese: 目前观点上的一致

sentences.english: The general consensus was that technology was a good thing.
sentences.chinese: 大家都认为科技是好东西。

sentences.english: the consensus politics of the fifties
sentences.chinese: 50年代的共识政治

name: conspiracy

sentences.english: There were many conspiracy theories (= beliefs that something is the result of a conspiracy ) surrounding Princess Diana’s death.
sentences.chinese: 围绕戴安娜王妃之死有许多阴谋论。

detailed_translations.english: a secret plan made by two or more people to do something that is harmful or illegal

name: coup
trans: At the end of the 18th century, Napoleon Bonaparte staged a coup to overthrow a group that had control of France.

sentences.english: Haiti’s first elected President was deposed in a violent military coup .
sentences.chinese: 海地的第一位民选总统在一场动荡的军事政变中被废黜。

sentences.english: a coup attempt by junior officers
sentences.chinese: 低级军官发动的一场军事政变

sentences.english: He evaded capture after the failed coup .
sentences.chinese: 政变失败后他逃脱了抓捕。

detailed_translations.chinese: 政变；妙计；出乎意料的行动；砰然的一击
detailed_translations.english: a sudden and sometimes violent attempt by citizens or the army to take control of the government

name: cynical
trans: The man became cynical after being lied to many times.

sentences.english: a cynical view of human nature
sentences.chinese: 认为人性本恶的一种观点

detailed_translations.chinese: 愤世嫉俗的， 怀疑的
detailed_translations.english: unwilling to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something

name: dome
trans: I looked up at the dome to admire its beauty.

sentences.english: ...the dome of the Capitol.
sentences.chinese: …国会大厦的穹顶。

detailed_translations.english: a round roof on a building

name: exclaim
trans: The singer interrupted the applause to exclaim his thanks after his performance.

sentences.english: ‘No!’ she exclaimed in shock.
sentences.chinese: “不！”她惊呼道。

detailed_translations.english: to say something suddenly and loudly because you are surprised, angry, or excited

name: forum
trans: The scientist shared her research at a special forum in the city.

sentences.english: the new national forum on the environment
sentences.chinese: 新的全国性环境论坛

detailed_translations.english: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

name: glamour
trans: The young woman showed of her glamour during the photo shoot.

sentences.english: ...the glamour of show biz.
sentences.chinese: …演艺业的诱惑力。

detailed_translations.english: the attractive and exciting quality of being connected with wealth and success

sentences.chinese: 一些黑人青年投诉称受到警察骚扰。

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The shooting inflamed ethnic tensions.
sentences.chinese: 枪击事件加剧了种族间的紧张局势。

name: melody
trans: I had the melody of the song stuck in my head all day.

sentences.english: They played some lovely melodies.
sentences.chinese: 他们演奏了一些动听的曲子。

sentences.english: a haunting melody
sentences.chinese: 难以忘怀的曲调

detailed_translations.english: a song or tune

name: awhile

sentences.chinese: 他在辛辛那提做了一阵子的药剂师。

sentences.english: Students are discovering the endless amount of information in cyberspace.
sentences.chinese: 学生在网络空间里不断发现无穷尽的信息。

detailed_translations.english: all the connections between computers in different places, considered as a real place where information, messages, pictures etc exist

name: edit
trans: She asked her brother to edit her paper before she submitted it to her teacher.

sentences.english: a collection of essays edited by John Gay
sentences.chinese: 由约翰·盖伊编辑的论文集

sentences.english: I know that this draft text will need to be edited.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这篇草稿需要校订。

detailed_translations.english: to prepare a book, piece of film etc for printing or broadcasting by removing mistakes or parts that are not acceptable

name: essay
trans: She had to write a two-page essay for her English class.

sentences.english: an essay on Bernard Shaw
sentences.chinese: 关于萧伯纳的文章

sentences.english: We asked Jason to write an essay about his hometown.
sentences.chinese: 我们让杰森写一篇关于他家乡的短文。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of writing about a particular subject by a student as part of a course of study

name: evaluate
trans: Jo and Ken evaluated the plan and agreed that it would work.

sentences.english: You should be able to evaluate your own work.
sentences.chinese: 你应该能够评估自己的工作。

sentences.english: We need to evaluate the success of the campaign.
sentences.chinese: 我们要评估一下这次运动是否成功。

sentences.english: It can be difficult to evaluate the effectiveness of different treatments.
sentences.chinese: 要对各种治疗方法的效果作出评估会很难。

sentences.english: She gave a faint smile.
sentences.chinese: 她淡淡一笑。

sentences.english: a very faint noise
sentences.chinese: 很微弱的声响

sentences.english: the faint light of dawn
sentences.chinese: 微弱的晨光

name: global
trans: Pollution is a global problem.

sentences.english: global climate change
sentences.chinese: 全球气候变化

sentences.english: the global economy
sentences.chinese: 全球经济

detailed_translations.english: affecting or including the whole world

name: gymnasium

sentences.english: I have found a new gymnasium.
sentences.chinese: 我找到一个新的健身房。

sentences.english: The next day, the arsonist was arrested at a gymnasium.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，纵火犯在一家体育馆被逮捕了。

sentences.chinese: 电脑打印机和行李包都运进了宿舍之后，所有人都到学校的体育馆集合，学生在露天看台的一侧，家长们在另一侧。

detailed_translations.english: a  gym

sentences.english: Your résumé should highlight your skills and achievements.
sentences.chinese: 你的简历应该突出自己的技能和成绩。

sentences.chinese: 在威尼斯度过的那个周末无疑是我们这次旅行最精彩的部分。

the most important, interesting, or enjoyable part of something such as a holiday, performance, or sports competition

name: ignorant
trans: I’m a bit ignorant about his theories. Can you explain them to me?

sentences.english: an ignorant and uneducated man
sentences.chinese: 不学无术的人

detailed_translations.english: not knowing facts or information that you ought to know

name: index
trans: If you look in the index, you’ll find the right page number.

sentences.english: ...the consumer price index.
sentences.chinese: …消费价格指数。

detailed_translations.english: a standard by which the level of something can be judged or measured

name: lecture
trans: His lecture on world hunger was very informative.

sentences.english: He regularly gives lectures on modern French literature.
sentences.chinese: 他经常讲授法国现代文学课程。

sentences.english: He lectures on European art at Manchester University.
sentences.chinese: 他在曼彻斯特大学讲授欧洲艺术。

detailed_translations.english: a long talk on a particular subject that someone gives to a group of people, especially to students in a university

sentences.chinese: 对于判谋杀犯死刑这种涉及伦理道德的问题，有个观点并非难事。

sentences.chinese: 如果我们同意应该允许某些婴儿死去，那就是让医生在道德上处于两难境地了。

sentences.english: Man is gifted with a moral sense by which he distinguishes good from evil.
sentences.chinese: 人类天生有道德意识，能区分善与恶。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the principles of what is right and wrong behaviour, and with the difference between good and evil

detailed_translations.chinese: 品行， 道德规范； 寓意
detailed_translations.english: principles or standards of good behaviour, especially in matters of sex

name: operate
trans: I’m sorry, but the trains are not operating today.

sentences.english: The whole tax system is now operating more efficiently.
sentences.chinese: 现在整个税收制度运作效率更高了。

sentences.english: The new law doesn’t operate in our favour.
sentences.chinese: 这项新法规对我们不利。

sentences.english: The car parks operate a pay-as-you-leave system.
sentences.chinese: 这些停车场按“离开时付费”的模式运作。

sentences.english: The bus company operates a Monday to Saturday service.
sentences.chinese: 这家公共汽车公司周一至周六运营。

detailed_translations.english: if a system, process, or service operates, or if you operate it, it works

name: private
trans: Don’t look at my diary! It’s private!

sentences.english: Morris has a private jet.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯拥有一架私人喷气式飞机。

sentences.english: He made some notes for his private use.
sentences.chinese: 他记了些笔记供自己所用。

sentences.english: They objected to any form of private property .
sentences.chinese: 他们反对任何形式的私有财产。

detailed_translations.english: for use by one person or group, not for everyone

name: recent
trans: I did not know what had caused his recent behavior.

sentences.english: Irving’s most recent book
sentences.chinese: 欧文最新的书

sentences.english: recent research into the causes of cancer
sentences.chinese: 近来对致癌原因的研究

sentences.english: the recent past
sentences.chinese: 不久前

detailed_translations.english: having happened or started only a short time ago

name: resolution
trans: At New Year, I made a list of resolutions to help me have a better year.

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

name: semester
trans: Jack is in his second semester of college.

sentences.english: the fall semester
sentences.chinese: 秋季学期

detailed_translations.english: one of the two periods of time that a year at high schools and universities is divided into, especially in the US

name: typewritten
trans: This is an important, formal project and must be typewritten.

name: weird
trans: My best friend’s dad is a bit weird.

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: accustom
trans: I find it difficult to accustom myself to new time zones when I travel around the world.

sentences.english: She tried to accustom herself to the tight bandages.
sentences.chinese: 她尝试着使自己习惯那些紧绷的绷带。

detailed_translations.english: to make yourself or another person become used to a situation or place

name: alpha
trans: The largest lion was the alpha male of the pack.

detailed_translations.chinese: 希腊字母的第一个字母；开端；最初
detailed_translations.english: the first letter in the Greek alphabet (Α, α), a vowel transliterated as a

name: arouse
trans: The politician’s words were meant to arouse the protestors’ anger.

sentences.english: Matt’s behavior was arousing the interest of the neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 马特的行为渐渐引起了邻居的兴趣。

sentences.english: Anne had to be aroused from a deep sleep.
sentences.chinese: 不得不把安妮从沉睡中唤醒。

detailed_translations.english: to make you become interested, expect something etc; to wake someone

name: articulate
trans: Alfred’s friends loved talking to him because he was so articulate and intelligent.

sentences.english: Many people are unable to articulate the unhappiness they feel.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都表达不出内心的痛苦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 清晰地发（音）；明确有力地表达；用关节连接；使相互连贯
detailed_translations.english: to express your ideas or feelings in words

detailed_translations.chinese: 发音清晰的；口才好的；有关节的
detailed_translations.english: writing or speech that is articulate is very clear and easy to understand even if the subject is difficult

name: buzz
trans: Seoul buzzes from dawn till dusk.

sentences.english: a loud buzzing noise
sentences.chinese: 很大的嗡嗡声

detailed_translations.chinese: 发出嗡嗡声；忙乱，急行；发出嘈杂的谈话声
detailed_translations.english: to make a continuous sound, like the sound of a  bee

detailed_translations.chinese: 嗡嗡声； 嘈杂的谈话声
detailed_translations.english: a continuous noise like the sound of a  bee

name: clash
trans: The sisters often clash over the right way to do things.

sentences.english: Troops clashed near the border.
sentences.chinese: 军队在边境附近发生了冲突。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发生冲突；不协调；砰地相撞，发出刺耳的撞击声
detailed_translations.english: if two armies, groups etc clash, they start fighting – used in news reports

detailed_translations.chinese: 冲突； 不协调； 刺耳的撞击声
detailed_translations.english: a short fight between two armies or groups – used in news reports

name: classification
trans: According to scientific classification, a duck-billed platypus is an egg-laying mammal.

sentences.english: the classification of wines according to quality
sentences.chinese: 葡萄酒按品质的分类

sentences.english: There are five job classifications.
sentences.chinese: 有五种工作类别。

detailed_translations.english: a process in which you put something into the group or class it belongs to

name: cling
trans: A mother sloth will cling tightly to her baby in the treetops.

sentences.english: His wet shirt clung to his body.
sentences.chinese: 他的湿衬衫紧紧地贴在身上。

sentences.english: After her mother's death, Sara clung to her aunt more than ever.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在母亲去世后比以往任何时候都更依附于她的姨妈。

sentences.english: Throughout the trial she had clung to the belief that he was innocent.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审判中，她都坚持相信他是清白的。

detailed_translations.english: to stick to someone or something, or seem to surround them

name: compliance
trans: The bratty child never shows compliance with her mother’s rules.

sentences.english: Inspectors were sent to visit nuclear sites and verify compliance with the treaty.
sentences.chinese: 监察员被派去参观核址并核实条约的遵守情况。

detailed_translations.english: when someone obeys a rule, agreement, or demand

name: comprehend
trans: The player could not comprehend why he lost the game.

sentences.english: She cannot comprehend the extent of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 她无法理解这场灾难的严重程度。

sentences.english: I did not fully comprehend what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 我没有完全理解发生了什么事。

detailed_translations.english: to understand something that is complicated or difficult

name: congregate
trans: Seeing a group of birds congregate in the sky is an awesome sight.

sentences.english: Crowds began to congregate to hear the President’s speech.
sentences.chinese: 人群开始聚拢，来聆听总统的演讲。

detailed_translations.english: to come together in a group

name: custody
trans: The prisoners were put in the custody of the jailers.

sentences.english: The mother is usually awarded custody (= legally allowed to have custody ) .
sentences.chinese: 母亲通常会获得监护权。

sentences.english: a dispute over who should have custody of the children
sentences.chinese: 关于孩子监护权归属问题的争执

sentences.english: The couple will retain joint custody (= they will both have custody ) of their daughters.
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩将继续保留对女儿的共同监护权。

sentences.english: Allen is fighting a bitter custody battle over his three children.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦为获得自己三个孩子的监护权拼死力争。

detailed_translations.english: the right to take care of a child, given to one of their parents when they have  divorced

name: disperse
trans: I watched the people disperse in all directions to avoid the charging bull.

sentences.english: Police used tear gas to disperse the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 警察用催泪瓦斯驱散人群。

detailed_translations.chinese: 分散， 赶散； 消散， 驱散
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

detailed_translations.chinese: 使分散，散开；使消散，消失
detailed_translations.english: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

name: embody
trans: Mother Teresa was said to embody goodness and kindness.

sentences.english: She embodies everything I admire in a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 她具备了我所钦佩的教师该具备的一切素质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 体现，使具体化；具体表达
detailed_translations.english: to be a very good example of an idea or quality

name: empirical
trans: Scientists must always find empirical evidence in their work.

sentences.english: empirical evidence
sentences.chinese: 实验证据

detailed_translations.english: based on scientific testing or practical experience, not on ideas

name: exclusion
trans: People gathered together to protest the exclusion of immigrants from our country.

sentences.english: Your essays tend to concentrate on one theme to the exclusion of everything else.
sentences.chinese: 你的文章往往会集中于一个主题而不顾及其他各个方面。

detailed_translations.chinese: 排除；排斥；驱逐；被排除在外的事物
detailed_translations.english: when someone is not allowed to take part in something or enter a place

name: flock
trans: Groups of birds will flock to the river in the spring.

sentences.english: People have been flocking to the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 看展览的人络绎不绝。

detailed_translations.english: to go or gather together somewhere in large numbers

name: graze
trans: The sheep and goats like to graze on the grass outside the village.

sentences.english: fields where they used to graze their sheep
sentences.chinese: 他们过去放羊的田野

detailed_translations.english: if an animal grazes, or if you graze it, it eats grass that is growing
to accidentally break the surface of your skin by rubbing it against something
a wound caused by rubbing that slightly breaks the surface of your skin

name: intelligent
trans: The intelligent student graduated from high school with the highest marks in his class.

sentences.english: a group of highly intelligent (= very intelligent )students
sentences.chinese: 一组聪明异常的学生

sentences.english: Sontag was once famously described as the most intelligent woman in America.
sentences.chinese: 桑塔格曾被称为美国最聪明的女人，这是众人皆知的事。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent person has a high level of mental ability and is good at understanding ideas and thinking clearly

name: jungle
trans: Many kinds of animals, including birds, reptiles, and even elephants live in a jungle.

sentences.english: the Amazon jungle
sentences.chinese: 亚马孙丛林

detailed_translations.english: a thick tropical forest with many large plants growing very close together

name: account
trans: After I paid for the new car, my bank account was nearly empty.

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: architect
trans: The plans for building the new home were drawn by a famous architect.

sentences.english: But I am an architect.
sentences.chinese: 但是我是一名建筑师。

sentences.english: They commissioned an architect to design the new library.
sentences.chinese: 他们委托一位建筑师设计这座新图书馆。

sentences.english: The building was constructed from the design of that architect.
sentences.chinese: 这幢大楼是按那位建筑师的设计建造的。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to design buildings

name: conceal
trans: You should conceal your money so no one can take it from you.

sentences.english: The shadows concealed her as she crept up to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她借着阴影蹑手蹑脚地走向房子。

sentences.english: The path was concealed by long grass.
sentences.chinese: 小路隐藏在长长的草里。

sentences.english: a concealed weapon
sentences.chinese: 藏匿的武器

detailed_translations.english: to hide something carefully

name: crime
trans: Police quickly arrived at the scene of the crime.

sentences.english: We moved here because there was very little crime.
sentences.chinese: 我们搬到这里来是因为这里的犯罪率很低。

sentences.english: Police officers are being given new powers to help combat crime.
sentences.chinese: 警官们被赋予新的权力帮助他们打击犯罪。

sentences.english: a police crackdown on car crime
sentences.chinese: 警察对汽车犯罪活动的一次严厉打击

sentences.english: a town with a relatively low crime rate
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率相对较低的一个城镇

detailed_translations.english: illegal activities in general

name: deed
trans: When she bought the car, she was given a deed to show the car was hers.

sentences.english: After the morning’s good deeds he deserved a rest.
sentences.chinese: 上午做了好事之后，他理应休息一下。

sentences.english: She tried to strangle her baby and her lover helped her finish the evil deed .
sentences.chinese: 她试图掐死自己的宝宝，她的情人帮着完成了这个罪恶的勾当。

detailed_translations.chinese: 行动；功绩；证书；[法] 契据
detailed_translations.english: something someone does, especially something that is very good or very bad

name: gratitude
trans: The kids showed Aunt Tess much gratitude for visiting them.

sentences.english: He smiled at them with gratitude.
sentences.chinese: 他向他们笑了笑表示谢意。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling of being grateful and wanting to express your thanks

name: habitat
trans: Frogs are often found in a wet habitat, such as near a lake, river, or pond.

sentences.english: watching monkeys in their natural habitat
sentences.chinese: 观察自然生活环境中的猴子

sentences.english: The grassland is an important habitat for many wild flowers.
sentences.chinese: 这片草原是很多野花的重要生长地。

detailed_translations.english: the natural home of a plant or animal

name: intervene
trans: The students argued until the teacher intervened.

sentences.english: The army will have to intervene to prevent further fighting.
sentences.chinese: 军队将不得不干预以阻止进一步的战斗。

sentences.english: The police don’t usually like to intervene in disputes between husbands and wives.
sentences.chinese: 警方通常不愿意介入夫妻之间的争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to become involved in an argument, fight, or other difficult situation in order to change what happens

name: landmark
trans: The tall tree was used as a landmark for people to find the road to the inn.

name: legal
trans: It was not legal for him to drive until he was 18 years old.

sentences.english: What the company has done is perfectly legal.
sentences.chinese: 公司所做的这一切完全合法。

sentences.english: plans to make the carrying of identity cards a legal requirement
sentences.chinese: 使携带身份证成为法定要求的计划

sentences.english: He had twice the legal limit of alcohol in his bloodstream.
sentences.chinese: 他血液中的酒精含量是法定限度的两倍。

sentences.english: a pressure group that is campaigning to make cannabis legal
sentences.chinese: 争取大麻合法化的压力团体

detailed_translations.english: if something is legal, you are allowed to do it or have to do it by law

name: memorable
trans: The party was memorable; people were still talking about it years later.

sentences.english: We want to make this a truly memorable day for the children.
sentences.chinese: 我们想让今天成为孩子们永远难忘的日子。

detailed_translations.english: very good, enjoyable, or unusual, and worth remembering

name: oblige
trans: If I wanted to have playtime, I was obliged to clean my room once a week.

sentences.english: Mr. Oakley has always been ready to oblige journalists with information.
sentences.chinese: 奥克利先生一直乐于提供信息帮助记者们。

sentences.english: We called up three economists to ask how to eliminate the deficit and they obliged with very straightforward answers.
sentences.chinese: 我们致电3位经济学家咨询消除赤字的方法，他们满足了我们的要求，给出了非常直接的答复。

detailed_translations.english: To oblige someone means to be helpful to them by doing what they have asked you to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 迫使；施恩于，帮…的忙；使感激
detailed_translations.english: if you are obliged to do something, you have to do it because the situation, the law, a duty etc makes it necessary

name: offense
trans: He was put in jail for two days for the offense.

sentences.english: His solicitor said he committed the offence because he was heavily in debt.
sentences.chinese: 他的律师说他犯罪是因为欠下巨债。

sentences.english: Don’t be upset by what he said; he meant no offence (= did not intend to offend anyone ).
sentences.chinese: 不要为他的话而生气，他并没有冒犯谁的意思。

detailed_translations.english: an illegal action or a crime

name: proclaim
trans: The army general proclaimed that the war was won.

sentences.english: The President proclaimed the republic’s independence.
sentences.chinese: 总统宣布共和国独立。

detailed_translations.chinese: 宣告，公布；声明；表明；赞扬
detailed_translations.english: to say publicly or officially that something important is true or exists

name: rally
trans: The school had a rally in the gym to support the basketball team.

sentences.english: After a shaky start, he rallied and won the title in style.
sentences.chinese: 虽然开局不顺，但他振作精神，最后漂亮地赢得了冠军。

sentences.english: The Tokyo stock market rallied later in the day.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚些时候东京股市止跌回升。

detailed_translations.chinese: 团结；重整；恢复；（网球等）连续对打
detailed_translations.english: to become stronger again after a period of weakness or defeat
a large public meeting, especially one that is held outdoors to support a political idea, protest etc

name: resolve
trans: She resolved the problem with her children by giving them both a toy.

sentences.english: Barnet was desperate for money to resolve his financial problems.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼特急需钱来解决他的经济问题。

sentences.english: After the divorce she resolved never to marry again.
sentences.chinese: 离婚以后，她决心永不再嫁。

sentences.english: Recent events strengthened her resolve to find out the truth.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件坚定了她找出真相的决心。

detailed_translations.english: to find a satisfactory way of dealing with a problem or difficulty
strong determination to succeed in doing something

name: resource
trans: The poor man didn’t have the resources to feed himself.

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: sentence
trans: The sentence for stealing a car is much worse than for stealing candy.

sentences.english: She received an eight-year prison sentence.
sentences.chinese: 她被判八年徒刑。

sentences.english: He has just begun a life sentence for murder.
sentences.chinese: 他犯了谋杀罪，刚开始服无期徒刑。

sentences.english: Sanchez was sentenced to three years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 桑切斯被判了三年监禁。

detailed_translations.english: a punishment that a judge gives to someone who is guilty of a crime
if a judge sentences someone who is guilty of a crime, they give them a punishment

name: volunteer
trans: Many people volunteered to help the adults learn to read.

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

name: witness
trans: The woman was the only witness of the horrible crime.

sentences.english: Police have appealed for witnesses to come forward.
sentences.chinese: 警方呼吁目击者站出来。

sentences.english: an eye witness (= someone who sees an event ) to the robbery
sentences.chinese: 抢劫案的一名目击者

detailed_translations.english: someone who sees a crime or an accident and can describe what happened

detailed_translations.chinese: 目击； 为…作证， 证明
detailed_translations.english: used to introduce an example that proves something you have just mentioned

name: access
trans: The manager was the only person with access to the password.

sentences.english: Access is by means of a small door on the right.
sentences.chinese: 入口是右边的一扇小门。

detailed_translations.chinese: 接近；通道，入口；接近的机会
detailed_translations.english: the way you use to enter a building or reach a place
to find information, especially on a computer

name: conduct
trans: She was punished for her bad conduct.

sentences.english: The Senator’s conduct is being investigated by the Ethics Committee.
sentences.chinese: 该参议员的行为正受到道德委员会的调查。

sentences.english: an inquiry into the conduct of the police
sentences.chinese: 对警方行为的调查

sentences.english: his arrest for disorderly conduct
sentences.chinese: 他因妨害治安行为而遭逮捕

detailed_translations.chinese: 举止， 行为； 指导； 管理； 实施
detailed_translations.english: the way someone behaves, especially in public, in their job etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 进行； 管理， 指挥， 引导； 传输， 传导
detailed_translations.english: to stand in front of a group of musicians or singers and direct their playing or singing

name: constant
trans: The television at home is in constant use.

sentences.english: There was a constant stream of visitors to the house.
sentences.chinese: 参观这幢房子的游客川流不息。

sentences.english: Amy lived in constant fear of being attacked.
sentences.chinese: 埃米一直生活在害怕遭到袭击的恐惧之中。

sentences.english: He kept in constant contact with his family while he was in Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他在澳大利亚时一直和家人保持着联系。

sentences.english: travelling at a constant speed
sentences.chinese: 以恒定速度行驶

detailed_translations.english: happening regularly or all the time

name: crack
trans: The old window was covered with cracks.

sentences.english: Don’t put boiling water in the glass or it will crack.
sentences.chinese: 不要把沸水倒进这个玻璃杯里，否则它会破裂的。

sentences.english: Concrete is liable to crack in very cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 在严寒的天气条件下混凝土可能会开裂。

sentences.english: He picked up a piece of rock and cracked it in half.
sentences.chinese: 他捡起一块石头，把它击碎成两半。

sentences.english: She fell and cracked a bone in her leg.
sentences.chinese: 她摔了一跤，结果一根腿骨骨折。

sentences.english: He cracked a couple of eggs into a pan.
sentences.chinese: 他往平底锅里打了几个鸡蛋。

detailed_translations.english: to break or to make something break, either so that it gets lines on its surface, or so that it breaks into pieces
a very narrow space between two things or two parts of something

name: device
trans: A thermometer is a device that tells temperature.

sentences.english: modern labour-saving devices
sentences.chinese: 省力的现代设备

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械， 装置； 设计； 手段， 策略
detailed_translations.english: a machine or tool that does a special job

name: enclose
trans: The cows in the field were enclosed by a fence.

sentences.english: Please enclose a cheque with your order.
sentences.chinese: 请随订单附上支票。

sentences.english: The pool area is enclosed by a six-foot wall.
sentences.chinese: 游泳区用六英尺高的高墙围了起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put something inside an envelope as well as a letter

name: grip
trans: I was scared, so I gripped my older sister’s hand.

sentences.english: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.chinese: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.english: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.chinese: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.english: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.english: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 他放开手往后退去。

detailed_translations.english: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

name: halt
trans: The criminal halted when he saw the police coming.

sentences.english: Heavy snowfalls brought traffic to a halt (= made it stop moving ).
sentences.chinese: 大雪使得交通陷于停顿。

sentences.english: The World Championship was brought to a temporary halt (= was stopped from continuing ).
sentences.chinese: 世界锦标赛暂停举行。

sentences.english: The President has called for a halt to the wave of emigration.
sentences.chinese: 总统呼吁遏制移民国外的热潮。

detailed_translations.english: a stop or pause
to prevent someone or something from continuing - used especially in news reports

name: impending
trans: The student was nervous about her impending test.

sentences.english: On the morning of the expedition, I awoke with a feeling of impending disaster.
sentences.chinese: 远征出发的那天早上，我醒来就有一种大难临头的感觉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 即将发生的；迫切的；悬挂的
detailed_translations.english: an impending event or situation, especially an unpleasant one, is going to happen very soon

name: influence
trans: My friend influenced my decision to attend Terrance University.

sentences.english: He used his influence to get his son into medical school.
sentences.chinese: 他利用权势把儿子弄进了医学院。

sentences.english: He denies exerting any political influence over them.
sentences.chinese: 他否认曾向他们施加过政治影响。

detailed_translations.english: the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want

name: law
trans: The students learned about different laws during social studies class.

sentences.english: Elected officials ought to obey the law.
sentences.chinese: 民选官员理应遵守法律。

sentences.english: laws passed by Parliament
sentences.chinese: 议会通过的法律

detailed_translations.english: the whole system of rules that people in a particular country or area must obey

name: mode
trans: Melissa turned the TV to quiet mode while she talked on the phone.

sentences.english: the most efficient mode of transport
sentences.chinese: 最高效的运输方式

sentences.english: Set the monitor to 256 colour mode.
sentences.chinese: 把显示器调成256色彩模式。

detailed_translations.english: a particular way or style of behaving, living or doing something

name: perspire
trans: I usually perspire a lot when I am at athletics practice.

sentences.english: Willie was perspiring heavily .
sentences.chinese: 威利大汗淋漓。

detailed_translations.english: if you perspire, parts of your body become wet, especially because you are hot or have been doing hard work

name: replace
trans: I replaced the tire on my car because it was flat.

sentences.english: I’m replacing Sue on the team.
sentences.chinese: 我将接替队里的休。

sentences.english: Lectures have replaced the old tutorial system.
sentences.chinese: 课堂授课取代了旧式的导师制。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something instead of another person, or start being used instead of another thing

name: snap
trans: I took the drumstick and snapped it with my hands.

sentences.english: A twig snapped under my feet.
sentences.chinese: 一根细枝在我脚下嚓一声断开了。

sentences.english: The wind snapped branches and power lines.
sentences.chinese: 大风刮断了树枝和输电线。

detailed_translations.chinese: 咔嚓折断， 啪地绷断； 猛咬； 猛然断裂 <；吧嗒一声；厉声说话， 怒声责骂
detailed_translations.english: to break with a sudden sharp noise, or to make something do this
a judgment or decision made quickly, without careful thought or discussion
to take a photograph
a sudden loud sound, especially made by something breaking or closing

name: sly
trans: The sly fox stole the eggs from the nest.

sentences.english: He leaned forward with a sly smile.
sentences.chinese: 他俯身向前诡秘地一笑。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is sly cleverly deceives people in order to get what they want

name: tend
trans: My mom tends to buy me the perfect gift each Christmas.

sentences.english: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照管， 照料， 护理
detailed_translations.english: to look after someone or something
if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again

name: valid
trans: The expert’s opinion on the subject was more valid than others.

sentences.english: a valid credit card
sentences.chinese: 有效信用卡

sentences.english: Your return ticket is valid for three months.
sentences.chinese: 你的往返票有效期为三个月。

sentences.english: Police officers must have a valid reason for stopping motorists.
sentences.chinese: 警察拦下驾车者必须有正当理由。

detailed_translations.english: that is legally or officially acceptable

name: version
trans: She read the students British version of the Chinese fairy tale.

sentences.english: Is the coffee break the adult version of recess?
sentences.chinese: 工间喝咖啡是成人的休息方式吗？

detailed_translations.english: a way of explaining or doing something that is typical of a particular group or period of time

name: whatsoever
trans: The boy had no idea whatsoever how to finish the story.

sentences.english: But there should be no Christmas for me, I knew, no gifts, no remembrance whatsoever.
sentences.chinese: 但我知道，对我来说，将没有圣诞节可言，没有礼物，没有怀念，什么都没有。

name: alongside
trans: We work alongside each other in the office.

sentences.english: A car drew up alongside .
sentences.chinese: 一辆车在旁边停了下来。

sentences.english: Children’s prices are shown alongside adult prices.
sentences.chinese: 儿童票价标在成人票价旁边。

detailed_translations.english: next to the side of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 在…旁边， 沿着…的边； 和…在一起

name: appetite
trans: Tom has a big appetite. He eats all the time.

sentences.english: Her husband always had a huge appetite.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫向来胃口极大。

sentences.english: Symptoms include tiredness and loss of appetite.
sentences.chinese: 症状包括疲倦和食欲不振。

detailed_translations.english: a desire for food

name: assist
trans: Andrew assisted me with my homework.

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

sentences.english: The family decided to assist me with my chores.
sentences.chinese: 家人决定分担我的琐事。

detailed_translations.english: to help someone to do something
If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them

name: breeze
trans: The breeze caused the leaves to fall off the tree.

sentences.english: flowers waving in the breeze
sentences.chinese: 在微风中摇曳的花儿

detailed_translations.chinese: 微风；轻而易举的事；煤屑；焦炭渣；小风波
detailed_translations.english: a gentle wind

name: defy
trans: The students got into trouble for defying their teacher’s rules.

sentences.english: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother.
sentences.chinese: 这是我第一次（也是最后一次）胆敢违抗我母亲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 藐视；公然反抗；挑衅；使落空
detailed_translations.english: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way

name: display
trans: The museum displayed many wonderful paintings.

sentences.english: a dazzling display (= very good display ) of flowers
sentences.chinese: 令人目眩神迷的花卉展

sentences.english: The window display caught her eye.
sentences.chinese: 橱窗陈列吸引了她的目光。

sentences.english: shop windows displaying the latest fashions
sentences.chinese: 展示最新时装的商店橱窗

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement of things for people to look at or buy
to show something to people, or put it in a place where people can see it easily

name: efficient
trans: My car is very efficient. I rarely have to buy gas.

sentences.english: a very efficient secretary
sentences.chinese: 效率高的秘书

sentences.english: an efficient use of land
sentences.chinese: 土地的有效使用

sentences.english: Lighting is now more energy efficient.
sentences.chinese: 如今的照明设备更加节能。

detailed_translations.english: if someone or something is efficient, they work well without wasting time, money, or energy

name: feeble
trans: The boy was too feeble to carry the object very far.

sentences.english: His voice sounded feeble and far away.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音听上去既无力又遥远。

sentences.english: She was too feeble to leave her room.
sentences.chinese: 她身体虚弱，无法走出自己的房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 虚弱的， 衰弱的， 无力的； 无效的， 无益的
detailed_translations.english: extremely weak

name: forgive
trans: Sandra forgave Peter after he said he was sorry.

sentences.english: He didn’t look the sort of man to forgive and forget (= forgive someone and no longer think about it ) .
sentences.chinese: 他看上去不是那种不记仇的人。

detailed_translations.english: to stop being angry with someone and stop blaming them, although they have done something wrong

name: lively
trans: Jennifer is very lively: she’s always running and playing.

sentences.english: a lively child
sentences.chinese: 精力充沛的孩子

detailed_translations.chinese: 活泼的；生动的；真实的；生气勃勃的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is lively has a lot of energy and is very active

name: majestic
trans: The rich people lived in a big, majestic house.

sentences.english: This lovely village is surrounded by majestic mountain scenery.
sentences.chinese: 这座美丽的村庄四周山色壮丽。

detailed_translations.english: very big, impressive, or beautiful

name: nor
trans: I eat neither apples nor oranges. I don’t like either one.

sentences.english: He can neither read nor write (= he cannot read or write ).
sentences.chinese: 他既不会读也不会写。

sentences.english: Hilary was neither shocked nor surprised by the news.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里对这个消息既没有感到震惊，也没有觉得意外。

sentences.english: Neither Matt nor Julie said anything.
sentences.chinese: 马特和朱莉都没有说什么。

sentences.english: ‘I don’t want to go.’ ‘Nor do I.’
sentences.chinese: “我不想去。”“我也不想去。”

detailed_translations.english: used when mentioning two things that are not true or do not happen

name: outraged
trans: My father was outraged when he saw that I had crashed his car.

sentences.english: Every few months, I receive an e-mail from an outraged (usually white) reader who is dismayed by what she sees as the denigration of my work.
sentences.chinese: 每隔几个月，我便会收到一封来自愤怒读者（通常是白人）的电子邮件，对于她认为我的作品遭到的诋毁感到愤忾。

sentences.english: And outraged, nauseous, flabbergasted ... I wish I could say I can't imagine what they were thinking, but in fact I do have a guess.
sentences.chinese: 我感到受了伤害，并且愤怒、恶心、震惊······ 我但愿自己能说无法想像出他们的想法，但事实上我有一个猜想。

sentences.english: Greeks have turned out in droves to a series of nationwide protests against the economy and austerity measures, outraged that they are being asked to make more sacrifices.
sentences.chinese: 希腊人举行了一系列针对经济状况和紧缩措施的大规模抗议，他们对政府要求自己做出更多牺牲感到愤怒。

name: pessimistic
trans: John is pessimistic. He always thinks something bad will happen.

sentences.english: a pessimistic view of life
sentences.chinese: 对人生的悲观看法

detailed_translations.english: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

name: relationship
trans: The teacher was proud of her good relationship with the students.

sentences.english: I have quite a good relationship with my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我和父母关系很好。

sentences.english: the relationship between diet and health problems
sentences.chinese: 膳食与健康问题之间的联系

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people or two groups feel about each other and behave towards each other

name: slap
trans: Out of anger, Helen slapped Eunice on the face.

sentences.english: Sarah slapped Aaron across the face.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉在阿龙的脸上掴了一巴掌。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拍击；侮辱；掌击；掴…的耳光
detailed_translations.english: to hit a surface with a lot of force, making a loud sharp sound
a quick hit with the flat part of your hand

name: smash
trans: Jacob smashed the window with a rock.

sentences.english: Vandals had smashed all the windows.
sentences.chinese: 破坏分子打碎了所有的窗子。

sentences.english: Firemen had to smash the lock to get in.
sentences.chinese: 消防员不得不砸锁而入。

sentences.english: Several cups fell to the floor and smashed to pieces .
sentences.chinese: 有几个杯子掉到地上摔得粉碎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 粉碎，打烂；狠打，猛击；破灭，失败；猛撞，猛冲
detailed_translations.english: to break into pieces violently or noisily, or to make something do this by dropping, throwing, or hitting it

detailed_translations.chinese: 破碎 ； 猛击， 猛撞； 轰动的演出， 巨大的成功
detailed_translations.english: the loud sound of something breaking

name: successful
trans: My father is a successful businessman.

sentences.english: The operation was successful.
sentences.chinese: 手术成功了。

sentences.english: a highly successful (= very successful ) meeting
sentences.chinese: 十分成功的会议

detailed_translations.english: achieving what you wanted, or having the effect or result you intended

name: wage
trans: The wages I receive from my job are really great!

sentences.english: The police are waging war on drug pushers in the city.
sentences.chinese: 警方正在市内开展一场打击毒贩的斗争。

detailed_translations.english: to be involved in a war against someone, or a fight against something

name: whereas
trans: My sister loves horror movies, whereas I prefer comedies.

sentences.english: The old system was fairly complicated whereas the new system is really very simple.
sentences.chinese: 旧系统相当复杂，而新系统却很简单。

sentences.english: Whereas the city spent over $1 billion on its museums and stadium, it failed to look after its schools.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市花了十亿美元建造博物馆和体育馆，但是却忽略了对学校的建设。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that although something is true of one thing, it is not true of another

name: animate
trans: Rocks and machines are not animate things.

sentences.english: Laughter animated his face for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 笑容使他的脸上一时增添了生气。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使有生气；使活泼；鼓舞；推动
detailed_translations.english: to give life or energy to something
living

name: classify
trans: The biologist classified the plant as a completely new species.

sentences.english: We’d classify Drabble’s novels under ‘Romance’.
sentences.chinese: 我们把德拉布尔的小说归类为“言情小说”。

sentences.english: Families are classified according to the father’s occupation.
sentences.chinese: 各个家庭按父亲的职业分类。

detailed_translations.english: to decide what group something belongs to

name: concede
trans: The student conceded that he had cheated on the test.

sentences.english: ‘That’s the only possible solution.’ ‘Yes, I suppose so,’ Charles conceded.
sentences.chinese: “那是唯一可行的解决办法。”“对，我想是。”查尔斯承认道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 承认， 承认…为真； 承认失败； 允许， 让予； 让步， 认输
detailed_translations.english: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

name: concept
trans: I learned some concepts about molecules before working in the science lab.

sentences.english: a new concept in business travel
sentences.chinese: 商务旅行的新理念

sentences.english: our basic concepts of decent human behaviour
sentences.chinese: 我们对得体的人类行为的基本观念

sentences.english: It’s very simple, once you grasp the concept .
sentences.chinese: 你一旦掌握了这个概念之后就很简单了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 概念， 观念； 设想
detailed_translations.english: an idea of how something is, or how something should be done

name: construct
trans: The men used wood and metal to construct a house.

sentences.english: There are plans to construct a new road bridge across the river.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要建造一条新的跨河公路桥。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a house, bridge, road etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 建筑物； 构想； 观念
detailed_translations.english: an idea formed by combining several pieces of information or knowledge

name: decade
trans: She celebrated her three decades of work with the company.

sentences.english: ...the last decade of the nineteenth century.
sentences.chinese: …19世纪的最后10年。

detailed_translations.english: a period of 10 years

name: diagram
trans: By following the diagram, I was able to put the desk together.

sentences.english: This diagram will illustrate what I mean.
sentences.chinese: 这个图表可说明我的意思。

sentences.english: This is a simpler diagram than the one I just showed you but the principles are the same.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个比我刚展示的还要更简单的图解，但是原理是一样的。

sentences.english: A table or diagram containing the name and address range of each peripheral addressable by the processor within the memory space.
sentences.chinese: 一个在内存空间中的，包含每个外设的名字和可由处理器设置的地址范围的表格或图表。

detailed_translations.english: to show or represent something in a diagram

detailed_translations.chinese: 图解， 简图， 图表
detailed_translations.english: a simple drawing or plan that shows exactly where something is, what something looks like, or how something works

name: ferry
trans: The ferry took the people across the lake.

sentences.english: They had recrossed the River Gambia by ferry.
sentences.chinese: 他们乘船又一次渡过了冈比亚河。

sentences.english: The ship was used to ferry supplies to Russia during the war.
sentences.chinese: 这艘船在战时被用来往俄罗斯 运送补给。

detailed_translations.english: a boat that carries people or goods across a river or a narrow area of water
to carry people or things a short distance from one place to another in a boat or other vehicle

name: handy
trans: An eraser is handy if you make a lot of mistakes.

sentences.english: It’s quite a handy little tool.
sentences.chinese: 这件小工具非常有用。

sentences.english: It’s very handy having a light above your desk.
sentences.chinese: 书桌上方有盏灯很有用。

sentences.english: Take your swimming trunks with you – they might come in handy (= be useful ).
sentences.chinese: 带上你的游泳裤，可能会派上用场的。

detailed_translations.english: useful

name: isolate
trans: The teacher isolated the bad child from the class before talking with her.

sentences.english: The town was isolated by the floods.
sentences.chinese: 洪水使该镇与外界隔绝。

sentences.english: The US has sought to isolate Cuba both economically and politically.
sentences.chinese: 美国一直想在经济和政治上孤立古巴。

detailed_translations.english: to separate one person, group, or thing from other people or things

name: longing
trans: Since he skipped breakfast, he had a longing for food all morning.

sentences.english: She looked back with longing on the good old days.
sentences.chinese: 她回首往事，怀念着过去的美好时光。

sentences.english: He gave a longing look at the ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 他看了看那冰激凌，显出很想吃的样子。

detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of wanting something or someone
feeling or showing that you want sth very much

name: numerous
trans: It was hard to drive fast since there were numerous holes in the road.

sentences.english: Numerous attempts have been made to hide the truth.
sentences.chinese: 为掩盖事实作了很多尝试。

sentences.english: The two leaders have worked together on numerous occasions.
sentences.chinese: 那两位领导人已经多次合作。

detailed_translations.english: many

name: particle
trans: The bottles of wine were covered in a layer of dust particles.

sentences.english: dust particles
sentences.chinese: 尘埃

sentences.english: the sub-atomic particles that make up matter
sentences.chinese: 构成物质的次原子微粒

detailed_translations.english: a very small piece of something

name: plea
trans: The poor, hungry man made a plea for food.

sentences.english: Caldwell made a plea for donations.
sentences.chinese: 考德威尔恳求捐款。

detailed_translations.english: a request that is urgent or full of emotion

name: refrain
trans: The doctor asked Mary to refrain from eating fast food as part of her diet.

sentences.english: Mrs. Hardie refrained from making any comment.
sentences.chinese: 哈迪太太忍住了没做任何评论。

detailed_translations.english: to not do something that you want to do
part of a song or poem that is repeated, especially at the end of each  verse

name: review
trans: The government ordered a careful review of the economic situation.

sentences.english: The government will review the situation later in the year.
sentences.chinese: 政府将在今年晚些时候对形势重新加以研究。

sentences.english: The decision will be reviewed by the Supreme Court.
sentences.chinese: 这个判决将由最高法院复核。

sentences.english: The team manager’s position will be reviewed at the end of the season.
sentences.chinese: 球队主教练的人选将在赛季末重新考虑。

sentences.english: If you have to cover 12 chapters in American history, begin by planning on three two-hour reviews with four chapters per session.
sentences.chinese: 如果你必须涵盖美国史的12个章节，首先计划3次2小时的复习，每次4章。

detailed_translations.english: to carefully examine or consider sth again, especially so that you can decide if it is necessary to make changes
(North Amercian English) a lesson in which you look again at sth you have studied, especially in order to prepare for an exam

name: sophisticated
trans: Jake is one of the most sophisticated people I’ve ever met.

sentences.english: sophisticated software
sentences.chinese: 很先进的软件

sentences.english: a highly sophisticated weapons system
sentences.chinese: 非常精密的武器系统

detailed_translations.english: a sophisticated machine, system, method etc is very well designed and very advanced, and often works in a complicated way

name: surrender
trans: The thief surrendered the money to the police when he was caught.

sentences.english: Germany surrendered on May 7th, 1945.
sentences.chinese: 德国于 1945 年 5 月 7 日投降。

sentences.english: The terrorists were given ten minutes to surrender.
sentences.chinese: 恐怖分子被限定在十分钟之内投降。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that you want to stop fighting, because you realize that you cannot win
to give up something or someone, especially because you are forced to
when you say officially that you want to stop fighting because you realize that you cannot win

name: upright
trans: Meerkats can’t walk like humans, but they can stand upright.

sentences.english: Katie was still awake, sitting bolt upright(= sitting with her back very straight ) staring at the television.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂还醒着，坐得笔直，眼睛盯着电视。

detailed_translations.chinese: 正直的，诚实的；垂直的，直立的；笔直的；合乎正道的
detailed_translations.english: standing or sitting straight up
a long piece of wood or metal that stands straight up and supports something

name: worthwhile
trans: On his visit to Canada, he realized studying English was worthwhile.

sentences.english: He wanted to do a worthwhile job.
sentences.chinese: 他想做有意义的工作。

sentences.english: We decided to give the money to a worthwhile cause (= one that helps people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们决定把这笔钱投入到慈善事业中。

detailed_translations.english: if something is worthwhile, it is important or useful, or you gain something from it

name: alliance
trans: The junior executives formed an alliance with each other.
