sentences.english: independent organizations and alliances
sentences.chinese: 独立组织和联盟

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which two or more countries, groups etc agree to work together to try to change or achieve something

name: applause
trans: At the end of his speech, everyone burst into loud applause.

sentences.english: She got a round of applause (=  a short period of applause  ) when she finished.
sentences.chinese: 她结束的时候获得一阵掌声。

detailed_translations.english: the sound of many people hitting their hands together and shouting, to show that they have enjoyed something

name: armed
trans: The robber was armed with a gun.

name: authoritative
trans: This book is an authoritative source on ancient Egypt’s Queen Nefertiti.

sentences.english: the most authoritative work on English surnames
sentences.chinese: 有关英语姓氏的最权威著作

detailed_translations.english: an authoritative book, account etc is respected because the person who wrote it knows a lot about the subject

name: bravery
trans: The books commended the general’s bravery.

sentences.english: an act of great bravery
sentences.chinese: 非常勇敢的行为

detailed_translations.english: actions, behaviour, or an attitude that shows courage and confidence

name: ceremony
trans: Tom and Amy’s marriage ceremony is in June.

sentences.english: a wedding ceremony
sentences.chinese: 婚礼

sentences.english: the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games
sentences.chinese: 奥运会开幕式

sentences.english: The queen was crowned with due ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 女王按照规定的礼仪加冕。

detailed_translations.english: an important social or religious event, when a traditional set of actions is performed in a formal way

name: culture
trans: Ancient Mexican culture is renowned for its architecture.

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

name: defense
trans: The air force works in defense of its country.

sentences.english: Of course, we'll consult closely with our allies every step of the way, because the security and defense of our allies, both in Europe and Asia, is not negotiable.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我们将在前行道路上就每一步骤与我们的盟国密切磋商，因为我们欧洲和亚洲盟国的安全与防卫是不容讨价还价的。

name: detail
trans: Jane told Ben all the details of her trip to China.

sentences.english: This issue will be discussed in more detail in Chapter 5.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题将在第五章里作更为详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: a single feature, fact, or piece of information about something
to list things or give all the facts or information about something

name: diverse
trans: Big cities have diverse populations with people of different races and ages.

sentences.english: subjects as diverse as pop music and archaeology
sentences.chinese: 像流行音乐和考古学这样各不相同的学科

detailed_translations.english: very different from each other

name: enchant
trans: The beautiful woman enchanted everybody in the room.

sentences.english: ...Celtic stories of cauldrons and enchanted vessels.
sentences.chinese: …凯尔特人关于神锅和魔法器皿的故事。

detailed_translations.english: In fairy tales and legends, to enchant someone or something means to put a magic spell on them

name: equip
trans: Steve was equipped with the tools needed to do the job.

sentences.english: They try to equip their vehicles with gadgets to deal with every possible contingency.
sentences.chinese: 他们尽量给他们的车辆配备各种小装置以应付任何可能的突发状况。

detailed_translations.english: to provide a person or place with the things that are needed for a particular kind of activity or work

name: exception
trans: Most students thought the test was hard, but Tim was the exception.

sentences.english: It’s been cold, but today’s an exception.
sentences.chinese: 天气一直寒冷，但今天是个例外。

sentences.english: The law applies to all EU countries; Britain is no exception.
sentences.chinese: 这项法律适用于所有欧盟国家，英国也不例外。

sentences.english: We don’t usually accept checks, but for you we’ll make an exception (= not include you in this rule ).
sentences.chinese: 我们一般不接受支票，但对你我们就破个例。

sentences.english: The spelling of this word is an interesting exception to the rule.
sentences.chinese: 这个单词的拼法是该规则一个有趣的例外。

sentences.english: Successful two-career couples are still the exception, not the rule (= used to emphasize that something is unusual ).
sentences.chinese: 夫妇俩都事业有成的仍不常见。

detailed_translations.english: something or someone that is not included in a general statement or does not follow a rule or pattern

name: genre
trans: She is considered a master in the comedy genre.

sentences.english: a literary genre
sentences.chinese: 文学体裁

detailed_translations.chinese: 类型；种类；体裁；样式；流派；风俗画
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of art, writing, music etc, which has certain features that all examples of this type share

detailed_translations.chinese: 风俗画的；以日常情景为主题的

name: impact
trans: My grandmother had a great impact on my life.

sentences.english: Such schemes mean little unless they impact people.
sentences.chinese: 除非能对人们造成影响，否则这样的计划意义不大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 影响， 作用， 冲击
detailed_translations.english: to have an important or noticeable effect on someone or something
the effect or influence that an event, situation etc has on someone or something

name: lure
trans: The store lures people in with big signs that say “Sale!”

sentences.english: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.
sentences.chinese: 他把她诱骗到家里，然后用父亲的枪把她打死。

detailed_translations.english: to persuade someone to do something, especially something wrong or dangerous, by making it seem attractive or exciting

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸引力， 诱惑物； 诱饵， 鱼饵
detailed_translations.english: something that attracts people, or the quality of being able to do this

name: obstacle
trans: Climbing over the giant rock was the biggest obstacle for the hikers.

sentences.english: The tax puts obstacles in the way of companies trying to develop trade overseas.
sentences.chinese: 这项税收为想在海外发展贸易的公司设置了障碍。

sentences.english: Women still have to overcome many obstacles to gain equality.
sentences.chinese: 妇女要获得平等仍需克服重重障碍。

sentences.english: We want to remove all obstacles to travel between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要消除在这两个国家之间旅行的所有障碍。

sentences.english: the single biggest obstacle to a Conservative victory in the next election
sentences.chinese: 保守党在下一届大选中获胜的最大障碍

sentences.english: There are formidable obstacles on the road to peace.
sentences.chinese: 通往和平的道路上存在难以逾越的障碍。

detailed_translations.english: something that makes it difficult to achieve some­thing

name: shelter
trans: The frog took shelter from the storm in a nearby hold.

sentences.english: The men took shelter in a bombed-out farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 那些男人躲在一间被炸毁的农舍里。

sentences.english: All around me, people were running for shelter .
sentences.chinese: 我周围的人都在奔跑着寻找地方躲避。

sentences.english: ...a wooden house, sheltered by a low pointed roof.
sentences.chinese: …一座由低矮的尖屋顶遮蔽的木房子。

detailed_translations.english: protection from danger or from wind, rain, hot sun etc
If a place or thing is sheltered by something, it is protected by that thing from wind and rain

name: supply
trans: The water heater supplied the house with warm water.

sentences.english: The nation’s fuel supplies will not last forever.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家的燃料供应不会无穷无尽。

sentences.english: To protect the food supply , the government ordered the slaughter of affected cattle.
sentences.chinese: 为保护食品供应，政府下令宰杀被感染的牛。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of something that is available to be used

name: vain
trans: Rebecca is so vain that she looks at herself in every mirror.

sentences.english: Police searched in vain for the missing gunman.
sentences.chinese: 警方搜寻失踪的持枪歹徒，但毫无结果。

sentences.english: Men can be just as vain as women.
sentences.chinese: 男人有时会和女人一样虚荣。

detailed_translations.english: without success in spite of your efforts

name: alternative
trans: Her first plan to make extra money seemed weak, so she chose an alternative.

sentences.english: An alternative route is along the Via Unione.
sentences.chinese: 另一条路线是沿着联合路走。

detailed_translations.chinese: 两者选一的， 供选择的； 另类的
detailed_translations.english: an alternative idea, plan etc is different from the one you have and can be used instead

detailed_translations.chinese: 替换物，选择；选择的自由
detailed_translations.english: something you can choose to do or use instead of something else

name: avenue
trans: Drive down this avenue and then turn left to get to the park.

sentences.english: Fifth Avenue
sentences.chinese: 第五大街

sentences.english: Shaftesbury Avenue
sentences.chinese: 沙夫茨伯里街

sentences.english: a tree-lined avenue
sentences.chinese: 林荫道

detailed_translations.english: used in the names of streets in a town or city

name: belly
trans: His belly was full because he had eaten a lot of food.

sentences.english: She laid her hands on her swollen belly.
sentences.chinese: 她把手放在隆起的肚子上。

detailed_translations.english: the middle part of an animal’s body, near its stomach
to fill with air and become rounder in shape

name: bid
trans: He made a bid to become the university’s next president.

sentences.english: the person who places the highest bid
sentences.chinese: 出价最高的人

sentences.english: We’ve made a bid of nearly £400 million for the company.
sentences.chinese: 我们出价近四亿英镑收购那家公司。

sentences.english: A takeover bid for the airline was launched today.
sentences.chinese: 今天有人出价收购该航空公司。

sentences.english: She bid £100 for a Victorian chair.
sentences.chinese: 她出价100英镑买一把维多利亚时代的椅子。

sentences.english: The two men ended up bidding against each other at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 结果那两个人在拍卖会上较起劲来。

detailed_translations.english: an offer to pay a particular price for something, especially at an  auction
to offer to pay a particular price for goods, especially in an auction

name: blow
trans: The wind is blowing very hard today. We should stay inside.

sentences.english: A cold breeze was blowing hard.
sentences.chinese: 寒风劲吹。

sentences.english: It was blowing from an easterly direction.
sentences.chinese: 这是从东面吹过来的。

sentences.english: Outside, the weather was blowing a gale.
sentences.chinese: 外面狂风大作。

sentences.english: Her hair was blowing in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发在微风中飘扬。

sentences.english: The whistle blew for half time.
sentences.chinese: 哨声响起，上半场结束。

detailed_translations.english: if the wind or a current of air blows, it moves

name: conflict
trans: The two nations had a conflict over which one could use the water in the river.

sentences.english: the threat of industrial conflict in the coalfields
sentences.chinese: 煤田发生劳资纠纷的风险

sentences.english: Marx points out the potential conflicts below the surface of society.
sentences.chinese: 马克思指出了隐藏在社会表层之下的潜在矛盾。

sentences.english: His views on the literal truth of the Bible brought him into conflict with other Christian leaders.
sentences.chinese: 他坚持《圣经》字面真理的观点使他与其他的基督教领袖发生了冲突。

sentences.english: Doctors exercise considerable power and often come into conflict with politicians.
sentences.chinese: 医生行使很大的权力，常常和政客们发生冲突。

sentences.english: a lawyer specializing in conflict resolution
sentences.chinese: 专门解决纠纷的律师

detailed_translations.english: a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries etc

name: continent
trans: Asia is the largest continent.

sentences.english: the continents of Asia and Africa
sentences.chinese: 亚洲及非洲大陆

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of land surrounded by sea
able to control your sexual desires

name: current
trans: The ocean currents took the ship far off into the sea.

sentences.english: the current President
sentences.chinese: 现任总统

sentences.english: In its current state, the car is worth £1,000.
sentences.chinese: 这辆车按现在的车况来看值1,000英镑。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing now

name: disrespect
trans: He showed disrespect by arguing with his boss during a meeting.

sentences.english: Damien has always had a healthy disrespect (= that you think is good ) for media opinion.
sentences.chinese: 达米安对媒体的观点从来都持合理的不以为然的态度。

sentences.english: It was said on the spur of the moment and I meant no disrespect to anybody.
sentences.chinese: 我一时冲口而出，无意冒犯任何人。

sentences.english: No disrespect to Phil, but the team has performed better since he left (= used to show you are not criticizing someone ) .
sentences.chinese: 我无意对菲尔不敬，不过自从他离开后球队表现更好了。

detailed_translations.english: lack of respect for someone or something

name: enthusiasm
trans: The crowd showed their enthusiasm for the soccer team by cheering loudly.

sentences.english: Gillian and Darren greeted the speakers with great enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。

sentences.english: We went along to the local diving club, full of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 我们兴高采烈地去了当地的潜水俱乐部。

sentences.english: They go about their tasks with little enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 他们执行任务时没多大干劲。

sentences.english: A delay of two hours did not dampen their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 耽误了两小时没有减弱他们的热情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it

name: harsh
trans: The desert can be a very harsh environment.

sentences.english: The hostages are being held in harsh conditions.
sentences.chinese: 人质被拘押在恶劣环境中。

sentences.english: a young girl suddenly exposed to the harsh realities of life
sentences.chinese: 骤然暴露于残酷现实生活中的小女孩

detailed_translations.english: harsh conditions are difficult to live in and very uncomfortable

name: lean
trans: The woman leaned against the counter because she was tired.

sentences.english: They were leaning forward, facing each other.
sentences.chinese: 他们面对面身体前倾。

sentences.english: He was leaning on the bridge, watching the boats go by.
sentences.chinese: 他靠在桥上，看着船来船往。

detailed_translations.english: to move or bend your body in a particular direction

name: meantime
trans: Ted began setting the table. In the meantime, I began preparing the food.

sentences.english: My first novel was rejected by six publishers. In the meantime I had written a play.
sentences.chinese: 我的第一部小说遭到六家出版商的拒绝。其间我又完成了一部戏剧。

sentences.english: The doctor will be here soon. In the meantime, try and relax.
sentences.chinese: 医生很快就来，现在尽量放松一下。

sentences.english: I'll contact them soon. Meantime don't tell them I'm back.
sentences.chinese: 我会尽快和他们联系。在此期间，不要告诉他们我回来了。

detailed_translations.english: in the period of time between two times or two events
英文释义: meanwhile

name: mischief
trans: Ben was up to mischief when he persuaded Ken to paint his face.

sentences.english: Now run along, and don’t get into mischief .
sentences.chinese: 好了，走开，不要捣乱。

sentences.english: They’ve got enough toys to keep them out of mischief for a while.
sentences.chinese: 他们有足够的玩具玩，暂时不会捣蛋。

sentences.english: If you can’t see Nick, you can be sure he’s up to some mischief (= behaving badly and causing trouble or damage ) .
sentences.chinese: 要是看不到尼克，就可以肯定他又在捣什么鬼了。

detailed_translations.english: bad behaviour, especially by children, that causes trouble or damage, but no serious harm

name: muscle
trans: She went to the gym in order to make her muscles stronger.

sentences.english: Relax your stomach muscles , then stretch again.
sentences.chinese: 放松腹部肌肉，然后再绷紧。

sentences.english: Regular exercise will help to strengthen your muscles .
sentences.chinese: 经常锻炼有助于强健肌肉。

sentences.english: It took muscle to work in an old-fashioned kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 在老式厨房里干活很费力。

detailed_translations.english: one of the pieces of flesh inside your body that you use in order to move, and that connect your bones together

name: rescue
trans: The firefighter rescued the man from the burning building.

sentences.english: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
sentences.chinese: 空难的生还者被直升机救了出来。

sentences.english: a daring rescue at sea
sentences.chinese: 英勇的海上营救行动

detailed_translations.english: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
when someone or something is rescued from danger

name: succession
trans: The student said the letters of the alphabet in succession.

sentences.english: If the prince dies, the succession passes to his son.
sentences.chinese: 王子如果去世，就由他的儿子继承。

detailed_translations.english: the act of taking over an official job or position, or the right to be the next to take it

name: terrain
trans: The terrain below was rocky and full of hills.

sentences.english: rocky terrain
sentences.chinese: 多石的地形

detailed_translations.chinese: [地理] 地形，地势；领域；地带
detailed_translations.english: a particular type of land

name: timid
trans: The timid child hides behind her mother whenever she sees a stranger.

sentences.english: I was a timid child.
sentences.chinese: 我曾是个胆小的孩子。

sentences.english: a policy that is both timid and inadequate
sentences.chinese: 一项既无胆识又不完善的政策

detailed_translations.english: not having courage or confidence

name: violence
trans: The boy hit his brother in an act of violence.

sentences.english: There is too much sex and violence on TV these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今电视上性爱和暴力场面太多。

detailed_translations.english: behaviour that is intended to hurt other people physically

name: affect
trans: The student’s poor attitude affected the other students in the class.

sentences.english: the areas affected by the hurricane
sentences.chinese: 受飓风影响的地区

sentences.english: a disease that affects the central nervous system
sentences.chinese: 影响中枢神经系统的疾病

sentences.english: decisions which affect our lives
sentences.chinese: 影响我们生活的决定

sentences.english: Trading has been adversely affected by the downturn in consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 贸易受到消费支出回落的不利影响。

sentences.english: We were all deeply affected by her death.
sentences.chinese: 我们都为她的去世深感悲痛。

detailed_translations.english: to do something that produces an effect or change in something or in someone’s situation

name: autograph
trans: Everybody wanted the movie star’s autograph.

sentences.english: Can I have your autograph?
sentences.chinese: 我能请你签个名吗？

sentences.english: a player who would always sign autographs and chat with fans
sentences.chinese: 总是会亲笔签名并与球迷交谈的一名球员

detailed_translations.english: a famous person’s signature that they give to someone who admires them
if a famous person autographs a book, photograph etc, they sign it

name: bead
trans: Beads of water collected on the outside of the glass.

sentences.english: She wore a string of green glass beads around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她脖子上戴着一串绿色的玻璃珠子。

detailed_translations.english: one of a set of small, usually round, pieces of glass, wood, plastic etc, that you can put on a string and wear as jewellery

name: brew
trans: Please brew a fresh pot of coffee.

sentences.english: Every beer on the menu was brewed locally.
sentences.chinese: 酒单上的所有啤酒都是本地酿造的。

detailed_translations.english: to make beer
to make beer
a drink that is brewed, especially tea

name: charm
trans: Gail charmed everyone with her humorous stories.

sentences.english: Joe’s boyish charm
sentences.chinese: 乔身上的稚趣

sentences.english: She turned on the charm (= used her charm ) to all the men.
sentences.chinese: 她对所有那些男人都施展魅力。

sentences.english: The room had no windows and all the charm of a prison cell (= used to say that something has no charm ) .
sentences.chinese: 这房间没有窗，简直就是牢房。

detailed_translations.english: a special quality someone or something has that makes people like them, feel attracted to them, or be easily influenced by them – used to show approval

name: destiny
trans: It was his destiny to become a great singer.

sentences.english: Nancy wondered whether it was her destiny to live in England and marry Melvyn.
sentences.chinese: 南希想知道她生活在英格兰又嫁给梅尔文是不是命运的安排。

sentences.english: We are masters of our own destiny.
sentences.chinese: 我们是自己命运的主人。

detailed_translations.english: the things that will happen to someone in the future, especially those that cannot be changed or controlled

name: equipment
trans: The factory produces a wide range of high-tech equipment.

sentences.english: a shop selling camping equipment
sentences.chinese: 出售露营装备的商店

sentences.english: some brand new computer equipment
sentences.chinese: 一些全新的计算机设备

sentences.english: a very useful piece of equipment
sentences.chinese: 一件非常有用的设备

sentences.english: A lot of money was spent on the equipment of the new hospital.
sentences.chinese: 新医院的装备花费巨大。

detailed_translations.english: the tools, machines etc that you need to do a particular job or activity

name: horn
trans: The boy honked his horn as he rode his bicycle past the house.

sentences.english: A mature cow has horns.
sentences.chinese: 成年母牛头上长有角。

detailed_translations.english: a container in the shape of an animal’s horn, used in the past for drinking from, carrying  gunpowder  etc

name: irritable
trans: She is irritable when she doesn’t get enough sleep.

sentences.english: Jo was tired, irritable, and depressed.
sentences.chinese: 乔疲惫暴躁，而且情绪低落。

detailed_translations.english: getting annoyed quickly or easily

name: lag
trans: The girl on rollerblades lagged behind the little girl on the bicycle.

sentences.english: In this scenario, due to the lag time required to assimilate new resources, the relationship between required resources and estimated delivery timeframe may even turn negative.
sentences.chinese: 在这种情况下，由于时间已经落后，需要吸收新的人力资源，需要的资源和预计的交付时间的关系甚至更加复杂。

sentences.english: But to many, at least as far as science is concerned, it is the countries that were doing well that are now doing better, whereas those at the bottom continue to lag significantly behind.
sentences.chinese: 但是对于许多人而言，至少在科学方面，正是那些在过去做的很好的国家现在正在做的更好，而那些位于底层的国家的科学继续落后。

sentences.english: One is that some countries still lag behind.
sentences.chinese: 一个原因是一些国家仍很落后。

name: nightmare
trans: The girl was scared to go back to sleep because she had had a nightmare.

sentences.english: a recurring nightmare
sentences.chinese: 一再出现的噩梦

detailed_translations.english: a very frightening dream

name: nutritious
trans: Mangoes are one of the most nutritious fruits in the world.

sentences.english: Wholemeal bread is more nutritious than white bread.
sentences.chinese: 全麦面包比白面包更有营养。

sentences.english: Nuts and fruit make nutritious snacks.
sentences.chinese: 坚果和水果是有营养价值的零食。

sentences.english: The cookbook contains many simple yet highly nutritious meals.
sentences.chinese: 那本烹饪书里有许多简单却营养价值很高的食谱。

detailed_translations.english: food that is nutritious is full of the natural substances that your body needs to stay healthy or to grow properly

name: protein
trans: Fish and beef are good sources of protein.

sentences.english: Where do you get your protein?
sentences.chinese: 你从哪里获得蛋白质？

sentences.english: Dairy source of protein and calcium.
sentences.chinese: 奶牛的蛋白质来源和钙。

sentences.english: So, what happens, this is another view of a sodium channel, so this is actually looking a little bit more at the protein structure .
sentences.chinese: 那么，这里发生了什么，这是钠离子通道的另一张图片，在这种蛋白质结构中，它看起来更复杂一点。

detailed_translations.english: one of several natural substances that exist in food such as meat, eggs, and beans, and which your body needs in order to grow and remain strong and healthy

name: signature
trans: I put my signature at the end of the letter.

sentences.english: Her signature is totally illegible (= cannot be read ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的签字完全无法辨认。

sentences.english: The school collected 4,000 signatures for the petition.
sentences.chinese: 学校为这份请愿书收集到了四千个签名。

sentences.english: The Ukrainians put their signatures to the Lisbon Protocol.
sentences.chinese: 乌克兰签署了《里斯本协议》。

sentences.english: Someone’s forged my signature (= made an illegal copy of my name to deceive people ) on this letter.
sentences.chinese: 有人在这封信中伪造了我的签名。

sentences.english: Each child must obtain the signature of his or her parents.
sentences.chinese: 每个小孩都必须得到父母的签字。

detailed_translations.english: your name written in the way you usually write it, for example at the end of a letter, or on a cheque etc, to show that you have written it

name: stuff
trans: We gave a lot of stuff to the charity.

sentences.english: I’ve got some sticky stuff on my shoe.
sentences.chinese: 我鞋子上有什么黏糊糊的东西。

sentences.english: How do you think you’re going to fit all that stuff into the car?
sentences.chinese: 你说这么多东西你怎么装进车里？

sentences.english: I felt sorry for the ones who had to eat the awful stuff.
sentences.chinese: 我很同情那些只能吃这种难吃东西的人。

sentences.english: Where’s all the camping stuff?
sentences.chinese: 野营用的东西都在哪儿？

detailed_translations.english: used when you are talking about things such as substances, materials, or groups of objects when you do not know what they are called, or it is not important to say exactly what they are

name: subconscious
trans: Breathing is one of the subconscious things that the body does.

sentences.english: a subconscious fear of failure
sentences.chinese: 对失败下意识的恐惧

detailed_translations.english: subconscious feelings, desires etc are hidden in your mind and affect your behaviour, but you do not know that you have them

name: van
trans: The delivery company uses large vans to deliver packages.

sentences.english: a delivery van
sentences.chinese: 运货车

sentences.english: a van driver
sentences.chinese: 小型货车司机

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle used especially for carrying goods, which is smaller than a truck and has a roof and usually no windows at the sides

name: warn
trans: The lifeguard warned people to stay away from the rough ocean.

sentences.english: ‘Be careful, the rocks are slippery,’ Alex warned.
sentences.chinese: “小心，岩石很滑。”亚历克斯提醒说。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it

name: workout
trans: She doesn’t do her workout on the weekends.

name: zoom
trans: The cars zoomed along the road.

detailed_translations.chinese: 急速上升；嗡嗡声；[摄] 变焦摄影
detailed_translations.english: a sound made by a vehicle that is travelling fast

name: brick
trans: There were several bricks scattered on the ground.

sentences.english: a brick wall
sentences.chinese: 砖墙

sentences.english: a house made of brick
sentences.chinese: 砖房

sentences.english: Protesters attacked the police with stones and bricks.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者用石头和砖块袭击警察。

detailed_translations.english: a hard block of baked clay used for building walls, houses etc

name: crumble
trans: The old house’s walls crumbled into a pile of rock and wood.

sentences.english: The fall leaves crumbled in my fingers.
sentences.chinese: 秋叶在我指间碎裂了。

sentences.english: 1/4 cup crumbled goat’s cheese
sentences.chinese: 四分之一杯山羊奶酪碎

detailed_translations.english: to break apart into lots of little pieces, or make something do this

name: dough
trans: I made heart-shaped cookies from the dough.

sentences.english: Add some raisins to the dough.
sentences.chinese: 在生面团中加一些葡萄干。

sentences.english: A baker is kneading a dough.
sentences.chinese: 一位面包师正在揉面团。

sentences.english: She patted the dough into a flat cake.
sentences.chinese: 她把面团轻轻拍成扁饼。

detailed_translations.english: a mixture of flour and water ready to be baked into bread,  pastry  etc

name: express
trans: The nurse expressed her sympathy for the sick patient.

sentences.english: Parents have expressed their concerns about their children’s safety.
sentences.chinese: 父母对自己孩子的安全表示忧虑。

sentences.english: She expressed an interest in seeing York.
sentences.chinese: 她表示有兴趣见见约克。

sentences.english: Many people have expressed their opposition to the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 许多人反对这些提议。

sentences.english: He first learnt to express himself through movement at his dance classes.
sentences.chinese: 他最初是在舞蹈班学会通过动作表达情感的。

sentences.english: Words can’t express (= it is impossible to describe ) how angry we felt.
sentences.chinese: 我们的愤怒无以言表。

sentences.english: London–Gatwick Express/Orient Express (=a fast train or bus which does a particular journey regularly)
sentences.chinese: 伦敦﹣盖特威克快车/东方快车

sentences.english: Send these books by express.
sentences.chinese: 把这些书用快递寄出去。

detailed_translations.english: to tell or show what you are feeling or thinking by using words, looks, or actions
a train or bus that does not stop in many places and therefore travels quickly

name: fist
trans: The bully made a fist and threatened to hit the small boy.

sentences.english: She held the money tightly in her fist.
sentences.chinese: 她把钱紧紧地攥在手中。

sentences.english: Malcolm clenched his fist (= held his fist very tightly closed ) angrily.
sentences.chinese: 马尔科姆愤怒地握紧拳头。

sentences.english: Dooley stood up and shook his fist in her face.
sentences.chinese: 杜利站起身，在她眼前挥舞着拳头。

sentences.english: Varney slammed his fist down onto the table so hard the dishes jumped.
sentences.chinese: 瓦尼一拳砸在桌子上，盘子都给震了起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拳，拳头；〈口〉笔迹；掌握；[印]指标参见号
detailed_translations.english: the hand when it is tightly closed, so that the fingers are curled in towards the  palm  . People close their hand in a fist when they are angry or are going to hit someone.

name: flexible
trans: The tree branch was so flexible it could be bent into a circle and not break.

sentences.english: We can be flexible about your starting date.
sentences.chinese: 你具体从哪天开始，我们可以灵活一点。

sentences.english: The government needs a more flexible approach to education.
sentences.chinese: 政府在处理教育问题上需要更加灵活。

detailed_translations.english: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

name: flush
trans: After the long race, the runner’s face was flushed.

sentences.english: Susan flushed deeply and looked away.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊脸涨得通红，目光转向别处。

sentences.english: He flushed angrily .
sentences.chinese: 他气得满脸通红。

detailed_translations.english: to become red in the face, for example when you are angry or embarrassed
if two surfaces are flush, they are at exactly the same level, so that the place where they meet is flat

name: injure
trans: The car crash injured two people.

sentences.english: Angus injured his leg playing rugby.
sentences.chinese: 安格斯在打橄榄球时弄伤了腿。

detailed_translations.english: to hurt yourself or someone else, for example in an accident or an attack

name: lump
trans: The artist took a lump of clay and turned it into a beautiful pot.

sentences.english: You are the one with a lump.
sentences.chinese: 你是那个有了肿块的人。

sentences.english: One day, I noticed a lump in her skin.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，我注意到她皮肤上有个肿块。

sentences.english: Then the lump or cancer attaches itself to this wall.
sentences.chinese: 然后肿块或癌就附着在那钙壁上。

detailed_translations.english: to collect into a mass or group
a small piece of something solid, without a particular shape
to put two or more different people or things together and consider them as a single group, sometimes wrongly

name: mixture
trans: The walls were built using a mixture of water, rock, and dirt.

sentences.english: The town is a mixture of the old and the new.
sentences.chinese: 这个小城新旧结合。

detailed_translations.english: a combination of two or more different things, feelings, or types of people

name: reconcile
trans: After arguing, the two friends were reconciled with each other.

sentences.english: The possibility remains that the two theories may be reconciled.
sentences.chinese: 这两种理论仍是有可能协调的。

sentences.english: The pair were reconciled after Jackson made a public apology.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊公开道歉之后，这两个人又言归于好了。

detailed_translations.english: if you reconcile two ideas, situations, or facts, you find a way in which they can both be true or acceptable

name: ruin
trans: Our walk in the park was ruined by the sudden rain.

sentences.english: an interesting old ruin
sentences.chinese: 一处有意思的古老废墟

sentences.english: the ruins of a bombed-out office block
sentences.chinese: 被炸毁的办公楼的废墟

sentences.english: Jefferson was ruined by the lawsuit.
sentences.chinese: 杰弗逊因为那场官司倾家荡产。

sentences.english: This illness has ruined my life.
sentences.chinese: 这个病毁掉了我的生活。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a building that is left after the rest has been destroyed
to make someone lose all their money

name: shatter
trans: When the ball hit the window, the glass shattered.

sentences.english: The explosion shattered the building.
sentences.chinese: 这次爆炸把大楼炸成一片废墟。

sentences.english: A tragic accident shattered her dreams of Olympic glory.
sentences.chinese: 一场不幸的意外事故使她获得奥运奖牌的梦想破灭了。

detailed_translations.english: to break suddenly into very small pieces, or to make something break in this way

name: shutter
trans: Mr. Smith closed the shutters every night to make his bedroom dark.

sentences.english: There are a few things you should check before pressing the shutter release.
sentences.chinese: 在按快门之前，有几件事情你应该检查。

detailed_translations.chinese: 快门；百叶窗；关闭物；遮板
detailed_translations.english: one of a pair of wooden or metal covers on the outside of a window that can be closed to keep light out or prevent thieves from coming in

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…装百叶窗；以百叶窗遮闭

name: sift
trans: The baker sifted the flour into a large bowl.

sentences.english: Police are sifting through the evidence.
sentences.chinese: 警方在筛查证据。

detailed_translations.english: to put flour, sugar etc through a sieve or similar container in order to remove large pieces

name: slight
trans: There was only a slight change in the little boy’s height.

sentences.english: a slight improvement
sentences.chinese: 些许的改进

sentences.english: a slight increase
sentences.chinese: 少许的增加

sentences.english: a slight change of plan
sentences.chinese: 计划的略微变动

sentences.english: a slight pause
sentences.chinese: 稍稍的停顿

sentences.english: a slight problem
sentences.chinese: 小问题

detailed_translations.english: small in degree
to offend someone by treating them rudely or without respect

name: sparkle
trans: The stars sparkled in the winter night’s sky.

sentences.english: The sea sparkled in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 阳光下大海碧波闪耀。

sentences.english: The crystal chandelier sparkled.
sentences.chinese: 那水晶枝形吊灯闪闪发光。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发光，闪耀，闪烁；活跃，焕发
detailed_translations.english: to shine in small bright flashes

detailed_translations.chinese: 闪光， 闪耀， 闪烁； 活力， 生气
detailed_translations.english: a bright shiny appearance, with small points of flashing light

name: sprinkle
trans: He sprinkled the pasta with salt and black pepper.

sentences.english: Sprinkle the meat with salt and place in the pan.
sentences.chinese: 给肉撒点盐，然后放进平锅里。

detailed_translations.english: to scatter small drops of liquid or small pieces of something
a small amount of something, especially scattered on top of something

name: stale
trans: The cookies sat on the table so long that they became stale.

sentences.english: stale jokes
sentences.chinese: 老掉牙的笑话

detailed_translations.english: not interesting or exciting any more

name: utter
trans: The lost boy was so scared that he could barely utter a single word.

sentences.english: That’s utter nonsense!
sentences.chinese: 真是一派胡言！

sentences.english: This company treats its employees with utter contempt.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司对其员工不屑一顾。

sentences.english: I watched in complete and utter horror as he pulled out a gun.
sentences.chinese: 我惊恐万分地看着他拔出枪来。

sentences.english: fifteen years of utter confusion
sentences.chinese: 15年的大混乱

detailed_translations.english: complete – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong
to make a sound with your voice, especially with difficulty

name: although
trans: Although she was late, her friends gave her a warm welcome.

sentences.english: Although in poor health, she continued to carry out her duties.
sentences.chinese: 尽管身体不好，她仍继续执行任务。

sentences.english: We decided to take rooms in Longwood House, although we knew we could not really afford the rent.
sentences.chinese: 虽然我们知道自己其实付不起租金，但还是决定住朗伍德庄园的房间。

sentences.english: Although I can’t help admiring the man’s courage, I do not approve of his methods.
sentences.chinese: 尽管我不得不佩服那个男子的勇气，却并不赞成他的方法。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that makes your main statement seem surprising or unlikely

name: apply
trans: She always applies makeup to her face before going outside.

sentences.english: We need to apply for planning permission to build a garage.
sentences.chinese: 我们建车库需要申请规划许可。

detailed_translations.chinese: 应用，实施，使用；适用；申请，请求
detailed_translations.english: to make a formal request, usually written, for something such as a job, a place at a university, or permission to do something
to put or spread something such as paint, liquid, or medicine onto a surface

name: await
trans: The players awaited the referee’s decision.

sentences.english: Several men are awaiting trial for robbery.
sentences.chinese: 几个人因抢劫正在候审。

detailed_translations.english: to wait for something

name: beloved
trans: The boy took a nap next to his beloved cat.

sentences.english: He never recovered from the death of his beloved daughter.
sentences.chinese: 他一直没有走出失去爱女的阴影。

sentences.english: He’s always talking about his beloved computer!
sentences.chinese: 他老是在谈论他的宝贝电脑！

sentences.english: It was a gift from her beloved.
sentences.chinese: 那是她心爱的人送的礼物。

detailed_translations.english: loved very much by someone
someone who is loved very much

name: climate
trans: The climate in the desert is very hot.

sentences.english: Los Angeles’ warm dry climate
sentences.chinese: 洛杉矶温暖干燥的气候

detailed_translations.chinese: 气候； 风土， 地带； 风气， 气氛
detailed_translations.english: the typical weather conditions in a particular area

name: complain
trans: The workers complained that they were being treated unfairly.

sentences.english: Residents are complaining because traffic in the area has increased.
sentences.chinese: 由于这个地区的交通流量有所增加，居民都在抱怨。

sentences.english: ‘You never ask my opinion about anything,’ Rod complained.
sentences.chinese: “你什么事都不问问我的看法。”罗德抱怨道。

sentences.english: Employees complained bitterly about working conditions.
sentences.chinese: 雇员们对工作条件十分不满。

detailed_translations.english: to say that you are annoyed, not satisfied, or unhappy about something or someone

name: confuse
trans: The sign confused the traveler because it pointed in two directions.

sentences.english: People might well confuse the two products.
sentences.chinese: 人们很容易混淆这两种产品。

detailed_translations.english: to think wrongly that a person or thing is someone or something else

name: due
trans: The papers were due on the 19th.

sentences.english: The team are due to fly to Italy next month.
sentences.chinese: 该球队预定下个月飞往意大利。

sentences.english: Any money due you will be sent by cheque through the post.
sentences.chinese: 应该支付给你的款项将会以支票邮寄给你。

detailed_translations.english: expected to happen or arrive at a particular time

name: establish
trans: He wanted to establish a club for people to help the Earth.

sentences.english: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
sentences.chinese: 身为记者，他已经声名鹊起。

sentences.english: He had three years in which to establish himself as Prime Minister.
sentences.chinese: 他有三年时间来确立自己首相的地位。

detailed_translations.english: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality

name: furnace
trans: Mr. Jones came to fix the furnace.

sentences.english: The metal glowed in the furnace.
sentences.chinese: 金属在熔炉里发出灼热的光。

sentences.english: An adjustable plate, as in the flue of a furnace or stove, for controlling the draft.
sentences.chinese: 挡板，调节风门一种可调节的薄片，如在熔炉或火炉的通气管中的，用来控制气流。

sentences.english: The graceful preface was laced by a commonplace maid near the furnace in the palace without any trace of embrace.
sentences.chinese: 这份优雅的前言是由一个平凡的侍女在宫殿里的火炉边，不留住拥抱过的痕迹而系上带子的。

detailed_translations.english: a large container for a very hot fire, used to produce power, heat, or liquid metal

name: leash
trans: Dogs must wear a leash to keep them from running away.

name: mature
trans: When they matured, they became as tall as their parents.

sentences.english: Laura is very mature for her age.
sentences.chinese: 相对她的年龄来说劳拉是很成熟的。

sentences.english: We’re mature enough to disagree on this issue but still respect each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们都很成熟，尽管我们对此事意见不同，但还是彼此尊重。

sentences.english: As the fish matures, its colours and patternings change.
sentences.chinese: 随着发育成熟，这种鱼的颜色和斑纹都会改变。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a child or young person, who is mature behaves in a sensible and reasonable way, as you would expect an adult to behave
to become fully grown or developed

name: measure
trans: The scientists carefully measured the amount of chemicals in the tubes.

sentences.english: New safety measures were being demanded after last night’s horrific train crash.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生严重的火车相撞事故后，民众要求制定新的安全措施。

sentences.english: The new bridge was erected as a temporary measure to replace the one which was destroyed by floods.
sentences.chinese: 建这座新桥是为了临时代替被洪水毁坏的那座桥。

detailed_translations.english: an action, especially an official one, that is intended to deal with a particular problem

name: midst
trans: She was in the midst of cleaning when the telephone rang.

sentences.english: I fear we have an enemy in our midst.
sentences.chinese: 我担心我们中间有内奸。

detailed_translations.english: in a particular group
surrounded by people or things

name: misery
trans: There was a lot of misery after Sam lost his dog.

sentences.english: What we are witnessing here is human misery on a vast scale.
sentences.chinese: 我们在这里所目睹的情景是许许多多的人都生活困苦。

sentences.english: the misery of unemployment
sentences.chinese: 失业的痛苦

sentences.english: the miseries of war
sentences.chinese: 战争造成的苦难

detailed_translations.english: great suffering that is caused for example by being very poor or very sick

name: powerless
trans: I fear my father is powerless now.

sentences.english: He felt so powerless.
sentences.chinese: 他感到如此无助。

detailed_translations.chinese: 无力的；[劳经] 无能力的，无权的
detailed_translations.english: unable to stop or control something because you do not have the power, strength, or legal right to do so

name: prior
trans: Ron had to wait since he arrived prior to the scheduled meeting time.

sentences.english: You do not need any prior knowledge of the subject.
sentences.chinese: 你无需事先具备该方面的知识。

sentences.english: Changes may not be made without the prior approval of the council.
sentences.chinese: 未经委员会事先同意，不得作出改变。

sentences.english: Vegetarian meals are provided by prior agreement.
sentences.chinese: 经事先协商可提供素食。

sentences.english: Some prior experience with the software is needed.
sentences.chinese: 要求事先熟悉这个软件。

detailed_translations.english: existing or arranged before something else or before the present situation

name: research
trans: Scientists did a lot of research on the subject of blood type.

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: spaceship
trans: Many people want to travel into space by spaceship.

sentences.english: ...an alien spaceship.
sentences.chinese: …一艘外星人的宇宙飞船。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle for carrying people through space

name: variety
trans: There are a variety of flowers at the shop.

sentences.english: I really like the variety the store has to offer.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢这家商店商品的丰富多样。

sentences.english: The lake has more than 20 varieties of fish.
sentences.chinese: 那个湖里有二十多种鱼。

sentences.english: a rare variety of orchid
sentences.chinese: 兰花的稀有品种

detailed_translations.english: the differences within a group, set of actions etc that make it interesting

name: altogether
trans: The company stopped using sugar altogether in its food.

sentences.english: an old custom that has vanished altogether
sentences.chinese: 一个彻底消亡的古老习俗

sentences.english: Congress could ban the procession altogether.
sentences.chinese: 国会可以完全禁止这次游行。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something has been done completely or has finished completely
not wearing any clothes – used humorously

name: bind
trans: The victims of the flood were bound by their need to help each other.

sentences.english: The monks are bound by vows of silence.
sentences.chinese: 僧侣们必须遵守保持缄默的誓言。

detailed_translations.chinese: 结合；装订；有约束力；过紧
detailed_translations.english: if you are bound by an agreement, promise etc, you must do what you have agreed to do or promised to do

detailed_translations.chinese: 捆绑；困境；讨厌的事情；植物的藤蔓
detailed_translations.english: an annoying or difficult situation

name: bruise
trans: She got a bruise on her knee from falling down.

sentences.english: minor cuts and bruises
sentences.chinese: 轻微的伤口和淤青

detailed_translations.english: a purple or brown mark on your skin that you get because you have fallen, been hit etc
to affect someone badly and make them feel less confident

name: custom
trans: It is a custom that the bride and groom have the first dance.

sentences.english: She was stopped at customs and questioned.
sentences.chinese: 她在海关被叫住接受问话。

sentences.english: It took ages to clear customs (= be allowed through customs ) but then we were out of the airport quite quickly.
sentences.chinese: 过海关花了很长时间，不过出机场倒是很快。

sentences.english: You won’t be able to take that through customs.
sentences.chinese: 你带着那东西过不了海关的。

detailed_translations.english: the place where your bags are checked for illegal goods when you go into a country

name: disobedient
trans: The disobedient children didn’t listen to their mother and had an accident.

sentences.english: Her tone was that of a parent to a disobedient child.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音听上去好像家长在教训不听话的小孩。

detailed_translations.english: deliberately not doing what you are told to do by your parents, teacher, etc

name: foresee
trans: The teacher didn’t foresee any problems with his large class.

sentences.english: I’ve put your name on the list and I don’t foresee any problems.
sentences.chinese: 我把你的名字写在名单上了，估计不会有什么问题。

sentences.english: The disaster could not have been foreseen.
sentences.chinese: 这场灾难是始料未及的。

detailed_translations.english: to think or know that something is going to happen in the future

name: glimpse
trans: She glimpsed outside the window as the plane was about to land.

sentences.english: I glimpsed a figure at the window.
sentences.chinese: 我瞥见窗前有个身影。

sentences.english: They caught a glimpse of a dark green car.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞥见一辆深绿色的汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them
a quick look at someone or something that does not allow you to see them clearly

name: hoop
trans: The boys tried to toss the ball through the basketball hoop.

sentences.english: A boy came towards them, rolling an iron hoop.
sentences.chinese: 一个男孩滚着一个铁环朝他们走来。

detailed_translations.english: a large ring made of wood, metal, plastic etc
to surround with or as if with a hoop

name: misfortune
trans: His family helped him when he encountered misfortune.

sentences.english: It seems the banks always profit from farmers’ misfortunes.
sentences.chinese: 银行似乎总是从农民的不幸中获益。

detailed_translations.english: very bad luck, or something that happens to you as a result of bad luck

name: negative
trans: She doesn’t like to say negative things about her friends.

sentences.english: students with a negative attitude to school
sentences.chinese: 对上学抱消极态度的学生

sentences.english: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
sentences.chinese: 他们都对警察印象不好。

sentences.english: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
sentences.chinese: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 否定的，消极的；负的，阴性的
detailed_translations.english: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones

detailed_translations.chinese: 负片， 底片； 负数
detailed_translations.english: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed

name: per
trans: It costs eight dollars per person to watch the baseball game.

sentences.english: How much does it cost per kilo?
sentences.chinese: 每公斤多少钱？

sentences.english: rooms costing £40 per night
sentences.chinese: 每晚收费40英镑的房间

sentences.english: Admission is £9.95 per adult.
sentences.chinese: 成人门票每位9.95英镑。

sentences.english: My car does 12 miles per litre (= for each litre of petrol ) .
sentences.chinese: 我的汽车每升汽油跑12英里。

sentences.english: The meal cost $25 per head (= for or by each person ) .
sentences.chinese: 那顿饭人均花费25美元。

detailed_translations.english: for each

name: plead
trans: He pleaded for his parents to let him go to the soccer game.

sentences.english: ‘Don’t go!’ Robert pleaded.
sentences.chinese: “别走！”罗伯特央求道。

sentences.english: He appeared before the committee to plead his case.
sentences.chinese: 他出现在委员会上为他的案子辩护。

detailed_translations.chinese: 恳求，请求；申诉，答辩，辩护
detailed_translations.english: to ask for something that you want very much, in a sincere and emotional way

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…辩护， 提出…为理由
detailed_translations.english: If you plead the case or cause of someone or something, you speak out in their support or defence

name: rip
trans: She ripped the paper in half by accident.

sentences.english: Her clothes had all been ripped.
sentences.chinese: 她的衣服都被撕破了。

sentences.english: The sail ripped under the force of the wind.
sentences.chinese: 船帆被狂风刮破了。

sentences.english: Impatiently, Sue ripped the letter open .
sentences.chinese: 休急不可待地撕开信封。

detailed_translations.english: to tear something or be torn quickly and violently
a long tear or cut

name: sake
trans: The parents worked hard for their children’s sake.

sentences.english: He moved to the seaside for the sake of his health.
sentences.chinese: 他为了健康而迁居海滨。

sentences.english: I only went for Kay’s sake.
sentences.chinese: 我是为了凯才去的。

sentences.english: I hope he’s told the truth for his own sake (= because it will be good for him ) .
sentences.chinese: 为了他自己好，我希望他已经说出了真相。

detailed_translations.english: in order to help, improve, or please someone or something

name: scrape
trans: I accidentally scraped the paint of the side of the car.

sentences.english: Scrape the carrots and slice them thinly.
sentences.chinese: 把这些胡萝卜去皮切成薄片。

sentences.english: The two of them scraped their dishes clean.
sentences.chinese: 他们两个把盘子擦得干干净净。

sentences.english: I heard the side of the car scrape against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 我听到汽车的侧面蹭着墙了。

sentences.english: the scrape of iron on stone
sentences.chinese: 铁摩擦石头发出的嚓嚓声

sentences.english: She emerged from the overturned car with only a few scrapes and bruises.
sentences.chinese: 她从翻了的车里钻出来，只擦破一点皮，碰了几块淤青。

detailed_translations.english: to remove something from a surface using the edge of a knife, a stick etc
the action of one thing rubbing roughly against another

name: source
trans: The river was the source of drinking water for the village.

sentences.english: They get their money from various sources.
sentences.chinese: 他们从各种途径弄到钱。

detailed_translations.english: a thing, place, activity etc that you get something from

name: stern
trans: The stern teacher didn’t allow the students to speak during class.

sentences.english: It is placed in the stern of a boat.
sentences.chinese: 它被放在船尾。

detailed_translations.english: the back of a ship
serious and strict, and showing strong disapproval of someone’s behaviour

name: stitch
trans: My grandmother stitched the pieces together to make a big blanket.

sentences.english: He had to have ten stitches in his head.
sentences.chinese: 他头上不得不缝了十针。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece of thread that has been sewn into a piece of cloth, or the action of the thread going into and out of the cloth
to sew two pieces of cloth together, or to sew a decoration onto a piece of cloth

name: thump
trans: They heard the thump when the bowling ball hit the floor.

sentences.english: If you don’t shut up, I’m going to thump you!
sentences.chinese: 你要是不住嘴，我就揍你！

sentences.english: She thumped the table with her fist.
sentences.chinese: 她挥拳砸在桌子上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 重击；用拳头打；砰地撞到
detailed_translations.english: to hit someone very hard with your hand closed
the dull sound that is made when something hits a surface

name: vehement
trans: Gina was vehement when she found out that Liz was bad in school.

sentences.english: She suddenly became very vehement and agitated, jumping around and shouting.
sentences.chinese: 她突然变得十分激动和不安，四处暴跳并大喊大叫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感情强烈的；热烈的；(人)有强烈感情的
detailed_translations.english: showing very strong feelings or opinions

name: ailing
trans: Antonio’s ailing health caused his head to hurt.

sentences.english: the ailing car industry
sentences.chinese: 不景气的汽车工业

detailed_translations.chinese: 生病的，身体不舒服的；体衰的
detailed_translations.english: ill and not likely to get better

name: alike
trans: The brothers looked so much alike that it was impossible to tell one from the other.

sentences.english: My mother and I are alike in many ways.
sentences.chinese: 我和母亲在许多方面很相似。

detailed_translations.english: very similar
used to emphasize that you mean both the people, groups, or things that you have just mentioned

name: appall
trans: Minerva was appalled when she read the email from her enemy.

name: bathe
trans: The mermaid bathed herself in the ocean.

sentences.english: I bathed, washed my hair, and got dressed.
sentences.chinese: 我洗了澡，洗了头，然后穿上衣服。

sentences.english: He bathed the children and put them to bed.
sentences.chinese: 他给孩子们洗了澡，然后把他们弄上床。

sentences.english: They bathed in the lake in the moonlight.
sentences.chinese: 月光下，他们在湖里游泳。

sentences.english: She brought a bowl of water and began to bathe the injured arm.
sentences.chinese: 她拿来一盆水，开始清洗受伤的手臂。

detailed_translations.chinese: 洗澡；给…洗；游泳；浸洗; 浸泡
detailed_translations.english: to wash yourself or someone else in a bath

name: bounds
trans: If your ball lands outside the lines, it’s out of bounds.

name: critique
trans: My job is to critique the food at various restaurants.

sentences.english: She had brought a book, a feminist critique of Victorian lady novelists.
sentences.chinese: 她带来了一本书，一本从女权主义角度对维多利亚时期女小说家进行的评论。

detailed_translations.english: a detailed explanation of the problems of something such as a set of political ideas
to say how good or bad a book, play, painting, or set of ideas is

name: demography
trans: If you study demography, you’ll see huge population growth in some areas of the world.

sentences.english: This slow-motion disaster, demography insists, cannot be avoided without a major shift in resources.
sentences.chinese: 这是一场缓慢进行的灾难，人口统计学仍坚持不能避免资源的主要转移。

detailed_translations.english: the study of human populations and the ways in which they change, for example the study of how many births, marriages and deaths happen in a particular place at a particular time

name: diagnosis
trans: The vet’s diagnosis was that our dog had a broken leg.

sentences.english: An exact diagnosis can only be made by obtaining a blood sample.
sentences.chinese: 只有抽取血样才能作出准确的诊断。

detailed_translations.english: the process of discovering exactly what is wrong with someone or something, by examining them closely

name: dip
trans: The economy experienced a dip in the 1930s, leading many workers to lose their jobs.

sentences.english: Dip each apple in the syrup until thickly coated.
sentences.chinese: 把每个苹果在糖浆里蘸一下，直到被厚厚地裹上糖浆。

detailed_translations.english: to put something into a liquid and lift it out again
to put something into a liquid and lift it out again

name: distress
trans: We were in great distress when our home was destroyed during the last hurricane.

sentences.english: The dream had distressed her greatly.
sentences.chinese: 这场梦使她深感不安。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel very upset

name: fever
trans: He had to miss school because he was sick with a fever.

sentences.english: Andy has a fever and won’t be coming into work today.
sentences.chinese: 安迪发烧了，今天不来上班。

sentences.english: I woke up this morning with a fever and an upset stomach.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上醒来时我发烧了，胃也不舒服。

sentences.english: She’s running a fever (= has a fever ) .
sentences.chinese: 她在发烧。

detailed_translations.english: an illness or a medical condition in which you have a very high temperature

detailed_translations.chinese: 使发烧；使狂热；使患热病

name: grim
trans: The boy made the grim discovery that he had accidentally deleted his homework.

sentences.english: ‘I’ll survive,’ he said with a grim smile.
sentences.chinese: “我死不了。”他阴笑着说。

sentences.english: The police officers were silent and grim-faced.
sentences.chinese: 警察默不作声，神情严肃。

detailed_translations.english: looking or sounding very serious

name: gut
trans: Thousands of bacteria live in your gut and help you digest food.

sentences.english: He had a gut feeling that Sarah was lying.
sentences.chinese: 他凭直觉感到萨拉在撒谎。

sentences.english: Let's have your gut reaction to the facts as we know them.
sentences.chinese: 请告诉我们你对这些我们了解的事实的直觉反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 内脏；肠子；剧情；胆量；海峡；勇气；直觉；肠
detailed_translations.english: a reaction or feeling that you are sure is right, although you cannot give a reason for it

detailed_translations.chinese: 取出内脏；摧毁（建筑物等）的内部
detailed_translations.english: to remove the organs from inside a fish or animal in order to prepare it for cooking

detailed_translations.chinese: 简单的；本质的，根本的；本能的，直觉的
detailed_translations.english: A gut feeling is based on instinct or emotion rather than reason

name: helmet
trans: When exploring underground caves, it is important to always wear a helmet.

sentences.english: The Sword split the Knight's helmet and bit him fatally.
sentences.chinese: 剑劈开了骑士的头盔并致命地刺进他。

sentences.english: Instead, he was told the last time that she loved him, got a hug from her, put his helmet on her so that she can live, and die himself...
sentences.chinese: 相反，他叫女孩最后一次说她爱他，最后一次拥抱他，并让她戴上自己的头盔，因而，女孩可以幸免于难，而他自己却离开了人世……

sentences.english: Without Christ we are defenseless against the Devil, but with "the helmet of salvation" our minds are protected by God.
sentences.chinese: 没有基督，我们无力防御魔鬼的攻击；但有救恩的头盔，我们的心思便有神的保护。

detailed_translations.english: a strong hard hat that soldiers,  motorcycle  riders, the police etc wear to protect their heads

name: herb
trans: I couldn’t decide which herb I wanted to buy at the market.

sentences.english: Sprinkle the dish with chopped fresh herbs.
sentences.chinese: 在菜肴上撒些切碎的新鲜香草。

detailed_translations.english: a small plant that is used to improve the taste of food, or to make medicine

name: militant
trans: The woman delivered an angry, militant speech on the floor of the legislature.

sentences.english: militant political activists
sentences.chinese: 激进的政治活动家

sentences.english: a militant animal rights group
sentences.chinese: 激进的动物权利保护团体

sentences.english: After the assassination of Martin Luther King, black leaders became more militant.
sentences.chinese: 马丁•路德•金遇刺后，黑人领袖变得更为激进了。

sentences.english: Even now we could not be sure that the militants would not find some new excuse to call a strike the following winter.
sentences.chinese: 即使到现在，我们也不能确定这些激进分子不会找到某个新的借口在下一年冬天号召一场罢工。

detailed_translations.english: a militant organization or person is willing to use strong or violent action in order to achieve political or social change

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有战斗性的人；好斗者；激进分子
detailed_translations.english: Militant is also a noun

name: miracle
trans: A miracle happened when Rosalita won over 60 million dollars in the lottery.

sentences.english: It’s a miracle you weren’t killed!
sentences.chinese: 你没有死真是奇迹！

sentences.english: By some miracle, we managed to catch the plane.
sentences.chinese: 我们奇迹般地赶上了飞机。

sentences.english: the economic miracle of the 1950s
sentences.chinese: 20世纪50年代的经济奇迹

sentences.english: She’s our miracle baby.
sentences.chinese: 她是我们的奇迹宝宝。

detailed_translations.english: something very lucky or very good that happens which you did not expect to happen or did not think was possible

name: mourn
trans: The entire family mourned their grandfather’s death together.

sentences.english: Hundreds of people gathered to mourn the slain president.
sentences.chinese: 成百上千人聚集在一起悼念遇刺的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to feel very sad and to miss someone after they have died

name: nonsense
trans: The baby was talking nonsense into the phone.

sentences.english: ‘I’m a prisoner in my own home.’ ‘Nonsense!’
sentences.chinese: “我在自己家里就像个囚犯。”“胡说！”

sentences.english: If you ask me, these modern teaching methods are a load of nonsense (= a lot of nonsense ).
sentences.chinese: 要我说，这些现代教学方法全是一派胡言。

sentences.english: He was talking utter nonsense as usual.
sentences.chinese: 他像平常一样又在胡说八道了。

sentences.english: By 1832 the idea had become an economic nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 到了1832年，那种观点已经成为经济学的谬论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 胡说， 废话； 冒失的行动
detailed_translations.english: ideas, opinions, statements etc that are not true or that seem very stupid

name: physician
trans: The physician was a friendly man who did his best with all of his patients.

sentences.english: your family physician
sentences.chinese: 你的家庭医生

detailed_translations.english: a doctor

name: accent
trans: The new teacher’s accent was clearly a German one.

sentences.english: He had a strong Irish accent
sentences.chinese: 他有浓重的爱尔兰口音。

detailed_translations.chinese: 口音；重音；强调；特点；重音符号
detailed_translations.english: the way someone pronounces the words of a language, showing which country or which part of a country they come from
to make something more noticeable so that people will pay attention to it

name: barber
trans: My hair is getting much too long. I’d better go to the barber’s shop.

sentences.english: My father marched me over to Otto, the local barber, to have my hair cut short.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸把我拽到当地理发师奥托跟前，让他把我的头发剪短。

detailed_translations.english: a man whose job is to cut men’s hair and sometimes to  shave  them

name: basement
trans: They turned their basement into a game room.

sentences.english: They bought an old schoolhouse to live in and built a workshop in the basement.
sentences.chinese: 他们买了座旧校舍居住，还在地下室建了个作坊。

detailed_translations.english: a room or area in a building that is under the level of the ground

name: blank
trans: She got a blank piece of paper to draw on.

sentences.english: Leave the last page blank.
sentences.chinese: 最后一页留空。

sentences.english: a blank cassette
sentences.chinese: 一盒空白磁带

sentences.english: When you’ve filled in the blanks , hand the form back to me.
sentences.chinese: 你填好表格以后把它交还给我。

detailed_translations.english: without any writing, print, or recorded sound
an empty space on a piece of paper, where you are supposed to write a word or letter

name: blink
trans: I blinked many times so that my eyes could adjust to the bright light.

sentences.english: I blinked as I came out into the sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 我走出来，在太阳光下直眨眼睛。

detailed_translations.english: to shut and open your eyes quickly
very quickly

name: choir
trans: He had choir practice every day after school.

sentences.english: The boy sings bass in the choir.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩在合唱团里唱男低音。

sentences.english: You joined the choir, but you don't even like singing. What is your design anyway?
sentences.chinese: 你根本不喜欢唱歌，但是你还是加入了唱诗班。到底你想干什么？

sentences.english: In a window across the street, a boy plays the flute, echoing the choir's songs.
sentences.chinese: 在街对面的一扇窗户里，一位少年吹着长笛，附和着唱诗班的歌声。

detailed_translations.english: a group of people who sing together for other people to listen to

name: comic
trans: The comic actor was famous for his jokes.

sentences.english: a comic novel
sentences.chinese: 滑稽小说

detailed_translations.english: amusing you and making you want to laugh

detailed_translations.chinese: 连环漫画；喜剧演员；滑稽人物
detailed_translations.english: a magazine for children that tells a story using comic strips

name: complicate
trans: The bad weather complicated finishing the job quickly.

sentences.english: I think that is because we unnecessarily complicate it.
sentences.chinese: 我想这是因为我们不必要地将生活复杂化了。

sentences.english: If the answer to all of these questions is no, a framework will only complicate matters.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有这些问题的答案都为否，那么使用框架只会把事情变复杂。

sentences.english: The selection service is one of the more difficult services to implement correctly because it has some valuable features that complicate the implementation.
sentences.chinese: 选择服务是比较难以正确实现的服务之一，因为它具有一些使实现复杂化的有价值的功能。

name: decline
trans: She declined his offer to pay for her dinner.

sentences.english: Offered the position of chairman, Smith declined, preferring to keep his current job.
sentences.chinese: 对担任主席的邀约，史密斯拒绝了，他宁愿留在现在的职位上。

sentences.english: Mary declined a hot drink and went to her room.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽谢绝了热饮料，到自己的房间去了。

sentences.english: The minister declined to comment (= refused to speak to people who report the news ) about the progress of the peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 部长拒绝就和谈进程发表评论。

detailed_translations.english: to say no politely when someone invites you somewhere, offers you something, or wants you to do something

name: errand
trans: He couldn’t go to practice because he had several errands to do.

sentences.english: Everybody rushing about on some incomprehensible errand someone forced him to do at pain of death.
sentences.chinese: 大家都忍受着死亡的痛苦被迫地抢着做一些令人难以理解的差事。

sentences.english: They can view a list of errands that match their interest profile, and, by entering a price, can bid to perform the errand.
sentences.chinese: 他们可以查看与他们的兴趣简档匹配的差事列表，并且，通过输入价格，可以为执行差事投标。

sentences.english: Get them a drink or a coffee, do a chore for them, offer to do an errand, anything they’d appreciate, really.
sentences.chinese: 为人递上一杯饮料或咖啡，做一些零星杂务，为别人提供一份差使等等使人感激的事情。 真的。

name: glove
trans: When it gets cold, I always put on a pair of gloves.

sentences.english: a pair of gloves
sentences.chinese: 一副手套

sentences.english: boxing gloves
sentences.chinese: 拳击手套

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing that you wear on your hand in order to protect it or keep it warm

name: hermit
trans: The hermit lived a simple life in a small cave in the forest.

sentences.english: I've spent the past ten years living like a hermit.
sentences.chinese: 我过去10年里过着隐士般的生活。

detailed_translations.chinese: （尤指宗教原因的）隐士；隐居者
detailed_translations.english: someone who lives alone and has a simple way of life, usually for religious reasons

name: justly
trans: We justly decided to give the prize to him.

name: leather
trans: He got a new leather jacket for his birthday.

sentences.english: The inside of the bag was lined with soft leather.
sentences.chinese: 这包的里面衬了软皮。

sentences.english: elegant leather boots
sentences.chinese: 精美的皮靴

detailed_translations.english: animal skin that has been treated to preserve it, and is used for making shoes, bags etc

name: ponder
trans: She sat in the park and pondered her problem.

sentences.english: He continued to ponder the problem as he walked home.
sentences.chinese: 他一边往家走一边继续思考那个问题。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time thinking carefully and seriously about a problem, a difficult question, or something that has happened

name: reserve
trans: He reserved a table at the busy restaurant.

sentences.english: Do you have to reserve tickets in advance?
sentences.chinese: 你必须预先订票吗？

detailed_translations.english: to arrange for a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc to be kept for you to use at a particular time in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 储备； 保留； 拘谨， 矜持； 替补队员， 后备部队； 自然保护区
detailed_translations.english: a supply of something kept to be used if it is needed

name: script
trans: He read the script of the play three times.

sentences.english: a diary entry written in neat black script
sentences.chinese: 用工整的黑色字写下的一则日记

sentences.english: ...James Cameron, who scripted and directed both films.
sentences.chinese: …为这两部电影写脚本并执导的詹姆斯·卡梅伦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 脚本；手迹；书写用的字母
detailed_translations.english: writing done by hand
The person who scripts a movie or a radio or television play writes it

name: search
trans: I searched the newspaper for a new job.

sentences.english: It was too dark to search further.
sentences.chinese: 天太暗，无法继续寻找。

sentences.english: The area was thoroughly searched .
sentences.chinese: 这一地区已被彻底搜查过。

sentences.english: I’ve searched high and low (= everywhere ) for my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 我到处找我的眼镜。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find someone or something by looking very carefully
an attempt to find someone or something

name: slam
trans: She slammed the book shut after she finished reading it.

sentences.english: We heard a car door slam.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到有车门砰的一声关上了。

sentences.english: He slammed the door shut.
sentences.chinese: 他把门砰地关上。

sentences.english: She slammed down the phone angrily.
sentences.chinese: 她气呼呼地啪的一声挂上电话。

name: staircase
trans: The staircase leads directly into the kitchen.

sentences.english: They walked down the staircase together.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起沿楼梯通道往下走。

detailed_translations.english: a set of stairs inside a building with its supports and the side parts that you hold on to

name: afflicted
trans: He was afflicted by pain in his right arm.

name: aisle
trans: They were told to clear the aisle because the plane was about to land.

sentences.english: Would you like a window seat or an aisle seat (=  seat next to the aisle  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 您想要靠窗的座位还是靠过道的座位？

name: atmosphere
trans: Scientists worry that harmful substances are hurting the atmosphere.

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: author
trans: The author was hard at work on his next novel.

sentences.english: Nothomb is a Belgian author.
sentences.chinese: 诺东是位比利时作家。

sentences.english: It’s clear that the author is a woman.
sentences.chinese: 显然，这位作者是女性。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has written a book

name: breakdown
trans: Her car had a breakdown, and she wasn’t sure how to fix it.

sentences.english: A sudden rise in oil prices could lead to a breakdown of the economy.
sentences.chinese: 油价暴涨会导致经济崩溃。

sentences.english: The breakdown of the negotiations was not unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 谈判的失败是预料之中的事。

detailed_translations.english: a failure of a relationship, discussion or system

name: cargo
trans: The cargo of the ship got wet when it started raining.

sentences.english: a cargo plane
sentences.chinese: 货机

detailed_translations.english: the goods that are being carried in a ship or plane

name: chapter
trans: The first chapter of a book usually introduces the main character of a story.

sentences.english: Read Chapter 11 as your homework.
sentences.chinese: 家庭作业是阅读第 11 章。

sentences.english: This chapter discusses power, and how people use it.
sentences.chinese: 这一章节讲权力，以及人们如何运用权力。

detailed_translations.english: one of the parts into which a book is divided

name: connect
trans: I connected the mouse to my laptop computer.

sentences.english: We’d like two rooms with connecting doors (= doors that join the rooms ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们想要两个有门相通的房间。

sentences.english: I didn’t connect the two events in my mind.
sentences.chinese: 我心里没把这两件事联系起来。

detailed_translations.english: to join two or more things together

name: etc.
trans: She was going to bring treats to the party: cookies, muffins, cake, etc.

name: flip
trans: To turn on the lights, just flip this switch.

sentences.english: I was fed up with his flip comments.
sentences.chinese: 我听够了他那些轻率的评论。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〈口〉无理的， 轻率的， 轻浮的
detailed_translations.english: not said or meant seriously
to move something with a quick sudden movement so that it is in a different position
an action in which you make a flat object such as a coin go upwards and turn over in the air

name: idle
trans: She read a book to keep from being idle.

sentences.english: I cannot afford to leave the land lying idle.
sentences.chinese: 我不能让土地闲置。

sentences.english: The whole team stood idle, waiting for the mechanic.
sentences.chinese: 整队人干站着等技工来。

sentences.english: The workers have been idle for the last six months.
sentences.chinese: 最近六个月工人们都很闲。

detailed_translations.english: not working or producing anything

name: notify
trans: The teacher notified us about a change to our assignment.

sentences.english: You will be notified of any changes in the system.
sentences.chinese: 系统中有任何变化都会通知你。

sentences.english: In August we were notified that our article had been rejected.
sentences.chinese: 8月份我们接到通知，说我们的文章不予采用。

detailed_translations.english: to formally or officially tell someone about something

name: pea
trans: His favorite food was peas.

sentences.english: roast chicken with peas and carrots
sentences.chinese: 烤鸡配豌豆胡萝卜

detailed_translations.english: a round green seed that is cooked and eaten as a vegetable, or the plant on which these seeds grow

name: raisin
trans: Raisins are one of my favorite snacks.

sentences.english: ...homemade oatmeal with brown sugar and raisins.
sentences.chinese: …自家煮的放有红糖和葡萄干的麦片粥。

detailed_translations.english: a dried  grape

name: retain
trans: Even by the afternoon, the day had retained the morning’s freshness.

sentences.english: You have the right to retain possession of the goods.
sentences.chinese: 你有权保留这些物品。

sentences.english: The state wants to retain control of food imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府想保留对食品进口的控制权。

detailed_translations.english: to keep something or continue to have something

name: state
trans: The president stated his opinion about the world’s health concerns.

sentences.english: She was in an extremely confused state of mind .
sentences.chinese: 她思绪纷乱。

sentences.english: She can’t go home now. Look at the state of her!
sentences.chinese: 她现在不能回家。看看她这副样子！

sentences.english: The country was in a state of war (= officially fighting a war ) .
sentences.chinese: 这个国家正处于战争状态。

sentences.english: Water exists in three states: liquid, gaseous, and solid.
sentences.chinese: 水有三种形态: 液态、气态和固态。

sentences.english: ...reform of the state social-security system.
sentences.chinese: …国家社会保障体制的改革。

detailed_translations.english: the physical or mental condition that someone or something is in
to formally say or write a piece of information or your opinion
State industries or organizations are financed and organized by the government rather than private companies

name: tray
trans: The waiter brought our food on a tray.

sentences.english: The waiter brought drinks on a tray.
sentences.chinese: 服务员用托盘端来饮料。

sentences.english: a cat litter tray
sentences.chinese: 猫砂盘

detailed_translations.english: a flat piece of plastic, metal, or wood, with raised edges, used for carrying things such as plates, food etc

name: unfortunate
trans: It was unfortunate that Dave’s team lost, but he still had fun.

sentences.english: When we entered the room, the teacher was yelling at some unfortunate student.
sentences.chinese: 我们进教室的时候，老师正在对着一个倒霉的学生吼叫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不幸的；令人遗憾的；不成功的
detailed_translations.english: someone who is unfortunate has something bad happen to them

name: vivid
trans: The figures in the painting were vivid.

sentences.english: I’ve got vivid memories of that summer.
sentences.chinese: 我对那年夏天记忆犹新。

sentences.english: He had a vivid picture of her in his mind.
sentences.chinese: 他的脑海中清晰地留着她的形象。

detailed_translations.english: vivid memories, dreams, descriptions etc are so clear that they seem real

name: vomit
trans: It is common for women to vomit when they are pregnant.

sentences.english: He had swallowed so much sea water he wanted to vomit.
sentences.chinese: 他呛了这么多海水，所以想吐。

sentences.english: I knew I was really in trouble when I began vomiting blood.
sentences.chinese: 我开始吐血的时候才知道我的麻烦大了。

food or other substances that come up from your stomach and through your mouth when you vomit

name: ambition
trans: His great ambition led him to try to climb the mountain alone.

sentences.english: He was young and full of ambition.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，而且雄心勃勃。

detailed_translations.english: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: ambulance
trans: The ambulance sped through the street to get to the accident.

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 救护车服务

sentences.english: the ambulance service
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我们需要叫救护车吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: [车辆][医] 救护车；战时流动医院
detailed_translations.english: a special vehicle that is used to take people who are ill or injured to hospital

name: ankle
trans: The man hurt his ankle while jogging in the park.

sentences.english: slender ankles
sentences.chinese: 纤细的脚踝

detailed_translations.english: the joint between your foot and your leg

name: cabin
trans: The man reached the mountain cabin after a long day of hiking along the river.

sentences.english: a log cabin
sentences.chinese: 原木小屋

sentences.english: 英文例句He showed her to a small cabin.
sentences.chinese: 他把她带到一间小房舱。

sentences.english: He sat quietly in the first class cabin of the flight looking tired.
sentences.chinese: 他静静地坐在班机的头等舱内，看上去有些疲惫。

detailed_translations.english: a small house, especially one built of wood in an area of forest or mountains

name: calendar
trans: Marco used an online calendar to keep track of his schedule.

sentences.english: There was a calendar on the wall above, with large squares around the dates.
sentences.chinese: 墙的上方曾有一本日历，日期框在大方格里。

sentences.english: The Christian calendar was originally based on the Julian calendar of the Romans.
sentences.chinese: 公历最初是基于罗马的儒略历的。

detailed_translations.english: a set of pages that show the days, weeks, and months of a particular year, that you usually hang on a wall

sentences.english: A potato has about 90 calories.
sentences.chinese: 一个马铃薯大约有90卡路里的热量。

sentences.english: a calorie-controlled diet
sentences.chinese: 控制热量的日常饮食

sentences.english: I need to burn off a few calories (= lose some weight by exercising ) .
sentences.chinese: 我要消耗掉一些卡路里。

sentences.english: My wife convinced me to finally start counting calories (= control my weight by being careful about what I eat ) .
sentences.chinese: 我妻子终于说服我开始计算卡路里、控制体重。

name: cave

sentences.english: the entrance to a cave
sentences.chinese: 洞穴的入口

detailed_translations.chinese: 使凹陷，使塌落；在…挖洞穴
detailed_translations.english: to hollow out
a large natural hole in the side of a cliff or hill, or under the ground

name: constantly
trans: He was constantly checking his watch to see if he was late.

sentences.english: He talked constantly about his work.
sentences.chinese: 他不断地谈到他的工作。

sentences.english: The English language is constantly changing .
sentences.chinese: 英语在不断地变化。

detailed_translations.english: all the time, or very often

name: contingent
