sentences.english: Has the Scottish contingent arrived yet?
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰代表团到了没有？

detailed_translations.chinese: 因情况而异的；不一定的；偶然发生的；可能的；依情况而定的；偶然的；[逻]有条件的
detailed_translations.english: depending on something that may happen in the future

detailed_translations.chinese: 分遣队；偶然事件；分得部分；代表团
detailed_translations.english: a group of people who all have something in common, such as their nationality, beliefs etc, and who are part of a larger group

name: deadline

sentences.english: I’m always working under pressure to meet deadlines (= finish something on time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我总是在赶工期的压力下工作。

sentences.chinese: 他们在校内施加了很大的影响力。

sentences.english: We were attacked on our left flank.
sentences.chinese: 我们的左翼受到攻击。

sentences.english: I am very fond of Michael.
sentences.chinese: 我很喜欢迈克尔。

detailed_translations.english: feeling affection for sb, especially sb you have known for a long time

name: forbid

sentences.english: He was forbidden to leave the house, as a punishment.
sentences.chinese: 作为惩罚，他被禁止离开家。

sentences.english: Lack of space forbids listing the names of all those who contributed.
sentences.chinese: 由于篇幅限制，无法列出所有捐款人的姓名。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that they are not allowed to do something, or that something is not allowed

name: haul
trans: The porter said he’d haul our suitcases up to our hotel room.

sentences.english: the steam locomotive which hauled the train
sentences.chinese: 拖动火车的蒸汽机车

sentences.chinese: 我用力拽上了门。

detailed_translations.english: to pull something heavy with a continuous steady movement

detailed_translations.chinese: 拖， 拉， 托运； 一次获得的数量
detailed_translations.english: the amount of fish caught when fishing with a net

name: impair
trans: Regularly eating too much can impair your health.

sentences.english: The illness had impaired his ability to think and concentrate.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病损害了他的思维能力和注意力。

detailed_translations.english: to damage something or make it not as good as it should be

sentences.english: One thing I’ve noticed is that when people have to wait, they become impatient or uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到一件事，就是当人们在等待的时候，人们会变的没有耐心、焦躁不安。

sentences.english: But remember to do your homework before stepping into the conference hall, or you will feel like a rudderless boat in mid-sea.
sentences.chinese: 但是要记得在走进会议大厅之前做好准备工作，否则你会感到就像在大海中间的一艘无舵的小船。

among or in the middle of

sentences.english: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
sentences.chinese: 营养和运动是保持健康所必不可少的。

sentences.english: a nutrition expert
sentences.chinese: 营养专家

detailed_translations.english: the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth

name: optimist

sentences.english: He’s an eternal optimist (= he always believes that good things will happen ).
sentences.chinese: 他是个永远的乐观主义者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who believes that good things will happen

name: background
trans: The new teacher had a background in science and math.

sentences.english: Students with a background in chemistry will probably find the course easier.
sentences.chinese: 学过化学的学生可能会觉得这门课程容易些。

sentences.english: It’s important to understand other people, people from different backgrounds .
sentences.chinese: 要理解别人，理解那些来自不同背景的人，这是很重要的。

sentences.english: Do you know anything about his background?
sentences.chinese: 关于他的背景，你知道什么吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 出身背景， 经历； 背景资料； 背景， 底子
detailed_translations.english: someone’s family, education, previous work etc

name: bait
trans: The best bait for catching fish is a big, fat worm.

sentences.english: We used worms as bait.
sentences.chinese: 我们用小虫子作诱饵。

sentences.english: The fish wouldn’t take the bait .
sentences.chinese: 鱼儿不上钩。

sentences.english: He baited his hook with pie.
sentences.chinese: 他把馅饼放在钓钩上作饵。

sentences.english: The boys dug pits and baited them so that they could spear their prey.
sentences.chinese: 男孩子们挖了陷阱，在里面放上诱饵，以便用矛刺杀猎物。

If you bait a hook or trap, you put bait on it or in it

name: chronicle
trans: The daily newspaper chronicles local and world events.

sentences.english: His life is chronicled in a new biography published last week.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平被写成一本新传记，于上周出版。

sentences.english: The book chronicles the events leading up to the war.
sentences.chinese: 该书记述了导致战争爆发的一系列事件。

detailed_translations.english: to describe events in the order in which they happened

name: copper

sentences.english: He offered to do the job for a few coppers.
sentences.chinese: 他说他来做这份工作，给他几个铜板就行。

sentences.english: His hair has reverted back to its original copper hue.
sentences.chinese: 他的头发恢复到了原来的铜色。

detailed_translations.english: a soft reddish-brown metal that allows electricity and heat to pass through it easily, and is used to make electrical wires, water pipes etc. It is a chemical element: symbol Cu
Copper is sometimes used to describe things that are reddish-brown in colour

name: disease
trans: He had a disease that caused him to lose his hearing.

sentences.english: His father died of heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲死于心脏病。

sentences.english: She contracted the disease while she was abroad on holiday.
sentences.chinese: 她在国外度假时染上了这种疾病。

detailed_translations.chinese: 病， 疾病； 不健全， 弊端
detailed_translations.english: an illness which affects a person, animal, or plant

name: folklore
trans: India’s folklore has stories about great warriors written in long poems.

sentences.english: In Chinese folklore the bat is a symbol of good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 在中国民间传说中，蝙蝠是好运的象征。

detailed_translations.chinese: 民俗学；民间传说；民间风俗
detailed_translations.english: the traditional stories, customs etc of a particular area or country

name: infect
trans: The common cold infects hundreds of millions of people each year.

sentences.english: People with the virus may feel perfectly well, but they can still infect others.
sentences.chinese: 带有这种病毒的人可能毫无症状，却仍可能传染他人。

sentences.english: He thought they might infect others with their bourgeois ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他认为他们可能用中产阶级思想去影响别人。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone a disease

name: itch
trans: The rough fabric in his shirt made his neck itch.

sentences.english: Scratch my back – I have an itch.
sentences.chinese: 给我挠挠背——我觉得痒。

detailed_translations.english: an uncomfortable feeling on your skin that makes you want to rub it with your nails
if part of your body or your clothes itch, you have an unpleasant feeling on your skin that makes you want to rub it with your nails

name: literature
trans: Early American literature covers the poetry and stories from 1500 to 1800.

sentences.english: He has read many of the major works of literature.
sentences.chinese: 他读过许多重要的文学作品。

sentences.english: Italian literature
sentences.chinese: 意大利文学

sentences.english: literature on the history of science
sentences.chinese: 科学史的文献资料

detailed_translations.chinese: 文学，文学作品；文献；文献
detailed_translations.english: books, plays, poems etc that people think are important and good

name: millennium
trans: Stonehenge is believed to have been built about five millennia ago.

sentences.english: people who have inhabited this land for millennia
sentences.chinese: 在这片土地上已经居住了数千年的人们

detailed_translations.chinese: 千年期，千禧年；一千年，千年纪念；太平盛世，黄金时代
detailed_translations.english: a period of 1,000 years

name: myth
trans: In Greece, there was a myth about a woman who had snakes for hair.

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

name: promote
trans: After two years at the company, she was promoted to manager.

sentences.english: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 你们没有必要牺牲环保来促进经济增长。

detailed_translations.english: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

name: relate
trans: A company’s plan usually relates to how much profit it can make.

sentences.english: The report seeks to relate the rise in crime to an increase in unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 报告试图把犯罪率上升和失业增加联系起来。

sentences.english: He later related the whole story to me.
sentences.chinese: 他后来给我讲了整件事的来龙去脉。

detailed_translations.english: if you relate two different things, you show how they are connected

name: religion
trans: Their religion taught that people should forgive their enemies.

sentences.english: The U.S. Constitution promises freedom of religion.
sentences.chinese: 美国宪法保证宗教信仰自由。

sentences.english: a course on philosophy and religion
sentences.chinese: 关于哲学和宗教的课程

sentences.english: the Islamic religion
sentences.chinese: 伊斯兰教

detailed_translations.english: a belief in one or more gods

name: sum
trans: He calculated the numbers to see what the sum of his bills would be.

sentences.english: He owes me a large sum of money .
sentences.chinese: 他欠我一大笔钱。

sentences.english: You will have to pay the sum of the two sets of costs.
sentences.chinese: 你得支付那两笔费用的总和。

sentences.english: I was good at sums at school.
sentences.chinese: 我上学时擅长算术。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money

name: teller
trans: The teller at the bank helped Kelly put money into a savings account.

sentences.english: Every bank pays close attention to the speed and accuracy of its tellers.
sentences.chinese: 每家银行都密切关注其出纳员的速度和准确性。

detailed_translations.chinese: （美）出纳员；讲述者；讲故事者；计票员
detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to receive and pay out money in a bank

name: trustworthy
trans: Mary is one of the most trustworthy people I’ve ever met.

sentences.english: He is a trustworthy and level-headed leader.
sentences.chinese: 他是个可信赖的、头脑冷静的领导。

detailed_translations.english: able to be trusted and depended on

name: update
trans: We need to update the programs on our computers.

sentences.english: The files need updating.
sentences.chinese: 这些档案需要更新。

detailed_translations.english: to add the most recent information to something
the most recent news or information about something

name: vein
trans: The blue veins in my hand are just under my skin.

sentences.english: the pulmonary vein
sentences.chinese: 肺静脉

sentences.english: She felt the blood racing through her veins as they kissed.
sentences.chinese: 他们接吻时她觉得热血沸腾。

detailed_translations.chinese: 血管；叶脉；[地质] 岩脉；纹理；翅脉；性情
detailed_translations.english: one of the tubes which carries blood to your heart from other parts of your body

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成脉络；象脉络般分布于

name: venom
trans: A snake’s venom can be used to cure the illnesses it creates.

sentences.english: There was real venom in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她的声音非常凶狠。

sentences.english: a look of pure venom
sentences.chinese: 恶毒的表情

detailed_translations.english: great anger or hatred

name: charity
trans: Thanks to his friends’ charity, he had enough money to pay the rent.

sentences.english: Several charities sent aid to the flood victims.
sentences.chinese: 有几家慈善机构已向洪灾灾民送去了救援物资。

detailed_translations.english: an organization that gives money, goods, or help to people who are poor, sick etc

name: commerce
trans: The new shopping mall increased the commerce in that section of town.

sentences.english: measures promoting local commerce and industry
sentences.chinese: 促进地方工商业发展的措施

detailed_translations.english: the buying and selling of goods and services

name: condemn
trans: The judge condemned the criminal to five years in prison.

sentences.english: Politicians were quick to condemn the bombing.
sentences.chinese: 政治家们立即对爆炸事件进行了谴责。

sentences.english: He was found guilty and condemned to death.
sentences.chinese: 他被裁定有罪，判了死刑。

detailed_translations.english: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

name: cozy
trans: The thick blanket made the bed very cozy.

sentences.english: And on that bed there is a granny, a snoring granny on a cozy bed in a napping house, where everyone is sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 床上有一位老奶奶，一个打着鼾的奶奶睡在舒适的床上，在那打瞌睡的房子里，每个人都在睡觉。

sentences.english: And on that bed there is a granny, a snoring granny on a cozy bed in a napping house, where everyone is sleeping.
sentences.chinese: 那张床上有一位老奶奶，在那打瞌睡的房子里，一个打着鼾奶奶睡在舒适的床上，在那里每个人都在睡觉。

sentences.english: Likewise, the good habit of doing exercises every day means repeatedly dragging oneself away from the TV series and cozy couch.
sentences.chinese: 同样，每天进行锻炼的良好习惯意味着日复一日强迫自己远离电视剧和舒适的沙发。

detailed_translations.chinese: 舒适的； 亲切友好的

name: deplete
trans: All the driving he was doing was depleting his car’s fuel supply.

sentences.english: ...substances that deplete the ozone layer.
sentences.chinese: …消耗臭氧层的物质。

detailed_translations.chinese: 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚
detailed_translations.english: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

name: economy
trans: The factory was good for the economy because it brought jobs to the area.

sentences.english: a successful economy
sentences.chinese: 发展成功的经济

sentences.english: the slowdown in the Japanese economy
sentences.chinese: 日本经济的减缓

sentences.english: The gas fire was turned low for reasons of economy.
sentences.chinese: 为了节省，把煤气取暖器开小了。

detailed_translations.english: the system by which a country’s money and goods are produced and used, or a country considered in this way

name: empire
trans: The emperor built roads to make travel easier throughout the empire.

sentences.english: the Roman empire
sentences.chinese: 罗马帝国

detailed_translations.english: a group of countries that are all controlled by one ruler or government

name: goods
trans: Shoes, hats, dresses, and purses were the goods she wanted to buy.

sentences.english: a goods train
sentences.chinese: 一列货车

sentences.english: the large market for consumer goods
sentences.chinese: 庞大的消费品市场

sentences.english: Britain’s leading exporter of manufactured goods
sentences.chinese: 英国主要的工业制成品出口商

sentences.english: There will be tax increases on a range of goods and services .
sentences.chinese: 有一些商品和服务将要增税。

detailed_translations.english: things which are carried by road, train etc

name: heed
trans: You should heed the advice on the sign and not drive so fast.

sentences.english: The government was taking little heed of these threats.
sentences.chinese: 政府对这些威胁几乎不当回事。

sentences.english: Tom paid no heed to her warning.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆根本没有理会她的警告。

detailed_translations.english: to pay attention to something, especially something someone says, and seriously consider it
to pay attention to someone’s advice or warning

name: hitchhike
trans: She didn’t have a car, so she hitchhiked several miles to her brother’s home.

sentences.english: Neff hitchhiked to New York during his Christmas holiday.
sentences.chinese: 内夫在圣诞节休假期间搭免费便车去了纽约。

name: mock
trans: The girls mocked Nancy because she was a new student.

sentences.english: Opposition MPs mocked the government’s decision.
sentences.chinese: 反对党议员讥笑政府的这一决策。

sentences.english: ‘Running away?’ he mocked.
sentences.chinese: “想逃跑？”他取笑道。

sentences.english: It’s easy for you to mock, but we put a lot of work into this play.
sentences.chinese: 你讲风凉话是很轻松，但我们这出戏可是费了很大力气的。

detailed_translations.english: to laugh at someone or something and try to make them look stupid by saying unkind things about them or by copying them

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿制的， 假装的；模拟的， 演习的
detailed_translations.english: not real, but intended to be very similar to a real situation, substance etc
school examinations taken as practice before official examinations

name: neutral
trans: The girl’s friend remained neutral while the couple was arguing.

sentences.english: I always tried to remain neutral when they started arguing.
sentences.chinese: 他们争论起来的时候我总是努力保持中立。

sentences.english: Clive decided to adopt a neutral position.
sentences.chinese: 克莱夫决定采取中立立场。

sentences.english: The British government acted as a neutral observer during the talks.
sentences.chinese: 英国政府在会谈中扮演了中立观察员的角色。

sentences.english: the neutral language of an official news report
sentences.chinese: 官方新闻报道采用的中性语言

detailed_translations.english: not supporting any of the people or groups involved in an argument or disagreement

name: persecute
trans: Dan felt persecuted because he was smaller than the other boys at school.

sentences.english: The Puritans left England to escape being persecuted.
sentences.chinese: 清教徒离开了英国以躲避迫害。

detailed_translations.english: to treat someone cruelly or unfairly over a period of time, especially because of their religious or political beliefs

name: pity
trans: Because she had pity for the lost boy, she helped him find his parents.

sentences.english: It’s a great pity Joyce wasn’t invited.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯没有受到邀请太遗憾了。

sentences.english: I like Charlie. Pity he had to marry that awful woman.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢查利，遗憾的是他得和那个糟糕的女人结婚。

sentences.english: A pity we can’t find the guy who did it.
sentences.chinese: 真遗憾我们找不到那个干了这件事的家伙。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you are disappointed about something and you wish things could happen differently

detailed_translations.chinese: 对……表示怜悯；对……感到同情
detailed_translations.english: to feel sorry for someone because they are in a very bad situation

name: reduce
trans: When the store reduced its prices, people wanted to shop there.

sentences.english: The governor announced a new plan to reduce crime.
sentences.chinese: 州长宣布了一项降低犯罪率的新计划。

sentences.english: The helmet law should reduce injuries in motorcycle accidents.
sentences.chinese: 头盔法的实施应该能减少摩托车事故的受伤率。

sentences.english: Small businesses will need to reduce costs in order to survive.
sentences.chinese: 小企业要想生存必须削减成本。

detailed_translations.english: to make something smaller or less in size, amount, or price

name: scribe
trans: In ancient Egypt, scribes recorded important events.

sentences.english: Might I your scribe and your confessor be.
sentences.chinese: 我可以你和你的忏悔神父是抄写员。

sentences.english: I stepped out of his office and was brought to a small window near the exit, behind which sat a scribe who I knew must be a prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 我走出他的办公室，被带到监狱出口处的一个小窗户边。窗后坐着一个抄写员，我知道他肯定是个囚徒。

detailed_translations.english: someone in the past whose job was to make written copies of official documents

name: temper
trans: She has a temper. Even the slightest mistakes make her angry.

sentences.english: Pete hit his brother in a fit of temper .
sentences.chinese: 皮特一气之下打了他弟弟。

detailed_translations.english: the way you are feeling at a particular time, especially when you are feeling angry for a short time

detailed_translations.chinese: 调和， 使缓和； 【冶】使回火
detailed_translations.english: to make something less severe or extreme

name: throne
trans: Nobody except the king and queen sat in the thrones in the great hall.

sentences.english: He is next in line to the throne (= will become king when the present ruler dies ) .
sentences.chinese: 他是第一王位继承人。

sentences.english: In 1913, George V was on the throne (= was ruling ) .
sentences.chinese: 1913年乔治五世在位。

detailed_translations.english: the position and power of being a king or queen

name: unity
trans: The project was finished early thanks to the unity of the workers.

sentences.english: economic unity
sentences.chinese: 经济统一

sentences.english: European unity
sentences.chinese: 欧洲的一体化

detailed_translations.english: when a group of people or countries agree or are joined together

name: victor
trans: At the end of the game, the blue team were the victors.

sentences.english: After the game the victors returned in triumph.
sentences.chinese: 比赛结束后，得胜者凯旋。

detailed_translations.english: the winner of a battle, game, competition etc

name: accurate
trans: The story in the newspaper wasn’t very accurate.

sentences.english: The brochure tries to give a fair and accurate description of each hotel.
sentences.chinese: 该手册尽量公正、准确地介绍每一家酒店。

detailed_translations.english: correct and true in every detail

name: analyze
trans: The scientist will analyze the blood sample.

sentences.english: How do you analyze this change?
sentences.chinese: 你该如何分析这种变化？

sentences.english: You have to hoover anything before you can analyze it.
sentences.chinese: 在你不具备分析能力之前，你只得胡乱吸收你所能学到的东西。

sentences.english: We should learn to discern and analyze the essentials of complicated questions.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该学会认识和分析复杂问题的本质。

name: asteroid
trans: In 1908, a giant asteroid hit Siberia.

sentences.english: Astronomers have detected an asteroid not far from Earth, moving in the same orbit around the Sun.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家在距离地球不远处发现一颗与地球绕日轨道相同的小行星。

sentences.english: Look at the movies that we see all the time. It's easy to imagine the end of the world. An asteroid destroying all life and so on.
sentences.chinese: 瞧瞧那些我们一直在看的电影，要想像世界末日那是很容易的事，比如一个小行星毁灭了所有生命之类的。

sentences.english: Moving on through the asteroid belt we enter the realms of the gas giant planets: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune, all of which dwarf the Earth.
sentences.chinese: 穿过小行星带继续前进，我们进入了气体巨行星区域：木星、土星、天王星、海王星，所有这些都使地球看起来像个侏儒。

detailed_translations.english: one of the many small  planet s  that move around the Sun, especially between Mars and Jupiter

name: controversy
trans: There has been a lot of controversy over the judge’s decision.

sentences.english: a political controversy
sentences.chinese: 政治争议

sentences.english: the controversy surrounding Skinner’s theories
sentences.chinese: 围绕斯金纳的理论的争议

sentences.english: (= began ) over the use of the chemicals on crops.
sentences.chinese: 对庄稼施用化学品的做法引起了争论。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument about something that involves many people and continues for a long time

name: evolve
trans: Many people think that humans evolved from animals.

sentences.english: The school has evolved its own style of teaching.
sentences.chinese: 学校逐步形成了自己的教学风格。

sentences.english: Businesses need to evolve rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 各项业务需要快速发展。

detailed_translations.english: to develop and change gradually over a long period of time

name: factor
trans: Smoking is the main factor that causes lung cancer.

sentences.english: The rise in crime is mainly due to social and economic factors.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率上升主要由社会和经济因素造成。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因素， 因子； 系数
detailed_translations.english: one of several things that influence or cause a situation

name: genetic
trans: The color of one’s eyes is genetic.

sentences.english: genetic defects
sentences.chinese: 遗传性缺陷

sentences.english: each person’s genetic make-up
sentences.chinese: 每个人的遗传特征

sentences.english: genetic research
sentences.chinese: 基因研究

detailed_translations.english: relating to genes or genetics

name: genome
trans: Understanding the human genome may help cure many diseases.

sentences.english: the human genome
sentences.chinese: 人类基因组

detailed_translations.english: all the  genes  in one type of living thing

name: identical
trans: James and John are identical twins.

sentences.english: four identical houses
sentences.chinese: 四幢一模一样的房子

detailed_translations.english: exactly the same, or very similar

name: intellectual
trans: We’ve always considered my Uncle Max to be the intellectual of the family.

sentences.english: Mark’s very intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 马克很聪明。

detailed_translations.english: relating to the ability to understand things and think intelligently
an intelligent, well-educated person who spends time thinking about complicated ideas and discussing them

name: majority
trans: A majority of the people voted for Tom Smith in the election.

sentences.english: The Labour Party won a huge majority at the last general election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上次大选中以巨大的票数优势获胜。

detailed_translations.english: most of the people or things in a group

name: mammal
trans: Even though they live in water, whales are actually mammals.

sentences.english: A whale is a kind of mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸是一种哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The whale is a mammal.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼是哺乳动物。

sentences.english: The problem with that theory is that no other mammal has resorted to this method of cooling down.
sentences.chinese: 这一理论的问题在于，没有其他的哺乳动物采取了这种降低体温的方式。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that drinks milk from its mother’s body when it is young. Humans, dogs, and whales are mammals.

name: multiply
trans: In the past year, the number of people at work has multiplied by ten percent.

sentences.english: Children will learn to multiply in the second grade.
sentences.chinese: 儿童在二年级学习乘法。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乘；使增加；使繁殖；使相乘
detailed_translations.english: to do a calculation in which you add a number to itself a particular number of times

name: offspring
trans: The dog’s offspring had the same color of fur as she did.

sentences.english: a young mother trying to control her offspring
sentences.chinese: 一个想管住自己孩子的年轻妈妈

detailed_translations.english: someone’s child or children – often used humorously

name: pesticide
trans: The farmer sprayed his crops with a pesticide to keep bugs away.

sentences.english: They sprinkled pesticide to bug the potatoes .
sentences.chinese: 他们喷撒杀虫剂给马铃薯除虫。

sentences.english: This resulted in the contamination of the bags used in that facility's fluid bed dryers with pesticide contamination.
sentences.chinese: 这导致了由于工厂的流体床干燥器被杀虫剂污染而把使用的包装袋污染。

sentences.english: Investigators in Japan have found punctures on the outside of at least one of the bags tied to the poisonings as well as traces of the pesticide.
sentences.chinese: 日本调查人员在其中至少一袋涉及中毒案的饺子的外包装袋上发现了刺孔以及杀虫剂的痕迹。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical substance used to kill insects and small animals that destroy crops

name: regulate
trans: The bank regulates how much money people can borrow.

sentences.english: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
sentences.chinese: 人出汗以调节体温。

detailed_translations.english: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc

name: reinforce
trans: Peter reinforced his opinion with information from a book.

sentences.english: I hope this will reinforce Indonesian determination to deal with this kind of threat.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这会加强印度尼西亚对付这类威胁的决心。

sentences.english: Both sides have been reinforcing their positions after yesterday's fierce fighting.
sentences.chinese: 在昨天的激战后，双方一直在增援各自的阵地。

detailed_translations.english: to give support to an opinion, idea, or feeling, and make it stronger

name: stricken
trans: The pilot landed the stricken airplane with difficulty.

sentences.english: Fire broke out on the stricken ship.
sentences.chinese: 失事船只起火了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 患病的；受挫折的；受…侵袭的；遭殃的
detailed_translations.english: very badly affected by trouble, illness, unhappiness etc

name: vast
trans: The wealthy man bought a vast amount of land in the countryside.

sentences.english: The refugees come across the border in vast numbers.
sentences.chinese: 大量难民涌过边境。

sentences.english: In the past five years, there has been a vast improvement in graduation rates.
sentences.chinese: 过去的五年内，毕业率大幅度提高。

detailed_translations.chinese: 巨大的， 大量的； 浩瀚的
detailed_translations.english: extremely large

name: vegetarian
trans: I became a vegetarian because I don’t like the taste of meat.

sentences.english: Our youngest daughter is a vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 我们的小女儿是个素食主义者。

sentences.english: dishes suitable for vegetarians
sentences.chinese: 适合素食者的菜肴

sentences.english: I’m thinking about becoming a vegetarian.
sentences.chinese: 我在考虑戒除荤食。

sentences.english: Yasmin sticks to a strict vegetarian diet.
sentences.chinese: 亚斯敏坚持一种严格的纯素饮食。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does not eat meat or fish
Someone who is vegetarian never eats meat or fish

name: bowl
trans: I put the fruit in the fruit bowl.

sentences.english: Mix all the ingredients thoroughly in a large bowl.
sentences.chinese: 将所有配料放在大碗里搅拌均匀。

sentences.english: Fill the bowl with water.
sentences.chinese: 在碗里装满水。

detailed_translations.english: a wide round container that is open at the top, used to hold liquids, food, flowers etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 玩保龄球；滑动；平稳快速移动
detailed_translations.english: to travel along very quickly and smoothly

name: cooking
trans: I really enjoy cooking, especially Italian food.

sentences.english: He did the cooking, cleaning, laundry, and home repairs.
sentences.chinese: 他做饭、打扫卫生、洗衣服，还在家修修补补。

detailed_translations.english: Cooking is the activity of preparing food

name: dense
trans: I easily became lost in the dense forest.

sentences.english: a dense rurally-based population
sentences.chinese: 居住在乡村的密集人口

sentences.english: dense fog/smoke/fumes
sentences.chinese: 浓雾 / 烟；浓烈的气体

detailed_translations.english: containing a lot of people, things, plants, etc. with little space between them

name: dignity
trans: When his company went out of business, he faced it with dignity.

sentences.english: We do this because we believe in the dignity and value of every person.
sentences.chinese: 我们这样做是因为我们相信每个人的尊严和价值。

sentences.english: They have to be treated well, with dignity.
sentences.chinese: 必须善待申请人，让人有尊严。

sentences.english: This award must be shared with everyone who strives for justice and dignity.
sentences.chinese: 我一定要与所有为正义和尊严奋斗的人分享此奖。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to behave in a calm controlled way even in a difficult situation

name: dominate
trans: The loud man dominated the conversation.

sentences.english: The industry is dominated by five multinational companies.
sentences.chinese: 这个行业受五家跨国公司控制。

sentences.english: New Orleans dominated throughout the game.
sentences.chinese: 新奥尔良队自始至终都控制着这场比赛。

sentences.english: Her loud voice totally dominated the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 她的大嗓门完全主导着这场谈话。

sentences.english: Education issues dominated the election campaign.
sentences.chinese: 教育问题成了这次选举活动的主要辩题。

detailed_translations.english: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

name: earthen
trans: The house’s roof was made of earthen tiles.

detailed_translations.chinese: 土制的；陶制的；地球上的
detailed_translations.english: an earthen floor or wall is made of soil

name: hostile
trans: We were happy to move away from our hostile neighbor.

sentences.english: Southampton fans gave their former coach a hostile reception .
sentences.chinese: 南安普敦队的球迷对球队的前任教练很不友善。

sentences.english: Carr wouldn’t meet Feng’s stare, which was openly hostile .
sentences.chinese: 卡尔不愿意面对冯公然敌视的目光。

sentences.english: his hostile attitude
sentences.chinese: 他敌对的态度

detailed_translations.english: angry and deliberately unfriendly towards someone, and ready to argue with them

name: incorrect
trans: Your answer is incorrect. You need to correct it.

sentences.english: The information you gave us was incorrect.
sentences.chinese: 你给我们的信息不准确。

detailed_translations.english: not correct or true

name: intake
trans: The doctor said I needed to increase my intake of fruits and vegetables.

sentences.english: Your intake of alcohol should not exceed two units per day.
sentences.chinese: 你每天酒精摄入量不能超过两个单位。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of food, drink etc that you take into your body

name: likewise
trans: If Joe is not going to school so he can go swimming, I want to do likewise.

sentences.english: Nanny put on a shawl and told the girls to do likewise.
sentences.chinese: 南妮披上披肩，并叫女孩们也这样做。

sentences.english: The clams were delicious. Likewise, the eggplant was excellent.
sentences.chinese: 蛤蜊味道鲜美，茄子也同样美味。

sentences.english: ‘You’re always welcome at our house.’ ‘Likewise.’
sentences.chinese: “欢迎你随时来我家做客。”“你也一样。

detailed_translations.english: in the same way

name: machine
trans: The machine was broken.

sentences.english: Could you get me a coffee from the drinks machine ?
sentences.chinese: 给我从自动饮料机里买一罐咖啡好吗？

sentences.english: The fax machine is broken.
sentences.chinese: 传真机坏了。

sentences.english: Did you put my dirty shirts in the machine (= washing machine ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你把我的脏衬衫放进洗衣机里了吗？

sentences.english: I left a message for you on your machine (= telephone answering machine ) .
sentences.chinese: 我在你的电话答录机里留了言。

sentences.english: The machine wouldn’t let me have any money (= cash machine ) .
sentences.chinese: 自动取款机不让我取钱。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment with moving parts that uses power such as electricity to do a particular job

name: medication
trans: The doctor gave me medication to treat my illness.

sentences.english: When somebody comes for treatment I always ask them if they are on any medication.
sentences.chinese: 有人来治疗时，我总是会问他们是否在服药。

detailed_translations.chinese: 药物；药物治疗；药物处理
detailed_translations.english: medicine or drugs given to people who are ill

name: obscure
trans: The old man travels the world in search of obscure books.

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.english: Trees obscured his vision; he couldn't see much of the square's southern half.
sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不著名的，不重要的；费解的，模糊不清的
detailed_translations.english: not well known and usually not very important
If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

name: oppress
trans: Free speech had been oppressed in his country.

sentences.english: native tribes oppressed by the authorities
sentences.chinese: 受到当局压迫的土著部落

detailed_translations.chinese: 压迫， 压制； 使沉重， 使烦恼
detailed_translations.english: to treat a group of people unfairly or cruelly, and prevent them from having the same rights that other people in society have

name: peel
trans: He peeled the apple before eating it.

sentences.english: Peel and dice the potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 把马铃薯去皮并切成丁。

detailed_translations.english: to remove the skin from fruit or vegetables
to remove the skin from fruit or vegetables
the skin of some fruits and vegetables, especially the thick skin of fruits such as oranges, which you do not eat

name: prescription
trans: The doctor gave me a prescription for my medication.

sentences.english: The new drug will not require a physician's prescription.
sentences.chinese: 这种新药不需要医生的处方。

sentences.english: If you’re pregnant, you can get free prescriptions.
sentences.chinese: 要是怀孕的话可以获得免费的处方药。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist

name: progress
trans: There are clear signs of progress.

sentences.english: The police are disappointed by the slow pro-gress of the investigation.
sentences.chinese: 警方对调查进度缓慢感到失望。

sentences.english: We made good progress despite the snow.
sentences.chinese: 尽管下雪，我们的行程还是很顺利。

sentences.english: I asked the nurse how my son was progressing.
sentences.chinese: 我询问护士我儿子身体恢复得如何。

detailed_translations.english: the process of getting better at doing something, or getting closer to finishing or achieving something
to improve, develop, or achieve things so that you are then at a more advanced stage

name: sandy
trans: I love walking on a sandy beach.

sentences.english: The soil is quite sandy.
sentences.chinese: 这种土壤沙很多。

detailed_translations.english: covered with sand or containing a lot of sand

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sandy)人名；(法、喀、罗、西、英)桑迪(教名Alasdair、Alastair、Alexander、Alister、Elshender的昵称)

name: shortage
trans: During the dry season, there was a shortage of water.

sentences.english: There is no heating available due to fuel shortages.
sentences.chinese: 因为燃料短缺，所以没有供暖。

sentences.english: There is no shortage of funds.
sentences.chinese: 不缺资金。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there is not enough of something that people need

name: skillful
trans: The carpenter is very skillful at building houses.

sentences.english: With a skillful movement he rounded the small fishing-boat.
sentences.chinese: 他以灵巧的动作使小渔船调过头来。

sentences.english: I like making things by hand because my mother is very skillful, and I liked staying with her when I was young.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢亲手作一些东西，这是因为我母亲的手非常巧，而且我小的时候喜欢同她在一起。

sentences.english: They understand that development is a difficult social activity that can be conquered not by a silver bullet, but rather by dedicated, skillful practitioners who know and leverage proven techniques.
sentences.chinese: 开发是一项有难度的社会活动，不仅不能够通过银弹来征服，而是由理解并实施可靠技术的那些专注且熟练的人们来解决。

name: aircraft
trans: At the museum in the airport, you can see a lot of old aircraft.

sentences.english: The return flight of the aircraft was delayed.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的返回航程被推迟了。

detailed_translations.english: a plane or other vehicle that can fly

name: celebrity
trans: It was the highlight of the evening when the celebrities arrived.

sentences.english: a sporting celebrity
sentences.chinese: 体育明星

sentences.english: He’s a national celebrity.
sentences.chinese: 他是全国有名的人物。

sentences.english: We invited a number of minor celebrities (= people who are not very famous ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请了一些小有名气的人物。

sentences.english: celebrity chef/gardener etc
sentences.chinese: 名厨/名人园艺师等

detailed_translations.english: a famous living person

name: concrete
trans: The man covered the ground with concrete.

sentences.english: What does that mean in concrete terms ?
sentences.chinese: 具体来说那到底是什么意思？

sentences.english: the lack of any concrete evidence
sentences.chinese: 缺少具体证据的

sentences.english: a dialogue about concrete issues and problems
sentences.chinese: 有关具体事情和问题的对话

detailed_translations.english: definite and specific

name: decisive
trans: Our boss is very decisive, so it did not take long to organize the project.

sentences.english: a decisive factor/victory/battle
sentences.chinese: 决定性的因素 / 胜利 / 战役

sentences.english: a decisive leader
sentences.chinese: 果断的领袖

detailed_translations.english: very important for the final result of a particular situation

name: esteemed
trans: An esteemed scientist is coming to the university to talk about his discoveries.

name: ethical
trans: Many people believe that it is ethical to help others in need.

sentences.english: The president must have the highest ethical standards.
sentences.chinese: 总统必须具备最高的道德水准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的
detailed_translations.english: relating to principles of what is right and wrong

name: extinct
trans: There used to be dinosaurs all over the world, but now they are extinct.

sentences.english: Dinosaurs have been extinct for millions of years.
sentences.chinese: 恐龙已灭绝数千万年了。

sentences.english: Pandas could become extinct in the wild.
sentences.chinese: 熊猫在野生环境中可能会绝种。

sentences.english: an extinct species
sentences.chinese: 已灭绝的一个物种

detailed_translations.english: (of a type of plant, animal, etc.) no longer in existence

name: hardy
trans: The farmer is a hardy man and doesn’t mind working outside.

sentences.english: hardy mountain goats
sentences.chinese: 能适应恶劣环境的石山羊

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚强的；勇敢的；能吃苦耐劳的；鲁莽的
detailed_translations.english: strong and healthy and able to bear difficult living conditions

detailed_translations.chinese: 强壮的人；耐寒植物；方柄凿
detailed_translations.english: any blacksmith's tool made with a square shank so that it can be lodged in a square hole in an anvil

name: institute
trans: I am going to a lecture about Ancient Rome at the Historical Institute.

sentences.english: We will institute a number of measures to better safeguard the public.
sentences.chinese: 我们将制定许多措施更好地保护公众。

sentences.english: research institutes
sentences.chinese: 研究所

detailed_translations.english: If you institute a system, rule, or course of action, you start it

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔从事科研或教育等的〕机构；学院；研究院
detailed_translations.english: an organization that has a particular purpose such as scientific or educational work, or the building where this organization is based

name: jealousy
trans: She felt a lot of jealousy when she saw her friend with a new car.

sentences.english: Sexual jealousy is a common motive for murder.
sentences.chinese: 性嫉妒是常见的谋杀动机。

sentences.english: feelings of professional jealousy
sentences.chinese: 职业上的嫉妒感

sentences.english: He quickly discovered the petty jealousies and gossip of village life.
sentences.chinese: 他很快就发现，在乡村生活中，人们狭隘善妒，喜欢传播流言蜚语。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of being jealous

name: migrate
trans: Many birds migrate to warmer countries in the winter.

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: nurture
trans: Robert nurtured his plants, and that is why they grow so well.

sentences.english: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
sentences.chinese: 在温室里培育的植物

detailed_translations.english: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

name: overhead
trans: As we sat on the top of the hill, a plane flew overhead.

sentences.english: Bullets whizzed overhead.
sentences.chinese: 子弹嗖嗖地掠过头顶。

sentences.english: A plane flew overhead.
sentences.chinese: 一架飞机从头顶飞过。

sentences.english: She turned on the overhead light and looked around the little room.
sentences.chinese: 她打开顶灯，环视这间小屋。

detailed_translations.english: above your head or in the sky
You use overhead to indicate that something is above you or above the place that you are talking about

detailed_translations.chinese: 经常费用， 管理费用
detailed_translations.english: money spent regularly on rent, insurance, electricity, and other things that are needed to keep a business operating

name: principle
trans: To maintain principles, it’s vital to watch, listen, and speak carefully.

sentences.english: Schools try to teach children a set of principles.
sentences.chinese: 学校设法教给孩子们一套道德准则。

sentences.english: He’s got no principles at all!
sentences.chinese: 他毫无道德准则！

sentences.english: It’s against my principles to accept gifts from clients.
sentences.chinese: 收受客户礼物违背我的原则。

detailed_translations.english: a moral rule or belief about what is right and wrong, that influences how you behave

name: rural
trans: I want to live in a small house in a rural area.

sentences.english: a rural setting
sentences.chinese: 乡村环境

sentences.english: rural bus routes
sentences.chinese: 乡村公共汽车路线

detailed_translations.english: happening in or relating to the countryside, not the city

name: secluded
trans: There was a secluded bench in the park.

sentences.english: He’s 80 years old now and lives a very secluded life.
sentences.chinese: 他现在80岁了，过着远离尘嚣的生活。

detailed_translations.english: very private and quiet

name: species
trans: There are 21 different species of butterfly in this forest.

sentences.english: Seven species of birds of prey have been observed.
sentences.chinese: 已有七种猛禽被观察到。

sentences.english: pandas and other endangered species
sentences.chinese: 熊猫以及其他濒危物种

detailed_translations.english: a group of animals or plants whose members are similar and can breed together to produce young animals or plants

name: swamp
trans: There are lots of wild animals living in the swamp.

sentences.english: I spent one whole night by a swamp behind the road listening to frogs.
sentences.chinese: 我整个晚上都在这条路后面的一个沼泽地旁听蛙鸣。

sentences.english: Their electronic navigation failed and a rogue wave swamped the boat.
sentences.chinese: 他们的电子导航装置失灵了，一个巨浪吞没了那只船。

detailed_translations.english: land that is always very wet or covered with a layer of water

detailed_translations.chinese: 使陷于沼泽；使沉没；使陷入困境
detailed_translations.english: If something swamps a place or object, it fills it with water

name: traverse
trans: The explorer traversed the desert alone on a camel.

sentences.english: two minutes to traverse the park
sentences.chinese: 两分钟横穿公园

detailed_translations.english: a sideways movement across a very steep slope in mountain-climbing

detailed_translations.chinese: 穿过；反对；详细研究；在…来回移动
detailed_translations.english: to move across, over, or through something, especially an area of land or water

name: zoology
trans: Helen wants to study zoology because she has always liked animals.

sentences.english: The scholarship money she won helped her attend Cornell University, where she majored in zoology.
sentences.chinese: 她赢得的奖学金帮助她上康奈尔大学，在那里他主修动物学。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of animals and their behaviour

name: accordingly
trans: He feels like he did a good job and his boss should pay him accordingly.

sentences.english: We have to discover his plans and act accordingly.
sentences.chinese: 我们得找出他的计划，照着办。

sentences.english: Some of the laws were contradictory. Accordingly, measures were taken to clarify them.
sentences.chinese: 有些法律相互矛盾，因此，采取了措施将其阐明。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is appropriate to what has been done or said in a particular situation

name: anchor
trans: When the ship reached its destination, the crew dropped the anchor.

sentences.english: We dropped anchor a few yards offshore.
sentences.chinese: 我们在离岸几码远的地方抛锚停航。

sentences.english: The next morning, they weighed anchor (=  lifted the anchor  ) and began to move south again.
sentences.chinese: 第二天早上他们起锚，又开始向南航行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 锚；抛锚停泊；靠山；新闻节目主播
detailed_translations.english: a piece of heavy metal that is lowered to the bottom of the sea, a lake etc to prevent a ship or boat moving
to fasten something firmly so that it cannot move

name: cause
trans: Tiredness caused the accident.

sentences.english: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.english: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.chinese: 不必惊慌。

sentences.english: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

detailed_translations.english: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

name: context
trans: They studied the context of the battle before giving their presentation.

sentences.english: The meaning of ‘mad’ depends on its context.
sentences.chinese: mad一词的意义要视上下文而定。

sentences.english: the political context of the election
sentences.chinese: 此次选举的政治背景

detailed_translations.english: the words that come just before and after a word or sentence and that help you understand its meaning

name: designate
trans: The famous lighthouse was designated as a historical monument.

sentences.english: This floor has been designated a no-smoking area.
sentences.chinese: 这楼层已定为无烟区。

sentences.english: Buildings are designated by red squares on the map.
sentences.chinese: 在地图上建筑物用红色方块标明。

detailed_translations.english: to say officially that sth has a particular character or name; to describe sth in a particular way

name: distort
trans: The man’s lawyer distorted the facts so that he would be set free.

sentences.english: His account was badly distorted by the press.
sentences.chinese: 他的话被报界严重歪曲。

sentences.english: an expensive subsidy which distorts the market
sentences.chinese: 扰乱市场秩序的高价补贴

detailed_translations.english: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

name: dock
trans: The huge ship pulled into the dock, and the crew unloaded the cargo.

sentences.english: The crash happened as the ferry attempted to dock on Staten Island.
sentences.chinese: 这次碰撞发生于渡船试图停靠在斯塔滕岛时。

detailed_translations.english: if a ship docks, or if the captain docks it, it sails into a dock so that it can unload
a place in a port where ships are loaded, unloaded, or repaired
if a ship docks, or if the captain docks it, it sails into a dock so that it can unload

name: energy
trans: If you lack energy, try eating better food.

sentences.english: Where do those kids get their energy from?
sentences.chinese: 那些孩子哪来这么多精力？

sentences.english: I really put a lot of energy into what I do.
sentences.chinese: 我做起事来总是投入很大精力。

sentences.english: kinetic energy
sentences.chinese: 动能

detailed_translations.english: the physical and mental strength that makes you able to do things

name: frequent
trans: While Dad was sick, the doctor made frequent visits to his house.

sentences.english: Trains rushed past at frequent intervals .
sentences.chinese: 火车频频驶过。

sentences.english: She was a frequent visitor to the house.
sentences.chinese: 她是家里的常客。

detailed_translations.english: happening or doing something often
to go to a particular place often

name: gears
trans: My brother has a car with four gears.

name: genuine
trans: After the painting was determined to be genuine, it sold for a million dollars.

sentences.english: ‘Did he really?’ Her surprise seemed genuine.
sentences.chinese: “他真的这样？”她好像是真的惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: a genuine feeling, desire etc is one that you really feel, not one you pretend to feel

name: grease
trans: When I was done working on the car, I had grease all over my hands.

sentences.english: ...grease-stained hands.
sentences.chinese: …沾满了油渍的手。

sentences.english: I greased front and rear hubs and adjusted the brakes.
sentences.chinese: 我把前后轮轴都加了润滑油并调试了刹车。

detailed_translations.chinese: 动物脂， 油脂； 润滑油
detailed_translations.english: a fatty or oily substance that comes off meat when it is cooked, or off food made using butter or oil
If you grease a part of a car, machine, or device, you put grease on it in order to make it work smoothly

name: knowledge
trans: He has trouble putting his knowledge into practice.

sentences.english: He did not have much knowledge of American history.
sentences.chinese: 他对美国历史所知不多。

sentences.english: Evans denied all knowledge of the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯说他对这次抢劫一无所知。

detailed_translations.english: the information, skills, and understanding that you have gained through learning or experience

name: omit
trans: I omitted some important information: he is not coming.

sentences.english: Please don’t omit any details, no matter how trivial they may seem.
sentences.chinese: 请不要忽略任何细节，不管它多细小。

detailed_translations.english: to not include someone or something, either deliberately or because you forget to do it

name: offset
trans: Increased wages are offset by higher prices for goods.

sentences.english: He was able to offset his travel expenses against tax.
sentences.chinese: 他可以用旅费抵税。

sentences.english: What expenses can you offset against tax ?
sentences.chinese: 什么开支可以获得税项减免？

detailed_translations.english: to use one cost, payment or situation in order to cancel or reduce the effect of another

name: overlap
trans: The gift on top overlaps the other gift on the bottom.

sentences.english: When the bag is folded, the bottom overlaps one side.
sentences.chinese: 把包折叠起来时，其底部与一边就重合了。

sentences.english: Overlap the slices carefully so there are no gaps.
sentences.chinese: 把薄片小心地叠放在一起，那样就没有间隙。

detailed_translations.chinese: 部分重叠； 部分相同
detailed_translations.english: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.
the amount by which two activities, ideas, things etc overlap

name: secondhand
trans: Her secondhand jeans were a bit faded in the front.

sentences.english: They could afford a secondhand car, she thought.
sentences.chinese: 他们能买得起一辆二手车，她想。

sentences.english: I only heard about it secondhand.
sentences.chinese: 我只间接听说了这件事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 二手的；旧的；间接获得的；做旧货生意的
detailed_translations.english: Secondhand things are not new and have been owned by someone else

detailed_translations.chinese: 间接地；间接听来；以旧货
detailed_translations.english: Secondhand is also an adverb

name: skill
trans: She worked with great skill and confidence.

sentences.english: Reading and writing are two different skills.
sentences.chinese: 阅读和写作是两种不同的技能。

sentences.english: Many jobs today require computer skills.
sentences.chinese: 如今的许多工作都需要计算机技能。

detailed_translations.english: an ability to do something well, especially because you have learned and practised it

name: slot
trans: To operate the machine, put your coins into the slot.

sentences.english: Alan dropped another quarter into the slot on the pay phone.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦往付费电话的投币口里又塞了一枚 25 分的硬币。

sentences.english: He was slotting a CD into a CD player.
sentences.chinese: 他正把一张光盘放入光盘播放器中。

sentences.english: The car seat belt slotted into place easily.
sentences.chinese: 那个汽车安全带很容易就扣好了。

detailed_translations.english: a long narrow hole in a surface, that you can put something into

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…放入狭长开口中； 把…纳入其中， 使有位置
detailed_translations.english: If you slot something into something else, or if it slots into it, you put it into a space where it fits

name: tactic
trans: Sam thought of a good tactic to attract more business.

sentences.english: You have probably heard of this tactic before.
sentences.chinese: 你以前也可能听说过这个策略。

sentences.english: Over the next few months, however, that tactic will be difficult to sustain.
sentences.chinese: 然而在接下去的几个月这个策略将很难维持下去。

name: beneficial
trans: Drinking milk every day is beneficial for your bones.

sentences.english: a drug that has a beneficial effect on the immune system
sentences.chinese: 有益于免疫系统的一种药物

sentences.english: an arrangement that is mutually beneficial
sentences.chinese: 一项互惠互利的协定

detailed_translations.english: having a good effect

name: birthplace
trans: China is the birthplace of chopsticks.

sentences.english: Stratford-upon-Avon was Shakespeare’s birthplace.
sentences.chinese: 埃文河畔的斯特拉特福是莎士比亚的出生地。

detailed_translations.english: the place where someone was born, used especially when talking about someone famous

name: capacity
trans: The parking lot has reached its full capacity.

sentences.english: The room had seating capacity for about 80.
sentences.chinese: 这房间能坐80个人左右。

sentences.english: The orchestra played to a capacity crowd (= the largest number of people who can fit into a hall, theatre etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐队为满场的观众演奏。

sentences.english: All the hotels were filled to capacity.
sentences.chinese: 所有的宾馆都住满了。

sentences.english: a child’s capacity for learning
sentences.chinese: 孩子的学习能力

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space a container, room etc has to hold things or people

name: comparative
trans: The money that John has is comparative to that of most other adults.

sentences.english: After a lifetime of poverty, his last few years were spent in comparable comfort.
sentences.chinese: 他穷了一辈子，最后几年还算过得比较舒适。

detailed_translations.english: the comparative form of an adjective or adverb shows an increase in size, quality, degree etc when it is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative form of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative form of ‘slowly’.

the form of an adjective or adverb that shows an increase in size, degree etc when something is considered in relation to something else. For example, ‘bigger’ is the comparative of ‘big’, and ‘more slowly’ is the comparative of ‘slowly’

name: comprehensive
trans: The teacher gave us a comprehensive review for the exam.

sentences.english: We offer our customers a comprehensive range of financial products.
sentences.chinese: 我们为客户提供全面的金融产品。

sentences.english: a comprehensive guide to British hotels and restaurants
sentences.chinese: 一本介绍英国酒店和餐厅的详尽指南

sentences.english: The following guidelines do not aim to be totally comprehensive.
sentences.chinese: 以下指导原则并非想要面面俱到。

detailed_translations.english: including all the necessary facts, details, or problems that need to be dealt with

name: conserve
trans: The group worked to conserve the beauty of Europe’s national parks.

sentences.english: We must conserve our woodlands for future generations.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须为子孙后代保护林地。

sentences.english: efforts to conserve fish stocks
sentences.chinese: 保护鱼类资源的努力

detailed_translations.english: to protect something and prevent it from changing or being damaged

name: crucial
trans: Clean air is crucial to the survival of humans, plants, and animals.

sentences.english: The conservation of tropical forests is of crucial importance .
sentences.chinese: 保护热带雨林至关重要。

detailed_translations.english: something that is crucial is extremely important, because everything else depends on it

name: cumulative
trans: The cumulative snowfall in the area is fifty centimeters per year.

sentences.english: Learning is a cumulative process.
sentences.chinese: 学习是个逐渐积累的过程。

detailed_translations.english: increasing gradually as more of something is added or happens

name: deposit
trans: I deposited the money into my bank account.

sentences.english: You are advised to deposit your valuables in the hotel safe.
sentences.chinese: 建议您把贵重物品存到酒店保险箱里。

sentences.english: As the river slows down, it deposits a layer of soil.
sentences.chinese: 河水流速变慢时，一层泥土便沉积下来。

sentences.english: I’d like to make a deposit (= pay some money ) into my savings account.
sentences.chinese: 我想存一笔钱到我的储蓄账户里。

sentences.english: fatty deposits on the heart
sentences.chinese: 心脏上沉积的脂肪层

detailed_translations.english: to put money or something valuable in a bank or other place where it will be safe
an amount of money that is paid into a bank account

name: distribute
trans: The teacher distributed crayons and markers to her students.

sentences.english: a man distributing leaflets to passers-by
sentences.chinese: 一个向路人派发传单的男子

sentences.english: Make sure that your weight is evenly distributed.
sentences.chinese: 注意让你的重量分布均匀。

detailed_translations.english: to share things among a group of people, especially in a planned way

name: equator
trans: The equator crosses the northern part of South America.

sentences.english: The United States is north of the equator.
sentences.chinese: 美国位于赤道以北。

sentences.english: In the hot zone near the equator the sun heats the air continually; hence the air there ascends.
sentences.chinese: 在靠近赤道的热带地区，太阳不断地加热那里的空气，于是那里的热空气就上升。

detailed_translations.english: an imaginary line drawn around the middle of the Earth that is exactly the same distance from the North Pole and the South Pole

name: exotic
trans: Rebecca tried many exotic foods on her trip to Africa.

sentences.english: exotic birds
sentences.chinese: 外国的奇异鸟类

sentences.english: exotic places
sentences.chinese: 有异国风情的地方

detailed_translations.chinese: 异国的；外来的；异国情调的
detailed_translations.english: something that is exotic seems unusual and interesting because it is related to a foreign country – use this to show approval

name: federal
trans: Sometimes federal laws are different from state laws.

sentences.english: Switzerland is a federal republic.
sentences.chinese: 瑞士是一个联邦共和国。

detailed_translations.english: a federal country or system of government consists of a group of states which control their own affairs, but which are also controlled by a single national government which makes decisions on foreign affairs, defence etc

name: formation
trans: The formation of ice happens when water freezes.

sentences.english: We now know a lot more about the early stages of planetary formation.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在对行星形成过程的早期阶段有了更多的了解。

sentences.english: the formation of a new government
sentences.chinese: 新政府的组成

sentences.english: the canyon’s impressive rock formations
sentences.chinese: 峡谷中壮观的岩层

detailed_translations.english: the process by which something develops into a particular thing or shape

name: frequency
trans: The frequency of rainstorms is very high, especially during the spring.

sentences.english: Businesses come and go with alarming frequency.
sentences.chinese: 商家开张停业惊人地频繁。

sentences.english: the frequency of serious road accidents
sentences.chinese: 重大道路交通事故的发生率

detailed_translations.english: the fact that something happens a lot

name: objective
trans: My objective this week is to finish my homework by 7:30 every night.

sentences.english: He vowed to achieve certain objectives before the end of his presidency.
sentences.chinese: 他立誓要在他的总统任期结束之前实现某些目标。

sentences.english: the best way to accomplish your objectives
sentences.chinese: 完成目标的最佳方法

sentences.english: The degree program has two main objectives.
sentences.chinese: 该学位课程有两个主要目标。

sentences.english: Managers should set specific performance objectives for their teams.
sentences.chinese: 经理应该为自己的团队制定明确的绩效目标。

sentences.english: The main objective was to improve children’s knowledge of geography.
sentences.chinese: 主要目的是要增长儿童的地理知识。

sentences.english: A clear objective was set and adhered to.
sentences.chinese: 定下了明确的目标并坚持到底。

sentences.english: One of your first business objectives should be to get your own office.
sentences.chinese: 你的首要工作目标之一应该是拥有自己的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: something that you are trying hard to achieve, especially in business or politics

name: oxygen
trans: She thinks there is more oxygen in the air in the country than in the city.

sentences.english: The human brain needs to be without oxygen for only four minutes before permanent damage occurs.
sentences.chinese: 人脑缺氧只需4分钟就会造成永久性损伤。

detailed_translations.english: a gas that has no colour or smell, is present in air, and is necessary for most animals and plants to live. It is a chemical element: symbol O

name: rainforest
trans: The rainforest is home to many animals.

sentences.english: The rainforest is essential in other areas also.
sentences.chinese: 雨林在其他地区也是必不可少的。

sentences.english: The rainforest around our house sometimes brings forth intriguing creatures like this.
sentences.chinese: 我们的房子周围的雨林有时带来了这样有趣的生物。

sentences.english: Then we carried on in the worst conditions yet: low, tangled rainforest that blocked out the light, and mud up to our thighs.
sentences.chinese: 那时我们还在最糟糕的环境里行进着：低矮、纷乱的雨林遮住了阳光，泥浆没至我们的大腿。

name: strategy
trans: The team came up with a strategy to win the game.

sentences.english: the government’s long-term economic strategy
sentences.chinese: 政府的长期经济策略

sentences.english: a company’s business strategy
sentences.chinese: 公司的经营策略

detailed_translations.english: a planned series of actions for achieving something

name: wooded
trans: Jim and Ben decided to go hiking in the wooded area by the river.

name: avail
trans: His studying was to no avail because he failed the test.

sentences.english: Guests should feel at liberty to avail themselves of your facilities.
sentences.chinese: 客人们应可以随意使用你们的设施。

sentences.english: His efforts were to no avail.
sentences.chinese: 他的努力是徒劳的。

detailed_translations.english: to be helpful or useful to sb

name: define
trans: People define success in many different ways.

sentences.english: the ability to define clients’ needs
sentences.chinese: 确定客户需求的能力

sentences.english: The duties of the post are difficult to define.
sentences.chinese: 这一职位的职责很难界定。

sentences.english: Define precisely what you mean by ‘crime’.
sentences.chinese: 把你说的 “犯罪” 明确定义一下。

detailed_translations.english: to describe something correctly and thoroughly, and to say what standards, limits, qualities etc it has that make it different from other things

name: dread
trans: I dread the possibility that I will not get into college.

sentences.english: The prospect of flying filled me with dread .
sentences.chinese: 想到要乘飞机我充满了恐惧。

sentences.english: She lives in dread of (= is continuously very afraid of ) the disease returning.
sentences.chinese: 她整天担心着会旧病复发。

detailed_translations.english: a strong fear of something that is going to happen or may happen
to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen

name: expand
trans: A balloon will expand as you blow air into it.

sentences.english: Water expands as it freezes.
sentences.chinese: 水结冰时会膨胀。

sentences.english: Sydney’s population expanded rapidly in the 1960s.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪60年代，悉尼的人口迅速增加。

sentences.english: exercises that expand the chest muscles
sentences.chinese: 扩展胸肌的运动

sentences.english: his expanding waistline
sentences.chinese: 他那逐渐增大的腰围

detailed_translations.english: to become larger in size, number, or amount, or to make something become larger

name: fundamental
trans: The fundamental rules of basketball are easy.

sentences.english: We have to tackle the fundamental cause of the problem.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须解决问题的根本原因。

sentences.english: the fundamental principles of liberty and equality
sentences.chinese: 自由和平等这两个基本原则

detailed_translations.english: relating to the most basic and important parts of something

name: horrifying
trans: There was a horrifying car accident today.

name: incredulous
trans: She was incredulous that monkeys could ever drive a car.

sentences.english: ‘You sold the car?’ she asked, incredulous.
sentences.chinese: “你把车卖了？”她难以置信地问道。

detailed_translations.english: unable or unwilling to believe something

name: linger
trans: The smell of fresh cookies lingered in the bakery.

sentences.english: He surprised all the doctors by lingering on for several weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他拖了几个星期才去世，让所有的医生都很惊讶。

detailed_translations.english: to continue looking at or dealing with something for longer than is usual or desirable

name: organism
trans: We studied the organism under the microscope.

sentences.english: All living organisms have to adapt to changes in environmental conditions.
sentences.chinese: 一切生物都要适应环境条件的变化。

sentences.english: Genes operate together in determining the characteristics of an individual organism.
sentences.chinese: 基因的共同作用决定生物个体的特性。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, plant, human, or any other living thing

name: paraphrase
trans: The students were asked to paraphrase the story they had just heard.

sentences.english: The last two clauses were an exact quote rather than a paraphrase of Mr. Forth's remarks.
sentences.chinese: 最后两个分句是对福思先生言论的准确引用而不是改述。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that expresses in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written
to express in a shorter, clearer, or different way what someone has said or written

name: plague
trans: A plague in Europe killed millions of people.

sentences.english: Financial problems continued to plague the company.
sentences.chinese: 资金问题持续困扰着该公司。

detailed_translations.english: to cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone, especially for a long period of time

name: presently
trans: Presently, our profits are good, but by next year we can do even better.

sentences.english: The doctor will be here presently.
sentences.chinese: 医生一会儿就到。

sentences.english: Presently, I fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 一会儿我就睡着了。

sentences.english: The range of courses presently available has grown.
sentences.chinese: 目前可选择的课程范围已经扩大了。

detailed_translations.english: in a short time

name: random
trans: Young children often ask random questions.

sentences.english: The gang picked their victims at random.
sentences.chinese: 这帮犯罪分子随意选择对象下手。

sentences.english: The company has introduced random drug testing of its employees.
sentences.chinese: 公司已实行对雇员的随机毒品测试。

detailed_translations.english: without any definite plan, aim, or pattern
happening or chosen without any definite plan, aim, or pattern

name: riot
trans: A riot broke out after the candidate lost the election.

sentences.english: urban riots
sentences.chinese: 城市骚乱

sentences.english: prison riots
sentences.chinese: 监狱暴乱

sentences.english: His murder triggered vicious race riots (= caused by a problem between different races ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的被杀引发了严重的种族骚乱。

sentences.english: police wearing riot gear
sentences.chinese: 配有防暴装备的警察

sentences.english: police in bullet-proof vests and carrying riot shields
sentences.chinese: 穿防弹背心、持防暴盾牌的警察

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which a large crowd of people are behaving in a violent and uncontrolled way, especially when they are protesting about something
if a crowd of people riot, they behave in a violent and uncontrolled way, for example by fighting the police and damaging cars or buildings

name: scribble
trans: I scribbled a rough diagram of our plan and gave it to him.

sentences.english: I couldn’t read his scribble.
sentences.chinese: 我看不懂他潦草的字。

detailed_translations.chinese: 潦草写成的东西；潦草的写法；杂文
detailed_translations.english: untidy writing that is difficult to read
to write something quickly and untidily

name: shrine
trans: He prayed at the shrine for an hour.

sentences.english: Elvis’ home has become a shrine for his fans.
sentences.chinese: 猫王的故居成了歌迷的朝圣地。

detailed_translations.english: a place that is connected with a holy event or holy person, and that people visit to pray

detailed_translations.chinese: 将…置于神龛内；把…奉为神圣

name: solitude
trans: John lives a life of solitude because he doesn’t get along well with people.

sentences.english: the solitude of her house on the lake
sentences.chinese: 她湖边那所房子的清静

detailed_translations.english: when you are alone, especially when this is what you enjoy

name: stark
trans: There is a stark contrast between their test scores.

sentences.english: In the cold dawn light, the castle looked stark and forbidding.
sentences.chinese: 在寒冷的曙光中，城堡看上去了无生气，令人生畏。

sentences.english: the stark beauty of New Mexico
sentences.chinese: 新墨西哥州的荒凉之美

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全的；荒凉的；刻板的；光秃秃的；朴实的
detailed_translations.english: very plain in appearance, with little or no colour or decoration

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全；明显地；突出地；质朴地
detailed_translations.english: completely crazy

detailed_translations.chinese: (Stark)人名；(俄、罗)斯塔尔克；(英、芬、法、瑞典)斯塔克；(德)施塔克

name: summon
trans: We summoned the doctor as soon as we noticed she was sick.

sentences.english: Robert summoned the waiter for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 罗伯特召唤服务员结账。

sentences.english: It took her a full month to summon the courage to tell her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她用了整整一个月的时间才鼓起勇气告诉了母亲。

detailed_translations.english: to order someone to come to a place

name: worsen
trans: The weather suddenly worsened, and we had to stay inside.

sentences.english: A lot of teachers expect the situation to worsen over the next few years.
sentences.chinese: 许多老师认为接下来的几年情形会更糟。

sentences.english: Interfering now could worsen the problem.
sentences.chinese: 目前介入可能会使问题更严重。

detailed_translations.english: to become worse or make something worse

name: automobile
trans: The first automobiles were very different from the ones that exist today.

sentences.english: the automobile industry
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业

detailed_translations.english: a car

name: candidate
trans: Alice is the best candidate for the job.

sentences.english: a presidential candidate
sentences.chinese: 总统候选人

sentences.english: Candidates are not allowed to use a calculator in this exam.
sentences.chinese: 这次考试的应试者不可以使用计算器。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is being considered for a job or is competing in an election

name: confidential
trans: The information from the meeting is confidential.

sentences.english: a confidential government report
sentences.chinese: 一份机密的政府报告

sentences.english: Doctors are required to keep patients’ records completely confidential .
sentences.chinese: 医生必须对病人的病历完全保密。

sentences.english: The information will be regarded as strictly confidential (= completely confidential ) .
sentences.chinese: 这一信息将被视为绝对机密。

detailed_translations.english: spoken or written in secret and intended to be kept secret

name: corporate
trans: Tom enjoys working in the corporate world.

sentences.english: The company is moving its corporate headquarters (= main offices ) from New York to Houston.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司要把总部从纽约迁到休斯敦。

sentences.english: Vince is vice-president of corporate communications.
sentences.chinese: 文斯是负责企业宣传的副总裁。

sentences.english: Corporate America is not about to be converted to the environmentalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 美国企业界不打算投身环保事业。

sentences.english: changing the corporate culture (= the way that people in a corporation think and behave ) to accept family-friendly policies
sentences.chinese: 改变公司文化，采取更关怀家庭的政策

sentences.english: an advertising campaign intended to reinforce our corporate identity
sentences.chinese: 旨在加强我们公司形象的广告宣传活动

sentences.english: The yacht can be hired for corporate hospitality (= entertainment provided by companies for their customers ) .
sentences.chinese: 可以租下这艘游艇用于公司招待客户。

detailed_translations.chinese: 法人团体的， 公司的； 全体的， 共同的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to or relating to a corporation

name: enhance
trans: Amy’s blue shirt really enhances the color of her eyes.

sentences.english: Good lighting will enhance any room.
sentences.chinese: 良好的照明能给房间增色不少。

sentences.english: The publicity has enhanced his reputation.
sentences.chinese: 这次宣传提高了他的声誉。

detailed_translations.english: to improve something

name: era
trans: During the medieval era, knights wore protective armor.

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: guideline
trans: Before they began the project, the teacher gave them some guidelines.

sentences.english: This chapter gives you some guidelines to help you in your work.
sentences.chinese: 本章将介绍一些指导性原则，为你的工作提供帮助。

detailed_translations.english: rules or instructions about the best way to do something

name: incorporate
trans: I decided to incorporate a new ingredient into my cake recipe.

sentences.english: It allows you to harness existing technologies and incorporate them into one application.
sentences.chinese: 它允许您利用现有的技术并将它们合并到同一个应用程序中。

sentences.english: The next step is to generate the report and then incorporate it as an affiliated document of the master document.
sentences.chinese: 紧接着的步骤就是产生这个报告，然后将它作为主文档的附属文档与主文档合并。

name: interact
trans: The kids began to interact when the adults left the room.

sentences.english: While the other children interacted and played together, Ted ignored them.
sentences.chinese: 当其他孩子们相互交往、一起玩耍时，泰德却不理他们。

detailed_translations.english: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

name: interval
trans: Tony rested for brief intervals while he worked in the yard.

sentences.english: He left the room, returning after a short interval with a message.
sentences.chinese: 他离开房间，过了一会儿就带回来一条消息。

sentences.english: We can get some drinks in the interval.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在幕间休息时喝点什么。

sentences.english: Trees had been planted at regular intervals.
sentences.chinese: 树已按均距栽种。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time between two events, activities etc

name: mobile
trans: Mobile phones are convenient because you can use them anywhere.

sentences.english: mobile air-conditioners
sentences.chinese: 移动式空调器

sentences.english: a mobile shop/library (= one inside a vehicle)
sentences.chinese: 流动商店 / 图书馆

detailed_translations.english: that is not fixed in one place and can be moved easily and quickly

name: modify
trans: I modified my outfit by adding a belt to it.

sentences.english: The feedback will be used to modify the course for next year.
sentences.chinese: 这些反馈意见将用于修改明年的课程。

sentences.english: The regulations can only be modified by a special committee.
sentences.chinese: 这些法规只能由特别委员会来修改。

detailed_translations.english: to make small changes to something in order to improve it and make it more suitable or effective

name: parallel
trans: There are two yellow parallel lines dividing both sides of traffic.

sentences.english: Lines AB and CD are parallel. AB
sentences.chinese: 线与CD线平行。

sentences.english: two parallel roads
sentences.chinese: 两条平行的道路

sentences.english: Take the road running parallel to the main road just after the village.
sentences.chinese: 过那个村子后走与主干道平行的路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并列的，平行的；类似的；对应的；并联的
detailed_translations.english: two lines, paths etc that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length

detailed_translations.chinese: 可相比拟的事物，相似处；平行线，平行面；纬线
detailed_translations.english: a relationship or similarity between two things, especially things that exist or happen in different places or at different times

detailed_translations.chinese: 与…相似， 与… 相当， 比得上
detailed_translations.english: if one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and seem to be related

name: phenomenon
trans: I thought the lights were a strange phenomenon, but they were just shooting stars.

sentences.english: Homelessness is not a new phenomenon .
sentences.chinese: 无家可归已不是什么新现象。

detailed_translations.english: something that happens or exists in society, science, or nature, especially something that is studied because it is difficult to understand

name: pollute
trans: The careless factory polluted the river with chemicals.

sentences.english: beaches polluted by raw sewage
sentences.chinese: 受未经处理的污水污染的海滩

sentences.english: The factory pollutes the air and water.
sentences.chinese: 那家工厂污染了空气和水。

detailed_translations.english: to make air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use

name: ridicule
trans: The other students ridicule Peter’s foreign accent.

sentences.english: the ridicule of his peers
sentences.chinese: 他同龄人的奚落

sentences.english: The government’s proposals were held up to ridicule (= suffered ridicule ) by opposition ministers.
sentences.chinese: 政府的提案遭到反对党部长们的嘲笑。

sentences.english: He had become an object of ridicule among the other teachers.
sentences.chinese: 他成了其他教师嘲笑的对象。

detailed_translations.english: unkind laughter or remarks that are intended to make someone or something seem stupid
to laugh at a person, idea etc and say that they are stupid

name: solar
trans: Using solar energy is good for the environment.

sentences.english: a solar eclipse
sentences.chinese: 日食

detailed_translations.english: relating to the sun

name: territory
trans: Gibraltar is a territory of Great Britain.

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: tournament
trans: My dad is playing in a golf tournament tomorrow.

sentences.english: She is aching to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 她渴望参加比赛。

sentences.english: They dropped two games in a row and were eliminated from the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他们在划船比赛中输了两场比赛，并被淘汰出局。

sentences.english: It's no use egging him on; he's made up his mind not to join in the tournament.
sentences.chinese: 他已拿定主意不参加比赛了，你再将他也没有用。

name: transportation
trans: I don’t have a car, so my normal transportation is the train.

sentences.english: The city needs to improve its public transportation (= buses, trains etc ) .
sentences.chinese: 这座城市需要改善公共交通。

detailed_translations.english: a system or method for carrying passengers or goods from one place to another

name: bill
trans: I have so many bills that I do not know how to pay them all.

sentences.english: Have you paid the phone bill?
sentences.chinese: 电话费你付了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a written list showing how much you have to pay for services you have received, work that has been done etc

name: boundary
trans: This fence shows the boundary between our yard and yours.

sentences.english: National boundaries are becoming increasingly meaningless in the global economy.
sentences.chinese: 在全球经济中，国界已经变得越来越没有意义。

sentences.english: We would need their agreement to build outside the city boundary .
sentences.chinese: 我们在市界以外的地方建房需要他们批准。

sentences.english: The stream curves round to mark the boundary of his property.
sentences.chinese: 小河打了个弯，为他这块地划出了边界。
