sentences.english: Anything that crosses the boundary of a black hole cannot get back.
sentences.chinese: 任何物质只要跨越黑洞的界线就再也无法出来。

sentences.english: We walked through the churchyard towards the boundary wall .
sentences.chinese: 我们穿过教堂墓地，向院墙走去。

sentences.english: The property’s boundary line is 25 feet from the back of the house.
sentences.chinese: 这块地产的边界线在屋后25英尺的地方。

sentences.english: boundary disputes between neighbouring countries
sentences.chinese: 邻国之间的边界争端

detailed_translations.english: the real or imaginary line that marks the edge of a state, country etc, or the edge of an area of land that belongs to someone

name: chaos
trans: His presentation was in chaos. I couldn’t understand what he meant.

sentences.english: The country was plunged into economic chaos.
sentences.chinese: 这个国家陷入了经济大混乱。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which everything is happening in a confused way and nothing is organized or arranged in order

name: consistent
trans: Sara comes in every day and is our most consistent worker.

sentences.english: We need to be consistent in our approach.
sentences.chinese: 我们在方法上要前后一致。

detailed_translations.english: always behaving in the same way or having the same attitudes, standards etc – usually used to show approval

name: cyclone
trans: Hundreds of homes were damaged by the cyclone.

sentences.english: The race was called off as a cyclone struck.
sentences.chinese: 由于旋风袭击，比赛被取消了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 旋风；[气象] 气旋；飓风
detailed_translations.english: a very strong wind that moves very fast in a circle

name: doomed
trans: Since I spent all my money, my date with Jane is doomed.

sentences.english: Their plans seemed doomed to failure.
sentences.chinese: 看起来，他们的计划注定要失败。

detailed_translations.english: If something is doomed to happen, or if you are doomed to a particular state, something unpleasant is certain to happen, and you can do nothing to prevent it

name: heir
trans: The princess was the heir to the king and queen’s throne.

sentences.english: Jonson was his political heir as leader of the party.
sentences.chinese: 琼森是他的政治接班人，他将担任该党派的领袖。

detailed_translations.english: the person who has the legal right to receive the property or title of another person when they die

name: martial
trans: Karate is a martial art that began many years ago in Japan.

sentences.english: martial music
sentences.chinese: 军乐

detailed_translations.english: connected with war and fighting

name: organic
trans: The organic carrots are more expensive, but they’re better for you.

sentences.english: Organic farming is better for the environment.
sentences.chinese: 有机耕作对环境更有利。

sentences.english: organic gardening
sentences.chinese: 有机园艺

detailed_translations.english: relating to farming or gardening methods of growing food without using artificial chemicals, or produced or grown by these methods

name: poultry
trans: He raises poultry and sells their meat for extra money.

sentences.english: ...a poultry farm.
sentences.chinese: …一个家禽饲养场。

detailed_translations.english: birds such as chickens and ducks that are kept on farms in order to produce eggs and meat

name: scramble
trans: The hikers scrambled down the side of the hill.

sentences.english: They tried to scramble up the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 他们想爬上悬崖。

sentences.english: The village was a 20-minute scramble away.
sentences.chinese: 村子离这里有20分钟的攀登路程。

detailed_translations.english: to climb up, down, or over something quickly and with difficulty, especially using your hands to help you
a difficult climb in which you have to use your hands to help you

name: sergeant
trans: He was promoted to sergeant after a year in the army.

sentences.english: Right, but how do you know there's a sergeant there?
sentences.chinese: 正确，可是你怎么知道那儿有一个中士？

detailed_translations.english: a low rank in the army, air force, police etc, or someone who has this rank

name: sheer
trans: I was impressed by her sheer dedication to jogging.

sentences.english: cliffs which rose sheer from the sea
sentences.chinese: 从海面垂直拔起的悬崖

detailed_translations.english: straight up or down in an almost vertical line
to change direction suddenly, especially in order to avoid something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全的，十足的；陡峭的，垂直的；极薄的，透明的
detailed_translations.english: a sheer drop, cliff, slope etc is very steep and almost vertical

name: stance
trans: My stance is that using oil and gas is bad for the environment.

sentences.english: a fighting stance
sentences.chinese: 搏击姿势

detailed_translations.chinese: 立场；姿态；位置；准备击球姿势
detailed_translations.english: an opinion that is stated publicly

name: telegraph
trans: In the 1900s, the telegraph was the fastest way to send a message.

sentences.english: Once he knew where we were, Lewis telegraphed every few hours.
sentences.chinese: 一知道我们在哪里，刘易斯就每隔几小时发一份电报来。

detailed_translations.english: an old-fashioned method of sending messages using radio or electrical signals
to send a message by telegraph

name: textile
trans: The blue textile was going to be used to make blouses.

sentences.english: Their main exports are textiles, especially silk and cotton.
sentences.chinese: 他们的主要出口商品是纺织品，尤其是丝绸和棉布。

detailed_translations.english: any type of woven cloth that is made in large quantities, used especially by people in the business of making clothes etc

name: tornado
trans: During a tornado, the safest place to be is underground.

sentences.english: The tornado rubbished the whole village.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风毁掉了整个村庄。

sentences.english: The tornado disrupted broadcasting along the entire coast.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风使整个沿海的广播都中断了。

sentences.english: The tornado is coming, so we had better batten down the hatches here and get to the cellar.
sentences.chinese: 龙卷风即将来临，因此我们最好把这里的舱口封上，到地下室去。

detailed_translations.english: an extremely violent storm consisting of air that spins very quickly and causes a lot of damage

name: typhoon
trans: Thousands of people lost electricity after a typhoon hit Australia.

sentences.english: They have received notice of a typhoon approaching.
sentences.chinese: 他们已收到台风即将来临的预报。

sentences.english: We both are under stress and standing in the middle of a typhoon .
sentences.chinese: 你我都处在很紧张的环境中，站在台风的中心。

sentences.english: The football match have to stand over next week for the typhoon storm.
sentences.chinese: 由于台风风暴，这场足球赛延期到下个星期举行。

detailed_translations.english: a very violent tropical storm

name: wail
trans: The baby wailed because it was hungry.

sentences.english: The women began to wail in mourning.
sentences.chinese: 女人们开始大放悲声。

sentences.english: Wails of grief were heard as visitors filed past the site of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 当来访者们列队走过灾难现场时听见阵阵悲痛的哀号声。

detailed_translations.english: If someone wails, they make long, loud, high-pitched cries which express sorrow or pain
Wail is also a noun

name: wardrobe
trans: She bought some new clothes to expand her wardrobe.

sentences.english: Can you hang these in the wardrobe, please?
sentences.chinese: 请你把这些衣服挂到衣橱里去好吗？

sentences.english: fitted/built-in wardrobes (=wardrobes built against a wall or fitted between two walls)
sentences.chinese: 固定式/嵌入式衣柜

detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture like a large cupboard that you hang clothes in

name: adverse
trans: I worry that the tornado will have an adverse effect on the farm.

sentences.english: They fear it could have an adverse effect on global financial markets.
sentences.chinese: 他们担心这会对全球金融市场产生不利影响。

sentences.english: Miller’s campaign has received a good deal of adverse publicity .
sentences.chinese: 米勒的竞选活动招来许多负面报道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）
detailed_translations.english: not good or favourable

name: alternate
trans: Taking the bus and driving to work are alternate ways to travel.

sentences.english: The two patterns alternate over periods of two to seven years in the tropical Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 在热带的太平洋地区，这两种现象的交替周期超过了两到七年。

sentences.english: To make the tiger blink, you alternate the transparency between the two areas by locating both the areas and paths in the corresponding XML.
sentences.chinese: 要让老虎眨眼，可以通过在相应的 XML 中定位这两个区域及其路径来在两个区域间交替透明性。

sentences.english: In most jurisdictions, twelve jurors and two alternates are chosen.
sentences.chinese: 在大多数审判中，12名陪审员和2名替补人员会被选出。

detailed_translations.english: if two things alternate, or if you alternate them, they happen one after the other in a repeated pattern
two alternate things are placed one after the other in a regular pattern
An alternate is a person or thing that replaces another, and can act or be used instead of them

name: biodegradable
trans: I use biodegradable compost to feed my garden.

sentences.english: This carton is made of biodegradable plastic.
sentences.chinese: 这盒子是用生物降解塑料做的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 生物所能分解的，能进行生物降解的
detailed_translations.english: materials, chemicals etc that are biodegradable are changed naturally by  bacteria  into substances that do not harm the environment

name: boxed
trans: Justine brought a boxed gift to the birthday party.

name: choke
trans: The gum Malinda swallowed made her choke.

sentences.english: I felt as if there was a weight on my chest, choking me.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉好像有重物压在胸口，让我喘不过气来。

sentences.english: The smoke was choking me.
sentences.chinese: 烟呛得我呼吸困难。

sentences.english: Weeds were choking the stream.
sentences.chinese: 野草将溪流堵塞了。

detailed_translations.english: if something chokes you, it makes you unable to breathe properly

name: convenient
trans: Walking through the park is a convenient way to exercise on the way to work.

sentences.english: Mail-order catalogs are a convenient way to shop.
sentences.chinese: 使用邮购目录是一种方便的购物方式。

sentences.english: My secretary will call you to arrange a convenient time to meet.
sentences.chinese: 我的秘书会打电话给你安排一个方便的时间见面。

sentences.english: restaurants convenient for shops and theatres
sentences.chinese: 靠近商店和剧院的餐厅

detailed_translations.english: useful to you because it saves you time, or does not spoil your plans or cause you problems

name: discard
trans: After repairing the window, discard any broken glass.

sentences.english: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.
sentences.chinese: 先阅读制造商的说明书再把盒子丢掉。

detailed_translations.chinese: 丢弃， 抛弃， 遗弃
detailed_translations.english: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it

name: dolphin
trans: Intelligent dolphins have learned to communicate with humans.

sentences.english: By hunting or gathering away from the group, both chimpanzee and dolphin moms ensure that what they find goes to their young.
sentences.chinese: 黑猩猩和海豚妈妈们远离群体打猎和收集食物，并保证他们所找到的食物都给孩子们。

sentences.english: Daniel: Yes, like a dolphin.
sentences.chinese: 丹尼尔: 嗯，像海豚一样。

detailed_translations.english: a very intelligent sea animal like a fish with a long grey pointed nose

name: ecologically
trans: We planted our garden according to ecologically correct practices.

name: fatal
trans: Being shot by the attacker proved fatal to the victim.

sentences.english: potentially fatal diseases
sentences.chinese: 潜在致命的疾病

sentences.english: If it is not treated correctly, the condition can prove fatal (= be fatal ) .
sentences.chinese: 如果治疗不当，这种病可能会致命。

detailed_translations.english: resulting in someone’s death

name: incidence
trans: We need to increase the incidence of success in school.

sentences.english: an area with a high incidence of crime
sentences.chinese: 犯罪率高的地区

sentences.english: the angle of incidence
sentences.chinese: 入射角

detailed_translations.english: the extent to which sth happens or has an effect

name: municipal
trans: The municipal parking lot downtown can fit one hundred cars.

sentences.english: the municipal waste dump
sentences.chinese: 城市垃圾场

sentences.english: municipal elections
sentences.chinese: 市级选举

detailed_translations.english: relating to or belonging to the government of a town or city

name: overuse
trans: Rochelle’s overuse of the exercise bike caused the gears to break.

sentences.english: Students tend to overuse certain words.
sentences.chinese: 学生往往会滥用某些词语。

detailed_translations.english: to use something too much, especially so that it is not effective any more or it is damaged

name: pond
trans: I learned to swim at the pond behind the recreation center.

sentences.english: The path descends to  the pond.
sentences.chinese: 小路下斜通到池塘。

sentences.english: This pond often catches in winter.
sentences.chinese: 这个池塘在冬天常常结冰。

sentences.english: Wild flowers and grasses rimmed the little pond.
sentences.chinese: 各种野花和野草环绕着这个小池塘。

detailed_translations.english: a small area of fresh water that is smaller than a lake, that is either natural or artificially made

name: recycle
trans: We recycle our newspapers so that they can be made into packing boxes.

sentences.english: The fashion world just keeps recycling old ideas.
sentences.chinese: 时装界就是不停地翻新旧观念。

detailed_translations.english: to use something such as an idea, writing etc again instead of developing something new

name: reusable
trans: Saburo keeps his empty jelly jars because they are reusable for storing sewing supplies.

sentences.english: Store refrigerated food in reusable containers rather than in plastic wrap or aluminium foil.
sentences.chinese: 用可再用容器而不是保鲜膜或铝箔纸来储存冷冻食品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可重复使用的；可再次使用的
detailed_translations.english: Things that are reusable can be used more than once

name: stuffed
trans: The newspapers were all stuffed into the drawer.

name: tragic
trans: The entire community attended the memorial service for the victims of the tragic fire.

sentences.english: The parents were not to blame for the tragic death of their son.
sentences.chinese: 儿子的惨死不是他父母的错。

sentences.english: a great tragic actor
sentences.chinese: 一名伟大的悲剧演员

detailed_translations.english: making you feel very sad, usually because sb has died or suffered a lot

name: utilize
trans: The team can utilize the lab equipment to complete the experiment.

sentences.english: We must consider how best to utilize what resources we have.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须考虑怎样充分利用现有的资源。

detailed_translations.english: to use something for a particular purpose

name: whale
trans: We were surprised when a whale surfaced next to our boat.

sentences.english: The receding tide stranded the whale.
sentences.chinese: 退潮把鲸鱼搁浅在海滩上。

sentences.english: So whale come out fish, because they are fish obviously.
sentences.chinese: 所以鲸鱼就是鱼，因为他们显然是鱼。

sentences.english: This sense of revelation is in part due to our changing attitude towards the whale.
sentences.chinese: 与鲸鱼感到关联部分是由于和我们对鲸鱼态度发生了变化。

detailed_translations.english: a very large animal that lives in the sea and looks like a fish, but is actually a mammal

name: amateur
trans: The amateur took pictures just as well as the person who worked for money.

sentences.english: a gifted amateur
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的业余爱好者

sentences.english: Mickelson won his first major golf tournament while still an amateur.
sentences.chinese: 米克尔森还是业余选手时就赢得了他第一个高尔夫球锦标赛大奖。

sentences.english: ...professional athletes and amateur runners.
sentences.chinese: …专业运动员和业余赛跑运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱好者；业余爱好者；外行
detailed_translations.english: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job
Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job

name: ambiguous
trans: It’s ambiguous as to whether a newborn baby looks like a girl or a boy.

sentences.english: The language in the Minister’s statement is highly ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 部长的声明措辞很含糊。

sentences.english: His role in the affair is ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 他在这起事件中的角色并不明确。

detailed_translations.english: that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

name: anonymous
trans: An anonymous donor gave a thousand dollars to the museum.

sentences.english: the anonymous author of a collection of poems
sentences.chinese: 一本诗集的佚名作者

sentences.english: According to one employee, who wishes to remain anonymous , the company engaged in illegal activities.
sentences.chinese: 根据一位不愿透露姓名的员工所述，这家公司曾从事非法活动。

detailed_translations.english: unknown by name

name: attain
trans: If you want to attain a healthy body, you must exercise every day.

sentences.english: More women are attaining positions of power.
sentences.chinese: 越来越多的女性获得要职。

detailed_translations.english: to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time
to succeed in achieving something after trying for a long time

name: autonomy
trans: In the 1800s, the people of India fought for autonomy from Britain.

sentences.english: campaigners who want greater autonomy for Corsica
sentences.chinese: 希望科西嘉有更多自治权的活动家

detailed_translations.english: freedom that a place or an organization has to govern or control itself

name: concession
trans: China gave Hong Kong to Britain as a concession after the war.

sentences.english: The British were not prepared to make any concessions .
sentences.chinese: 英国人没有打算作出让步。

sentences.english: the import/export concessions that had been granted to the island
sentences.chinese: 同意给该岛的进出口特许权

detailed_translations.english: something that you allow someone to have in order to end an argument or a disagreement

name: decay
trans: The decay in the old building was obvious.

sentences.english: Her body was already starting to decay.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体已经开始腐烂。

sentences.english: Most archaeological finds are broken, damaged, or decayed.
sentences.chinese: 大部分考古发现物都已破裂、损坏或腐烂。

sentences.english: decaying organic matter
sentences.chinese: 腐烂的有机物

sentences.english: In Orthodox Europe, mass religion seems to have decayed less.
sentences.chinese: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区，集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

sentences.english: tooth decay
sentences.chinese: 蛀牙

detailed_translations.english: to be slowly destroyed by a natural chemical process, or to make something do this
the natural chemical change that causes the slow destruction of something

name: dwell
trans: Before he was a successful writer, Mark Twain dwelled in the city of Hannibal, Missouri.

sentences.english: They dwelt in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在森林里。

sentences.english: So you made a mistake, but there's no need to dwell on it.
sentences.chinese: 你是错了，不过不必老是想着这事儿。

detailed_translations.english: to live in a particular place

name: enlighten
trans: Greek philosophers wanted to enlighten the people of Athens with their ideas.

sentences.english: Baldwin enlightened her as to the nature of the experiment.
sentences.chinese: 鲍德温给她讲解了这个实验的性质。

detailed_translations.english: to give someone more knowledge and greater understanding about something

name: enrich
trans: Taxes on people’s income can be used to enrich the government.

sentences.english: Add fertilizer to enrich the soil.
sentences.chinese: 施上肥料使土壤肥沃。

sentences.english: Education can greatly enrich your life.
sentences.chinese: 教育可以大大充实生活。

detailed_translations.english: to improve the quality of something, especially by adding things to it

name: flourish
trans: The Roman Empire flourished in Europe two thousand years ago.

sentences.english: He took his cap from under his arm with a flourish and pulled it low over his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他挥手从腋下取出帽子，拉低帽檐盖住眼睛。

sentences.english: He flourished the glass to emphasize the point.
sentences.chinese: 他挥舞着杯子来强调这一点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 兴旺；茂盛；挥舞；炫耀；华饰
detailed_translations.english: a curved line that you use to decorate writing
If you flourish an object, you wave it about in a way that makes people notice it

name: geometry
trans: If you want to be able to calculate the area of a circle, you must study geometry.

sentences.english: the very ordered way in which mathematics and geometry describe nature
sentences.chinese: 数学和几何学描述自然的条理性

detailed_translations.english: the study in  mathematics  of the angles and shapes formed by the relationships of lines, surfaces, and solid objects in space

name: gleam
trans: The waves of the ocean would gleam every night at sunset.

sentences.english: They saw a sudden gleam of light.
sentences.chinese: 他们看到一道微光一闪而过。

sentences.english: The wooden panelling was gleaming with wax polish.
sentences.chinese: 木嵌板上过蜡显得很光亮。

detailed_translations.english: a small pale light, especially one that shines for a short time
to shine softly

name: greed
trans: The story of King Midas is a story of greed.

sentences.english: people motivated by jealousy and greed
sentences.chinese: 受妒忌和贪婪驱使的人们

detailed_translations.english: a strong desire for more food, money, power, possessions etc than you need

name: harmony
trans: The United Nations is struggling to bring peace and harmony to the world.

sentences.english: the gorgeous vocal harmonies on ‘Mexicali Rose’
sentences.chinese: 《墨西哥玫瑰》的精彩和声演唱

sentences.english: three-part harmonies
sentences.chinese: 三部和声

detailed_translations.english: notes of music combined together in a pleasant way

name: indigenous
trans: The Pueblo people were an indigenous tribe in Arizona who lived in adobe homes.

sentences.english: the many indigenous cultures which existed in Siberia
sentences.chinese: 存在于西伯利亚的许多当地文化

detailed_translations.chinese: 本土的；土著的；国产的；固有的
detailed_translations.english: indigenous people or things have always been in the place where they are, rather than being brought there from somewhere else

name: jurisdiction
trans: We did not have jurisdiction to bring the criminal to trial.

sentences.english: The British police have no jurisdiction over foreign bank accounts.
sentences.chinese: 英国警方对外国银行的账户没有司法管辖权。

detailed_translations.chinese: 司法权，审判权，管辖权；权限，权力
detailed_translations.english: the right to use an official power to make legal decisions, or the area where this right exists

name: parade
trans: This parade of elephants is part of an open-air exhibit to honor these majestic animals.

sentences.english: a victory parade
sentences.chinese: 胜利游行

sentences.english: the St Patrick’s Day parade
sentences.chinese: 圣帕特里克节庆祝游行

sentences.english: a military parade
sentences.chinese: 军事检阅

sentences.english: The marchers paraded peacefully through the capital.
sentences.chinese: 游行队伍有秩序地列队穿过首都。

detailed_translations.english: a public celebration when musical bands, brightly decorated vehicles etc move down the street
to walk or march together to celebrate or protest about something

name: statue
trans: The Venus de Milo is a famous ancient Greek statue.

sentences.english: Churchill’s statue stands outside the parliament building.
sentences.chinese: 丘吉尔的塑像矗立在议会大厦外。

sentences.english: A bronze statue was erected in his honour.
sentences.chinese: 人们立了一座铜像纪念他。

detailed_translations.english: an image of a person or animal that is made in solid material such as stone or metal and is usually large

name: virgin
trans: The virgin goddess of the moon was known as Diana.

sentences.english: I was a virgin until I was thirty years old.
sentences.chinese: 我到30岁时还是个处女。

sentences.english: a virgin bride
sentences.chinese: 贞洁的新娘

detailed_translations.english: someone who has never had sex
without sexual experience

name: abnormal
trans: I felt abnormal this morning, like I was sick.

sentences.english: abnormal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 反常行为

sentences.english: an abnormal level of cholesterol
sentences.chinese: 胆固醇水平异常

sentences.english: My parents thought it was abnormal for a boy to be interested in ballet.
sentences.chinese: 我父母认为一个男孩子对芭蕾舞感兴趣并不正常。

detailed_translations.english: very different from usual in a way that seems strange, worrying, wrong, or dangerous

name: absent
trans: I was absent from school yesterday because I went on a trip with my father.

sentences.english: The dull, absent look on her face implied boredom.
sentences.chinese: 她脸上呆滞、茫然的神情说明她觉得无聊了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺席的；缺少的；心不在焉的；茫然的
detailed_translations.english: not at work, school, a meeting etc, because you are sick or decide not to go
to not go to a place or take part in an event where people expect you to be

name: adjacent
trans: My apartment is adjacent to a lovely park and playground.

sentences.english: We stayed in adjacent rooms.
sentences.chinese: 我们住在毗连的房间里。

sentences.english: the building adjacent to the library
sentences.chinese: 紧挨着图书馆的建筑

detailed_translations.english: (of an area, a building, a room, etc.) next to or near sth

name: aluminum
trans: I used the aluminum foil to wrap the food.

sentences.english: To make an aluminum can, that takes energy.
sentences.chinese: 为了制造一个铝罐，就得消耗能源。

sentences.english: And she sat and sat on that aluminum throne ever since.
sentences.chinese: 自那以后，她就一直坐在那个铝制的宝座上。

sentences.english: He says not only does arsenic belong under phosphorus, I predict that there is an element that lies below aluminum and above indium.
sentences.chinese: 他认为不仅砷属于在磷下面，我预言还有一个元素,是在铝之上和铟的下边的。

name: applicable
trans: I discovered that my old password was no longer applicable to the website.

sentences.english: What is a reasonable standard for one family is not applicable for another.
sentences.chinese: 对一个家庭合理的标准对于另一个家庭并不适用。

detailed_translations.english: if something is applicable to a particular person, group, or situation, it affects them or is related to them

name: artificial
trans: The artificial Christmas tree was made of plastic.

sentences.english: artificial flowers
sentences.chinese: 假花

sentences.english: artificial light
sentences.chinese: 人造光

sentences.english: artificial fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥

detailed_translations.english: not real or not made of natural things but made to be like something that is real or natural

name: bicycle
trans: I rode my bicycle down the mountain road.

sentences.english: Can James ride a bicycle yet?
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯会骑自行车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle with two wheels that you ride by pushing its pedals with your feet

name: broker
trans: The lawyer will broker our agreement.

sentences.english: a real estate broker
sentences.chinese: 房地产经纪人

detailed_translations.english: someone who buys and sells things such as  share s  in companies or foreign money for other people

detailed_translations.chinese: 作为权力经纪人进行谈判

name: bureaucracy
trans: The members of the bureaucracy were flooded by too many petitions.

sentences.english: the reduction of unnecessary bureaucracy
sentences.chinese: 消除不必要的官僚体制

detailed_translations.english: a complicated official system that is annoying or confusing because it has a lot of rules, processes etc

name: configure
trans: The engineer helped to configure my new computer.

name: consolidate
trans: When we moved in together, we had to consolidate our belongings.

sentences.english: The company has consolidated its position as the country’s leading gas supplier.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司巩固了作为该国主要煤气供应商的地位。

sentences.english: We consolidate information from a wide range of sources.
sentences.chinese: 我们把来自各种渠道的信息加以汇总。

detailed_translations.english: to strengthen the position of power or success that you have, so that it becomes more effective or continues for longer

name: convenience
trans: I love the convenience of having a swimming pool in my back yard.

sentences.english: Ready meals sell well because of their convenience.
sentences.chinese: 即食餐因为方便销路好。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being suitable or useful for a particular purpose, especially by making something easier or saving you time

name: deduct
trans: I had to deduct my expenses from my checkbook.

sentences.english: The company deducted this payment from his compensation.
sentences.chinese: 公司从他的补偿金中扣除了这笔款项。

detailed_translations.english: to take away an amount or part from a total

name: deem
trans: I deemed the ice cream to be very delicious.

sentences.english: French and German were deemed essential.
sentences.chinese: 法语和德语被认为是必需的。

detailed_translations.english: to think of something in a particular way or as having a particular quality

name: entrepreneur
trans: The entrepreneur made a success out of his new business.

sentences.english: “You have to be an optimist to be an inventor or entrepreneur, ” he concludes.
sentences.chinese: 要成为一位发明家或企业家，你必须得是个乐天派。

sentences.english: If any of you end up being entrepreneur, which I hope you will be, what do you have in store for yourself, and what does that journey look like?
sentences.chinese: 如果你们当中任何一个人成了企业家，这也是我希望你们做到的，你自己会有什么样的储备，那样的一段旅程又将是什么样的？

sentences.english: How would you define personal growth as an entrepreneur?
sentences.chinese: 你会如何定义,一个企业家的个人成长？

detailed_translations.english: someone who starts a new business or arranges business deals in order to make money, often in a way that involves financial risks

name: evenly
trans: Sprinkle the sugar evenly all over the cookies.

sentences.english: The profits will be split evenly between the three of us.
sentences.chinese: 利润将由我们三人平分。

sentences.english: ‘I warned you not to phone me, ’ he said evenly.
sentences.chinese: “我告诫过你不要给我打电话。”他平静地说。

detailed_translations.english: divided in an equal way

name: fiscal
trans: Did the company show fiscal growth this year?

sentences.english: a fiscal crisis
sentences.chinese: 财政危机

sentences.english: a fiscal matter
sentences.chinese: 财政事务

detailed_translations.english: relating to money, taxes, debts etc that are owned and managed by the government

name: franchise
trans: The fast food restaurant has a franchise near my home.

sentences.english: a franchise holder
sentences.chinese: 特许经营权持有人

sentences.english: a franchise agreement
sentences.chinese: 特许经营协议

detailed_translations.chinese: 特权；公民权；经销权；管辖权
detailed_translations.english: permission given by a company to someone who wants to sell its goods or services

detailed_translations.chinese: 给…以特许（或特权）；赋予公民权
detailed_translations.english: to give or sell a franchise to someone

name: ideological
trans: The citizens of England had ideological differenes about its government.

sentences.english: The party is split by ideological differences.
sentences.chinese: 意识形态上的差异造成该政党分裂。

detailed_translations.english: based on strong beliefs or ideas, especially political or economic ideas

name: robot
trans: I bought a robot that can clean the floor on its own.

sentences.english: cars built by robots
sentences.chinese: 机器人制造的汽车

detailed_translations.english: a machine that can move and do some of the work of a person, and is usually controlled by a computer

name: abbey
trans: When the monk returned to the abbey, he went immediately to his bedroom.

sentences.english: Once upon a time, there was an abbess in a small abbey .
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，一个小修道院里有一个女修道院院长。

detailed_translations.english: a large church with buildings next to it where  monk s  and  nun s  live or used to live

name: abundant
trans: Cakes, cookies, and candy were so abundant that the child was very happy.

sentences.english: an abundant supply of fresh water
sentences.chinese: 充足的淡水供应

sentences.english: abundant opportunities for well qualified staff
sentences.chinese: 提供给高素质的员工的大量机会

detailed_translations.chinese: 丰富的， 富裕的； 大量的， 充足的
detailed_translations.english: something that is abundant exists or is available in large quantities so that there is more than enough

name: adjoin
trans: She can listen to her brother’s conversations because her room adjoins his.

sentences.english: A vacant plot of land adjoins his house.
sentences.chinese: 有一块空地紧挨着他家。

detailed_translations.english: to be next to or joined to sth

name: ample
trans: There was an ample supply of oats to feed the horses.

sentences.english: an ample bosom
sentences.chinese: 丰满的胸部

detailed_translations.english: more than enough

name: arid
trans: Not many plants grow in the arid desert.

sentences.english: Water from the Great Lakes is pumped to arid regions .
sentences.chinese: 五大湖中的水被输往干旱地区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 干旱的；不毛的，[农] 荒芜的
detailed_translations.english: arid land or an arid  climate  is very dry because it has very little rain

name: cathedral
trans: The large cathedral is full of people on Sunday mornings.

sentences.english: This Gothic cathedral has attracted visitors from all around the world .
sentences.chinese: 这座哥特式的大教堂吸引了世界各地的游客。

sentences.english: Rosie gray is the one and only person , if it had not been for her , this crystal cathedral would not be here.
sentences.chinese: 她就是那一位，唯一的一人若没有她，水晶宫大教堂不会存在，这事工永远不会展开。

detailed_translations.english: the main church of a particular area under the control of a  bishop

name: crisis
trans: The crisis was over and things returned to normal.

sentences.english: The country now faces an economic crisis .
sentences.chinese: 该国目前正面临一场经济危机。

sentences.english: The Prime Minister was criticized for the way in which he handled the crisis .
sentences.chinese: 首相处理危机的方式遭到了批评。

sentences.english: the current debt crisis
sentences.chinese: 当前的债务危机

sentences.english: a major political crisis
sentences.chinese: 重大的政治危机

sentences.english: I was relieved that we had averted yet another financial crisis .
sentences.chinese: 我如释重负，我们又避免了一场财政危机。

sentences.english: Oil companies were heavily criticized when they made large profits during the oil crisis of the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 石油公司因在20世纪70年代的石油危机中赚取了丰厚利润而受到严厉抨击。

sentences.english: The car industry is now in crisis .
sentences.chinese: 汽车工业现在正处于危机之中。

sentences.english: He doesn’t seem to be very good at crisis management .
sentences.chinese: 他好像不大擅长处理危机。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which there are a lot of problems that must be dealt with quickly so that the situation does not get worse or more dangerous

name: deprive
trans: Because the child was bad, she was deprived of her dessert after dinner.

sentences.english: They've been deprived of the fuel necessary to heat their homes.
sentences.chinese: 他们无法得到住房取暖必需的燃料。

detailed_translations.english: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it

name: drought
trans: After three months of drought, the vegetation and trees started dying.

sentences.english: ...a country where drought and famines have killed up to two million people during the last eighteen years.
sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

name: eligible
trans: Only people who bought tickets were eligible to win a prize.

sentences.english: Stephen was regarded as an eligible bachelor.
sentences.chinese: 斯蒂芬被认为是一个钻石王老五。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

name: fast
trans: In her religion, they fast for five days and then have a big feast.

sentences.english: a fast car
sentences.chinese: 速度很快的汽车

sentences.english: That can’t be the time - my watch must be fast.
sentences.chinese: 不可能是这个时间——一定是我的表快了。

sentences.english: Slow down – you’re driving too fast.
sentences.chinese: 慢点——你开得太快了。

detailed_translations.english: moving or able to move quickly
moving quickly

name: grumble
trans: He grumbled about having to work late on Friday.

sentences.english: ‘This is boring,’ Kathleen grumbled.
sentences.chinese: “这真无聊。”凯瑟琳抱怨道。

sentences.english: My only grumble is that there isn't a non-smoking section.
sentences.chinese: 我惟一的抱怨是这儿没有无烟区。

sentences.english: They grumble about how hard they have to work.
sentences.chinese: 他们抱怨自己工作得很辛苦。

sentences.english: Taft grumbled that the law so favoured the criminal that trials seemed like a game of chance.
sentences.chinese: 塔夫脱抱怨法律如此有利于罪犯，使得审判看来像是一场运气的游戏。

detailed_translations.english: to keep complaining in an unhappy way
Grumble is also a noun
If someone grumbles, they complain about something in a bad-tempered way

name: inland
trans: The river curved inland near the campground.

sentences.english: The next day, we drove inland.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，我们乘车开往内陆。

sentences.english: We beached the boat and headed inland.
sentences.chinese: 我们想使船靠岸，朝内陆方向驶去。

sentences.english: In 1985 a glacier buried this shore; since then the ice has retreated a half mile inland.
sentences.chinese: 1985年，一座冰川在海滨融化，自那时起冰川已经向内陆退缩了半英里。

detailed_translations.english: an inland area, city etc is not near the coast

detailed_translations.chinese: 在内地；向内地；向内陆；在内陆
detailed_translations.english: in a direction away from the coast and towards the centre of a country

name: moisture
trans: If you breathe on a window, moisture from your breath collects on the glass.

sentences.english: Plants use their roots to absorb moisture from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物利用根从土壤中吸收水分。

sentences.english: Your skin’s moisture content varies according to weather conditions.
sentences.chinese: 皮肤的水分含量随着天气状况而变化。

detailed_translations.english: small amounts of water that are present in the air, in a substance, or on a surface

name: nonetheless
trans: She tried to keep the dog out of the mud, but it got dirty nonetheless.

sentences.english: The region was extremely beautiful. Nonetheless Gerard could not imagine spending the rest of his life there.
sentences.chinese: 那个地区非常漂亮，然而杰拉德却无法想象自己要在那里度过余生。

sentences.english: The paintings are complex, but have plenty of appeal nonetheless.
sentences.chinese: 这些画复杂难懂，不过还是不乏吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尽管如此， 依然， 然而
detailed_translations.english: in spite of the fact that has just been mentioned

name: oath
trans: Judges must take an oath to be fair to everyone in court.

sentences.english: The president took the oath of office (= made the official public promises that every president makes when starting their job ) .
sentences.chinese: 总统宣誓就职。

sentences.english: She could not break her oath .
sentences.chinese: 她不能违背誓言。

detailed_translations.english: a formal and very serious promise

name: prairie
trans: The prairie was perfect for a farm because there were hills and trees.

sentences.english: About 160 species of rare birds live in the swamps and prairie there.
sentences.chinese: 大约有160种珍稀鸟类栖息在这里的沼泽地和大草原上。

sentences.english: How many an afternoon antinia and i have trailed along the prairie under the magnificence .
sentences.chinese: 有多少个下午，我同安东妮亚在大草原上这种壮丽的景色中慢慢地走着啊！

sentences.english: From your English garden variety to your prairie wildflower, floral prints tell a sweet story.
sentences.chinese: 从英式花园的百花齐放到大草原的野花儿，印花叙述着甜美的故事。

detailed_translations.english: a wide open area of fairly flat land in North America which is covered in grass or wheat

name: rugged
trans: Their car couldn’t make it far along the rugged roads.

sentences.english: a rugged coastline
sentences.chinese: 崎岖不平的海岸线

sentences.english: the rugged beauty of the Highlands
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰高地崎岖起伏的美景

detailed_translations.chinese: 崎岖的；坚固的；高低不平的；粗糙的
detailed_translations.english: land that is rugged is rough and uneven

name: scarce
trans: When gasoline was scarce, we rode our bike to school instead of driving.

sentences.english: Food was often scarce in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 冬季常常粮食短缺。

sentences.english: There was fierce competition for the scarce resources .
sentences.chinese: 对这些紧缺资源的争夺非常激烈。

detailed_translations.chinese: 缺乏的， 不足的； 稀少的， 罕见的
detailed_translations.english: if something is scarce, there is not very much of it available

name: speculate
trans: My sister looked at the sky and speculated that it would rain tomorrow.

sentences.english: She refused to speculate.
sentences.chinese: 她拒绝猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to guess about the possible causes or effects of something, without knowing all the facts or details

name: aquatic
trans: The dolphin is an aquatic mammal.

sentences.english: an aquatic plant
sentences.chinese: 水生植物

detailed_translations.chinese: 水生的；水栖的；在水中或水面进行的
detailed_translations.english: living or growing in water

detailed_translations.chinese: 水上运动；水生植物或动物

name: biosphere
trans: Birds, trees, and worms all thrive in the biosphere.

sentences.english: The technosphere supports the biosphere.
sentences.chinese: 人工圈支持着生物圈。

sentences.english: The impact of modern technology on the biosphere is evident worldwide.
sentences.chinese: 现代技术对生物圈的影响在全世界是明显的。

sentences.english: The carbon cycle is the biogeochemical cycle by which carbon is exchanged among the biosphere, pedosphere, geosphere, hydrosphere, and atmosphere of the Earth.
sentences.chinese: 碳循环是一个生物地质化学循环圈，碳通过此循环在生物圈、土壤圈、地层、水圈、大气中交流。

detailed_translations.english: the part of the world in which animals, plants etc can live

name: bizarre
trans: My bizarre dreams make no sense to me when I am awake.

sentences.english: a bizarre coincidence
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的巧合

sentences.english: dancers in rather bizarre costumes
sentences.chinese: 身着奇装异服的舞者

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or strange

name: Celsius
trans: Water freezes at zero degrees Celsius.

sentences.english: Highest temperatures 11° Celsius, that's 52° Fahrenheit.
sentences.chinese: 最高温度11摄氏度，即52华氏度。

detailed_translations.english: Celsius is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.

detailed_translations.english: old and no longer used

name: enterprise

sentences.chinese: 国有企业/公共事业单位

sentences.english: We’re looking for young people with enterprise and creativity.
sentences.chinese: 我们在寻找有事业心和创造力的年轻人。

sentences.english: leasing and other forms of business finance
sentences.chinese: 租赁及其他商业金融形式

sentences.english: Russia’s finance minister
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯财政部长

sentences.english: the world of high finance
sentences.chinese: 高级金融界

name: indifferent

sentences.chinese: 政府从紧的货币政策

name: precaution

sentences.chinese: 防火措施被忽视了。

name: preliminary

sentences.english: the preliminary stages of the competition

sentences.chinese: 初稿

sentences.english: Water poured through the hole, saturating the carpet.
sentences.chinese: 水从洞里流进来，浸湿了地毯。

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透，使湿透；使饱和，使充满

detailed_translations.chinese: 浸透的，饱和的；深颜色的

name: simplicity

sentences.english: Mona wrote with a beautiful simplicity of style.
sentences.chinese: 莫娜的文笔朴实优美。

sentences.chinese: 为简明起见，税单分成三个部分。

sentences.english: James’ solution to this problem was simplicity itself (= very simple ) .
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯对这个问题的解决办法十分简单。

name: sow
trans: He always sows his garden seeds in the springtime.

sentences.english: Sow the seeds in late March.
sentences.chinese: 三月底播种。

detailed_translations.english: to plant or scatter seeds on a piece of ground

name: spade

sentences.english: ...a garden spade.
sentences.chinese: …一把花园里使用的锹。

detailed_translations.english: a tool for digging that has a long handle and a broad metal blade that you push into the ground

sentences.chinese: 他用竹竿支撑起西红柿秧。

sentences.english: Secondly,put some tomato paste on the bread.
sentences.chinese: 第二，放一些西红柿在面包上粘贴。

sentences.english: The salmon was brought to the table whole, garnished with parsley and slices of tomato and cucumber.
sentences.chinese: 整条大麻哈鱼被端上了桌，并用欧芹、西红柿片和黄瓜片作为花色配菜。

name: upcoming

sentences.english: the upcoming elections
sentences.chinese: 即将举行的选举

sentences.english: "In anthropology, you can't equate third gender with homosexuality," he said.
sentences.chinese: “在人类学中，你不能将同性恋和第三性别混同，”他说。

sentences.english: When I was a student at Cambridge I remember an anthropology professor holding up a picture of a bone with 28 incisions carved in it.
sentences.chinese: 当我还在剑桥读书的时候，我记得有一位人类学的教授拿出一张照片，上面是一根有28个切口的骨头。

sentences.english: Not to be the skunk at this party, but I think it's important to ask whether neuroscience reveals anything more than we already know from, say, anthropology.

name: applaud

sentences.chinese: 观众掌声雷动。

sentences.english: A crowd of 300 supporters warmly applauded her speech.

name: appoint
trans: Two students were appointed to help the scientists with their research.

sentences.english: a crude wooden bridge

name: cube

sentences.english: a sugar cube
sentences.chinese: 一块方糖

sentences.english: an ice cube
sentences.chinese: 一小方块冰

sentences.chinese: 把肉切成丁。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of energy, oil, electricity etc that is used

sentences.chinese: 一张卡纸

sentences.chinese: 警方还在调查这起事故的确切原因。

name: facilitate

name: fleet

sentences.english: Atalanta was fleet of foot (= able to run quickly ) .
sentences.chinese: 阿塔兰特跑起来很快。

detailed_translations.english: fast or quick

sentences.chinese: 国家电网

detailed_translations.english: the network of electricity supply wires that connects  power stations  and provides electricity to buildings in an area

sentences.english: a ban on beef imports
sentences.chinese: 禁止进口牛肉

sentences.english: In 2001, Britain exported more cars than it imported.
sentences.chinese: 2001年英国的汽车出口量大于进口

name: marble

sentences.english: The columns were of white marble.
sentences.chinese: 柱子是白色的大理石。

sentences.english: a marble statue
sentences.chinese: 大理石雕像

detailed_translations.english: a type of hard rock that becomes smooth when it is polished, and is used for making buildings,  statue s  etc

sentences.chinese: 尽管双桅帆给水手们提供了这些优势，它们也因为这额外的桅杆和船帆而造价更加昂贵。

sentences.chinese: 斯托芬表示，探测船将被制成胶囊状，并由一个小型核动力引擎驱动，尽管不会有帆，但船上会有一个固定照相机的桅杆。

sentences.english: She has also studied everything from how to stitch her own wounds to how to cope with sleep deprivation and how to put out fires on board her 11.5-metre twin-mast ketch.
sentences.chinese: 她还学习了相关知识，从如何缝合伤口，到如何应付睡眠不足的状况，再到如何扑灭高11.5米的双桅杆帆船上的火情，可谓应有尽有。

name: nausea

sentences.chinese: 我感到一阵恶心。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you think you are going to vomit (= bring food up from your stomach through your mouth )

name: naval
trans: The country sent all of its naval forces to protect them.

sentences.english: a naval officer
sentences.chinese: 海军军官

sentences.english: naval battles
sentences.chinese: 海战

detailed_translations.english: relating to the navy or used by the navy

name: pouch
trans: I keep my money in a small pouch.

sentences.english: a money pouch
sentences.chinese: 一个钱袋

detailed_translations.english: a small leather, cloth, or plastic bag that you can keep things in, and which is sometimes attached to a belt

name: saturated
trans: Leigh’s hair became saturated in the rainstorm.

detailed_translations.chinese: 饱和的；渗透的；深颜色的
detailed_translations.english: extremely wet

detailed_translations.chinese: 使渗透，使饱和（saturate的过去式）

name: update
trans: My phone is downloading a software update.

sentences.english: The files need updating.
sentences.chinese: 这些档案需要更新。

detailed_translations.english: to add the most recent information to something

name: attorney

sentences.english: ...a prosecuting attorney.
sentences.chinese: …一位公诉律师。

detailed_translations.english: a lawyer

name: chronic

sentences.english: chronic arthritis
sentences.chinese: 慢性关节炎

sentences.english: chronic asthma
sentences.chinese: 慢性哮喘

sentences.english: chronic heart disease
sentences.chinese: 慢性心脏病

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

name: donor
trans: He was proud to be a blood donor.

sentences.english: We urgently need more assistance from donor countries (= countries that give money, food etc to help in poor countries or disaster areas ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们急需捐赠国的更多援助。

sentences.english: An anonymous donor (= whose name is unknown ) has given £500 towards the restoration fund.
sentences.chinese: 一位匿名捐赠者向重建基金捐了500英镑。

sentences.english: ...the severe shortage of donor organs.
sentences.chinese: …捐献器官的严重匮乏。

detailed_translations.english: a person, group etc that gives something, especially money, to help an organization or country

detailed_translations.chinese: 捐献的；经人工授精出生的
detailed_translations.english: Donor organs or parts are organs or parts of the body which people allow doctors to use to help people who are ill

name: fellow
trans: All of my fellow patients at the hospital have also complained about the food.

sentences.english: Paul’s an easy-going sort of fellow.
sentences.chinese: 保罗人很随和。

detailed_translations.english: a man

name: gossip
trans: The friends exchanged gossip about the people they knew in school.

sentences.english: Who knows how much of the gossip was true.
sentences.chinese: 有谁知道这些流言蜚语有多少是真的呢？

sentences.english: You must avoid gossip and focus on what you have to do.
sentences.chinese: 务必避免流言蜚语，关注你必须做的事务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 流言蜚语；爱说长道短的人
detailed_translations.english: information that is passed from one person to another about other people’s behaviour and private lives, often including unkind or untrue remarks

name: graduate
trans: At the end of the spring, my friends and I will graduate from high school.

sentences.english: a graduate student
sentences.chinese: 研究生

detailed_translations.english: relating to or involved in studies done at a university after completing a first degree
to obtain a degree, especially a first degree, from a college or university
someone who has completed a university degree, especially a first degree

name: graffiti
trans: The wall was covered with colorful graffiti.

sentences.english: The walls are daubed with graffiti.
sentences.chinese: 墙上满是乱七八糟的涂鸦。

detailed_translations.chinese: 墙上乱写乱画的东西（graffito的复数形式）
detailed_translations.english: rude, humorous, or political writing and pictures on the walls of buildings, trains etc

name: guardian
trans: The librarians are the guardians of the books.

sentences.english: Destiny's legal guardian was her grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 德斯蒂妮的法定监护人是她的祖母。

detailed_translations.chinese: [法] 监护人，保护人；守护者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is legally responsible for looking after someone else’s child, especially after the child’s parents have died

name: implicate
trans: The man was implicated in the theft at the store.

sentences.english: The allegations implicated Abe to such an extent he was forced to resign.
sentences.chinese: 安倍深受指控牵连，不得不辞职。

detailed_translations.english: to show or suggest that someone is involved in a crime or dishonest act

name: kin
trans: His kin were all farmers.

sentences.english: We’ll have to notify the next of kin of his death.
sentences.chinese: 我们得把他去世的消息通知他的直系亲属。

detailed_translations.english: your family

name: referee
trans: The soccer player didn’t agree with the referee.

sentences.english: His headmaster agreed to act as his referee.
sentences.chinese: 他的校长同意做他的推荐人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who makes sure that the rules of a sport such as football,  basketball  , or  boxing  , are followed
to be the referee of a game

name: sever
trans: He severed the string using scissors.

sentences.english: Martin’s hand was severed in the accident.
sentences.chinese: 马丁的一只手在事故中被切断了。

sentences.english: a severed rope
sentences.chinese: 割断的绳子

detailed_translations.english: to cut through something completely, separating it into two parts, or to become cut in this way

detailed_translations.chinese: (Sever)人名；(俄)谢韦尔；(捷、塞、意、西、土、瑞典、罗)塞韦尔；(英)塞弗；(德)泽弗

name: shaft
trans: The golf club had a long wooden shaft that he held in his hands.

sentences.english: a drive shaft
sentences.chinese: 驱动轴

detailed_translations.chinese: 拍杆；[机] 轴；箭杆；杆状物
detailed_translations.english: an  arrow

name: stab
trans: He stabbed the fork into the potato and passed it to his daughter.

sentences.english: He was stabbed to death in a fight.
sentences.chinese: 他在一次打斗中被捅死了。

detailed_translations.english: to push a knife into someone or something
an act of stabbing or trying to stab someone with a knife

name: stimulus
trans: Having a lot of money is a stimulus for people to buy more things.

sentences.english: Tax cuts provided the stimulus which the slow economy needed.
sentences.chinese: 减税为不景气的经济带来了其所需的刺激。

detailed_translations.english: something that helps a process to develop more quickly or more strongly

name: suspicion
trans: The police had a suspicion that the driver had stolen the purse.

sentences.english: I can’t say for definite who did it, but I certainly have my suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不能确切说是谁干的，但我肯定有怀疑的对象。

sentences.english: Police suspicions were confirmed when the stolen property was found in his flat.
sentences.chinese: 失窃物品在他公寓里找到，警方的怀疑得到了证实。

sentences.english: I wondered how I could leave early without arousing anyone’s suspicions .
sentences.chinese: 我不知道怎么才能早点离开而又不引起别人的怀疑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑， 疑心， 猜疑； 一点儿， 少量
detailed_translations.english: a feeling you have that someone is probably guilty of doing something wrong or dishonest

name: terminate
trans: The trip was terminated after the car broke down.

sentences.english: The court ruled that the contract must be terminated.
sentences.chinese: 法庭裁决该合同必须终止。

sentences.english: to terminate a pregnancy (= to perform or have an abortion )
sentences.chinese: 终止妊娠（堕胎）

detailed_translations.english: ito end; to make sth end

name: theme
trans: The students discussed the book’s theme in class.

sentences.english: The book’s theme is the conflict between love and duty.
sentences.chinese: 本书的主题是爱与责任之间的冲突。

sentences.english: Freia’s theme in Wagner’s opera
sentences.chinese: 瓦格纳歌剧中的弗莱雅主旋律

detailed_translations.chinese: 题目；主题；主旋律；（句子的）主位；词干
detailed_translations.english: the main subject or idea in a piece of writing, speech, film etc

name: tuition
trans: University tuitions have increased by 50 percent in the last five years.

sentences.english: I had to have extra tuition in maths.
sentences.chinese: 我不得不上数学补习课。

detailed_translations.english: teaching, especially in small groups

name: aggressive
trans: Nobody liked to play games with him because he was always too aggressive.

sentences.english: Jim’s voice became aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的声音凶了起来。

sentences.english: Teachers apparently expect a certain amount of aggressive behaviour from boys.
sentences.chinese: 老师显然料到男孩子多少会有些好勇斗狠的行为。

sentences.english: A successful businessman has to be aggressive.
sentences.chinese: 成功的实业家必须得有股冲劲。

detailed_translations.chinese: 挑衅的，好斗的；有上进心的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in an angry threatening way, as if you want to fight or attack someone

name: amnesty
trans: She was denied amnesty for her involvement in the war.

sentences.english: Activists who were involved in crimes of violence will not automatically be granted amnesty.
sentences.chinese: 参与暴力犯罪的活跃分子不会被自动地给予赦免。

detailed_translations.english: an official order by a government that allows a particular group of prisoners to go free

name: arena
trans: The new arena was all set to hold the championship match.

sentences.english: a sports arena
sentences.chinese: 运动场

sentences.english: an indoor arena
sentences.chinese: 室内剧场

detailed_translations.english: a building with a large flat central area surrounded by seats, where sports or entertainments take place

name: auditorium
trans: People have gathered at the school auditorium to watch the play.

sentences.english: Anderson was to sing at the Constitution Hall auditorium.
sentences.chinese: 安德森将要在宪法厅的观众席演唱。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a theatre where people sit when watching a play, concert etc

name: captive
trans: The guards told the captive that there was no way he could escape the prison.

sentences.english: captive soldiers
sentences.chinese: 被俘的士兵

sentences.english: captive animals
sentences.chinese: 被关住的动物

sentences.english: His son had been taken captive (= became a prisoner ) during the raid.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子在这次突袭中被劫持了。

sentences.english: a pilot who was held captive (= kept as a prisoner ) for six years
sentences.chinese: 一名被囚六年的飞行员

detailed_translations.chinese: 被俘虏的， 被监禁的
detailed_translations.english: kept in prison or in a place that you are not allowed to leave
someone who is kept as a prisoner, especially in a war

name: combat
trans: The two warriors were locked in combat.

sentences.english: In the case of this battle, the combat did only last a singleday.
sentences.chinese: 在译成战役的情况下，这场战斗仅仅持续了短短的一天。

sentences.english: We will remove our combat brigades from Iraq by the end of next summer, and all of our troops by the end of 2011.
sentences.chinese: 我们会在明年夏末从伊拉克撤回我们的战斗旅，在2011年末，我们所有军队都将从伊拉克撤出。

sentences.english: These people would then be given training in vigilance and combat not just to defend themselves but also the borders.
sentences.chinese: 这些人会被提供警戒和战斗训练，不仅是为了保护自己，而且要保护边界安全。

detailed_translations.english: fighting, especially during a war

name: commonplace
trans: There is nothing commonplace about the way Morris dresses.

sentences.english: Car thefts are commonplace in this part of town.
sentences.chinese: 镇上的这个地段盗车案屡见不鲜。

sentences.english: It is a commonplace to say that Northern Ireland is a backwater in the modern Europe.
sentences.chinese: 说北爱尔兰是现代欧洲死气沉沉的落后地区已是陈词滥调了。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing in many places, and therefore not special or unusual
something that has been said so often that it is no longer interesting or original

name: compound
trans: The workers waited outside the compound for the gates of the factory to open.

sentences.english: ...the big compound eyes of dragonflies.
sentences.chinese: …蜻蜓的大复眼。

detailed_translations.english: Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things
a substance containing atoms from two or more  elements

detailed_translations.chinese: 使恶化， 加重； 使化合， 使合成
detailed_translations.english: to make a difficult situation worse by adding more problems

name: corps
trans: The army had a corps of archers who trained apart from the regular soldiers.

sentences.english: My corps ! your corps ! our corps ! maring corps !
sentences.chinese: 我的、你的、大家的海军陆战队！

sentences.english: The corps' corn in the corner is scorned by the stubborn corporation.
sentences.chinese: 军团在角落里的谷物受到了顽固的公司司（社团）的嘲笑。

detailed_translations.english: a trained army unit made of two or more  divisions (= groups of soldiers )

name: distract
trans: The phone call distracted him so much that he forgot all about his homework.

sentences.english: Try not to distract the other students.
sentences.chinese: 尽量不要让其他学生分心。

detailed_translations.english: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

name: dumb
trans: She did not share the secret. She remained as silent as if she were dumb.

sentences.english: What a dumb question.
sentences.chinese: 多么愚蠢的问题。

sentences.english: a bunch of dumb kids
sentences.chinese: 一帮笨孩子

sentences.english: ‘What is it?’ I asked, playing dumb (= pretending to be stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: “那是什么？” 我装傻问道。

sentences.english: She’s no dumb blonde (= a pretty woman with blonde hair who seems stupid ) .
sentences.chinese: 她可不是那种没有头脑的金发女郎。

detailed_translations.chinese: 哑的；暂不说话的；愚笨的
detailed_translations.english: stupid

name: foe
trans: It was hard to believe that anyone could be his foe.

sentences.english: Britain’s friends and foes
sentences.chinese: 英国的朋友和敌人

detailed_translations.english: an enemy

name: hack
trans: My uncle used the ax to hack the tree into many logs.

sentences.english: One more hack and the branch was off.
sentences.chinese: 又砍了一下树枝就掉下来了。

detailed_translations.english: a taxi, or a taxi driver
to cut something roughly or violently

name: meditate
trans: She liked to meditate for several hours each day.

sentences.english: She sat quietly, meditating on the day’s events.
sentences.chinese: 她静静地坐着，思考着这一天发生的事。

sentences.english: I try to meditate for half an hour every evening.
sentences.chinese: 我每天晚上尽量默想半小时。

detailed_translations.chinese: 想,考虑；(尤指宗教上的)沉思,冥想
detailed_translations.english: to think seriously and deeply about something

name: nick
trans: While cutting the carrots, the cook nicked his finger with the edge of his knife.

sentences.english: The barbed wire had left only the tiniest nick just below my right eye.
sentences.chinese: 这带刺的铁丝在我右眼正下方只留下了极小的划痕。

detailed_translations.english: a very small cut made on the edge or surface of something

name: provoke
trans: The older boy provoked Paul by calling him mean names.

sentences.english: The dog would not have attacked if it hadn’t been provoked.
sentences.chinese: 如果不是被惹恼了，那狗原本不会攻击的。

sentences.english: Paul tried to provoke Fletch into a fight.
sentences.chinese: 保罗试图激怒弗莱琪打一架。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone angry, especially deliberately

name: realm
trans: He was not very active in the realm of business.

sentences.english: the spiritual realm
sentences.chinese: 精神领域

detailed_translations.english: a general area of knowledge, activity, or thought

name: reign
trans: The emperor’s reign lasted for only two years.

sentences.english: Last night confusion reigned about how the debate, which continues today, would end.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚，这场在今天继续进行的辩论将如何结束的问题令人困惑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 当政， 统治； 占主导地位
detailed_translations.english: If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused

detailed_translations.chinese: 君主的统治，君主的统治时期
detailed_translations.english: the period when someone is king, queen, or  emperor

name: rust
trans: The old metal gate would not swing because the hinges were covered in rust.

sentences.english: There were large patches of rust on the car.
sentences.chinese: 车上有大片锈斑。

sentences.english: The metal had begun to rust.
sentences.chinese: 金属开始生锈。

detailed_translations.english: the reddish-brown substance that forms on iron or steel when it gets wet
to become covered with rust, or to make something become covered in rust

name: sacred
trans: One religion in India will not harm cows because it believes that they are sacred.

sentences.english: a sacred vow
sentences.chinese: 神圣的誓言

sentences.english: the miraculous powers of sacred relics
sentences.chinese: 圣物的神奇力量

sentences.english: Certain animals were considered sacred.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物被认为是神圣的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 神的；神圣的；宗教的；庄严的
detailed_translations.english: relating to a god or religion

name: aesthetic
trans: The dresses were noteworthy for their aesthetic design.

sentences.english: From an esthetic point of view, it’s a nice design.
sentences.chinese: 从美学角度看，这是个不错的设计。

sentences.english: a work of great aesthetic appeal
sentences.chinese: 极富美之神韵的作品

detailed_translations.english: connected with beauty and the study of beauty

name: arrogant
trans: He is very arrogant. Even though he’s not the boss, he tells everyone what to do.

sentences.english: He was unbearably arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 他的傲慢让人无法忍受。

sentences.english: an arrogant attitude
sentences.chinese: 傲慢的态度

detailed_translations.english: behaving in an unpleasant or rude way because you think you are more important than other people

name: bias
trans: The mothers had a natural bias for their own child’s picture.

sentences.english: Students were evaluated without bias.
sentences.chinese: 对学生的评估都是公正的。

detailed_translations.english: an opinion about whether a person, group, or idea is good or bad that influences how you deal with it

name: canyon
trans: The canyon was so deep that the ground inside was covered in shadow.

sentences.english: The canyon is famous for producing echoes.
sentences.chinese: 这个峡谷以回声而闻名。

sentences.english: The grand canyon was not dug by the hand of man, but riven by nature.
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷并非人力所开而是受大自然之力而成的。

sentences.english: We made our way up the fixed rope and then down into a deeper third canyon.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着固定的绳索前进，然后到达了一个更深的峡谷，这已经是第三个了。

detailed_translations.english: a deep valley with very steep sides of rock that usually has a river running through it

name: creek
trans: Only small fish lived in the shallow waters of the creek.

sentences.english: Follow Austin Creek for a few miles.
sentences.chinese: 沿着奥斯汀河走上几英里。

detailed_translations.english: a small narrow stream or river

name: drill
trans: The carpenter used the drill to make several holes in the wood.

sentences.english: an electric drill
sentences.chinese: 电钻

sentences.english: rifle drill
sentences.chinese: 步枪操练

sentences.english: Drill a hole in each corner.
sentences.chinese: 在每个角上钻一个孔。

detailed_translations.english: a tool or machine used for making holes in something
to make a hole in something using a drill

name: executive
trans: After twenty years at the company, he finally became the executive.

sentences.english: a commission with executive powers
sentences.chinese: 有执行权的委员会

detailed_translations.english: relating to the job of managing a business or organization and making decisions
a group of people who are in charge of an organization and make the rules

name: fatigue
trans: After three days with little sleep, she was feeling a lot of fatigue.

sentences.english: She hoped to sleep off her fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 她希望睡一觉之后会消除疲劳。

sentences.english: I have got over my weakness and fatigue.
sentences.chinese: 我已从虚弱和疲劳中恢复过来了。

sentences.english: Everyone has analogy fatigue at this point.
sentences.chinese: 在这一点上，人人都有类比疲劳。

detailed_translations.english: very great tiredness

name: incline
trans: This mountain has one of the steepest inclines in the world.

sentences.english: a steep incline
sentences.chinese: 陡坡

detailed_translations.english: a slope
if a situation, fact etc inclines you to do or think something, it influences you towards a particular action or opinion

name: nasty
trans: The rotten apple left a nasty taste inside her mouth.

sentences.english: a nasty temper
sentences.chinese: 坏脾气

sentences.english: the nasty things that were being written about her
sentences.chinese: 人们描述的那些关于她的坏事情

sentences.english: There’s a nasty streak in her character.
sentences.chinese: 她性格中有令人讨厌的一面。

sentences.english: Drivers often have a nasty habit of driving too close to cyclists.
sentences.chinese: 司机常有一个坏习惯，就是车开得离骑自行车的人太近。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下流的；肮脏的；脾气不好的；险恶的
detailed_translations.english: nasty behaviour or remarks are extremely unkind and unpleasant

name: perceive
trans: He was talking loudly, so he did not perceive that the music had stopped.

sentences.english: That morning, he perceived a change in Franca’s mood.
sentences.chinese: 那天早上，他注意到弗兰卡情绪的变化。

sentences.english: Cats are not able to perceive colour.
sentences.chinese: 猫不能辨别颜色。

detailed_translations.english: to notice, see, or recognize something

name: primate
trans: Primates use their hands for such tasks as swinging from branches.

sentences.english: The woolly spider monkey is the largest primate in the Americas.
sentences.chinese: 绒毛蛛猴是美洲最大的灵长目动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大主教；灵长类的动物；首领
detailed_translations.english: a member of the group of animals that includes humans and monkeys

name: primitive
trans: The computers of the 1980s are primitive compared to those of today.

sentences.english: a primitive society
sentences.chinese: 原始社会

sentences.english: a primitive nomadic tribe
sentences.chinese: 原始的游牧部落

sentences.english: the tools used by primitive man
sentences.chinese: 原始人所用的工具

sentences.english: primitive art
sentences.chinese: 原始艺术

sentences.english: The first station buildings were quite primitive.
sentences.chinese: 最初的车站建筑很简陋。

detailed_translations.chinese: 原始的；简单的；简单的，简陋的
detailed_translations.english: belonging to a simple way of life that existed in the past and does not have modern industries and machines

name: stereotype
trans: There’s a stereotype that pigs are dirty animals. But they are rather clean.

sentences.english: There's always been a stereotype about successful businessmen.
sentences.chinese: 对成功的商人们总有一种成见。

detailed_translations.english: a belief or idea of what a particular type of person or thing is like. Stereotypes are often unfair or untrue.

name: sticky
trans: Place the sticky part of the tape against the paper, so it will cling to the wall.

sentences.english: There’s some sticky stuff in your hair.
sentences.chinese: 你的头发上有什么黏糊糊的东西。

sentences.english: a sticky floor
sentences.chinese: 黏糊糊的地板

detailed_translations.english: made of or covered with a substance that sticks to surfaces

name: termite
trans: The wood we found was full of termites.

sentences.english: A German man and woman, their faces in close-up, talked about the good and essential symbiotic nature of termite mounds, with subtitles.
sentences.chinese: 一个德国男人和女人的脸部特写镜头，他们在谈论白蚁堆美好而必要的共栖性特质，带字幕。

sentences.english: Office blocks modeled on termite nests and buildings that can resist climate change have been the focus at a conference by some of Australia's most influential designers in Melbourne.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚一些最有影响的设计师在墨尔本的一个会议上着重讨论了以白蚁巢穴为模型的办公楼群，以及能够抵御气候变化的建筑物。

sentences.english: The hills recede into the distance and now we are in vast grasslands dotted with termite mounds, skyscraper sandcastles of the insect world.
sentences.chinese: 山丘已经远去，我们现在行进在宽广的草原上，草地上有白蚁堆，那是昆虫世界的摩天大楼。

detailed_translations.english: an insect that eats and destroys wood from trees and buildings

name: thereby
trans: He didn’t score a goal, thereby ending his chance at setting a record.

sentences.english: Our bodies can sweat, thereby losing heat by evaporation.
sentences.chinese: 我们的身体会流汗，由此能通过蒸发散热。

detailed_translations.english: with the result that something else happens

name: trail
trans: A narrow trail cut through the field and over the hills.

sentences.english: The trail led over Boulder Pass before descending to a lake.
sentences.chinese: 小路越过博尔德山口，然后向下通往湖边。

sentences.english: The bus left a trail of black smoke behind it.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车开过，留下一股黑烟。

sentences.english: Police trailed the gang for several days.
sentences.chinese: 警察跟踪了那个团伙好几天。

detailed_translations.english: a rough path across countryside or through a forest
to follow someone by looking for signs that they have gone in a particular direction

name: twig
trans: They started the fire with a handful of dry twigs.

sentences.english: There is the bird, sitting on a twig halfway up the tree.
sentences.chinese: 鸟儿在那里，栖息在树中段的一根细枝上。

detailed_translations.english: to understand (something)
a small very thin stem of wood that grows from a branch on a tree

name: welfare
trans: Having plenty of clean water is necessary for the welfare of people.

sentences.english: Our only concern is the children’s welfare.
sentences.chinese: 我们唯一关心的是孩子们的幸福。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s welfare is their health and happiness

name: behalf
trans: The original speaker was sick, so his son gave the speech on his behalf.

sentences.english: She asked the doctor to speak to her parents on her behalf.
sentences.chinese: 她请医生代她同她父母谈谈。

sentences.english: On behalf of everyone here, may I wish you a very happy retirement.
sentences.chinese: 请允许我代表在座的各位祝你退休后生活愉快。

detailed_translations.english: instead of someone, or as their representative

trans: The tiny bird flapped its wings and ate from the flowers.

sentences.english: The flags were flapping in the breeze.
sentences.chinese: 旗帜在微风中飘扬。

detailed_translations.chinese: 飘动， 拍动； 振翅
detailed_translations.english: if a bird flaps its wings, it moves them up and down in order to fly

detailed_translations.chinese: 片状垂悬物；飘动，摆动，振动；激动，慌忙状态
detailed_translations.english: a thin flat piece of cloth, paper, skin etc that is fixed by one edge to a surface, which you can lift up easily
to move quickly up and down or from side to side, often making a noise

name: glacier
trans: The North Pole is covered by a huge glacier.

sentences.english: The glacier calved a large iceberg.
sentences.chinese: 冰川崩解而产生一个大冰山。

sentences.english: The glacier dislocated great stones.
sentences.chinese: 冰川使许多大石块移位了。

sentences.english: A river or glacier debouches on the plains.
sentences.chinese: 一条河流或冰川流向平原。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

name: globe
trans: Water covers most of the globe.

sentences.english: Three large globes stand on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 3个巨大的地球仪立在地板上。

sentences.english: We export our goods all over the globe.
sentences.chinese: 我们的商品出口到世界各地。

detailed_translations.english: the world

name: horizontal
trans: The Russian fag has three horizontal stripes of white, blue, and red.

sentences.english: a horizontal surface
sentences.chinese: 水平面

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平的；地平线的；同一阶层的
detailed_translations.english: flat and level

detailed_translations.chinese: 水平线，水平面；水平位置
detailed_translations.english: a horizontal line or surface

name: hum
trans: The man hummed his favorite song.

sentences.english: He began to hum a tune.
sentences.chinese: 他开始哼唱一支曲子。

detailed_translations.english: to sing a tune by making a continuous sound with your lips closed
a low continuous sound

name: inventory
trans: Gwen was checking the inventory to make sure we had what we needed.

sentences.english: ...one inventory of twelve sails for each yacht.
sentences.chinese: …为每艘游艇配备12张帆的存货。

detailed_translations.chinese: 详细目录， 存货清单
detailed_translations.english: a list of all the things in a place

name: inward
trans: She had an inward feeling of guilt when she lied to her mother.

sentences.english: a feeling of inward satisfaction
sentences.chinese: 内心的满足感

sentences.english: inward panic
sentences.chinese: 内心的恐慌

sentences.english: He pushed open the front door, which swung inward with a groan.
sentences.chinese: 他推开前门，门呀的一声向里开了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 向内的；内部的；精神的；本质上的；熟悉的
detailed_translations.english: felt or experienced in your own mind but not expressed to other people
If something moves or faces inward, it moves or faces toward the inside or centre of something

name: loaf
trans: Could you please buy a loaf of bread for sandwiches?

sentences.english: a loaf of bread
sentences.chinese: 一条面包

detailed_translations.english: bread that is shaped and baked in one piece and can be cut into slices

detailed_translations.chinese: 游荡；游手好闲；虚度光阴
detailed_translations.english: to spend time somewhere and not do very much

name: oracle
trans: The king went to the oracle to ask if going to war was a good idea.

detailed_translations.english: someone who the ancient Greeks believed could communicate with the gods, who gave advice to people or told them what would happen

name: orbit
trans: The Moon orbits the Earth.

sentences.english: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: overview
trans: My brother gave me an overview of the important parts of the book.

sentences.english: The central section of the book is a historical overview of drug use.
sentences.chinese: 本书的中心部分是对药物使用的一个历史概述。

detailed_translations.english: a short description of a subject or situation that gives the main ideas without explaining all the details

name: preview
trans: The band played us a preview of their new song.

sentences.english: the press preview of the show (= when people who write for newspapers, television etc could see it )
sentences.chinese: 该节目的媒体试映

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when you can see a film, play, painting etc before it is shown to the public
to see or describe something before it is shown to the public

name: previous
trans: He turned back to the previous page to read the paragraph again.

sentences.english: She has a teenage daughter from a previous marriage.
sentences.chinese: 她有个出自前一次婚姻的十几岁的女儿。

detailed_translations.english: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

name: provide
trans: Each student was provided with a test and three sharp pencils.

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

trans: Burglaries seem to recur over and over in our neighborhood.

sentences.english: There is a danger that the disease may recur.
sentences.chinese: 这种病有复发的危险。

sentences.english: Love is a recurring theme in the book.
sentences.chinese: 爱情是这本书中反复出现的主题。

detailed_translations.chinese: (尤指不好的事)一再发生；重现
detailed_translations.english: if something, especially something bad or unpleasant, recurs, it happens again

name: relevant
trans: The 30-year-old book about politics is still relevant to our society today.

sentences.english: Relevant documents were presented in court.
sentences.chinese: 法庭上出示了相关的文件。

sentences.english: We received all the relevant information.
sentences.chinese: 我们收到了所有相关信息。

detailed_translations.english: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

trans: Special masks are worn during the rite when a new baby is born.

sentences.english: funeral rites
sentences.chinese: 殡葬仪式

sentences.english: ancient fertility rites
sentences.chinese: 古代的生殖崇拜仪式

sentences.english: These traditional rites are performed only by the women of the village.
sentences.chinese: 这些传统仪式只由村里的女人来进行。

detailed_translations.english: a ceremony that is always performed in the same way, usually for religious purposes

name: stall
trans: If you give the car a push, it won’t stall.

sentences.english: Quit stalling and answer my question!
sentences.chinese: 别拖延时间，快回答我的问题！

sentences.english: He was just stalling for time .
sentences.chinese: 他只是在拖延时间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 熄火； 拖延， 推迟
detailed_translations.english: to deliberately delay because you are not ready to do something, answer questions etc
a table or a small shop with an open front, especially outdoors, where goods are sold

name: supernatural
trans: The dragon had supernatural powers, such as flying and breathing fire.

sentences.english: supernatural powers
sentences.chinese: 超自然力量

sentences.english: He writes short stories with a touch of the supernatural.
sentences.chinese: 他写带点儿超自然物的短篇故事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 超自然的；神奇的，不可思议的
detailed_translations.english: impossible to explain by natural causes, and therefore seeming to involve the powers of gods or magic

detailed_translations.chinese: 超自然现象；不可思议的事
detailed_translations.english: The supernatural is things that are supernatural
