trans: We took a trip to the aquarium and saw a scary shark.

sentences.english: We saw a ray at the aquarium.
sentences.chinese: 我们在水族馆看见了一只鳐。

sentences.english: In Amsterdam the girls all stand in the windows shimmering as tantalising as tropical fish beyond the gleam of aquarium glass.
sentences.chinese: 在阿姆斯特丹，姑娘们都站在窗后，光芒四射柔情撩人宛如水族馆玻璃背后脉脉含情的热带鱼。

sentences.english: Recently the bakers created an octopus complete with tentacles and suckers for a charity event held for a local aquarium.
sentences.chinese: 最近，面包师为当地水族馆举行的慈善活动制作了这只章鱼，它拥有完整的触手和吸盘。

detailed_translations.english: a clear glass or plastic container for fish and other water animals

name: arbitrary
trans: The classroom had many arbitrary rules that confused me.

sentences.english: an arbitrary decision
sentences.chinese: 武断的决定

sentences.english: the arbitrary arrests of political opponents
sentences.chinese: 对政敌的任意逮捕

detailed_translations.english: decided or arranged without any reason or plan, often unfairly

name: autobiography
trans: I read an autobiography about my favorite entertainer.

sentences.english: He published his autobiography last autumn.
sentences.chinese: 他去年秋天出版了他的自传。

detailed_translations.english: a book in which someone writes about their own life, or books of this type

name: convention
trans: In the US, a popular convention is to shake hands when you meet someone.

sentences.english: a teachers’ convention
sentences.chinese: 教师大会

sentences.english: the city’s new convention center
sentences.chinese: 该市新建的会议中心

sentences.english: a convention for science fiction fans
sentences.chinese: 科幻小说迷的集会

detailed_translations.english: a large formal meeting for people who belong to the same profession or organization or who have the same interests

name: gracious
trans: The operator was gracious enough to help me find the number.

sentences.english: Sibyl was the most gracious, helpful, and generous person to work with.
sentences.chinese: 西比尔非常和蔼，乐于助人，而且为人慷慨，和她共事最愉快。

sentences.english: a gracious apology
sentences.chinese: 落落大方的道歉

detailed_translations.chinese: 亲切的，和蔼的；优美的；雅致的，雍容华贵的
detailed_translations.english: behaving in a polite, kind, and generous way, especially to people of a lower rank

name: improve
trans: He studied hard to improve his test scores from the previous year.

sentences.english: a course for students wishing to improve their English
sentences.chinese: 为想提高英语水平的学生开设的一门课

sentences.english: The doctors say she is improving (= after being ill ).
sentences.chinese: 医生说她正在康复。

sentences.english: You could use the money for improving your home.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用这笔钱改善家居。

sentences.english: Many wines improve with age (= get better as they get older ).
sentences.chinese: 很多葡萄酒年代越久越香醇。

detailed_translations.english: to make something better, or to become better
to make something better, or to become better

name: insulate
trans: People can conserve energy by insulating their houses.

sentences.english: an insulated attic
sentences.chinese: 隔热[隔音]的阁楼

sentences.english: Pipes may need insulating against the cold.
sentences.chinese: 管道可能需要隔温以防冰冻。

name: intrigue

sentences.english: Other people’s houses always intrigued her.
sentences.chinese: 别人的房子总令她好奇。

if something intrigues you, it interests you a lot because it seems strange or mysterious

detailed_translations.chinese: 阴谋， 诡计， 密谋
detailed_translations.english: the making of secret plans to harm someone or make them lose their position of power, or a plan of this kind

name: longevity

sentences.english: The ancient Chinese claimed that garlic promoted longevity.
sentences.chinese: 中国古人说蒜能延寿。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of time that someone or something lives

sentences.english: Oh dear, I seem to have misplaced the letter.
sentences.chinese: 哎呀，我好像忘了把信放在什么地方。

detailed_translations.chinese: 放错地方；忘记把…放在什么地方；错误地信任某人
detailed_translations.english: to lose something for a short time by putting it in the wrong place

name: naughty
trans: The boy had to go to his room because he was being naughty.

sentences.english: You’re a very naughty boy! Look what you’ve done!
sentences.chinese: 你真是个淘气鬼！瞧你干了些什么！

detailed_translations.english: a naughty child does not obey adults and behaves badly

name: norm
trans: Wearing a heavy coat all summer is not considered a norm.

sentences.english: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

detailed_translations.english: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

name: orangutan

sentences.english: From ostrich to orangutan, egg sac to live birth, infanticide to matricide, the diversity of behaviors between parent and progeny is as great as the diversity of life on our planet.
sentences.chinese: 从鸵鸟到猩猩，从卵囊孵化到活产，从婴孩夭折到母亲难产而死， 亲代和后代行为的多元化堪比我们这个星球的生物多样性。

sentences.english: Martel's acclaimed novel chronicles the travails of a shipwrecked teenage boy stuck on a life raft with only a female orangutan, injured zebra, hungry hyena and brooding Bengal tiger for company.
sentences.chinese: 马特尔备受推崇的小说记述了一名男孩在船只遇难后，与一只雌猩猩、受伤的斑马、饥饿的鬣狗和一只阴沉的孟加拉虎困在一条救生筏上的苦难历程。

detailed_translations.english: An orangutan is an ape with long reddish hair that comes from Borneo and Sumatra

name: overload
trans: If you overload the truck, it might crash.

sentences.english: 57 percent complained of work overload.
sentences.chinese: 57%的人抱怨工作负担过重。

detailed_translations.english: too much of sth

name: philanthropy

sentences.english: ...a retired banker well known for his philanthropy.
sentences.chinese: ...一位以乐善好施闻名的退休银行家。

detailed_translations.english: the practice of giving money and help to people who are poor or in trouble

name: probe

sentences.english: a fibre-optic probe
sentences.chinese: 一根光纤探针

sentences.english: The surgeon would pick up his instruments, probe, repair, and stitch up again.
sentences.chinese: 外科医生会拿起器械进行探查、修复，然后再缝合。

detailed_translations.english: a long thin metal instrument that doctors and scientists use to examine parts of the body
to look for something or examine something, using a long thin object

name: recipient

sentences.english: ...the largest recipient of U.S. foreign aid.
sentences.chinese: …最大的美国对外援助接受方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who receives something

sentences.english: Bird evolved from reptiles, so the first bird must have come out of an egg--laid by a reptile.
sentences.chinese: 禽类是由爬虫类进化而来，所以，第一只禽鸟肯定是从爬虫类孵化的蛋里出来的。

sentences.english: No matter how dry your skin gets, you will never turn into an alligator or any other type of reptile.
sentences.chinese: 不论皮肤多么干燥，你永远不会变成美洲鳄或任何其他一种皮肤粗糙的爬行动物。

sentences.chinese: 这种身长只有10厘米小型爬行动物，可以在沙子中以最快每秒15厘米的速度游动。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal, such as a snake or  lizard  , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

name: thrive
trans: He may be an old man, but he continues to thrive.

sentences.english: plants that thrive in tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 在热带雨林蓬勃生长的植物

sentences.english: a business which managed to thrive during a recession
sentences.chinese: 在经济萧条时期也能顺利发展的一家企业

detailed_translations.english: to become very successful or very strong and healthy

name: ultimate
trans: By trying hard in school, I will reach my ultimate goal of becoming a doctor.

sentences.english: The ultimate outcome of the experiment cannot be predicted.
sentences.chinese: 试验的最后结果无法预测。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s ultimate aim is their main and most important aim, that they hope to achieve in the future

name: antique
trans: My grandmother’s antique rocking chair is worth a lot of money.

sentences.english: an antique rosewood desk
sentences.chinese: 古董红木书桌

detailed_translations.chinese: 古老的，年代久远的；过时的，古董的；古风的，古式的
detailed_translations.english: antique furniture, jewellery etc is old and often valuable

detailed_translations.chinese: 古董，古玩；古风，古希腊和古罗马艺术风格
detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture, jewellery etc that was made a very long time ago and is therefore valuable

name: applicant
trans: Lots of applicants came into the store when the job position became available.

sentences.english: We have had lots of applicants for these positions.
sentences.chinese: 对这些职位我们已有了很多申请人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has formally asked, usually in writing, for a job, university place etc

name: artifact
trans: We studied artifacts from an ancient Chinese settlement.

sentences.english: In the wrong hands this powerful artifact has the ability to unravel the soul.
sentences.chinese: 在错误手这强有力的人工制品有能力解开灵魂。

name: authentic
trans: We ate authentic Italian food on our vacation to Rome.

sentences.english: an authentic account
sentences.chinese: 真实可信的说法

detailed_translations.chinese: 真的， 真正的； 可靠的， 可信的
detailed_translations.english: based on facts

name: chronology
trans: We learned the chronology of World War II in history class.

sentences.english: The book includes a chronology of his life and works.
sentences.chinese: 本书附有他的生平和著作年表。

detailed_translations.english: an account of events in the order in which they happened

name: diplomat
trans: The Spanish diplomat discussed trade issues with officials in Peru.

sentences.english: French diplomats
sentences.chinese: 法国外交官

detailed_translations.english: someone who officially represents their government in a foreign country

name: epic
trans: The poet wrote an epic about the great discoveries of the past thousand years.

sentences.english: an epic tale of mutiny on the high seas
sentences.chinese: 关于公海哗变的惊心动魄的故事

sentences.english: epic poetry
sentences.chinese: 史诗

detailed_translations.english: an epic book, poem, or film tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

detailed_translations.chinese: 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品
detailed_translations.english: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

name: excerpt
trans: I didn’t listen to the entire symphony online, but I did play an excerpt.

sentences.english: ...an excerpt from Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker.
sentences.chinese: …柴可夫斯基的《胡桃夹子》选段。

detailed_translations.english: a short piece taken from a book, poem, piece of music etc

name: fossil
trans: The expert arranged the fossils to build the skeleton of the dinosaur.

sentences.english: fossils of early reptiles
sentences.chinese: 早期爬行动物的化石

sentences.english: Marine sponges have a long fossil record (= their development has been recorded over a long period ).
sentences.chinese: 海绵动物留下了漫长的化石记录。

detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant that lived many thousands of years ago and that has been preserved, or the shape of one of these animals or plants that has been preserved in rock

name: humiliate
trans: I was humiliated when I tripped and fell down in front of the whole school.

sentences.english: Her boss humiliated her in front of all her colleagues.
sentences.chinese: 她的老板在所有同事面前羞辱了她。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel ashamed or stupid, especially when other people are present

name: lyric
trans: I enjoy reading and creating my own lyric poetry.

sentences.english: Wordsworth was one of the greatest lyric poets of his time.
sentences.chinese: 华兹华斯是他那个时代最伟大的抒情诗人之一。

detailed_translations.english: expressing strong personal emotions such as love, in a way that is similar to music in its sounds and  rhythm
the words of a song

name: majesty
trans: The majesty of the old castle amazed the tourists who came to see it.

sentences.english: the sheer majesty of St Peter's in Rome
sentences.chinese: 罗马圣彼得大教堂的雄伟庄严

sentences.english: His Majesty the King
sentences.chinese: 国王陛下

detailed_translations.english: the impressive and attractive quality that sth has

name: monarch
trans: The monarch lived in a beautiful palace with a grand gate.

sentences.english: Britain's head of state is a constitutional monarch.
sentences.chinese: 英国的国家元首是君主立宪的国王或女王。

detailed_translations.english: a king or queen

name: precede
trans: The hurricane was preceded by a moment of still wind and clear sky.

sentences.english: a type of cloud that precedes rain
sentences.chinese: 下雨前出现的一种云

sentences.english: Lunch will be preceded by a short speech from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 午餐开始之前主席会发表一段简短的讲话。

sentences.english: The guard preceded them down the corridor.
sentences.chinese: 警卫带领他们穿过了走廊。

detailed_translations.english: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

name: punctual
trans: My mother hates being late. She is the most punctual person I know.

sentences.english: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
sentences.chinese: 她一向准时赴约。

sentences.english: the punctual payment of invoices
sentences.chinese: 准时结清费用清单

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged

name: recruit
trans: We successfully recruited someone to be the new manager.

sentences.english: We’re having difficulty recruiting enough qualified staff.
sentences.chinese: 我们难以招聘到足够的合格职员。

sentences.english: Many government officials were recruited from private industry.
sentences.chinese: 很多政府官员是从私营企业招募来的。

sentences.english: Drill sergeants have eight weeks to turn fresh recruits into soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 操练军士要在八个星期之内把新兵训练成真正的士兵。

detailed_translations.english: to find new people to work in a company, join an organization, do a job etc
someone who has just joined the army, navy, or  air force

name: refund
trans: I asked for a refund because the shoes I bought were too tight.

sentences.english: They refused to give me a refund .
sentences.chinese: 他们拒绝给我退款。

sentences.english: Return your purchase within 14 days for a full refund .
sentences.chinese: 14 天之内退货可以全额退款。

sentences.english: You should go down there and demand a refund.
sentences.chinese: 你应该到那里去，要求退款。

detailed_translations.english: an amount of money that is given back to you if you are not satisfied with the goods or services that you have paid for
to give someone their money back, especially because they are not satisfied with the goods or services they have paid for

name: register
trans: At a wedding, there is register for all of the guests to sign.

sentences.english: Have you signed the hotel register ?
sentences.chinese: 你在酒店登记簿上签名了吗？

sentences.english: Police want a national register of DNA samples.
sentences.chinese: 警方想要一个全国范围的DNA样本登记册。

sentences.english: How many students have registered for English classes?
sentences.chinese: 有多少学生注册选修英语课了？

detailed_translations.english: an official list of names of people, companies etc, or a book that has this list
to put someone’s or something’s name on an official list

name: renown
trans: Michael is a singer of great renown in New Zealand.

sentences.english: He achieved some renown as a football player.
sentences.chinese: 作为足球运动员，他小有名气。

detailed_translations.english: when you are famous and a lot of people admire you for a special skill, achievement, or quality

name: tusk
trans: Sadly, some people hunt elephants and remove their tusks to sell them.

sentences.english: A huge tusk decorated the wall of his study.
sentences.chinese: 他书房的墙上装饰着一支巨大的象牙。

sentences.english: First find the key to the museum, then get the mammoth tusk from the natural history wing.
sentences.chinese: 首先找到进入博物馆的门，然后从自然历史展区拿到猛犸象牙。

sentences.english: That hole is now being filled - thanks to narwhals, medium-size whales, endemic to the Arctic, known as unicorns of the seas because of the single, spiralling tusk found in males.
sentences.chinese: 这个洞现在正在被填补起来--这归功于角鲸，一种中等大小的，北极特有的鲸，因为雄鲸长着一个螺旋纹的长牙而被称为海中的独角兽。

detailed_translations.english: one of a pair of very long pointed teeth, that stick out of the mouth of animals such as  elephants

name: coexist
trans: Our pets coexist in our home with few or no problems.

sentences.english: But I think both can coexist.
sentences.chinese: 但是我认为两者可以共存。

sentences.english: In fact, both do coexist.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，两者是共存的。

sentences.english: We must coexist with them, but not let them take us over.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须与之共存，但不要让它们将我们压垮。

detailed_translations.english: if two different things coexist, they exist at the same time or in the same place

name: conceive
trans: The child could not conceive the actual size of the Earth.

sentences.english: He conceived the idea of transforming the old power station into an arts centre.
sentences.chinese: 他想出了一个把旧发电站改造为艺术中心的主意。

sentences.english: God is often conceived of as male.
sentences.chinese: 上帝常常被想象为男性。

sentences.english: She is unable to conceive.
sentences.chinese: 她不能怀孕。

sentences.english: Their first child was conceived on their wedding night.
sentences.chinese: 他们的第一个小孩是在新婚之夜怀上的。

detailed_translations.english: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

name: dubious
trans: The police thought that the man’s description of the crime was dubious.

sentences.english: The firm was accused of dubious accounting practices.
sentences.chinese: 该公司被指控有不诚实的会计行为。

sentences.english: Many critics regard this argument as dubious or, at best, misleading.
sentences.chinese: 许多批评家认为这一论点靠不住，或者说至少有误导性。

sentences.english: The assumption that growth in one country benefits the whole world is highly dubious .
sentences.chinese: 一国的经济增长会对全世界有益的假设是很值得怀疑的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 怀疑的， 犹豫不决的， 无把握的； 有问题的； 靠不住的
detailed_translations.english: probably not honest, true, right etc

name: ego
trans: Kelly’s ego made her think that she was some kind of a superhero.

sentences.english: That promotion really boosted her ego (= made her feel better about herself ).
sentences.chinese: 那次晋升确实增强了她的自信心。

sentences.english: I need someone to massage my bruised ego (= when you feel less confident than before ).
sentences.chinese: 我需要有人来安抚我受挫的自信心。

sentences.english: a fragile ego
sentences.chinese: 脆弱的自尊心

detailed_translations.chinese: 自我，自己，个人思考和感觉能力
detailed_translations.english: the opinion that you have about yourself

name: elastic
trans: He attached the elastic bungee to his legs before he jumped of the platform.

sentences.english: a piece of elastic
sentences.chinese: 一根橡皮带

sentences.english: the horny elastic pad in a horse’s hoof
sentences.chinese: 马蹄上粗硬而有弹性的肉掌

detailed_translations.english: a type of rubber material that can stretch and then return to its usual length or size
a material that is elastic can stretch and then go back to its usual length or size

name: endeavor
trans: The company’s new advertising endeavor ended in a horrible failure.

sentences.english: We always endeavor to please our customers.
sentences.chinese: 我们总是竭尽全力让顾客满意。

sentences.english: an outstanding example of human endeavor
sentences.chinese: 人类努力进取的突出例证

detailed_translations.english: to try very hard
an attempt to do something new or difficult

name: engrave
trans: The couple engraved their names onto the old pine tree.

sentences.english: Your wedding ring can be engraved with a personal inscription at no extra cost.
sentences.chinese: 你的结婚戒指可以刻上个人题字不另收费。

sentences.english: The shop will also engrave your child's name on the side.
sentences.chinese: 商店也将在一侧刻上你孩子的名字。

sentences.english: ...a bottle engraved with her name.
sentences.chinese: …一个刻有她名字的瓶子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 雕刻；  铭记， 深印于 ， 铭刻
detailed_translations.english: If you engrave something with a design or words, or if you engrave a design or words on it, you cut the design or words into its surface

name: excavate
trans: The team wishes to excavate the site in hope of finding fossils.

sentences.english: Schliemann excavated the ancient city of Troy.
sentences.chinese: 谢里曼发掘出特洛伊古城。

detailed_translations.english: if a scientist or archaeologist excavates an area of land, they dig carefully to find ancient objects, bones etc

name: jagged
trans: The swimmer was hurt when he fell on the jagged rocks.

sentences.english: the broken bottle’s jagged edge
sentences.chinese: 碎瓶子的锯齿状边缘

sentences.english: the jagged rocks of St. Saviour’s Point
sentences.chinese: 圣基督角嶙峋的岩石

detailed_translations.english: having a rough or pointed edge or surface

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成缺口；使成锯齿状（jag的过去式）

name: locale
trans: The spa was the perfect locale for my mother to relax and enjoy her vacation.

sentences.english: people who see the countryside as a locale for recreation
sentences.chinese: 把乡间视为娱乐消遣之地的人

detailed_translations.english: the place where something happens or where the action takes place in a book or a film

name: magnitude
trans: This was a discovery of great magnitude.

sentences.english: an increase of this order of magnitude
sentences.chinese: 如此大幅度的增长

sentences.english: The star varies in brightness by about three magnitudes.
sentences.chinese: 星体的亮度大约分三个星等。

detailed_translations.english: the great size or importance of something

name: mold
trans: Using a cupcake mold will ensure that they come out just right.

sentences.english: Because of its flexibility, we can mold software into any form to do almost anything.
sentences.chinese: 由于灵活性，我们可以将软件塑造成任何形式从而处理几乎所有的问题。

sentences.english: The women of a nation mold its morals, its religion, and its politics by the lives they live.
sentences.chinese: 一个国家的妇女通过她们的生活方式塑造了这个国家的道德、宗教和政治。

name: outright
trans: Everyone knew that the boy’s story was an outright lie.

sentences.english: If she asked me outright, I’d tell her.
sentences.chinese: 如果她坦率地问我，那我会告诉她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 全部地；立刻地；率直地；一直向前；痛快地
detailed_translations.english: clearly and directly, without trying to hide your feelings or intentions

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全的，彻底的；直率的；总共的
detailed_translations.english: clear and direct

name: periphery
trans: A beautiful floral pattern is on the periphery of the stationery.

sentences.english: extremists on the periphery of the animal rights movement
sentences.chinese: 处于动物权利运动边缘的极端分子

detailed_translations.chinese: 外围，边缘；圆周；圆柱体表面
detailed_translations.english: the edge of an area

name: plaster
trans: He used plaster to fill in the cracks in the old walls.

sentences.english: She gets sunburned even when she plasters herself from head to toe in factor 7 sun lotion.
sentences.chinese: 即使她从头到脚涂抹上防晒系数是7的防晒霜，她也会被晒伤。

detailed_translations.english: a substance used to cover walls and ceilings with a smooth even surface. It consists of  lime  , water, and sand.

detailed_translations.chinese: 减轻；粘贴；涂以灰泥；敷以膏药；使平服
detailed_translations.english: If you plaster yourself in some kind of sticky substance, you cover yourself in it

name: shovel
trans: The boy grabbed his shovel and got all of the snow off of the sidewalk.

sentences.english: ...a coal shovel.
sentences.chinese: …一把煤铲。

sentences.english: The workmen shovelled gravel onto the road.
sentences.chinese: 工人们把碎石铲到路面上。

detailed_translations.english: a tool with a rounded blade and a long handle used for moving earth, stones etc
to lift and move earth, stones etc with a shovel

name: skeletal
trans: We studied the skeletal system in anatomy class.

sentences.english: Police discovered the skeletal remains of a corpse buried near the river.
sentences.chinese: 警方发现了埋在河边的一具尸骨。

detailed_translations.english: like a skeleton or relating to a skeleton

name: stumble
trans: She stumbles a lot when she is drunk.

sentences.english: In her hurry, she stumbled and spilled the milk all over the floor.
sentences.chinese: 匆忙中她绊了一下，把牛奶洒得满地都是。

sentences.english: I make it into the darkness with only one stumble.
sentences.chinese: 我只踉跄了一下就把它弄进了黑暗中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 跌， 绊；结结巴巴地说话
detailed_translations.english: to hit your foot against something or put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running, so that you almost fall
Stumble is also a noun

name: thigh
trans: He suffered from a serious thigh injury.

sentences.english: The shorts are so small I can't fit my thighs into any of them.
sentences.chinese: 短裤太小了，我的大腿塞不进去。

detailed_translations.english: the top part of your leg, between your knee and your hip

name: vicious
trans: The vicious dog tried to bite the small child.

sentences.english: Sarah can be quite vicious at times.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉有时相当狠毒。

sentences.english: a vicious personal attack on the Duchess
sentences.chinese: 对公爵夫人恶毒的人身攻击

sentences.english: She was shocked by the vicious tone in his voice.
sentences.chinese: 她对他恶毒的语气感到震惊。

detailed_translations.english: very unkind in a way that is intended to hurt someone’s feelings or make their character seem bad

name: attic
trans: There were two windows in their attic.

sentences.english: a small attic room
sentences.chinese: 一间小阁楼

detailed_translations.chinese: 阁楼；顶楼；鼓室上的隐窝
detailed_translations.english: a space or room just below the roof of a house, often used for storing things

name: chunk
trans: When they broke open the rock, they saw it was filled with chunks of gold.

sentences.english: ice chunks
sentences.chinese: 大冰块

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚片， 大块； 相当大的部分
detailed_translations.english: a large thick piece of something that does not have an even shape

name: civic
trans: Most of the important civic buildings are located downtown.

sentences.english: Jackson spent the day meeting with local religious and civic leaders.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊那天与当地的宗教领袖和市领导会面。

detailed_translations.english: relating to a town or city

name: descent
trans: During the space shuttle’s descent, the Earth appeared larger and larger.

sentences.english: Passengers must fasten their seat belts prior to descent.
sentences.chinese: 乘客在飞机降落之前必须系好安全带。

sentences.english: young men and women of Asian descent
sentences.chinese: 亚裔男女青年

sentences.english: There is a gradual descent to the sea.
sentences.chinese: 有一片斜坡缓缓伸延到海边。

detailed_translations.english: the process of going down

name: din
trans: The din of the rusty machinery made the factory a horrible place to work.

sentences.english: We expect the din of the cloud-related chatter to turn into a real roar by this time next year.
sentences.chinese: 我们期望云相关的喋喋不休的喧闹在明年的这个时候变成真正的咆哮。

detailed_translations.english: a loud unpleasant noise that continues for a long time

name: dissatisfy
trans: He was dissatisfied with his meal.

sentences.english: More or other, they still dissatisfy.
sentences.chinese: 更多或另外一些，它们仍然不满足。

sentences.english: American's unilateralism act in fighting terrorism and its expansion tendency dissatisfy American's allied countries.
sentences.chinese: 第三，美国反恐中的“单边主义”行为和扩大化倾向令盟国极为不满。

sentences.english: Are your dissatisfy actions related to the content of your work your company culture or the people with whom you work?
sentences.chinese: 你不满意的是你工作的内容，公司文化，还是公司同事呢？

detailed_translations.english: to fail to satisfy; disappoint

name: fuss
trans: The child made an awful fuss because she didn’t want to go to bed.

sentences.english: James said he’d better be getting back or there’d be a fuss.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯说他最好回来，否则就会有人小题大做了。

sentences.english: Stop fussing around and find something useful to do!
sentences.chinese: 别瞎忙活了，找点有用的事干！

detailed_translations.english: anxious behaviour or activity that is usually about unimportant things
to do things, or pay too much attention to things, that are not important or necessary

name: glamorous
trans: There is nothing glamorous about where we live. It is very ordinary.

sentences.english: She led an exciting and glamorous life.
sentences.chinese: 她生活奢华，充满刺激。

sentences.english: the most glamorous neighborhood in the city
sentences.chinese: 城里最繁华的街区

sentences.english: On television, she looks so glamorous.
sentences.chinese: 她在电视里看上去光彩照人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 富有魅力的, 迷人的
detailed_translations.english: attractive, exciting, and related to wealth and success

name: gourmet
trans: In order to get a gourmet meal, you have to eat at an expensive restaurant.

sentences.english: The seafood here is a gourmet's delight.
sentences.chinese: 这儿的海鲜是美食家的一大享受。

sentences.english: Flavoured coffee is sold at gourmet food stores and coffee shops.
sentences.chinese: 调味咖啡在美食店和咖啡馆出售。

sentences.english: The couple share a love of gourmet cooking.
sentences.chinese: 这对夫妇都有烹饪美食的爱好。

detailed_translations.english: someone who knows a lot about food and wine and who enjoys good food and wine
Gourmet food is nicer or more unusual or sophisticated than ordinary food, and is often more expensive

name: hence
trans: Mary forgot the key. Hence, we couldn’t open the door.

sentences.english: The cost of transport is a major expense for an industry. Hence factory location is an important consideration.
sentences.chinese: 运输成本是企业的一大支出，因此工厂选址是重要的考虑因素。

detailed_translations.english: for this reason

name: intrinsic
trans: Paper money has no intrinsic value. It is useful simply because society says it is.

sentences.english: the intrinsic interest of the subject
sentences.chinese: 该话题本身的趣味

detailed_translations.english: being part of the nature or character of someone or something

name: kettle
trans: The soup was being cooked in a large kettle.

sentences.english: She filled the kettle and switched it on.
sentences.chinese: 她把水壶灌满，打开了开关。

sentences.english: The kettle’s boiling (= the water in it is boiling ).
sentences.chinese: 水壶里的水开了。

sentences.english: (= start boiling water in a kettle ), will you?
sentences.chinese: 烧壶水，好吗？

sentences.english: Put the meat into a small kettle.
sentences.chinese: 把肉放进一个小锅里。

detailed_translations.english: a container with a lid, a handle, and a spout,used for boiling and pouring water

name: ministry
trans: The Ministry of Trade is responsible for taxing imports and exports.

sentences.english: the Ministry of Agriculture
sentences.chinese: 农业部

sentences.english: Converted in his early teens, he entered the ministry (= started working as a church leader ) in 1855.
sentences.chinese: 他十三四岁皈依基督教，1855年当上牧师。

sentences.english: the ministry of Jesus
sentences.chinese: 耶稣的传道工作

detailed_translations.chinese: （政府的）部；；（全体）牧师；牧师的职责
detailed_translations.english: a government department that is responsible for one of the areas of government work, such as education or health

name: ordeal
trans: Driving in the snowstorm was an ordeal she’d never forget.

sentences.english: He was beginning to wonder if he would survive the ordeal.
sentences.chinese: 他开始怀疑自己能否熬过这场磨难。

sentences.english: Teresa had a transplant in 1989 and was just recovering from that ordeal when she suffered a brain hemorrhage.
sentences.chinese: 特雷莎在1989年做了一次移植手术，而正当她刚刚从那可怕的磨难中逐渐恢复时，又患了脑溢血。

sentences.english: Soon the whole terrifying ordeal would be over.
sentences.chinese: 这场恐怖的磨难很快就会过去的。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible or painful experience that continues for a period of time

name: outspoken
trans: She was an outspoken critic about the new banking laws.

sentences.english: an outspoken critic of the education reforms
sentences.chinese: 对教育改革直言不讳的批评者

detailed_translations.english: expressing your opinions honestly and directly, even when doing this might annoy some people

name: overwork
trans: After working for three weeks with only one day of rest, Judy was overworked.

sentences.english: You’ve been overworking – why don’t you take a week off?
sentences.chinese: 你最近在超强度工作——为什么不休息一周呢？

sentences.english: Have they been overworking you again?
sentences.chinese: 他们又让你超负荷工作了？

detailed_translations.english: to work too much or to make someone work too much
too much hard work

name: particular
trans: The dress shop didn’t have the particular dress she was looking for.

sentences.english: In this particular case, no one else was involved.
sentences.chinese: 这件事没有其他人牵涉其中。

sentences.english: Most students choose one particular area for research.
sentences.chinese: 大多数学生选择一个特定领域进行研究。

sentences.english: Marty’s very particular about his food.
sentences.chinese: 马蒂对食物很挑剔。

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别的，特指的；讲究的；挑剔的，吹毛求疵的
detailed_translations.english: a particular thing or person is the one that you are talking about, and not any other

name: snore
trans: It was impossible to get to sleep because my husband snored.

sentences.english: Uncle Arthur, after a loud snore, woke suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 阿瑟大叔响亮地打了个鼾后，突然醒了过来。

detailed_translations.english: Snore is also a noun
to breathe in a noisy way through your mouth and nose while you are asleep

name: soundly
trans: The nearest opponent was ten meters behind. She won the race soundly.

sentences.english: How can he sleep soundly at night? He's the one responsible for all those crimes.
sentences.chinese: 他晚上怎么能睡得香？他可是所有那些犯罪活动的罪魁祸首啊。

detailed_translations.english: If you sleep soundly, you sleep deeply and do not wake during your sleep

name: superintendent
trans: The superintendent decided to close the schools because of the weather.

sentences.english: a young park superintendent
sentences.chinese: 年轻的公园负责人

sentences.english: the superintendent of the Methodist Church in Hawaii
sentences.chinese: 夏威夷卫理公会负责人

detailed_translations.english: someone who is officially in charge of a place, job, activity etc

name: congested
trans: Tom didn’t get home until after dark because the road was so congested.

sentences.english: congested airspace
sentences.chinese: 拥挤的空域

sentences.english: London’s roads are heavily congested (= very congested ) .
sentences.chinese: 伦敦的马路非常拥挤。

detailed_translations.english: full of traffic

detailed_translations.chinese: 挤满；超负荷（congest的过去分词）

name: courier
trans: Before trains, most couriers used horses to travel.

sentences.english: ...a motorcycle courier.
sentences.chinese: …一名骑摩托车的信使。

detailed_translations.chinese: 导游；情报员，通讯员；送快信的人
detailed_translations.english: A courier is a person who is paid to take letters and packages direct from one place to another

name: deform
trans: The computer program deformed the building’s picture into an unreal sight.

sentences.english: Wearing badly-fitting shoes can deform your feet.
sentences.chinese: 穿不合脚的鞋会使脚变形。

detailed_translations.english: if you deform something, or if it deforms, its usual shape changes so that its usefulness or appearance is spoiled

name: etiquette
trans: When in Asian countries, bowing is a form of etiquette.

sentences.english: strict rules of professional etiquette
sentences.chinese: 严格的行规

detailed_translations.english: the formal rules for polite behaviour in society or in a particular group

name: exclusive
trans: The golf course was so exclusive that most people hadn’t even heard of it.

sentences.english: Bel Air is an exclusive suburb of Los Angeles.
sentences.chinese: 贝莱尔是洛杉矶郊外一处高级住宅区。

detailed_translations.chinese: 奢华的，高级的；独有的，独享的；排斥的，排他的；不包括…的，不把…计算在内的
detailed_translations.english: available or belonging only to particular people, and not shared
an important or exciting story that is printed in only one newspaper, because that newspaper was the first to find out about it

name: freight
trans: Trade ships only carried valuable freight like silk and spices.

sentences.english: freight services
sentences.chinese: 货运公司

sentences.english: We’ll send your personal belongings by air freight and your furniture by sea freight .
sentences.chinese: 你的个人物品我们将以空运方式运送，家具将以海运方式运送。

detailed_translations.english: goods that are carried by ship, train, or aircraft, and the system of moving these goods
to send goods by air, sea, or train

name: garment
trans: The businessman had all of his garments cleaned before the important meeting.

sentences.english: She pulled the garment on and zipped it up.
sentences.chinese: 她穿上衣服并拉好拉链。

sentences.english: She works in the garment district of Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 她在曼哈顿的服装加工区工作。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing

name: insomnia
trans: Nate’s insomnia prevented him from getting enough rest.

sentences.english: If you have insomnia, try my simple cure.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有失眠症，试试我的简单疗法。

sentences.english: In my insomnia, you have to hold me to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 在我失眠的时候，你要抱着我睡。

sentences.english: I know someone with insomnia who only gets two hours of sleep each night.
sentences.chinese: 我认识一个患有失眠症的人，他每天晚上只能睡上两个小时。

detailed_translations.english: if you suffer from insomnia, you are not able to sleep

name: intuitive
trans: Rhonda had an intuitive feeling that Shane wasn’t coming to school today.

sentences.english: He seemed to have an intuitive awareness of how I felt.
sentences.chinese: 他好像凭直觉就知道我的感受。

detailed_translations.english: an intuitive idea is based on a feeling rather than on knowledge or facts

name: liable
trans: During the summer months, hikers in the forest are liable to see deer and elk.

sentences.english: The car is liable to overheat on long trips.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车跑长途容易过热。

detailed_translations.english: likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc

name: obsess
trans: After watching the Star Wars movies, Ike obsessed about becoming a Jedi.

sentences.english: The project seems to obsess him.
sentences.chinese: 这项工程似乎令他着迷。

detailed_translations.english: if something or someone obsesses you, you think or worry about them all the time and you cannot think about anything else – used to show disapproval

name: overboard
trans: Tom and Gary slipped on the wet floor and fell overboard.

sentences.english: His sailing instructor fell overboard and nearly drowned during a lesson.
sentences.chinese: 他的帆船教练在一次课上落水，差点溺死。

detailed_translations.chinese: 极其热心的；全身心投入的

name: premium
trans: Tony paid a premium for the gas because it made his car run better.

sentences.english: premium ice cream
sentences.chinese: 优质冰激凌

sentences.english: the current consumer trend for premium products
sentences.chinese: 当前消费者喜欢购买优质产品的趋向

sentences.english: premium quality British potatoes
sentences.chinese: 优质英国马铃薯

detailed_translations.chinese: 高级的，优质的；售价高的
detailed_translations.english: of very high quality

detailed_translations.chinese: 保险金；额外费用，加付款；奖品，赠品；额外津贴
detailed_translations.english: the cost of insurance, especially the amount that you pay each year

name: privilege
trans: Only the best employee had the privilege of parking in that spot.

sentences.english: He had no special privileges and was treated just like every other prisoner.
sentences.chinese: 他不享受特权，待遇和任何其他犯人一样。

detailed_translations.english: a special advantage that is given only to one person or group of people

name: propel
trans: The strong wind propelled the leaf through the air and across the street.

sentences.english: a boat propelled by a small motor
sentences.chinese: 由小马达驱动的小船

sentences.english: One of our students was unable to propel her wheelchair up the ramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有名学生无法把她的轮椅推上坡道。

detailed_translations.english: to move, drive, or push something forward

name: socialize
trans: I like to socialize with my classmates after school.

sentences.english: ...an open meeting, where members socialized and welcomed any new members.
sentences.chinese: …让会员们相互交流、欢迎所有新成员的一次公开集会。

detailed_translations.english: to spend time with other people in a friendly way

name: suppress
trans: She suppressed her urge to scream because she didn’t want to be noticed.

sentences.english: The uprising was ruthlessly suppressed.
sentences.chinese: 起义受到了残酷的镇压。

detailed_translations.english: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force

name: tram
trans: I took the tram to Eighth Avenue.

sentences.english: The tramp from the tram swamped the ham hamburge with shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 有轨电车的脚步声淹没了带有香波的火腿汉堡。

sentences.english: The tramp from the tram swamped the ham hamburger with shampoo.
sentences.chinese: 来自有轨电车的流浪者用洗发水淹没火腿汉堡。

sentences.english: In Rio de Janeiro, an extensive network of tram lines, including the Santa Teresa line, operated for more than a century.
sentences.chinese: 在里约热内卢，一个包括圣特雷莎线在内的巨大电车线路网络运行了逾一个世纪。

detailed_translations.english: a vehicle for passengers, which travels along metal tracks in the street

name: unsettle
trans: The dark clouds in the sky unsettled Beth.

sentences.english: The sudden changes unsettled Judy.
sentences.chinese: 突如其来的变化弄得朱迪心神不宁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使动摇；使不安定；使心神不宁
detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel slightly nervous, worried, or upset

name: warp
trans: The woman put the clock above the fireplace, and the heat warped it.

sentences.english: The door must be warped. It won’t close properly.
sentences.chinese: 这门肯定是变形了，关不严。

detailed_translations.english: a part of something that has become bent or twisted from its original shape
if something warps, or if heat or cold warps it, it becomes bent or twisted, and loses its original shape

name: accumulate
trans: The mail accumulated in their mailbox while they were on vacation.

sentences.english: It is unjust that a privileged few should continue to accumulate wealth.
sentences.chinese: 少数特权阶级继续积聚财富，这是不公平的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time
to gradually get more and more money, possessions, knowledge etc over a period of time

name: aerial
trans: The aerial photographer took pictures from the air balloon.

sentences.english: an aerial attack
sentences.chinese: 空袭

sentences.english: aerial photographs
sentences.chinese: 在空中拍摄的照片

sentences.english: an aerial view of the Three Gorges Dam project
sentences.chinese: 一张三峡大坝工程鸟瞰图

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞机的，航空的；空中的，架空的
detailed_translations.english: from a plane
a piece of equipment for receiving or sending radio or television signals, usually consisting of a piece of metal or wire

name: apparatus
trans: The campers had an apparatus that showed them their exact location.

sentences.english: Astronauts have special breathing apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 航天员有专门的呼吸装装备。

sentences.english: The tax will require a massive administrative apparatus.
sentences.chinese: 税收需要大规模的行政机构。

detailed_translations.chinese: 器械，器具，仪器；机构，组织
detailed_translations.english: the set of tools and machines that you use for a particular scientific, medical, or technical purpose

name: avalanche
trans: The avalanche destroyed the mountain village.

sentences.english: Just after the avalanche.
sentences.chinese: 就在这雪崩后不久。

sentences.english: But what if the avalanche happened?
sentences.chinese: 不过，要是发生雪崩怎么办呢？

sentences.english: If the value was much lower than one, on the other hand, the avalanche would soon die out.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，如果结果是一个比一小很多的数字，那么雪崩很快就会停止。

detailed_translations.english: a large mass of snow, ice, and rocks that falls down the side of a mountain

name: consistency
trans: Her consistency in archery meant that our team had a chance to win.

sentences.english: She scores goals with remarkable consistency.
sentences.chinese: 她以非凡的连贯性进球得分。

detailed_translations.english: how thick, smooth etc a substance is

name: discharge
trans: I was discharged from the hospital after three days.

sentences.english: Sewage is discharged directly into the sea.
sentences.chinese: 污水被直接排放到海里。

sentences.english: the discharge of toxic waste into the sea
sentences.chinese: 有毒废物向海里的排放

detailed_translations.english: to send out gas, liquid, smoke etc, or to allow it to escape
when gas, liquid, smoke etc is sent out, or the substance that is sent out

name: episode
trans: We watched the final exciting episode of the TV series.

sentences.english: I'd like to try and forget the whole episode.
sentences.chinese: 我倒想尽量把那段经历全部忘掉。

sentences.english: One of the funniest episodes in the book occurs in Chapter 6.
sentences.chinese: 书中最有趣的片段之一在第6章。

detailed_translations.chinese: （人生的）一段经历；（小说的）片段，插曲
detailed_translations.english: an event, a situation, or a period of time in sb's life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way

name: intact
trans: Despite being over 30 years old, my father’s model ship is still intact.

sentences.english: Only the medieval tower had remained intact.
sentences.chinese: 只有这座中世纪塔楼保存完好。

sentences.english: His reputation survived intact.
sentences.chinese: 他的声望丝毫未受影响。

detailed_translations.chinese: 完整的；原封不动的；未受损伤的
detailed_translations.english: not broken, damaged, or spoiled

name: mortal
trans: All people are mortal.

sentences.english: Her father’s death reminded her that she was mortal.
sentences.chinese: 父亲的去世让她认识到终有一天她也会死去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凡人的；致死的；终有一死的；不共戴天的
detailed_translations.english: not able to live for ever
a human – used especially when comparing humans with gods,  spirit s  etc

name: omen
trans: He thought that seeing a black cat in the street was an omen of bad luck.

sentences.english: The car won’t start. Do you think it’s an omen?
sentences.chinese: 汽车发动不起来。你觉得这是某种预兆吗？

detailed_translations.english: a sign of what will happen in the future

name: overcast
trans: The sky was overcast in the morning, but by noon it was bright again.

sentences.english: Tomorrow will be overcast.
sentences.chinese: 明天是阴天。

sentences.english: The sky is overcast.
sentences.chinese: 天阴了。

sentences.english: During the daytime, it will be overcast, turning clear later.
sentences.chinese: 今天白天，阴转晴。

name: poignant
trans: The girls cried at the end of the poignant movie.

sentences.english: ...a poignant combination of beautiful surroundings and tragic history.
sentences.chinese: …优美环境与悲怆历史的辛酸结合。

sentences.english: ...a poignant love story.
sentences.chinese: …一个令人感伤的爱情故事。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖锐的；辛酸的；深刻的；切中要害的
detailed_translations.english: Something that is poignant affects you deeply and makes you feel sadness or regret

name: ranger
trans: Peter wanted to be a ranger because he liked spending time outside.

sentences.english: a park ranger
sentences.chinese: 公园管理员

detailed_translations.chinese: 突击队员；漫游者；骑警；别动队员

name: rubble
trans: There was rubble all over the city after the earthquake.

sentences.english: Brick rubble is useful as the base for paths and patios.
sentences.chinese: 碎砖可用作道路和天井的基石。

detailed_translations.english: broken stones or bricks from a building or wall that has been destroyed

name: seclude
trans: She was secluded on an island for over a year.

detailed_translations.english: to remove from contact with others

name: sideways
trans: Jim turned sideways in order to slow down and stop his snowboard.

sentences.english: A strong gust of wind blew the car sideways into the ditch.
sentences.chinese: 一阵狂风把汽车横着掀进了沟里。

sentences.english: Alfred shot him a sideways glance.
sentences.chinese: 艾尔弗雷德斜着眼看了他一下。

detailed_translations.english: to or towards one side
Sideways is also an adjective

name: sob
trans: I sobbed when my youngest daughter got married.

sentences.english: He began sobbing uncontrollably .
sentences.chinese: 他不由自主地抽噎起来。

sentences.english: Her sobs grew louder.
sentences.chinese: 她的呜咽声变得更大了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 啜泣，呜咽；（风等）发出呜咽声
detailed_translations.english: to cry noisily while breathing in short sudden bursts
A sob is one of the noises that you make when you are crying

name: sober
trans: After the funeral, everybody felt very sober.

sentences.english: He’s a nice guy when he’s sober.
sentences.chinese: 他没喝醉时是个不错的家伙。

detailed_translations.english: not drunk

name: speck
trans: A speck of blood appeared where the mosquito had bit him.

sentences.english: He has even cut himself shaving. There is a speck of blood by his ear.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至在刮脸时划伤了自己。他耳边有一点血迹。

detailed_translations.english: A speck is a very small stain, mark, or shape

name: upbringing
trans: He had a strict upbringing and was never allowed to watch television.

sentences.english: Mike had had a strict upbringing.
sentences.chinese: 迈克从小家教很严。

detailed_translations.english: the way that your parents care for you and teach you to behave when you are growing up

name: bliss
trans: Every time he sees his girlfriend, he feels a sense of bliss.

sentences.english: I didn’t have to get up till 11 – it was sheer bliss.
sentences.chinese: 我可以睡到11点才起来，真幸福啊。

detailed_translations.english: perfect happiness or enjoyment

name: butler
trans: Whenever he needed something, he rang a bell, and the butler appeared.

sentences.english: I called for the butler to clear up the broken crockery.
sentences.chinese: 我叫来男管家清理摔碎的陶瓷。

detailed_translations.english: the main male servant of a house

name: cramp
trans: After the marathon, Jenny got a terrible cramp in her calf muscle.

sentences.english: Several players were suffering from cramp.
sentences.chinese: 有几名球员抽筋了。

sentences.english: muscle cramps
sentences.chinese: 肌肉痉挛

detailed_translations.chinese: 痉挛，绞痛；[五金] 铁夹钳
detailed_translations.english: a severe pain that you get in part of your body when a muscle becomes too tight, making it difficult for you to move that part of your body

detailed_translations.chinese: 束缚，限制；使…抽筋；以铁箍扣紧
detailed_translations.english: to prevent the development of someone or something

detailed_translations.chinese: 狭窄的；难解的；受限制的

name: decorate
trans: Have you decorated the room for Christmas yet?

sentences.english: The bathroom is decorated in green and yellow.
sentences.chinese: 浴室里是用绿色和黄色装潢的。

sentences.english: We plan to spend the weekend decorating.
sentences.chinese: 我们计划用这个周末来装修。

detailed_translations.english: to paint the inside of a room, put special paper on the walls etc

name: dilapidated
trans: Paint peeled off of the old dilapidated apartment building.

sentences.english: ...an old dilapidated barn.
sentences.chinese: …一座破旧的谷仓。

detailed_translations.chinese: 荒废的，要塌似的；破坏的
detailed_translations.english: A building that is dilapidated is old and in a generally bad condition

name: evoke
trans: The picture evoked memories of when she was a young girl.

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

name: farewell
trans: She got on the plane after we said our farewells.

sentences.english: Mourners gathered to bid farewell to the victims of the plane tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 哀悼者来向空难受害者告别。

sentences.english: a farewell speech
sentences.chinese: 告别演说

detailed_translations.english: the action of saying goodbye

detailed_translations.chinese: 别了！（常含有永别或不容易再见面的意思）；再会！
detailed_translations.english: the action of saying goodbye

name: faucet
trans: Turn off the faucet when you are done brushing your teeth.

sentences.english: If God turns off one faucet, he can turn on another.
sentences.chinese: 如果上帝关住一个你的水龙头，他能开启另一个”。

sentences.english: Your security is not in your bank account; your security is in the Lord. If God turns off one faucet, he can turn on another.
sentences.chinese: “你的安全并不在你的银行账户里；而在于上帝。如果上帝关住一个你的水龙头，他能开启另一个”。

sentences.english: Really, a user experience designer could help to improve a person’s experience with just about anything —a doorknob, a faucet, a shopping cart.
sentences.chinese: 诚然，用户体验设计师可以帮助人们提高几乎关于任何事物——一个门把手，一个水龙头，一个购物车——的体验。

detailed_translations.english: the thing that you turn on and off to control the flow of water from a pipe

name: filth
trans: There was tons of filth and trash on the shore of the river.

sentences.english: a mound of filth and rubbish
sentences.chinese: 一堆脏东西和垃圾

sentences.english: people living in filth
sentences.chinese: 生活在肮脏环境里的人

sentences.english: Passing cars covered his shoes with filth.
sentences.chinese: 来往的车辆弄得他鞋子上全是脏东西。

detailed_translations.english: dirt, especially a lot of it

name: flaw
trans: We discovered a major flaw in the metal chain.

sentences.english: A design flaw (= a mistake or weakness in the way something was made ) caused the engine to explode.
sentences.chinese: 一个设计缺陷导致了引擎爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: a mistake, mark, or weakness that makes something imperfect

name: grin
trans: That joke makes me grin every time I hear it.

sentences.english: He grins, delighted at the memory.
sentences.chinese: 想起往事，他咧嘴笑了。

detailed_translations.english: to smile widely
a wide smile

name: housekeeping
trans: Housekeeping is not much fun, but it has to be done.

name: mound
trans: There was a mound of clothes on the teenager’s messy floor.

sentences.english: an ancient burial mound
sentences.chinese: 古代墓冢

detailed_translations.english: a pile of earth or stones that looks like a small hill

name: numb
trans: After holding my hand under the icy water, my fingers were numb.

sentences.english: The cold had numbed her fingers.
sentences.chinese: 她的手指冻僵了。

sentences.english: the numbing effect of the drug
sentences.chinese: 那种药物的麻醉效果

detailed_translations.chinese: 使麻木；使发愣；使失去感觉
detailed_translations.english: to make someone unable to feel pain or feel things they are touching
a part of your body that is numb is unable to feel anything, for example because you are very cold

name: reckless
trans: The reckless driver posed a threat to everyone else on the road.

sentences.english: He was accused of causing death by reckless driving .
sentences.chinese: 他被控因鲁莽驾驶致人死亡。

sentences.english: a reckless disregard for safety
sentences.chinese: 不顾安全的鲁莽行为

sentences.english: He ran into the burning house with reckless abandon (= without caring about the danger ) .
sentences.chinese: 他不顾危险冲入着火的房子里。

detailed_translations.english: not caring or worrying about the possible bad or dangerous results of your actions

name: slate
trans: The roof of the church is made of slate.

sentences.english: There were several slates missing from the roof.
sentences.chinese: 房顶有几块石板瓦掉了。

detailed_translations.english: a dark grey rock that can easily be split into flat thin pieces

detailed_translations.chinese: 铺石板；严厉批评某人；计划
detailed_translations.english: if something is slated to happen, it is planned to happen in the future, especially at a particular time

name: stool
trans: I don’t find stools very comfortable to sit on.

sentences.english: a bar stool
sentences.chinese: 酒吧高凳

detailed_translations.english: a seat that has three or four legs, but no back or arms

name: testament
trans: The beautiful performance was a testament to the singer’s natural talents.

sentences.english: The aircraft’s safety record is a testament to its designers’ skill.
sentences.chinese: 飞机的安全记录是设计师能力的明证。

detailed_translations.chinese: [法] 遗嘱；圣约；确实的证明
detailed_translations.english: a  will 2 2

name: timber
trans: Trees in this area are grown specifically to be used for timber.

sentences.english: a bench made of timber
sentences.chinese: 木制长椅

detailed_translations.english: wood used for building or making things

name: valve
trans: The mechanic removed the dirt to clear the engine valve.

sentences.english: heart valves
sentences.chinese: 心脏瓣膜

detailed_translations.english: a part of a tube or pipe that opens and shuts like a door to control the flow of liquid, gas, air etc passing through it

name: camouflage
trans: The green and brown camouflage was best used for hiding in forests and jungles.

sentences.english: soldiers learning camouflage technique
sentences.chinese: 在学习伪装技术的士兵

sentences.english: the camouflage netting over the tanks
sentences.chinese: 坦克上的伪装网

detailed_translations.english: a way of hiding something, especially soldiers and military equipment, by using paint, leaves etc to make it look like the things around it
to hide something, especially by making it look the same as the things around it, or by making it seem like something else

name: confront
trans: I confronted him as he left the meeting and told him I thought he was wrong.

sentences.english: The problems confronting the new government were enormous.
sentences.chinese: 新政府面临的难题是巨大的。

trans: At the camp, the boys’ cabin was lined with cots.

trans: In their final year at school, the students were asked to enlist in the military.

sentences.chinese: 里尔靠近法比边境。

sentences.english: She bought a new outfit for the party.
sentences.chinese: 她为了这次派对买了套新衣服。

sentences.english: a cowboy outfit

detailed_translations.english: a set of clothes worn together, especially for a special occasion

an animal’s foot that has nails or  claw s

name: splendid

sentences.english: a splendid idea

sentences.english: a splendid opportunity

sentences.chinese: 至于她个人的安全，她说她并没有过度担心，但是她的确在考虑一个流浪疯子可以做些什么。

sentences.chinese: 另外，比如说，你陷入了讨厌的、损失惨重的债务，而且必须像一个可怜的小流浪儿一样向政府祈求。

sentences.chinese: 大片大片的林地

sentences.chinese: 她发现雷切尔在厨房里，看上去苍老而疲惫。

name: amid

detailed_translations.english: In a theatre, backstage refers to the areas behind the stage

sentences.chinese: 一辆汽车和一辆小型货车在高速公路上相撞了。

sentences.english: Two trains collided head-on (= when they were moving directly towards each other ) .

sentences.english: Police finally managed to catch the culprit.

sentences.chinese: 他因癌症而早逝

to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law

sentences.chinese: 一片嘈杂声中别人根本听不到我说话。

name: dreary

sentences.chinese: 沉闷的冬日

name: duplicate

sentences.english: a duplicate key

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全一样的， 复制的
detailed_translations.english: exactly the same as something, or made as an exact copy of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 完全一样的东西，复制品

detailed_translations.chinese: 复制， 复印； 重复
detailed_translations.english: to copy something exactly

sentences.english: electromagnetic waves
sentences.chinese: 电磁波

detailed_translations.english: relating to both electricity and magnetism, or having both electrical and magnetic qualities

sentences.english: Most things are balanced - with equal numbers of electrons and protons.
sentences.chinese: 大部分物体都是电荷平衡的——含等量的电子和质子。

name: glide

sentences.english: Waiters glide between tightly packed tables bearing trays of pasta.
sentences.chinese: 侍者们托着一盘盘的意大利面食在拥挤的餐桌间自如穿行。

name: ingenious

sentences.english: an ingenious device
sentences.chinese: 精巧的装置

sentences.english: an ingenious cook
sentences.chinese: 心灵手巧的厨师

name: innovation

sentences.english: We must encourage innovation if the company is to remain competitive.
sentences.chinese: 公司要想保持竞争力，就必须鼓励革新。

sentences.english: recent innovations in English teaching

sentences.chinese: 创新的语言教学法

sentences.chinese: 废物回收利用的创新计划

name: launch

sentences.english: A test satellite was launched from Cape Canaveral.
sentences.chinese: 一颗实验人造卫星从卡纳维拉尔角发射升空。

sentences.english: The organization has launched a campaign to raise $150,000.
sentences.chinese: 为了筹集15万美元，该组织发起了一场募捐活动。

sentences.english: The Canadian police plan to launch an investigation into the deal.
sentences.chinese: 加拿大警方计划对这宗交易进行调查。

name: meteorological
trans: The thunderstorm was so large that it became a great meteorological event.

sentences.english: ...adverse meteorological conditions.
sentences.chinese: …不利的气象条件。

detailed_translations.english: Meteorological means relating to meteorology

name: meteorology

sentences.english: This is a book about meteorology.
sentences.chinese: 这本书是讲气象的。

sentences.english: It plays an increasingly important part in meteorology for cloud, precipitation, hail and thunderstorm detection as well as the navigation of aircraft and ships.
sentences.chinese: 它在对云层、降水、冰雹和雷暴的气象探测以及在船舰和飞机的导航中，起着日益重要的作用。

sentences.english: All of this depends on certain assumptions and the meteorology, the geology and the hydrology of the area plus the contours of the land around this particular power plant.
sentences.chinese: 所有的这些都是根据某些假设,和气象状态，地质情况，还有，水文请跨国,在加上土地的等高线,在这个特定的核能电站的周围。

detailed_translations.english: the scientific study of weather conditions

name: penetrate
trans: The knife easily penetrated the surface of the orange.

sentences.english: bullets that penetrate thick armour plating
sentences.chinese: 穿过厚装甲的子弹

sentences.english: Sunlight barely penetrated the dirty windows.
sentences.chinese: 阳光几乎照不进那些肮脏的窗户。

detailed_translations.english: to enter something and pass or spread through it, especially when this is difficult

name: persistent
trans: They made persistent attempts to get him to eat.

sentences.english: persistent rumours
sentences.chinese: 持续流传的谣言

sentences.english: persistent headaches
sentences.chinese: 持续头疼

sentences.english: a persistent problem
sentences.chinese: 长期问题

sentences.english: persistent rain
sentences.chinese: 连绵的雨

detailed_translations.english: continuing to exist or happen, especially for longer than is usual or desirable

name: propulsion

sentences.english: research into liquid hydrogen as a means of propulsion
sentences.chinese: 对液态氢作为一种动力方式进行的研究

detailed_translations.english: the force that drives a vehicle forward

name: simulate
trans: The French language teacher could simulate the accent of a French citizen.

sentences.english: a machine that simulates conditions in space
sentences.chinese: 一台模拟太空环境的机器

sentences.english: Interviews can be simulated in the classroom.
sentences.chinese: 可以在教室里模拟面试。

name: spur

sentences.english: The crowd’s reaction only acted as a spur.
sentences.chinese: 人群的反应不过起了刺激作用。

sentences.english: The band were spurred on by the success of their last two singles.
sentences.chinese: 乐队因最近两张单曲唱片的成功而深受鼓舞。

sentences.chinese: 是当地报纸上的一篇文章最终促使他行动起来。

name: stimulate

sentences.english: the President’s plan to stimulate economic growth
sentences.chinese: 总统刺激经济增长的计划

sentences.chinese: 她对艺术的兴趣是她父亲激发的。

name: beforehand

sentences.english: The police need to be briefed beforehand on how to deal with this sort of situation.
sentences.chinese: 需要事先告诉警察这种情况怎样处理。

sentences.english: When you give a speech, it’s natural to feel nervous beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 你在演讲之前感到紧张是很自然的。

detailed_translations.english: before something else happens or is done

name: blurred
trans: There was blurred photographs of what was supposed to be a flying saucer.

name: centigrade
trans: During the spring time, the temperature gets as warm as 26 degrees centigrade.

sentences.english: ...daytime temperatures of up to forty degrees centigrade.
sentences.chinese: …高达40摄氏度的日间气温。

sentences.english: The number at the bottom is the recommended water temperature in centigrade.

Centigrade is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 0 degrees and boils at 100 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °C.
