sentences.chinese: 团结的表示

sentences.english: an appeal for worker solidarity
sentences.chinese: 呼吁工人们团结

detailed_translations.english: loyalty and general agreement between all the people in a group, or between different groups, because they all have a shared aim

name: tact
trans: Since both sides would not agree, it required someone with tact to make peace.

sentences.english: Her patience and tact were legendary .
sentences.chinese: 她的耐心和机智是出名的。

sentences.english: Are you hurting others by your lack of tact?
sentences.chinese: 你曾经因为缺乏机智而伤害过他人吗？

sentences.english: If you have a genuine complaint about someone or something, communicate the issue with tact, consideration and neutrality.
sentences.chinese: 如果你确实对某人或某事有意见，还是老练、细致并中立地沟通解决吧。

name: undermine
trans: The documents helped to undermine the workers’ trust in their bosses’ honesty.

sentences.english: economic policies that threaten to undermine the health care system
sentences.chinese: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

detailed_translations.english: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective

name: constrain
trans: Jim cannot join us because he is constrained by previous plans.

sentences.english: Poor soil has constrained the level of crop production.
sentences.chinese: 贫瘠的土地限制了农作物的产量。

sentences.english: Women’s employment opportunities are often severely constrained by family commitments.
sentences.chinese: 女性的就业机会常常受到家庭责任的严重限制。

detailed_translations.english: to limit something

name: depot
trans: He waited for his mother to arrive at the depot.

sentences.english: the company’s distribution depot
sentences.chinese: 公司的发货仓库

sentences.english: a fuel storage depot
sentences.chinese: 燃料储存仓库

detailed_translations.english: a place where goods are stored until they are needed

name: emulate
trans: As a small boy, he always tried to emulate his big brother.

sentences.english: He hoped to emulate the success of Wilder.
sentences.chinese: 他希望效仿怀尔德的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿真；模仿；尽力赶上；同…竞争
detailed_translations.english: to do something or behave in the same way as someone else, especially because you admire them

name: forefinger
trans: He shouted, “There it is!” and pointed with his forefinger.

sentences.english: He took the pen between his thumb and forefinger.
sentences.chinese: 他用拇指和食指夹起笔。

detailed_translations.english: the finger next to your thumb

name: guts
trans: The doctor can tell you every process that happens in one’s guts.

name: inherent
trans: Sweating is an inherent bodily function when exercising.

sentences.english: Every business has its own inherent risks.
sentences.chinese: 每笔生意本身都有风险。

sentences.english: I’m afraid the problems you mention are inherent in the system.
sentences.chinese: 你提及的这些问题恐怕本来就存在于这个体制中。

detailed_translations.english: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

name: intimidate
trans: My dad intimidates my friends whenever they visit.

sentences.english: Attempts to intimidate her failed.
sentences.chinese: 恐吓她的企图失败了。

detailed_translations.english: to frighten or threaten someone into making them do what you want

name: janitor
trans: The school janitor cleaned up the messy cafeteria.

sentences.english: Ed Roberts had been a school janitor for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 埃德·罗伯茨做学校的看门人已很久了。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to look after a school or other large building

name: moist
trans: The ground is still moist from the rain last night.

sentences.english: Make sure the soil is moist before planting the seeds.
sentences.chinese: 播种之前要确保土壤湿润。

sentences.english: a rich, moist chocolate cake
sentences.chinese: 香浓软润的巧克力蛋糕

sentences.english: warm moist air
sentences.chinese: 温暖湿润的空气

sentences.english: Her eyes were moist (= she was almost crying ) .
sentences.chinese: 她的眼睛湿润了。

detailed_translations.english: slightly wet, especially in a way that is pleasant or suitable

name: nope
trans: He asked if I had any money, and I had to say, “Nope.”

name: prod
trans: The bully prodded me in the chest with her finger.

sentences.english: a cattle prod
sentences.chinese: 赶牛刺棒

detailed_translations.english: a pointed instrument used for pushing animals, to make them move
to quickly push something or someone with your finger or a pointed object

name: ransom
trans: He kidnapped the prince and demanded $1 million as a ransom.

sentences.english: The same system was used for ransoming or exchanging captives.
sentences.chinese: 同一系统也被用来赎回或交换俘虏。

detailed_translations.chinese: 赎回，赎；勒索赎金；救赎；得赎金后释放
detailed_translations.english: If you ransom someone who has been kidnapped, you pay the money to set them free
an amount of money that is paid to free someone who is held as a prisoner

name: restrain
trans: Mike restrained Allen from reaching the door.

sentences.english: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 我只得阻止她跑到街上去。

sentences.english: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
sentences.chinese: 价格上涨会抑制消费支出。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

name: saliva
trans: The baby could not keep the saliva from dripping out of its mouth.

sentences.english: He noticed a lot of saliva settling in his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他注意到有很多唾液滞留在他的嘴里。

detailed_translations.english: the liquid that is produced naturally in your mouth

name: spit
trans: He emerged from the pool and spit water from his mouth.

sentences.english: Nick rolled down his window and spat.
sentences.chinese: 尼克摇下窗子，啐了口唾沫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吐痰；吐口水；发出劈啪声
detailed_translations.english: to force a small amount of  saliva (= the liquid in your mouth )  out of your mouth
the watery liquid that is produced in your mouth

name: sprint
trans: The kids didn’t want to be late to class, so they sprinted to the bus stop.

sentences.english: Sergeant Horne sprinted to the car.
sentences.chinese: 霍恩中士冲向那辆汽车。

detailed_translations.english: to run very fast for a short distance
a short race in which the runners, riders, swimmers etc move very fast over a short distance

name: stunt
trans: The man jumped over the cars as a promotional stunt.

sentences.english: Todd flew over the city in a hot-air balloon as a publicity stunt .
sentences.chinese: 作为一种宣传噱头，托德乘坐热气球飞越城市上空。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to attract people’s attention, especially in advertising or politics

detailed_translations.chinese: 阻碍…的正常生长或发展
detailed_translations.english: to stop something or someone from growing to their full size or developing properly

name: tolerant
trans: The tolerant leader thought that everyone was equal regardless of race.

sentences.english: a tolerant society
sentences.chinese: 宽容的社会

sentences.english: trees that are tolerant of salt sea winds
sentences.chinese: 能耐海风的树木

detailed_translations.english: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

name: vampire
trans: The vampire snuck up on the woman and bit her neck.

name: yawn
trans: The child yawned and stretched her arms before going to bed for the night.

sentences.english: Alan stretched and yawned.
sentences.chinese: 艾伦伸伸懒腰，打了个呵欠。

sentences.english: Kay shook her head and stifled a yawn (= tried to stop yawning ).
sentences.chinese: 凯摇摇头，忍住呵欠。

detailed_translations.english: to open your mouth wide and breathe in deeply because you are tired or bored
an act of yawning

name: adjoining
trans: I couldn’t sleep because the people in the adjoining room were loud.

name: allege
trans: The little girl had alleged that her older brother hid her favorite doll.

sentences.english: She alleged that there was rampant drug use among the male members of the group.
sentences.chinese: 她指称该组织中有大量的男性成员吸毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 断言， 宣称， 硬说
detailed_translations.english: to say that something is true or that someone has done something wrong, although it has not been proved

name: arch
trans: The arch of the bridge was not high enough for the tall boat to pass underneath.

sentences.english: When she passed under the arch leading out of the park, Mira whooped with delight.
sentences.chinese: 从通向公园外的拱门下走过时，米拉高兴地喊叫起来。

detailed_translations.english: a structure with a curved top and straight sides that supports the weight of a bridge or building
to form or make something form a curved shape

name: assemble
trans: The parents assembled to discuss ways to improve their children’s education.

sentences.english: A large crowd had assembled outside the American embassy.
sentences.chinese: 一大群人聚集在美国大使馆外。

sentences.english: He looked around at the assembled company (=  all the people who had come there  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他环顾四周聚集的人群。

sentences.english: She had assembled a collection of her favourite songs.
sentences.chinese: 她收集了一些自己最喜欢听的歌。

sentences.english: The aircraft will continue to be assembled in France.
sentences.chinese: 飞机将继续在法国组装。

detailed_translations.english: if you assemble a large number of people or things, or if they assemble, they are gathered together in one place, often for a particular purpose

name: casualty
trans: The only casualty in the car accident was a woman who broke her arm.

sentences.english: We have had our first casualty. One runner has dropped out with cramp.
sentences.chinese: 我们有了第一位伤员，有一位队员因腿部痉挛退出了。

sentences.english: Any history of bombing must also be a history of civilian casualty, for bombing saves the lives of soldiers only at the expense of other lives.
sentences.chinese: 任何空袭的历史也必定是平民伤亡的历史，因为空袭救了士兵的性命只能以其他人的生命为代价。

sentences.english: The first item always on that was the overnight casualty report from Iraq and Afghanistan, and I would often come and see that had been circled by the president or that he would be reflecting on that.
sentences.chinese: 上面的第一条永远是,这一晚在伊拉克和阿富汗,士兵的伤亡报告，我来的时候会看到那条消息,被布什总统圈了出来,他看着报告会陷入沉思。

name: erect
trans: The king erected two towers on the north and south sides of his castle.

sentences.english: an imposing town hall, erected in 1892
sentences.chinese: 一座气势宏伟的市政厅，建于1892年

sentences.english: Police have erected barriers across the main roads into the town.
sentences.chinese: 警察在进城的主要道路上设立了路障。

sentences.english: It took a couple of hours to erect the tent.
sentences.chinese: 搭帐篷花了几个小时。

detailed_translations.english: to build something such as a building or wall

name: foul
trans: He wouldn’t let his dog drink from the water because it had a foul smell.

sentences.english: Refugees in the camps are short of food and at risk from foul water.
sentences.chinese: 营中难民缺少食物，还面临水源污染的危险。

sentences.english: extractor fans to remove foul air from the tunnel
sentences.chinese: 排出隧道污浊空气的排气扇

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯规的；邪恶的；污秽的；淤塞的
detailed_translations.english: very dirty

detailed_translations.chinese: 犯规；弄脏；淤塞；缠住，妨害
detailed_translations.english: to make something very dirty, especially with waste
an action in a sport that is against the rules

name: hectare
trans: His family farm covered many hectares.

sentences.english: Mist rose from a nearby stand of thriving eucalyptus trees she planted after receiving title to more than a hectare of farmland.
sentences.chinese: 雾气从附近生长繁茂的桉树林中升起，这些树是她在获得对一公顷多农田的所有权后栽种的。

sentences.english: This could be estimated at 1000 litres of hydrogen for 330 grams of chlorophyll per day whereas for example colza produces roughly only 1000 litres of oil per hectare . . .
sentences.chinese: 这种农场每天估计能够产生1000升氢气，而且只消耗330克叶绿素； 而比如种植菜籽，每公顷土地才能产生大约1000升油。

sentences.english: Researchers at the algae greenhouse plan to scale up the trial to a 100 hectare (247 acre) site over the next three years.
sentences.chinese: 藻类温室的研究人员计划在未来三年内将试验范围扩大到一片100公顷（合247英亩）的场地上。

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring area, equal to 10,000 square metres

name: heighten
trans: The pleasant music heightened their enjoyment of the wonderful dinner.

sentences.english: There are fears that the march will heighten racial tension.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心这次游行会加深种族间的紧张局势。

sentences.english: Increased levels of fat in the diet could heighten the risk of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 饮食中脂肪摄入量的提升会增加患癌症的风险。

detailed_translations.english: if something heightens a feeling, effect etc, or if a feeling etc heightens, it becomes stronger or increases

name: hospitality
trans: The travelers were amazed at the hospitality given them by the hotel’s staff.

sentences.english: Thanks for your hospitality over the past few weeks.
sentences.chinese: 感谢你几周来的热情款待。

detailed_translations.english: friendly behaviour towards visitors

name: mansion
trans: The mansion had thirty bedrooms, two kitchens, and a pool.

sentences.english: a beautiful country mansion
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的乡村宅第

detailed_translations.english: a very large house

name: outnumber
trans: The girls outnumbered the boys at the school by four to one.

sentences.english: Flats outnumber houses in this area.
sentences.chinese: 这个地区公寓房比独栋房子多。

sentences.english: His troops were hopelessly outnumbered.
sentences.chinese: 他的军队在数量上远远不及对方。

detailed_translations.english: to be more in number than another group

name: overjoyed
trans: He was overjoyed by the news of his promotion.

sentences.english: Shelley was overjoyed to see me.
sentences.chinese: 谢莉看见我高兴极了。

detailed_translations.english: extremely pleased or happy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…万分高兴；使…狂喜（overjoy的过去分词）

name: pasture
trans: The sheep were taken to a pasture where there was more grass.

sentences.english: large areas of rough upland pasture
sentences.chinese: 大片起伏的山地牧场

sentences.english: the lush pastures of the southern counties
sentences.chinese: 南部各郡茂盛的牧场

detailed_translations.english: land or a field that is covered with grass and is used for cattle, sheep etc to feed on
to put animals outside in a field to feed on the grass

name: petition
trans: The citizens all signed a petition asking the mayor to repair the sidewalks.

sentences.english: Local residents have drawn up a petition to protest the hospital closure.
sentences.chinese: 当地居民已草拟了一份请愿书，抗议关闭医院。

sentences.english: Villagers petitioned the local authority to provide better bus services.
sentences.chinese: 村民请愿要求地方当局提供更好的公共汽车服务。

detailed_translations.english: a written request signed by a lot of people, asking someone in authority to do something or change something
to ask the government or an organization to do something by sending them a petition

name: renovate
trans: The old fire station was renovated into an apartment building.

sentences.english: The hotel has been renovated and redecorated.
sentences.chinese: 酒店已经翻新，并重新装饰。

detailed_translations.english: to repair a building or old furniture so that it is in good condition again

name: revise
trans: When the editor discovered certain facts were wrong, he revised the book.

sentences.english: The college has revised its plans because of local objections.
sentences.chinese: 由于地方上的反对，学院已经修改了计划。

sentences.english: We have revised our estimates of population growth.
sentences.chinese: 我们已修正了对人口增长的估计。

detailed_translations.english: to change something because of new information or ideas

name: slab
trans: I looked at various slabs of stone to decorate my house.

sentences.english: a concrete slab
sentences.chinese: 水泥板

sentences.english: paving slabs
sentences.chinese: 铺路石板

detailed_translations.chinese: 厚板，平板；混凝土路面；厚片
detailed_translations.english: a thick flat piece of a hard material such as stone

name: terrace
trans: In the afternoons, she liked to sit on the terrace and check her email.

sentences.english: Both a staircase and a lift connect the two floors with an enclosed terrace on the roof.
sentences.chinese: 通过一道楼梯和一台电梯连接两层楼和封闭的屋顶平台。

sentences.english: Mirrored walls, skylights and large plated windows overlooking the garden and terrace fill this modern space with light.
sentences.chinese: 镜墙、天窗和大型的金属镀窗俯瞰花园和阳台，让这个现代空间充满光线。

detailed_translations.english: a flat outdoor area next to a building or on a roof, where you can sit outside to eat, relax etc

name: turf
trans: After the game, the turf looked ragged.

sentences.english: soft green turf
sentences.chinese: 柔软的绿色草皮

detailed_translations.english: a surface that consists of soil with grass on top, or an artificial surface that looks like this
to cover an area of land with turf

name: analogous
trans: The relationship with his teacher was analogous to that of a son and mother.

sentences.english: Marine construction technology like this is very complex, somewhat analogous to trying to build a bridge under water.
sentences.chinese: 像这样的海洋建筑技术非常复杂，有些类似于尝试在水下建筑一座桥。

detailed_translations.chinese: 类似的；[昆] 同功的；可比拟的
detailed_translations.english: similar to another situation or thing so that a comparison can be made

name: binoculars
trans: He could see the ship on the horizon only if he used his binoculars.

sentences.english: The man focused some binoculars on the green peninsula ahead .
sentences.chinese: 男人拿起双筒望远镜眺望前面那青翠的半岛。

sentences.english: He raised the binoculars to his eye again, scanning across the scene.
sentences.chinese: 他再一次把双筒望远镜举到眼前，仔细观察整个现场。

sentences.english: Practice thesepaths several times with binoculars, and then repeat the one which works bestfor you using the finder of your telescope.
sentences.chinese: 用双筒望远镜练习这些路径几次，然后使用你的望远镜的寻星镜重复最适合的一个路径。

detailed_translations.english: a pair of special glasses, that you hold up to your eyes to look at objects that are a long distance away

name: bulk
trans: The large elephant moved its bulk with legs as strong as tree trunks.

sentences.english: The bulk of consumers are based in towns.
sentences.chinese: 大多数消费者都是城镇居民。

sentences.english: The dough will rise until it is double in bulk.
sentences.chinese: 面团会发酵到原来的两倍大。

detailed_translations.english: the main or largest part of something

name: comprise
trans: Our school’s football team is mostly comprised with seniors.

sentences.english: The house comprises two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a living room.
sentences.chinese: 这座房子有两间卧室、一间厨房和一间起居室。

sentences.english: Women comprise a high proportion of part-time workers.
sentences.chinese: 兼职人员中妇女占了很大一部分。

detailed_translations.english: to consist of particular parts, groups etc

name: depict
trans: The statue’s face depicted the general’s determination and courage.

sentences.english: a book depicting life in pre-revolutionary Russia
sentences.chinese: 描写革命前俄国人生活的一本书

detailed_translations.english: to describe something or someone in writing or speech, or to show them in a painting, picture etc

name: dual
trans: The room had a dual function. It was a living room, but at night it was a bedroom.

sentences.english: a dual system of education
sentences.chinese: 二元[双元]教育体系

detailed_translations.english: having two of something or two parts

name: Fahrenheit
trans: When the temperature dropped to 32° Fahrenheit, it started snowing.

sentences.english: By mid-morning, the temperature was already above 100 degrees Fahrenheit.
sentences.chinese: 到上午10点左右，气温已超过华氏100度了。

detailed_translations.english: Fahrenheit is a scale for measuring temperature, in which water freezes at 32 degrees and boils at 212 degrees. It is represented by the symbol °F.
a scale of temperature in which water freezes at 32˚ and boils at 212˚

name: fulfill
trans: The professor did not fulfill his promise not to miss a single class.

sentences.english: And that is why we can fulfill our destiny.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么我们能实现我们的命运。

sentences.english: What important dream have you yet to realize and fulfill?
sentences.chinese: 你有什么重要的梦想还没有实现和完成？

name: grove
trans: All the trees in this grove are apple trees.

sentences.english: ...an olive grove.
sentences.chinese: …一片橄榄树丛。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of land with trees growing on it

name: ore
trans: The factory melted the ore and used it to make iron products.

sentences.english: iron ore
sentences.chinese: 铁矿石

sentences.english: veins of rich ore
sentences.chinese: 富矿脉

detailed_translations.english: rock or earth from which metal can be obtained

name: outback
trans: Many Australian farmers use the outback to raise cattle.

name: outweigh
trans: Finding a warm place to sleep outweighed the need to find something to eat.

sentences.english: The advantages of this deal largely outweigh the disadvantages.
sentences.chinese: 这笔交易的利远大于弊。

detailed_translations.english: If one thing outweighs another, the first thing is of greater importance, benefit, or significance than the second thing

name: paradox
trans: The paradox of her work was that the less she worked, the more she got done.

sentences.english: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less.
sentences.chinese: 悖论就是: 如果渔夫减少捕鱼，反而会打到更多的鱼。

detailed_translations.english: a statement that seems impossible because it contains two opposing ideas that are both true

name: pier
trans: If you want to catch bigger fish, then go to the far end of the pier.

sentences.english: ...Chicago's Navy Pier.
sentences.chinese: …芝加哥的海军码头。

sentences.english: Waves were swashing against the piers.
sentences.chinese: 浪花拍击着桥墩。

detailed_translations.english: a structure that is built over and into the water so that boats can stop next to it or people can walk along it

name: shortcut
trans: We got to the house early because we took a shortcut through the forest.

sentences.english: I tried to take a shortcut and got lost.
sentences.chinese: 我试着走近路，结果迷路了。

sentences.english: Fame can be a shortcut to love and money.
sentences.chinese: 名望可以是得到爱情和金钱的捷径。

detailed_translations.english: a quicker way of getting somewhere than the usual route

name: tariff
trans: Our tariff on imported wool makes foreign wool more expensive.

sentences.english: America wants to eliminate tariffs on items such as electronics.
sentences.chinese: 美国想要取消电子类产品的关税。

detailed_translations.english: a tax on goods coming into a country or going out of a country

name: thermometer
trans: The thermometer outside the window indicated that it was a hot day today.

sentences.english: The thermometer registered over 100˚C.
sentences.chinese: 温度计显示高于100摄氏度。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that measures the temperature of the air, of your body etc

name: tilt
trans: She tilted her glass and almost spilled some of the wine inside.

sentences.english: My mother tilted her head and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 我妈妈歪着头笑了。

sentences.english: Ned’s mouth tilted upwards slightly at the corners.
sentences.chinese: 内德的嘴角微微翘起。

detailed_translations.english: to move a part of your body, especially your head or chin, upwards or to the side
a movement or position in which one side of something is higher than the other

name: vice versa
trans: Students learn from their teachers, and vice versa.

sentences.english: The boys may refuse to play with the girls, and vice versa.
sentences.chinese: 男孩可能拒绝和女孩玩耍，反之亦然。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that the opposite of a situation you have just described is also true

name: whereabouts
trans: The police looked for the lost dog, but its whereabouts were still unknown.

sentences.english: He showed great reluctance to reveal his whereabouts.
sentences.chinese: 他极不愿意说出他的行踪。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下落；行踪；去向；所在之处
detailed_translations.english: the place or area where someone or something is
